title: 我的博物馆
description: 在学习绘本故事《奥莉薇》 的过程中， 孩子们对有奥莉薇去的博物馆很感兴趣。 宇翔对于博物馆很好奇， 我们一起收集了一些关于博物馆的信息。 当我问他：“ 如果你有一个博物馆， 会是什么博物馆呢？” 他认真的想了想， 告诉我说：" 我要有一个家的博物馆。” 于是我接着问， “那这个家的博物馆里都有什么呢？你能画出来给我看吗？” 宇翔听了很开心， 他迅速地拿出一张纸， 开始画了起来。 画完之后他主动在其他小朋友们面前做了分享与说话， 他告诉朋友们：“ 这是房子博物馆。 这是一个个的家。 我画房子， 因为人人都爱自己的家。 这个博物馆会在2026年1月2日开， 它是在日本。 ”
interpretation: 通过宇翔制作的海报， 可以看出他能够将自己的想象通过绘画的方式表现出来， 是创作能力的体现。 同时， 他能够使用简单的华语以小段话的方式表达出来， 说明他具有良好的沟通与表达能力， 能够自信地使用华语。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 表达：能针对某一个话题展开讨论。
语言学习成果（说）- 说华语：能熟练自如地讲华语。
语言学习成果（读）- 阅读：尝试制作图画书。

title: "Dried Leaves Exploration"
description:
Matthias eyes fixated on the leaves scattering to the floor and he picked them up with his hands. He checked the dried leaves and started moving his hands up and down. He slowly wriggled his fingers on the dried leaves to check its texture and continued to manipulate with his hands. He then held onto the twig and started grabbing the dried leaf with another hand. He slowly plucked out one of the dried leaves from the twig and dropped it to the floor. He continued to pluck one more leaf and dropped to the floor. 

Again, he plucked out the leaf again and this time, he had more leaves scattered to the floor. He picked them up and gathered them in his hands and dropped them to the floor. When the educarer picked up a bunch of leaves, he looked at the educarer’s hands and watched as the dried leaves flew down and scattered to the floor and some landed on his head! He picked the leaves from the floor and placed them back into the tray and continued to explore the leaves for another few minutes.
interpretation: Matthias displayed curiosity as he explored the dried leaves with his hands by manipulating and checking the texture of the dried leaves. He also wriggled with his fingers to check the texture of the dried leaves to experiment with the leaves through sensory experience and showed sustained concentration. When he watched the educarer pick a bunch of dried leaves and flew down, scattered to the floor and on his head, he saw the action and experience with cause and effect.

learning_goals.title: Children are confident, curious involved learners

title: "Pulling and Pushing of Straws"
description:
Matthias sat in front of the educarer and watched the educarer demonstrate the activity to him. “Let’s grab the straw and pull it out from the box. Then you put the straw on the tray like this”. As he observed the educarer carefully, “Now, it’s your turn Matthias”, he grabbed the straw with his right hand and slowly pulled it out from the box. “Place the straw on the tray here”, as he slowly moved his hand towards the tray and released it on the tray. “Let’s pull another straw”, as soon as he heard the educarer’s voice, he moved his hand to the straws and grabbed one of them and placed the straw on the tray. He continued to grab the rest of the straws from the box and placed them on the tray. “Yay, you did it!

The educarer asked, "How about we push the straw through the hole like this?”  Matthias watched the educarer attentively pushing the straw through the hole, he picked one of the straws from the tray and moved the straw to the hole. While making attempts to push the straw through the hole, he maneuvered his hand and pushed the straw in. He grabbed another straw from the tray and repeated his actions. This time, he pushed and pulled the straw with a little more force and successfully pushed it through the hole. He also used his alternate hands to remove two straws at the same time to explore. When he tried to push back the two straws through the hole with both hands, it didn’t go in easily. He kept trying to maneuver with both hands and when he was unable to do it, he showed the two straws to the educarer to ask for help and continue trying to push the straws through the holes again.
interpretation: Matthias is capable of following instructions and imitating the educarer’s actions such as observing the educarer demonstrating the activity and pulling out the straws from the box to the tray. He continues to repeat the action of grabbing and placing straws, demonstrating a growing confidence and engagement with the task. He maneuvered his hands to push and pull the straws which shows good grasping skills, eye-hand coordination and hands control movements. When he encountered a challenge with two straws, he seeked help from the educarer and continued to make effort in the exploration.

learning_goals.title: Foster hand-eye coordination

title: "Pom Poms Pouring"
description:
Matthias sat on the floor with a tray and cups of pom poms in front of him. He picked one of the pom pom from the cup and explored it with his fingers. He squeezed the pom pom with his pincer grip and placed it back into the cup. “Come, let me hold your hand and hold the cup like this”, as the educarer guided his hand to pour out the pom poms into the empty cup. He watched the pom poms drop into the cup and he used his hand to touch the pom poms. When the educarer guided his hand again, “Let’s pour it like this”, he saw the pom poms dropped into the cup again and some scattered to the tray and the floor. He picked the pom poms from the tray and placed them back into the cup. He also searched for the scattered pom poms and picked them up from the floor and placed them back into the cup.

When it was his turn, “Come Matthias, it’s your turn to pour the pom poms”, he held the cup filled with pom poms and started shaking the cup. Some of the pom poms flew out from the cup and scattered to the floor. He saw the pom poms moving and rolling away and continued to pour out the remaining pom poms in the cup. He easily poured out the pom poms into the empty cup. Then, he checked the cup that he was holding and showed it to the educarer. “This cup is empty. No more pom poms”, as he showed “no more” with his hands. When the educarer pointed at the other cup filled with pom poms, “see, you poured into the cup”, he picked with his hands and smiled at the educarer.
interpretation: Matthias displayed confidence and curiosity as he explored the pom poms pouring activity. With educarer’s guidance, he was able to experience pouring motion and see visual results such as an empty cup when he checked the cup after pouring the pom poms out. As he explored and experimented the activity, he demonstrated a desire to explore different ways to explore the pom poms such as observing pom poms movement and rolling when he shakes the cup. He was also able to use the “no more” gesture and smiled at the educarer to be pleased with his accomplishment and to communicate to the educarer.

learning_goals.title: Foster enjoyment in playing with toys and materials

title: 二月第二周，玩丝巾。（Update）
description:
老师拿丝巾与他玩躲猫猫，引导他把丝巾拉下来；他融入玩丝巾乐趣。
他达到社会行为的发展目标，真棒！

learning_goals.title: 通过与婴幼儿的互动，如：躲猫猫游戏，培养其幽默感

title: 颜色排序
description:
教师带领幼儿观察一些不同风格的绘画作品，鼓励他们细心观察。通过讨论，引导他们注意颜色的不同层次。例如，画面中有些部分使用了明亮的色调，而其他部分则使用了较深的颜色。从而引出颜色深浅的概念。教师出示色块，请幼儿观察这些颜色，带领他们从深到浅或从浅到深排列这些色块。之后，教师请幼儿创作色彩排序画，鼓励幼儿使用水彩颜料，按照从深到浅或者从浅到深的顺序选择颜料盘里的颜色，绘制出自己喜欢的图形进行排序。
教师将白纸递给家乐，他用笔刷蘸取了一些黑色颜料在纸上画出一个黑色圆圈，他一边画，一边说：“我要画pokemon的，这是一个pokemon ball。”教师告诉他ball的华文是球。他说道：“我画的球，我要画一个eevee。”说完，他蘸取了一些紫色在白纸上画了一个轮廓。教师告他紫色太浅了，之后很难找到更浅的颜色。他问道：“How？”教师请他看看调色盘里的紫色，请他看看自己的笔刷。他看后说：“太多水了。”教师点点头，请他再蘸取一些紫色填充到图案中。他填好后，又使用了橙色、黄色。他指着白色说：“这个看不见。”教师告诉他白色已经沾染到其他颜色并请他试试看。他蘸取了白色，在纸上画下一个图案。他说：“可以。”教师问他选择的哪种排列顺序，他说：“From light to dark."教师告诉他是从浅到深，他复述了：“从浅到深。”教师指正他从浅到深第一个颜色应该是白色。他指着作品说：“From 这边。”
interpretation: 家乐通过观察绘画作品学习颜色的变化，学会了区分颜色的深浅。还通过动手实践，选取色彩盘里的颜色和色卡按照要求排序，加深了对颜色深浅的理解，逐渐培养了对艺术作品色彩运用的感知力。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 倾听：能听出一段话的要点。
语言学习成果（说）- 表达：能针对某一个话题展开讨论。

title: 捞皮筋
description:
描述：
       教师和幼儿坐在桌子前，教师向幼儿介绍“捞皮筋活动”要用到的物品有皮筋，筷子，碗。然后向幼儿讲解并演示如何捞皮筋。
       晟德用他的右手拿起一根筷子，将筷子伸进水里面，用筷子将皮筋挑起来，然后将筷子上的皮筋放在盘子里，他看着教师笑着说：“张老师，你看。”教师回应晟德：“晟德你很棒哦，你能够将水里面的皮筋挑起来。”晟德继续将筷子伸进水里面，然后用筷子将皮筋挑出来放在盘子上。晟德完成活动后，教师对晟德竖起大拇指。
interpretation:
诠释：

      在活动过程中，晟德能够用筷子将水里面的皮筋挑出来，并将筷子上的皮筋放在盘子上，展现出晟德的抓握能力，手眼协调能力和手部肌肉的精细动作。晟德在活动中也能用简单的语言与教师进行沟通。

learning_goals.title: 通过使用工具、跑、攀爬、投掷及穿珠等活动，促进粗大动作及精细动作的感知发展
通过重复和练习，促进幼儿简单句子表达能力的发展

title: 奥莉薇
description: 在学习绘本《 奥莉薇》 的过程中， 暄恩对于故事很感兴趣，她仔细地阅读绘本故事， 并且尝试和我沟通。通过沟通， 我请她说说他最喜欢的故事的情节，暄恩仔细地想了想， 告诉我说：“ 我喜欢奥莉薇在堆沙堡的这幅画，她堆了高高的沙堡， 因为我也喜欢和爸爸妈妈还有弟弟一起堆沙堡。” 。 听了她的答案之后， 我便问她：“ 如果请你用绘画的方式表达出来， 你会怎样画呢？” 她看了看我， 想了想， 说到：“ 我会画奥莉薇和她的妈妈， 还有她的弟弟一起在沙滩上， 这边有高高的沙堡。”
interpretation: 通过暄恩的回答，可以看出暄恩的回复具有逻辑性， 说明她能够准确地理解老师问句的含义， 也能够使用清晰明确有逻辑的语句来表达自己的想法。 通过她和老师的对话， 也能够看出， 她能够自信流利地使用华语来和别人沟通。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 倾听：能听出一段话的要点。
语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：能够积极主动地用华语表达，态度自然。

title: 我喜欢...

title: 我喜欢...
description: 在学习绘本《 奥莉薇》 的过程中， 之诚对于故事很感兴趣， 他仔细地阅读绘本，并且尝试和我沟通，通过讨论， 我请他说说他最喜欢的故事的情节， 之诚想了想， 借助老师的帮助， 慢慢地告诉我说：“ 我喜欢奥莉薇在海边晒太阳的画面， 因为我也喜欢去海边玩。” 我便问他：“ 如果请你用绘画的方式表达出来， 你会怎样画呢？” 他看了看我， 想了想， 说到：“ 我会画蓝蓝的大海， 奥莉薇在海边玩球。 ”
interpretation: 通过之诚的回答，可以看出之诚的回复具有逻辑性， 说明他能够准确地理解老师文具的含义， 也能够使用清晰明确有逻辑的语句来表达自己的想法。 通过他和老师的对话， 也能够看出， 他能够自信流利地使用华语来和别人沟通。

title: 二月第二周：触摸大自然的色彩 （Update )
description:
老师轻轻翻开触摸书，指着书中的图案，说：“这是大象，看，象爸爸带着象宝宝在河边玩水。” 然后引导依璇用小手摸一摸象爸爸和象宝宝的身体。
每翻一页，老师都鼓励依璇触摸不同的动物，并用简单的词汇描述触感，比如“毛毛的”“粗粗的“，帮助依璇通过触摸感知动物和大自然的特征并丰富依璇的感官体验。

learning_goals.title: 通过谈话、歌曲、故事和儿歌，培养聆听和理解能力

title: 二月第二周：探索触摸墙 （Update )
description:
老师抱着筠心来到触摸墙前，让筠心用小手触摸不同的材质。老师指着吸管说：“这是吸管，粗大的，软软的。” 接着，让筠心摸一摸大纽扣，说：“这里有大纽扣，圆圆的，硬硬的。”
老师再让筠心触摸泡泡膜、说：“摸摸这个，圆圆的，软软的。” 最后，老师鼓励宝宝按一按灯光开关，说：“按一按，灯亮了！”
筠心对触摸墙充满兴趣，老师鼓励筠心多触摸、按压、感受不同的材质，丰富感官体验。

learning_goals.title: 婴幼儿是自信、好奇和投入的学习者

title: 我喜欢...
description: 在学习绘本《 奥莉薇》 的过程中， 语涵对于故事很感兴趣， 她仔细地看着绘本， 一边看一边和我讨论。 通过讨论， 我请她说说她最喜欢的故事的情节，语涵仔细地想了想， 对我说：“ 我喜欢奥莉薇在沙滩山晒太阳， （看起来） 很舒服的样子。 我也喜欢这样子晒太阳。”听了她的答案之后， 我便问她：“ 如果请你用绘画的方式表达出来， 你会怎样画呢？” 她看了看我， 想了想， 说到：“ 我会画奥莉薇在这里， 这边有海和太阳。”
interpretation: 通过语涵的回答，可以看出语涵的回复具有逻辑性， 说明她能够准确地理解老师问句的含义， 也能够使用清晰明确有逻辑的语句来表达自己的想法。 通过她和老师的对话， 也能够看出， 她能够自信流利地使用华语来和别人沟通。

title: 自由发掘新乐器
description:
瑞泽在课室里自由探索，发现玩具柜子里面有一摞朔料碗，瑞泽拿起整套的碗放在地板上，然后用两只手把摞在一起的碗分开再摞回去，在反复几次后瑞泽拿起两个碗用碗底相互敲击，敲出铛铛铛的声音，瑞泽听到声音露出笑容，之后开始有节奏的敲击时快时慢，身体也跟着节奏扭动。
自由探索活动让瑞泽发挥自己的想象力，理解物体结构可以完美的摞在一起，通过听到的声音发掘乐器的作用，结合节奏进行律动。

children.fullname: Lam Sui Tsak Reagan (Lan Rui Ze)

learning_goals.title: 通过练习和重复，促进婴幼儿聆听和理解能力的发展
通过故事和歌曲，培养婴幼儿对语言节奏的初步感知
通过自由探索活动，如：提供玩水、球、盒子等材料，发展婴幼儿的大小和形状概念

title: 隧道探索
description:
老师们在课室里安放了软体感统爬滑组合，辅助幼儿进行体能训练，老师让祥宏俯卧在隧道里面并在前方引导，祥宏对新的物品很好奇首先观察周围，然后对老师露出笑容，老师在前方叫祥宏的名字，祥宏表现出兴奋的向前用力，然后身体会更加的退到隧道里面，老师出现在祥宏的视线，祥宏高兴的笑出声音。
活动中祥宏想向前移动身体时，反而会后退这是幼儿学习爬行时的初步表现，表示幼儿在尝试控制自己的身体，但还不能完全的掌控，退后是前进的很好开始，加油祥宏！

learning_goals.title: 通过翻身、坐、爬、站等动作，发展身体健康和身体控制能力
发展平衡感，如：锻炼手臂、腿部肌肉力量
创设课室环境，让婴幼儿有机会移动、翻滚和爬行，以满足其发展的需要

title: 鳄鱼牙齿有几颗？
description:
教师出示纸质鳄鱼嘴巴模型，带领幼儿观察并讨论鳄鱼头部的外形特征。鼓励幼儿根据观察猜测鳄鱼的牙齿数量，邀请幼儿用手指点数的方式数出牙齿数量，并与猜测结果进行核对。幼儿分组轮流数鳄鱼牙齿，完成任务后，教师表扬和鼓励幼儿数一数有几颗牙齿。

在观察纸质鳄鱼嘴巴模型时，隽恩认真观察鳄鱼头部的外形特征，积极参与讨论。当教师邀请幼儿猜测鳄鱼的牙齿数量时，隽恩大胆说出自己的猜测，并在数牙齿时表现出专注和耐心，使用手指逐一数出每颗牙齿，与猜测结果进行对比。轮到小组活动时，隽恩主动参与，他能完成数牙齿的任务，数完后自信地说出结果。


活动中，隽恩能积极与认真的完成活动，他能理解一个口头指示，并按照指示完成数鳄鱼牙齿的任务，展现了良好的倾听能力和执行力。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解1个口头指示并完成任务。

title: 记忆翻牌游戏
description:
教师展示高兴、伤心、生气、害怕的表情图，引导幼儿复习情绪词语并模仿表情。
教师和幼儿一起玩记忆翻牌游戏，翻牌时鼓励幼儿说出情绪名称并模仿对应表情，对于未找到匹配卡片的幼儿，鼓励其坚持尝试，完成任务。游戏结束后，教师带领幼儿围坐讨论，说说自己或朋友在什么情况下会感到高兴、伤心、生气或害怕。

在情绪表情复习活动中，天瑞积极观察教师展示的高兴、伤心、生气和害怕的表情图，能够准确说出情绪词语并模仿相应的表情。在记忆翻牌游戏中，天瑞专注寻找匹配的卡片，尽管有时未能找到正确的牌，但他表现出坚持尝试的态度，最终成功完成任务。讨论环节中，天瑞主动分享自己感到生气时的经历，并认真倾听同伴的分享，表现出良好的语言表达能力和社交互动能力。

天瑞能够准确说出和模仿高兴、伤心、生气和害怕的情绪表情，积极参与记忆翻牌游戏，表现出专注力和坚持不懈的态度。讨论中，天瑞主动分享自己的情绪经历，并认真倾听同伴的发言，展现了良好的语言表达能力和社交互动能力。

children.fullname: Heng Tian Rui Matthias (Xing Tian Rui)

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（读）- 文字：喜欢认字。

title: 云嘉的一周校园生活分享
description:
这里有一些云嘉来学校第一周的活动照片要和爸爸、妈妈分享。
经过一周的适应，云嘉可以和每位老师亲近，在老师的协助下参与各种活动，我们也期待可以看到云嘉的更多进展和进步唷！

learning_goals.title: 通过主要保育模式，培养婴幼儿的信任感和依恋关系

title: 云嘉的第二周校园生活分享
description:
时间过得飞快，云嘉已经来到学校两周的时间了！
总是笑咪咪的云嘉对校园环境越来越适应了！这周云嘉在学校有更多的体验，和老师一起做手工、探索课室各个角落、也可以在老师的鼓励下与朋友们一起参与体验活动，真的很开心云嘉可以适应新环境的人事物，快来看看云嘉在学校的回忆吧！

learning_goals.title: 在常规活动、互动和体验中，培养成人与婴幼儿之间的互动

title: Exploring the busy board
description:
During the classroom activity, the children were encouraged to engage with the busy board, using their hands to manipulate its various interactive elements. The teacher provided positive reinforcement, offering verbal encouragement and praise to support the children’s curiosity and engagement.

Layla displayed deep focus while exploring the busy board. She positioned herself on her tummy, using both hands to actively feel and manipulate different components. She experimented with pulling and pressing various items, demonstrating curiosity and a willingness to explore. She sustained engagement for approximately ten minutes before transitioning to another activity.
interpretation: This observation highlights Layla’s enjoyment and engagement in sensory play, as well as her ability to focus on a task for an extended period.

learning_goals.title: Foster enjoyment in playing with toys and materials

title: 二月第三周，模范动作。（Update）
description:
老师与她互动，教导她对敲玩具；然后听它发出声音。
她无论趴、坐、躺着，都会模范老师的动作，真棒！

learning_goals.title: 在常规活动、互动和体验中，培养成人与婴幼儿之间的互动

title: 我的博物馆
description: 在学习绘本故事《奥莉薇》 的过程中， 孩子们对有奥莉薇去的博物馆很感兴趣。 谦睿对于博物馆很好奇， 我们一起收集了一些关于博物馆的信息。 当我问他：“ 如果你有一个博物馆， 会是什么博物馆呢？” 他认真的想了想， 告诉我说：" 我要有一个汽车的博物馆， 然后这个旁边是很多的家” 于是我接着问， “那这个博物馆里都有什么呢？你能画出来给我看吗？” 谦睿听了很开心， 他迅速地拿出一张纸， 开始画了起来。 画完之后他主动在其他小朋友们面前做了分享与说话， 他告诉朋友们：“ 这是汽车博物馆。 这是一个个的家。 我画了很多的家， 因为人人都爱家， 从家出去这边就是汽车。 这个博物馆会在2025年4月5日开， 它是在我的家开。 ”
interpretation: 通过谦睿制作的海报， 可以看出他能够将自己的想象通过绘画的方式表现出来， 是创作能力的体现。 同时， 他能够使用简单的华语以小段话的方式表达出来， 说明他具有良好的沟通与表达能力， 能够自信地使用华语。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 表达：能针对某一个话题展开讨论。
语言学习成果（说）- 说华语：能熟练自如地讲华语。
语言学习成果（读）- 阅读：尝试制作图画书。

title: 我的博物馆
description: 在学习绘本故事《奥莉薇》 的过程中， 孩子们对有奥莉薇去的博物馆很感兴趣。 凱杰对于博物馆很好奇， 我们一起收集了一些关于博物馆的信息。 当我问他：“ 如果你有一个博物馆， 会是什么博物馆呢？” 他认真的想了想， 告诉我说：" 我要有一个恐龙的博物馆。” 于是我接着问， “那这个博物馆里都有什么呢？你能画出来给我看吗？” 凱杰听了很开心， 他迅速地拿出一张纸， 开始画了起来。 画完之后他主动在其他小朋友们面前做了分享与说话， 通过老师和朋友的协助， 他自信地分享到：“ 这是恐龙博物馆。 里面有恐龙， 我喜欢恐龙。这个博物馆要在2025年9月4日开， 在滨海湾。”
interpretation: 通过凱杰制作的海报， 可以看出他能够将自己的想象通过绘画的方式表现出来， 是创作能力的体现。 同时， 他能够使用简单的华语以小段话的方式表达出来， 说明他具有良好的沟通与表达能力， 能够自信地使用华语。

title: 我的博物馆
description: 在学习绘本故事《奥莉薇》 的过程中， 孩子们对有奥莉薇去的博物馆很感兴趣。 睿嘉对于博物馆很好奇， 我们一起收集了一些关于博物馆的信息。 当我问她：“ 如果你有一个博物馆， 会是什么博物馆呢？” 他认真的想了想， 告诉我说：" 我要有一个鲜花的博物馆。” 于是我接着问， “那这个博物馆里都有什么呢？你能画出来给我看吗？” 睿嘉听了很开心， 她迅速地拿出一张纸， 开始画了起来。 画完之后她主动在其他小朋友们面前做了分享与说话， 她告诉朋友们：“ 这是鲜花博物馆。 这是一朵朵的花。 我喜欢花， 它会让我很开心。 这个博物馆会在2025年12月8日开， 它是在后港。
interpretation: 通过睿嘉制作的海报， 可以看出她能够将自己的想象通过绘画的方式表现出来， 是创作能力的体现。 同时， 她能够她用简单的华语以小段话的方式表达出来， 说明她具有良好的沟通与表达能力， 能够自信地使用华语。

语言学习成果（读）- 阅读：尝试制作图画书。

title: Brown Bear, Brown Bear
description: Kaen was sitting with his friends in the library space when he picked up the book Brown Bear, Brown Bear by Eric Carle. He began flipping through the pages while singing the song that goes along with the book. He identified each character and finished singing before turning to the next page. When the teacher prompted him, Kaen continued singing and responded to questions like, “What is that?” as he described the pictures. In the following video, he successfully named the animals and their colours, saying things like, “a green frog,” “a blue horse,” and “a yellow duck.”
interpretation: Kaen’s actions show his developing language and cognitive skills. He is actively engaging with the book Brown Bear, Brown Bear by Eric Carle, demonstrating his ability to remember and recognise different animals and their colours. When Kaen sings the song, it shows his ability to describe and label objects, indicating his expanding vocabulary. "White Dog, white dog what do you see? I see a black sheep looking at me."

learning_goals.title: Foster language skills through practice and repetition
Foster language vocabulary through stories

title: 围栏漫步 PTC
description:
瑞泽用双手拉着围栏的栏杆借力站起来，然后手拉栏杆平木沿着围栏慢慢挪动脚步到转角，之后转到围栏的另一边，瑞泽对自己的活动轨迹很满足，露出开心的笑容。
瑞泽有很强的自信心，大胆的尝试新运动，也有很强烈的自我认同感会为自己成绩满足高兴！活动中也体现了瑞泽的大小肌肉发展都很好，手指的抓握能力力度，还有四肢的大肌肉都很有力量。

title: 我爱乐器 PTC
description: 瑞泽在玩具柜中选择了木琴，老师辅助瑞泽将木琴放到地板上并递给瑞泽敲击棒，瑞泽手拿敲击棒在木琴敲击，当木琴发出声音时瑞泽很开心，之后尝试敲击不同的琴片，瑞泽发现声音不同露出深思的表情，之后在不同的琴片上反复敲击尝试。活动中瑞泽发现声音的不同并不停探索，在探索中找到乐趣，并自我欣赏沉浸在自己的创作中。

title: 我看到我抓到 PTC
description: 老师放祥宏在软垫上仰卧，在祥宏视线适宜的角度吊起玩具，鼓励祥宏伸手抓握拉扯，祥宏开始只是观察，老师抓住一个玩具刚在祥宏手里让祥宏抓握，然后放开，祥宏开始自己伸手抓，开始还不是每次都能准确的抓到，祥宏不放弃一直伸手抓，直到抓住一次后，祥宏再次伸手时就会准确很多的抓到玩具，抓到玩具后拉扯再松开，反复动作，老师鼓励时还会看向老师，然后再继续。活动中祥宏掌握了手眼协调的初步发展，能坚持不断的尝试直到达到抓住的目标，并享受看到抓到的乐趣。

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development (grasping, holding to small objects, pushing small objects, pinching small objects, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：能用五指抓物品。
Foster hand-eye coordination (stretch to grasp objects, transfer things from one hand to another, etc.) 发展手眼协调能力，如：能伸手去抓东西；将物品从一只手转移到另一只手等。
Develop the sense of sight (through directing their attention to hanging mobiles, toys on the cot, etc.) 发展视觉能力，如：注视悬挂在床上的玩具并将手伸向玩具等。

title: 我们聊聊天 PTC
description: 老师让祥宏拉着老师的手来增加祥宏的安全和亲近的感觉，老师给祥宏讲故事，故事开始前老师说祥宏：“今天我们祥宏好帅啊！”老师会做出欣喜的表情，祥宏回应“哎哎…”的声音，老师又问：“祥宏想不想听故事啊？”祥宏还是回应轻轻的“啊啊…”声音。老师给祥宏讲了《毛毛虫》的故事，然后让祥宏看玩偶毛毛虫，拿给祥宏摸摸这就是毛毛虫，祥宏看的很认真。活动中老师会以对话的形式和祥宏沟通，祥宏听到后做出“依啊哎”的回应，这是幼儿早起语言发展的基础，幼儿有听到我们友好的声音，并轻柔的做出回应。

title: Match and Celebrate Pairs
description: During a numeracy pairing activity, the teacher provided a variety of items for the children to find and match things that are of a pair and would work well together. Thaddeus picked up a dustpan before reaching over for a cleaning brush. When asked to described how would the items be used together, Thaddeus then made a sweeping motion with the brush before moving it closer to the dustpan. The teacher then added a piece of paper acting as rubbish for Thaddeus to demonstrate using the items once more. Thaddeus then dramatized his actions again by showing how he swept up the piece of paper into the dustpan.
interpretation: The action of selecting a brush after picking up a dustpan reflected Thaddeus' ability to demonstrate a logical understanding that these two items are functionally related and typically used together. By making a sweeping motion and using the dustpan, Thaddeus also physically demonstrated the items' relationship through actions. He showed a good understanding of how the two objects work as a set, reinforcing the concept of pairing through practical application. Through his dramatization of sweeping up 'rubbish', Thaddeus additionally symbolically represented the purpose of the paired objects he had chosen. This is an important early numeracy skill, as it reflects making connections between objects and their functions.

learning_goals.title: Pair related objects (e.g: a cup to a saucer, a fork to a spoon)

title: Matching and Celebrate Pairs
description: During a numeracy pairing activity, the teacher provided a variety of items for the children to find and match things that are of a pair and would work well together. Diyansh first picked out a sharpener before reaching for a colour pencil next. When asked to describe his items and how they worked together, Diyansh could correctly name the items before explaining, "You use the sharpener to sharpen the colour pencil." Diyansh then went on to fit the pencil into the hole of the sharpener before making a twisting motion with the colour pencil to demonstrate how it would be sharpened.
interpretation: Diyansh demonstrated a good understanding of object relationships by selecting a sharpener and then correctly choosing a colour pencil — two items that naturally pair together. Diyansh's verbal explanation reflects his understanding of how the colour pencil and sharpener work together. By physically fitting the pencil into the sharpener and mimicking the twisting motion, Diyansh translated his verbal understanding into a hands-on demonstration. This shows he not only understands the conceptual relationship but also knows how to use the objects together in practice. Diyansh’s explanation and demonstration illustrates his awareness of cause and effect — understanding that using the sharpener on the pencil produces a specific outcome (a sharpened tip). This logical reasoning is an important part of early numeracy development.

learning_goals.title: Pair related objects (e.g: a cup to a saucer, a fork to a spoon)

title: Match and Celebrate Pairs
description: During a pairing activity, the teacher provided a variety of items for the class to find and match things that would work well together. Elly first reached for the plate and then a fork. When asked how would she used both items together, Elly started to bring the fork from the plate towards her mouth. She then said, "I can eat spaghetti like this." The teacher then replied, "Oh you use the fork to eat the spaghetti from the plate?" Elly nodded in response and spoke, "Yes" before twirling her fork and bringing it to her mouth to dramatize the action of eat spaghetti with a fork.
interpretation: By selecting a plate and then a fork, Elly demonstrated an understanding of functional object pairs. She recognized that these two items are commonly used together, showing her ability to match objects that have a practical relationship. Elly didn’t just name the objects — she acted out their use. By bringing the fork from the plate to her mouth and later twirling it, she physically demonstrated how the fork and plate work together during mealtime. This hands-on demonstration reinforced her good conceptual understanding of the pairing. Elly's association of the plate and fork with eating spaghetti, also reflects her ability to connect the objects to a real-life context. Through this activity, Elly shows her strong development of understanding relationships between objects, which is a foundational concept in early numeracy development.

learning_goals.title: Pair related objects (e.g: a cup to a saucer, a fork to a spoon)

title: 一月份：躲猫猫（PTC )
description:
活动目标：通过活动和游戏，初步发展物体恒存概念
记录与描述:
老师把筠心趴在地垫上，把玩具用手巾盖住，筠心立刻露出好奇的表情，目不转睛地盯着那块手巾。过了一会儿，小手开始行动，慢慢伸向手巾的一角，小心翼翼地拉开，露出了藏在下面的玩具。筠心成功找到玩具后，眼睛一亮，并发出声音，好像在说：“我找到你啦！”通过反复尝试、筠心会逐渐意识到即使玩具被手盖住、也不会真的消失。通过活动和游戏不仅吸引筠心的注意力、还帮助筠心初步发展物体恒存概念

learning_goals.title: That children become confident, curious, involved learners 婴幼儿是自信、好奇和投入的学习者。
Foster development of object permanence through activities, and games 通过活动和游戏，初步发展物体恒存概念。

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: 一月份：动物弹出玩具盒 （PTC )
description:
活动目标：发展手眼协调能力，如：能用五指抓物品
记录与描述：老师将动物弹出玩具放在依璇面前，吸引她的注意力。老师按下按钮，盖子打开，动物弹了出来，并夸张地说：“哇！动物出来了！”依璇看到动物弹出后，露出好奇的表情，目不转睛地盯着盖子和动物。老师继续按下其他按钮，展示不同的动物，每次都用愉快的语气说：“小动物出来了！”依璇对动物的出现表现出浓厚的兴趣，尝试用小手去触摸玩具，老师微笑着鼓励她探索和观察.
通过活动和游戏、发展手眼协调能力和专注力.

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development (grasping, holding to small objects, pushing small objects, pinching small objects, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：能用五指抓物品。
Foster hand-eye coordination (stretch to grasp objects, transfer things from one hand to another, etc.) 发展手眼协调能力，如：能伸手去抓东西；将物品从一只手转移到另一只手等。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation:
媖绮想象并绘制了奥莉薇一家去探望新出生的宝宝威廉，因为在故事开始前，作者提到也献给还没赶上绘本问世前出生的威廉。可能是感受到了奥莉薇的淘气个性，媖绮的作品中出现了猪宝宝在家的墙上绘画，妈妈回家后很生气的场景。

她的作品色彩丰富且包含了多个场景，体现了她对故事的理解和想象力。画面清晰，能够通过表情、动作和场景表达人物关系和情节发展。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：对书写汉字有兴趣。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation:
礼宣绘制了奥莉薇的两位不同的家庭成员，小猫可乐和老狗米花。他的作品很好的结合奥莉薇起床后和猫猫狗狗一起玩的情节。画面由两只拟人化的动物组成，分别对应于左右两页。明亮的蓝色、紫色和黄色使画面更有活力。动物的脚下还有绘本中原本的样子作为对比。

画面整体色彩丰富，形象生动，体现了他的创造力和对世界的独特观察。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 笔画与笔顺：主动地仿写短句。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation:
恺骏的作品由左右两个场景组成，左边背景是棕色，代表了奥莉薇的房间，他绘制了奥莉薇起床的情景。右侧使用了蓝绿色，代表奥莉薇走出卧室来到另一个场景。

恺骏将作品和自己的兴趣结合，奥莉薇起床后玩的拼图正式他最近喜爱的游戏。恺骏按照时间顺序表达了奥莉薇起床后的活动，情节发展明确。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：能够积极主动地用华语表达，态度自然。
语言学习成果（写）- 笔画与笔顺：主动地仿写短句。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation:
彦申绘制了奥莉薇起床要去海边玩从而感到非常开心的场景，因为她对奥莉薇去海边堆沙堡和晒成一条热狗的故事情节印象深刻。她的作品画面色彩鲜艳，线条简单明确，内容富有童趣。

她在绘制时添加了一些细节，如：奥莉薇的服饰、房间的布置，这些细节反映了她对故事情节的记忆和再创新高。

通过作品，彦申表达了对奥莉薇这一角色喜爱和共鸣。画中的场景从满了快乐和温馨的情感。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 笔画与笔顺：主动地仿写短句。

title: Work Sample - My Traffic Light Craft
description: As part of our exploration on the theme of "Transportation," Jayley engaged in creating her own traffic light craft using red, yellow, and green paint. With a paintbrush in hand, she eagerly transformed a plain paper plate into a bright, colorful signal. She began by carefully dotting her brush and marvelling at the imprints left behind. She soon explored working with different strokes and movements, gradually covering her paper plate with paint. Curious about the texture, she gently touched the paint with her fingers before continuing her masterpiece. When she was done, Jayley beamed with pride, excitedly smiling and pointing to her artwork. Through this activity, she explored colour recognition, creativity, and sensory experiences while having fun with art.

learning_goals.title: Foster an interest in art (drawing, painting, modelling, collage work etc.) 通过美术活动，如：粗蜡笔涂鸦、水彩画、撕贴画、拼贴等，培养幼儿对艺术的兴趣。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation:
馨琪的作品左侧是一栋带有黄色屋顶、粉色窗户的小房子。她绘制了奥莉薇和妈妈，是她心目中奥莉薇温馨的小家。右侧她绘制了奥莉薇刚起床，它要求妈妈给它读书的富有童真的内容。

馨琪的作品背景以淡蓝和紫色渲染为主，给人以宁静的感觉。作品内容展现出她对故事的理解，她记忆深刻的内容是奥莉薇在睡觉前要求妈妈为它几本书时的讨价还价的情景。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 笔画与笔顺：主动地仿写短句。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation:
子彬的故事左侧是一栋有红色屋顶的房子，屋内画着奥莉薇和弟弟小恩。屋内有玩具、花朵和灯，展现出家庭的温馨。右侧场景展现了奥莉薇在和弟弟进行户外捉迷藏。

作品画面采用了红色、绿色、粉色等鲜艳的色彩，使画面富有生机和童趣。绘画线条流畅，从构图、色彩和文字的搭配都展现了他的创造力和对绘本内容的理解。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 笔画与笔顺：主动地仿写短句。

description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation:
玫柔的作品画面整体颜色鲜艳，橙色、粉色、蓝色等颜色搭配出活泼的氛围，反应出她天真烂漫的绘画风格。她绘制了奥莉薇在墙上作画以及涂妈妈的口红的场景，以及妈妈开门后惊讶的表情。

这幅画从构图、色彩应用到文字描述，都展现了玫柔的艺术表达能力对故事的理解。

语言学习成果（写）- 笔画与笔顺：主动地仿写短句。

title: Toy Hunt
description:
The word "matching" was introduced to the children, and examples were given to help them understand the concept. A box with different toys was presented to the children, and they were invited to find the toy that matched the one they chose. Aydin chose the green bottle and began looking for its match. Aydin walked around the class, searching for the other green bottle in each corner. When Aydin couldn't find the bottle, I asked him if he needed help from his friends. Aydin replied, "No," and continued searching. Aydin was having a hard time finding the bottle, so I gave him a hint, saying, “Is it in the box?” referring to the wooden box. Aydin looked for the wooden box, and when he found it, he looked inside. With a smile, Aydin looked at me and said, “I found it!” I asked Aydin if the bottles matched or were the same, and he replied, “Yes.”

Aydin successfully matched two identical green bottles, demonstrating his ability to recognise and match identical objects showing an understanding of the concept of matching. Aydin effectively communicated his thoughts and feelings throughout the activity. He expressed his excitement and achievement by smiling and saying, “I found it!” Additionally, Aydin demonstrated persistence and independence by continuing to search for the matching bottle, even when he faced difficulty. His clear verbal communication and actions showed his ability to express his ideas and feelings effectively with others.

learning_goals.title: Match identical objects or pictures.

title: Toy Hunt
description:
The word "matching" was introduced to the children, and examples were given to help them understand the concept. A box with different toys was presented to the children, and they were invited to find the toy that matched the one they chose. Kyan chose the pink tube and began looking for its match. He walked around the class, focused on finding the other pink tube. I asked him, "What is the colour of your toy?" and Kyan replied, "Pink." I told Kyan to look for a pink toy to encourage him, and even his friends cheered for him, saying, "You can do it!" Kyan smiled and eagerly continued looking for the pink tube. He walked near the cubby, looked up, and found the other pink tube. Kyan said, "I found it." I asked Kyan if they matched, and he put the two pink tubes together, saying, "Yes."

Kyan successfully matched two pink tubes, demonstrating his ability to recognise and match identical objects. Kyan experienced feelings of focus and determination as he worked to find the matching toy. Additionally, the encouragement from his peers, as they cheered him on with phrases like "You can do it!" helped foster a sense of support and positive social interaction.

learning_goals.title: Match identical objects or pictures.

title: Obstacle
description:
The obstacle course was set up, and the children were invited to explore it. Eldrin, full of excitement, climbed onto the first arch. When he reached the second arch, he paused and began thinking about how he would get down. While trying to balance himself, Eldrin attempted to climb down while facing forward, but he struggled with the descent. I asked if he needed help and offered my hand for him to hold. Eldrin took my hand and carefully descended the arch. Afterward, Eldrin knelt down and crawled under the arch, making sure it didn't move. With careful attention and determination, Eldrin successfully completed all the obstacles and, feeling confident, asked to do another round.

Eldrin was full of confidence, displaying his strength and abilities. Throughout the activity, he managed to move with balance and control.

learning_goals.title: Move with balance and control.

title: Match and Celebrate Pair
description:
A box with different objects was presented to the children, and the concept of pairing was explained by demonstrating an example. Each child was invited to choose the item they liked, and Eldrin chose a pencil. I asked him, “What is a pencil for? How do you use it?” Eldrin mimed drawing with the pencil. I invited Eldrin to stand in front and look for his friend who was holding an item that would pair with the pencil. Eldrin said, “Paper,” and Solomon immediately stood up beside him. I asked both of them how to use the items they were holding. Solomon placed the paper on the chair, and Eldrin used the pencil to draw on it. Eldrin happily drew on the paper.

Eldrin displayed an understanding of the concept of pairing related objects. He demonstrated an enthusiastic attitude and interacted positively with his teachers and friends.

learning_goals.title: Pair related objects (e.g: a cup to a saucer, a fork to a spoon)

title: This is Me
description:
The children were introduced to journal writing, and the question to reflect on was, "Can you draw your face and tell me what makes it special?" Engracia began making marks and drawing shapes. While drawing her hair, she said, “Teacher Chari, this is my Elsa hair.” I replied, “That is nice hair.” Engracia smiled and continued drawing her face. Once she was done, I asked, “Could you share with me what you drew?” Engracia shared, “This is my hair, Elsa hair. I like Elsa.” I asked her again, “Is that what makes you special?” She answered yes. Engracia continued sharing what she drew, saying things like, “My mouth is here,” “This is my face,” and “I like my hair.”

During the activity, Engracia showed great interest and enthusiasm in drawing her face portrait using lines and shapes and sharing her thoughts. While sharing, she could communicate her thoughts and feelings about her face portrait and how much she likes Elsa.

learning_goals.title: Use letter-like shapes, symbols and letters to convey meaning.

title: Five Senses
description:
The ‘Talking Tub’ was presented to the children, and they were invited to take one object. Solomon searched the box and quickly took the sunglasses, saying, “I have eyeglasses at home, too.” Once everyone had an object from the box, they were invited to describe it. A friend passed the scented tissue to Solomon, and I invited her to share her observation. Solomon smelled the scented tissue and asked, “What is this smell?” I answered, “That’s a mint smell. Do you like it?” Solomon smiled and said yes. When it was Solomon’s turn to share, he described the sunglasses by saying, “I wear eyeglasses when it's a sunny day.” Then, I encouraged him to look at the board and point to the body part we use the sunglasses on. He immediately pointed to the eyes and tried to place the sunglasses on the eye picture. Solomon laughed when I noticed what he had done.

Throughout the activity, Solomon observed and talked about the scented tissue and sunglasses. He also demonstrated the ability to describe the use of sunglasses, specifically their use for the eyes, and engaged in a conversation about smell. As Solomon described the sunglasses and made connections between the object and his own experiences (wearing eyeglasses on sunny days), he demonstrated self-awareness and confidence in sharing his thoughts.

learning_goals.title: Observe and talk about living things, non-living things, places and events.

title: Five Senses
description:
The 'Talking Tub' activity was introduced to the children, and each child was invited to select an object. Gemma chose a mouth flashcard and, together with Liv, showed it to the group. I asked Gemma, "What body part is this?" In a soft voice, Gemma replied, "Mouth." I then asked the group, "What is the function of the mouth?" The children responded, "To eat food."
After discussing body parts, the children were encouraged to explore the other objects in the tub. A tissue with a mint scent was handed to each child, and Gemma was asked if she liked the smell. She shook her head and passed the tissue back to me. The next item, a rock, was given to Gemma. After briefly touching it, she handed it to her peer. Solomon, who was behind Gemma, asked her, "Is it heavy?" Gemma responded by nodding her head.

Gemma observed and interacted with various non-living objects, such as the mint-scented tissue and the rock. She explored the objects presented to her through touch and smell, which required her to observe their properties (e.g., the texture of the rock, the scent of the tissue). During the activity, Gemma demonstrated her ability to recognize and express her personal preferences and emotions in a social setting. The interaction between Solomon and Gemma shows that she is able to engage in conversation and respond appropriately to her peers, demonstrating social awareness and communication skills.

children.fullname: Gemma Koh Yu Xuan (Xu Yu Xuan)

learning_goals.title: Observe and talk about living things, non-living things, places and events.

title: Numicon Color Match and Sort
description:
A Numicon set was introduced to the children, and the concept of sorting was explained. An example was demonstrated to help them understand the activity. Jasmine and her friends were invited to sort the Numicon toys by colour. Jasmine selected the plate with blue paper, indicating that she needed to look for the blue Numicon toys. Once the Numicon toys were laid out in front of them, Jasmine and her friends began sorting. Jasmine carefully searched for the blue Numicon pieces and placed them on her plate. While sorting, Jasmine came across a pink Numicon and kindly gave it to Engracia to help her. Together, Jasmine and her friends successfully sorted all the Numicon toys, showing great teamwork and focus.

Jasmine displayed an enthusiastic attitude while doing the activity and demonstrated a clear understanding of how to sort the toys by colour.

learning_goals.title: Sort one category of objects from an assortment of objects.

title: Obstacle
description:
The obstacle course was set up, and the children were invited to explore it. Naomi began with the cones and stones, carefully stepping on each one with great balance, making sure she reached the end. When she arrived at the arch, she approached it cautiously and slowly climbed onto it. Stretching her legs, Naomi reached for the other side of the arch and landed safely on the ground. Naomi completed all the obstacles with confidence, demonstrating excellent body coordination and control throughout the course.

Naomi displayed confidence and demonstrated her strength, managing to move with both balance and control throughout the course.

learning_goals.title: Move with balance and control.

title: Exploring Bubbles
description: The educarer placed a container filled with soap and water in front of Elijah. She then dipped her hand into the tub and moved it around to create bubbles. Afterward, she encouraged Elijah to do the same, asking him to move his hand back and forth inside the tub to form more bubbles. Once there were plenty of bubbles, Elijah scooped them up with one hand and clapped with excitement. When he clapped, he noticed the bubbles splashed all over his face and body. Delighted, he repeated the action several times. When the bubbles were gone from his hand, he continued to scoop and clap, making sure the bubbles splashed all over again. Elijah had so much fun scooping and splashing the bubbles repeatedly.
interpretation: Elijah was able to follow simple, one-step instructions, demonstrating an awareness of how his actions lead to certain outcomes and actively trying to make things happen. He shows a high level of happiness, trust, confidence, vitality, curiosity, and engages in positive interactions. During this activity, he was able to maintain interest and curiosity for several minutes. Elijah also demonstrated an understanding of cause and effect, noticing how actions impact one another. Overall, he sustained intense focus and involvement, showing concentration, energy, and persistence. Great job, Elijah!

learning_goals.title: Foster understanding of cause and effect through engagement with toys, materials and books 通过玩有回馈动作的玩具（如：按压一个会嘎嘎叫的玩具）、探索材料（如：吹泡泡）和阅读书籍等活动，初步发展婴幼儿对于因果关系的感知。

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: Peek-a-boo, Where are you?
description: The educarer began singing the "Peek-a-boo, Where are you?" song. Elijah then approached Miya, who was near the mirror, and faced her while covering his face. The educarer said, "Elijah, Peek-a-boo, where’s Miya?" Elijah removed his hand and stared directly at Miya before repeating the action. This time, the educarer asked, "Can you cover your ear? Where’s your ear?" Elijah and Miya then took turns covering their ears and other facial features, such as their head, nose, and mouth. They both observed each other closely while the educarer asked about the locations of the different facial features. Elijah seemed to guide Miya in identifying the facial features; when the educarer asked, "Where’s your head?" Elijah pointed to his own head first, while Miya watched and then imitated the same action. Well done, Elijah, for guiding Miya along!
interpretation: From this activity, we observed that Elijah’s self-conscious emotions seem to emerge in the presence of others. He clearly enjoys guiding and showing his friends that he understands what the educarer is saying. Elijah also displays a high level of happiness, trust, confidence, vitality, curiosity, and engages in positive interactions with his peers. He was able to label several emotions and actions based on the educarer's prompts, demonstrating his ability to connect his feelings with his social behaviors. By performing the correct actions and guiding his friends through the activity, Elijah showcased a strong sense of self-concept and self-esteem, as well as a developing self-identity, particularly through his identification of different facial features. He also demonstrated sustained involvement, concentration, energy, and persistence throughout the activity, interacting and engaging well with his friends.

learning_goals.title: Foster interactions between children during routines and experiences 在常规活动、互动和体验中，培养婴幼儿之间的互动。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: Twist the bottle cover
description: The educarer handed Elijah a cupboard filled with different-sized bottle caps for him to explore. The educarer first demonstrated how to twist open the bottle caps using just his fingers. Afterward, the educarer ensured that the caps were not twisted too tightly, making it easier for Elijah to open them. When Elijah took over, he quickly understood the task and seemed confident in twisting open the bottle caps, regardless of their size. In just a few seconds, he was able to twist the caps open, often trying to open two at once—one in each hand. While he was usually able to open the bottle cap with his right hand, he didn’t give up when the other hand had difficulty. After having two bottle caps in his hands, Elijah even tried mixing them up, placing them in different combinations, but noticed that the sizes didn’t fit as well. Elijah continued this activity for a good 5-10 minutes.
interpretation: From this activity, we observed that Elijah is always very interested in exploring new activities. He demonstrated sustained involvement throughout the task, showing concentration, energy, and persistence by not giving up easily. Elijah was able to pick up the smallest bottle caps, displaying a well-coordinated pincer grasp as he twisted the caps open. Although he attempted to use both hands, he primarily used his right hand, indicating a preference for it. He also displayed a high level of happiness and confidence as he successfully twisted the caps open. His curiosity was evident when he mixed up the bottle caps, but in the end, he was able to match them back to their original places correctly. Keep up the curiosity, Elijah, and continue to be excited to explore new things

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development (grasping, holding to small objects, pushing small objects, pinching small objects, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：能用五指抓物品。
Foster hand-eye coordination (stretch to grasp objects, transfer things from one hand to another, etc.) 发展手眼协调能力，如：能伸手去抓东西；将物品从一只手转移到另一只手等。

title: Guess Who?
description:
Maeve was invited to play a game of ‘Guess Who?’ with her friends. Standing behind the blanket, Maeve had to name the friend standing across her when the blanket was lifted up. “Are you ready?” the teacher asked. “Yes!” she squealed and beamed excitedly. “Alright, close your eyes!” Maeve closed her eyes. “And open! Who’s standing in front of you?” the teacher asked. Maeve waited for a while before saying, “Caden! Ethan!” 

Maeve indicated her interest to try again and eagerly said, “I want!” As the teacher readied her and said, “1, 2, 3! Open!” Maeve leaned in to get a good look of her friend and exclaimed, “Ethan! Hello, Ethan!” The teacher praised her stating that it was a good game.
interpretation: Maeve fostered a sense of self and others when she named her friends in the game. While playing, she showed excitement to interact with her friends by displaying pro-social behaviours such as leaning towards her friends and smiling at them. Maeve also fostered a sense of trust in her teacher as she comfortably interacted and followed her lead in the game.

learning_goals.title: Foster interactions, attachment and relationships with adults and children 通过与成人和同伴的互动，建立良好的关系。
Foster sense of self (telling others their names) 培养自我意识，如：说出自己的名字等。
Foster sense of others (saying out the names of their peers) 培养对他人的认识，如：说出同伴的名字等。
Foster appropriate skills to regulate own behaviour and feelings 了解并用词语来表达自己的情绪，发展幼儿调节自己行为和情绪的能力。
Foster social skills at all times – routines, interactions and activities 在常规活动、互动和体验中，培养社会交往技能。
Foster sense of self-concept and identity 培养自我概念和认同感，如：能使用代词“我”。
Foster sense of belonging in a group 发展幼儿的集体归属感，如：能说出自己的小组或班级的名称等。
Foster sense of well-being 通过与培育师和同伴间的积极互动，培养幼儿的幸福感。
Foster a sense of trust in adults 通过回应与互动，培养幼儿对成人的信任感。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: Self-Portrait Show and Tell
description:
Cyrus was excited to share his self-portrait with his friends. The teacher marveled at his self-portrait and asked, “Cyrus, can you show your friend where your hair is?” Cyrus looked at his self-portrait and pointed to the hair and said, “This my hair!” “How about your eyes?” The teacher asked. Cyrus replied, “Here are my eyes!” “Can you point to your friend? Where is your mouth?” The teacher furthered her question. Cyrus pointed to the mouth and said, “My mouth!”

“The self-portrait looked so much like you; who did it with you?” The teacher commented. Cyrus thought for a while and replied, “My mama did it with me!” “Aw, your mama did it with you? That’s really sweet!” Cyrus beamed brightly as his friends applauded him for his sharing.
interpretation: Cyrus showed the ability to understand and comprehend the teacher's spoken language and questions. Then, he confidently expressed himself with two-three words phrases to communicate the features of his self-portrait to his friends.

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: 小手创意画——毛毛虫
description:
描述：
　　教师向幼儿展示毛毛虫的图片，请幼儿观察毛毛虫，引导幼儿说出这是毛毛虫。然后向幼儿介绍做美术活动所需的材料以及活动流程。
　　轩伊走到桌子旁边，摸了摸桌子上的“毛毛虫”的头，教师问轩伊：“你想要做美术活动吗？”轩伊点了点头。然后她坐在桌子前，接过粘有“毛毛虫”的头的白纸，将其放在桌子上面，拿起笔刷蘸取绿色的颜料，将颜料涂在手上面，然后将小手上的颜料拓印在白纸上，教师指着白纸对轩伊说：“轩伊，你的小手也要拍拍这里哦。（毛毛虫的头的后面）”轩伊看着教师点了点头，然后再次将小手涂满颜料，然后用小手继续拍打白纸，当整张白纸都是绿色后，轩伊告诉老师她做完了。教师对轩伊竖起大拇指并说道：“轩伊，你的毛毛虫是胖胖的呦。”轩伊笑着说：“胖胖的。”
interpretation:
诠释：

      轩伊主动要做“毛毛虫”的美术活动，展现出轩伊对美术活动感兴趣。在进行活动中，她也能够在教师的引导下完成美术活动。她也能够说出简单的华文词汇。

Maeve replied, “Smiling! I make a happy face!” “And where is your hair?” The teacher furthered her question. Maeve pointed to the hair and said, “I cut the hair!”

“The self-portrait looked so much like you; who did it with you?” The teacher commented. Maeve thought for a while and replied, “My mama did it with me! And my papa too!" “Aw, your mama did it with you? That’s really sweet!” Maeve beamed brightly as her friends applauded her for her sharing.
interpretation: Maeve showed the ability to understand and comprehend the teacher's spoken language and questions. Then, she confidently expressed herself with four-five words in a sentence to communicate the features of her self-portrait to her friends.

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: 作品分析
description:
围绕绘本《逃家小兔》幼儿们掌握了句式：如果你变成、、我就变成、、在创意美术的延申课程中，幼儿们继续围绕句式“如果你变成……，我就变成……”展开丰富的想象，设计并制作了一本独特的剪贴画小书。他们挑选多种颜色的彩纸，运用剪、贴、画等方式，将自己的奇思妙想变成具体的图画和文字。
 灵熙说：“如果你变成小猫，我就变成照顾猫的人。”她用篮色和黄色的彩纸剪出想要的图案，让画面生动有趣。
 通过这次活动，幼儿不仅锻炼了动手能力，还培养了想象力和表达能力。在翻阅自己制作的小书时，他们脸上洋溢着自豪和喜悦。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 倾听：能认真有礼貌地倾听别人讲话，能辨别声调、语调的不同，有良好的倾听习惯。
语言学习成果（听）- 倾听：能听出一段话的要点。
语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解3个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（听）- 欣赏文学作品：喜欢倾听故事，在语言的引导下能对故事展开想象，体会故事描述的情景和表达的感情。
语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：能够积极主动地用华语表达，态度自然。
语言学习成果（说）- 表达：能清楚连贯地表达事情经过。
语言学习成果（说）- 表达：能针对某一个话题展开讨论。
语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（说）- 说华语：能熟练自如地讲华语。

title: 我的博物馆
description: 在学习绘本故事《奥莉薇》 的过程中， 孩子们对有奥莉薇去的博物馆很感兴趣。 Miles对于博物馆很好奇， 我们一起收集了一些关于博物馆的信息。 当我问他：“ 如果你有一个博物馆， 会是什么博物馆呢？” 他认真的想了想， 告诉我说：" 我要有一个蛇的博物馆。” 于是我接着问， “那这个博物馆里都有什么呢？你能画出来给我看吗？” Miles听了很开心， 他迅速地拿出一张纸， 开始画了起来。 画完之后他主动在其他小朋友们面前做了分享与说话， 他告诉朋友们：“ 这是蛇博物馆。 这是一条条的蛇。 我画了很多蛇， 因为我喜欢。 这个博物馆会在2025年5月3日开， 它是在滨海湾。 ”
interpretation: 通过Miles制作的海报， 可以看出他能够将自己的想象通过绘画的方式表现出来， 是创作能力的体现。 同时， 他能够使用简单的华语以小段话的方式表达出来， 说明他具有良好的沟通与表达能力， 能够自信地使用华语。

learning_goals.title: 运用观察和想象力创作平面和立体的艺术作品：通过其它的媒介（如：蜡或墨汁）或不同素材来探索画的特性。
描述和讨论他们对各种艺术品的所见、所闻和所感。

title: 作品分析
description:
围绕绘本《逃家小兔》幼儿们掌握了句式：如果你变成、、我就变成、、在创意美术的延申课程中，幼儿们继续围绕句式“如果你变成……，我就变成……”展开丰富的想象，设计并制作了一本独特的剪贴画小书。他们挑选多种颜色的彩纸，运用剪、贴、画等方式，将自己的奇思妙想变成具体的图画和文字。
 诗雅说：“如果你变成飞机，我就变成蓝天。”她用篮色和粉色的彩纸剪出想要的图案，让画面生动有趣。
 通过这次活动，幼儿不仅锻炼了动手能力，还培养了想象力和表达能力。在翻阅自己制作的小书时，他们脸上洋溢着自豪和喜悦。

title: 作品分析——《生气的脸》
description:
《生气的脸》活动围绕绘本《菲菲生气了——非常、非常的生气》展开，帮助幼儿认识和表达“生气”这一情绪，并通过语言与艺术创作加深理解。活动开始时，教师展示生气表情的照片，引导幼儿观察并描述表情特征，如皱眉和撅嘴。随后，幼儿通过照镜子模仿生气表情，并用华语表达自己的观察。接着，幼儿使用马克笔在纸盘上绘制“生气的脸”，再通过双面胶、吸管、扭扭棒等材料进行装饰，进一步展现情绪感受。最后，幼儿展示作品并参与整理材料，培养责任感。活动提升了幼儿的语言表达能力和创造力，帮助他们更好地理解和管理情绪。


  黄子睿在创作过程中，首先使用纸盘作为作品的基础背景。他使用黑色马克笔绘制脸部的基本轮廓，包括眉毛、眼睛和嘴巴，并通过夸张的线条表现生气的情绪。之后，他进一步丰富作品，选择了彩色扭扭棒和吸管进行装饰。他用橙色扭扭棒制作嘴巴和眉毛，使五官更加立体，同时用蓝色和绿色的吸管装饰额头，增强作品的视觉层次感。
interpretation: 子睿作品以纸盘为基础，通过马克笔、吸管和扭扭棒进行创作，表现“生气的脸”。作品中，眉毛和嘴巴使用直线描绘，线条粗细均匀，五官特征清晰。眉毛位置略向下倾斜，表现情绪特征。吸管以绿色和蓝色为主，分布在纸盘的上方，用于表现头部装饰，排列整齐，增加了整体的结构感。红色扭扭棒用于嘴部装饰，呈现曲线，突出了嘴巴的表情特征。整体作品在五官与装饰元素的结合上展现了明确的层次感。幼儿在创作时模仿生气表情，通过皱眉和张嘴的行为为作品增添了真实性，使用材料时动作协调，能够自主完成主要部分。

learning_goals.title: 描述和说明他们在艺术作品中的想法和构思，开始有意识地把各种艺术元素组织在一起，创造出艺术视觉表现，如：用颜色表达情感；用线条营造动感；用模板创作各种图案。
谈论他们朋友的作品。

title: Bus
description: The teacher introduced a new storybook titled "We All Go Traveling By" to the children. Davi listened attentively as the teacher read the story. When the bus appeared in the book, Davi immediately pointed at it and identified it, and his teacher acknowledged his response. As the story continued, Davi continued to point at the bus every time it appeared. At the end of the story, the book showed various pictures of transportation, and Davi pointed at each one, looking at his teacher. The teacher would then identify each  transportation as Davi pointed them out.
interpretation: This observation shows that Davi demonstrates interest in the storybook as he listens attentively to his teacher and identifies the bus in the story. Davi is also developing his language skills, as he points at the pictures and seeks the teacher's help in identifying them.

learning_goals.title: Foster language and expression through songs, stories and rhymes 通过歌曲、故事和儿歌，培养幼儿的理解和用简单的字、词表达的能力。

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: Peek a boo friends
description: The children were introduced to a learning material called "Peek-a-Boo Friends." They were encouraged to open the lid and guess who was inside. Davi was given a peek-a-boo friend board, opened the lid, and saw Laoshi’s picture. He looked at the teacher, and the teacher explained who the person inside the lid was. Davi then opened another lid and found a photo of his friend. He looked at the teacher, who asked if it was his picture. Davi simply looked at the teacher, took another board, and when he finally discovered his own picture, he smiled and pointed at it.
interpretation: This observation shows that Davi is developing a sense of self as he explores the peek-a-boo board, actively searching for his own picture. It also demonstrates his ability to recognize that the person in the first few pictures was not himself.

learning_goals.title: Foster sense of self (responding to their names) 培养自我意识，如：回应自己的名字等。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: scribbling
description: Davi was invited to participate in a scribbling experience. He immediately sat down in the chair, and was given a piece of paper and a basket of crayons. Without hesitation, Davi took a pink crayon with his left hand. He then began to scribble with an upward and downward motion, using a digital pronate grasp (with his palm facing down and little finger facing the ceiling, holding the crayon with all of his fingers resting against the palm). Afterward, Davi picked up a white crayon with his left hand, then shifted it to his right hand, maintaining the same grasp. He continued by scribbling in a sideways motion.
interpretation: Davi’s scribbling expereince fosters his fine motor skills. He used his left hand to hold the crayon with a grip where his fingers wrapped around it, showing control. When he switched to his right hand, he was able to use the same grip, which shows that he’s developing coordination between both hands.

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development ( pick up objects using pincer grasp, hold crayon to scribble, fasten/unfasten zippers/buttons, screw, unscrew bottle caps, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：用大拇指、食指及中指（三指）抓物品、拉拉链、扣纽扣、拧瓶盖等。

title: 幼儿作品--蛇年大吉
description:
老师邀请小朋友们参与手工制作--蛇年大吉的活动。老师提供材料：纸盘、彩色颜料、毛笔、胶水、裁剪好的舌头、假眼睛、彩色圆形贴纸若干。请小朋友们选择自己喜欢的颜色，绘画在纸盘上。纸盘上的颜色干后，老师帮助幼儿裁剪出蛇的形状，邀请幼儿粘贴蛇的假眼睛、舌头和花纹。
小朋友们基本可以参与手工制作活动，并且可以尝试说：“蛇”，模仿出蛇发出：“嘶嘶”的声音。同时可以选择自己喜欢的颜色，涂画在纸盘上。最后在老师的引导下，粘贴好小蛇的眼睛、舌头和圆形贴纸当作小蛇的花纹。
interpretation: 通过手工活动蛇年大吉，小朋友们进一步了解蛇的名称和样子。同时增强了自身的绘画能力，促进手要协调能力和手部小肌肉的发展。

learning_goals.title: Communication and Language Development - Art 沟通与语言发展 - 审美与创意表达-美术
Foster an interest in art (drawing, painting, modelling, collage work etc.) 通过美术活动，如：粗蜡笔涂鸦、水彩画、撕贴画、拼贴等，培养幼儿对艺术的兴趣。

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: Create my Snake!
description:
In the images, he is seen using a paintbrush with a firm grip, carefully selecting colours from the watercolour palette to apply onto a paper plate to decorate his snake. His brush strokes appear deliberate, indicating a growing control over fine motor skills and an emerging ability to express himself through art. Morgan shows focus and concentration as he experiments with different colours and brush movements, illustrating an awareness of artistic techniques and an appreciation for aesthetic expression. Additionally, Morgan is observed attempting to cut along a drawn outline on a paper plate to transform it into a paper snake. As he move his thumb and index finger in a pinching movement, he tried to cut along the curved line. However, his cuts would make it through the paper plate, resulting in cutting small pieces of paper plate out. Morgan did not give up and decided to paste his pieces of paper plate onto another A4-sized paper in a shape of a snake.

Morgan engages positively in shared creative activities alongside his peers. While working on his craft, he appears focused on his task, yet remains comfortable in the presence of others, demonstrating a balance between independent creativity and social awareness. His engagement with art suggests a sense of confidence and enjoyment, which contributes to his overall emotional well-being.
interpretation: Morgan demonstrates a strong engagement in artistic activities, displaying both curiosity and intentionality in his creative process. He also displays his budding ability to use scissors with some control. His hand-eye coordination  are evident as he attempts to follow the lines, suggesting a developing confidence in crafting and manipulating materials. His engagement in these tasks highlights his enthusiasm for creative exploration and his ability to execute artistic ideas with intentionality.

learning_goals.title: Experiment with a variety of tools (e.g: hands/fingers/feet, roller, sponge, paint brush) for drawing, printing and painting.
Represent things in the environment through artwork.

title: Train Structure Exploration
description:
Eva approached the netted rope bridge inside the train structure at the Tiong Bahru Park with a look of curiosity and determination. She carefully placed one hand on the rope and leaned forward, peeking through the gaps to see the sand far below. “I am so tall now! I see Teacher Debra!” she told the teacher, her voice tinged with excitement. The teacher assured her it was safe, encouraging her to explore. Eva tested the ropes by pressing them gently with her foot. “It is wriggly and wobbly!” she exclaimed, giggling as she felt the ropes shift slightly under her weight. She then crouched down, using her hands to feel the texture of the rope, and commented, “Look! I can stay on it. I am not falling down.” The teacher explained that the ropes are braided tightly to make them strong, sparking Eva’s fascination as she observed how the individual strands were intertwined.

As Eva leaned over the edge to look at the ropes below, she spotted something colorful. “There’s something red down there!” she said, pointing eagerly. She adjusted her position, stretching her arm slightly to try and reach it through the netting. Although she couldn’t grab it, her interest didn’t wane. “See, Aria. Our friends are there,” she cheered as she continue looking through the netting.

Eva demonstrated strong social and emotional competencies through her curiosity and engagement with her surroundings. She expressed excitement and enthusiasm in sharing her discoveries with her teacher and peers, showing effective communication skills. Her willingness to explore the rope bridge, despite its wobbly nature, reflected her resilience and ability to manage emotions in new situations.
interpretation: From this observation, Eva displays her curious observations and verbalising them to her teachers and friends around her. She also beginning to connect the data that she had gather during her observations and share them with her peers cheerfully. With more guidance, Eva can make more meaningful connections to her prior knowledge and surroundings around her.

learning_goals.title: Observe and talk about living things, non-living things, places and events.
Encourage children to look out for interesting things and the changes occuring in their immediate environment.

title: 幼儿作品——可爱的小手
description:
老师邀请小朋友们参与可爱的小手印画活动。老师提供材料彩色颜料、毛笔、卡纸、假眼睛、棉棒、胶水、纸盘、装饰材料若干。请小朋友们选择喜欢的颜色挤在纸盘上，使用毛笔涂画在小手上，然后在印画在卡纸上，待印画的小手干了后，小朋友们使用棉棒沾取胶水，选择喜欢的装饰品粘贴在小手上，独一无二的可气的小手就制作好了。
小朋友们基本上可以参与印画小手的活动，并可以独立选择喜欢的颜色挤在纸盘上。部分小朋友们在印画过程中需要帮助，但是大部分小朋友们都能独立选择自己喜欢的装饰材料，粘贴在小手上。
interpretation: 通过制作印画可爱的小手活动，小朋友们可以进一步加深了解自己的小手，可以尝试说出：”手“。同时使用棉棒沾取胶水，粘贴自己喜欢的装饰材料，促进手眼协调和手部精细动作的发展。

learning_goals.title: Foster an interest in art (drawing, painting, modelling, collage work etc.) 通过美术活动，如：粗蜡笔涂鸦、水彩画、撕贴画、拼贴等，培养幼儿对艺术的兴趣。

title: 幼儿作品——可爱的小手
description:
老师邀请小朋友们参与可爱的小手印画活动。老师提供材料彩色颜料、毛笔、卡纸、假眼睛、棉棒、胶水、纸盘、装饰材料若干。请小朋友们选择喜欢的颜色挤在纸盘上，使用毛笔涂画在小手上，然后在印画在卡纸上，待印画的小手干了后，小朋友们使用棉棒沾取胶水，选择喜欢的装饰品粘贴在小手上，独一无二的可气的小手就制作好了。
小朋友们基本上可以参与印画小手的活动，并可以独立选择喜欢的颜色挤在纸盘上。部分小朋友们在印画过程中需要帮助，但是大部分小朋友们都能独立选择自己喜欢的装饰材料，粘贴在小手上。
interpretation: 通过制作印画可爱的小手活动，小朋友们可以进一步加深了解自己的小手，可以尝试说出：”手“。同时使用棉棒沾取胶水，粘贴自己喜欢的装饰材料，促进手眼协调和手部精细动作的发展。

learning_goals.title: Foster an interest in art (drawing, painting, modelling, collage work etc.) 通过美术活动，如：粗蜡笔涂鸦、水彩画、撕贴画、拼贴等，培养幼儿对艺术的兴趣。

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: 二月第四周：自主握奶瓶，快乐喝奶 （Update )
description: 在常规喂奶时间里，依璇熟练地用双手握住奶瓶，偶尔还会调皮地换成单手，一边稳稳地抓着奶瓶，一边轻轻握住枕头的边缘，舒适地依偎在柔软的枕头上，享受着安静而满足的喝奶时光，直到把奶喝得一滴不剩。

learning_goals.title: Foster sense of independence and well-being and awareness of  taking care of self 开始配合穿衣等常规活动，初步培养自理意识。

title: Work Sample: Self-Portrait
description: Children were invited to create their own self-portraits using a combination of art tools, including pencils, black zebra markers, and watercolour paints. This allowed them to explore different art techniques such as drawing, tracing and painting. Each portrait is a reflection of the child's unique artistic expression in the lines, shapes and colours they use.

learning_goals.title: Experiment with a variety of media (e.g. marker, crayon, paint, chalk, play dough)

title: 二月份：听见名字，快乐回应 ( PTC )
description: 在常规活动中，当老师轻柔地呼唤依璇的名字时，依璇立刻敏锐地做出反应，迅速转过头来，专注地望着老师的脸。小小的眼睛里闪烁着好奇的光芒，仿佛在认真聆听。随着老师的动作变化，幼儿也兴奋地模仿起来，有时张开小嘴，像是在学着发声，有时又低下头，似乎在思考或害羞地笑。这样的互动，如同一场默契的交流，让依璇在温暖的陪伴中，逐渐认识自己的名字，也享受着与成人沟通的乐趣。

learning_goals.title: Develop sense of self (connecting themselves to their names) 发展自我意识，如：聆听自己的名字。
Develop a sense of security through educators’ responses to infants 通过培育师的及时回应，建立婴幼儿的安全感。
Foster interactions between children during routines and experiences 在常规活动、互动和体验中，培养婴幼儿之间的互动。

title: 二月份:摸一摸，拿一拿 （PTC ）
description: 老师轻轻地将一个小篮子放在筠心面前，篮子里装着松果和小小的纸圆筒，等待着小手去探索。筠心好奇地伸出手，仔细挑选着，捏起一颗松果翻看，又轻轻放回。接着，筠心又拿起纸圆筒，试着摇一摇、敲一敲，感受不同的触感。忽然，筠心眼睛一亮，抓起整个篮子，兴奋地倾斜着，似乎想看看里面的东西会不会全部倒出来。小小的动作中，流露出满满的专注与好奇。

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development (grasping, holding to small objects, pushing small objects, pinching small objects, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：能用五指抓物品。
Foster hand-eye coordination (stretch to grasp objects, transfer things from one hand to another, etc.) 发展手眼协调能力，如：能伸手去抓东西；将物品从一只手转移到另一只手等。

title: 流水
description: 邀请恩熙坐在浴盆里后，老师把放入了舀水容器的水盆放在她的前面对她说：“恩熙，看！盆里有清清的水，它没有动！老师把它用水勺舀起来，举高，倒！…”在水流下来的时候，恩熙抬头定睛看向水柱，稍后，她也分别看了老师用玩具洒水器和小帆船等为恩熙展示了水流下的水柱。当老师做完水流展示之后老师把装了水的花洒递给恩熙，她伸出左手接了过去，接着抬起手臂转动手腕在眼睛的注视下倒了一些水出来。她在持续了约3-4分钟的活动期间反复多次的拿着花洒等玩具倒出了水。
interpretation: 综合来看，恩熙在这一过程中通过观察、模仿、尝试和重复操作，逐步建立了对水流特性的基本理解。这一探索性的游戏体验提升了她的认知能力

learning_goals.title: Foster beginning science concepts through free exploration (water play) 通过自由探索初步发展婴幼儿对科学概念的感知，如：玩水。

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: 吸管插洞洞
description:
老师邀请小朋友参与吸管插洞洞活动。老师提供好打好孔的纸箱和吸管若干，请小朋友们一只手抓住吸管，插入洞洞中。
老师对小朋友们说：“谁要参加吸管插洞洞游戏啊？”章易看着老师拍拍自己。老师笑着对章易说：“我，我要玩。”老师拿出吸管和洞洞箱，请章易小朋友动手操作。章易右手五指抓握住吸管，另一只手把住箱子。用力向下插入洞洞中，吸管不见了，章易低头看向洞洞中，并尝试中手指向下抠洞洞。章易又拿出一根吸管单手抓住，继续在相同的洞洞向下插。当插入很多根吸管后，章易看向老师伸出双手表示没有。老师鼓励章易说：“吸管没有了、没有。”章易说：“没”，老师表扬章易：“真棒！”老师把洞洞箱抬起来，下面有好多插进去的吸管。章易发出：“哇”的感叹声。双手捡起地上的吸管，继续插入参与插洞洞的游戏。
interpretation: 章易可以积极主动参与吸管插洞洞的活动，并尝试学习用语言和动作表达自己的想法。可以单手五指抓握吸管，成功的插入洞洞中。章易在探索过程中，逐渐由五指过度到三指抓握吸管插进洞洞中，说明章易手眼协调能力良好。

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development ( pick up objects using pincer grasp, hold crayon to scribble, fasten/unfasten zippers/buttons, screw, unscrew bottle caps, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：用大拇指、食指及中指（三指）抓物品、拉拉链、扣纽扣、拧瓶盖等。

title: 吸管插洞洞
description:
老师邀请小朋友参与吸管插洞洞活动。老师提供好打好孔的纸箱和吸管若干，请小朋友们一只手抓住，插入洞洞中。
老师对小朋友们说：“谁要参加吸管插洞洞游戏啊？”翰毅看着老师说：“maius”。老师笑着对翰毅说：“我要玩、翰毅要玩。”翰毅重复说：“我、翰毅玩。”老师拿出吸管和洞洞箱，请翰毅小朋友动手操作。翰毅左手抓握住吸管按着洞洞箱，右手三指抓握把住吸管向下插入洞洞中。在用力向下插的过程中，吸管不见了。翰毅又拿出一根吸管单手抓住，继续在相同的洞洞向下插。当吸管插光后。翰毅说：“more 。”老师鼓励翰毅说：“还要、我还要吸管。”翰毅看着老师说：“还要”，老师表扬翰毅：“说的很好！” 并给翰毅很多吸管，翰毅继续参与插洞洞的游戏中。
interpretation: 翰毅可以积极主动参与吸管插洞洞的活动中，并尝试使用语言表达自己的想法。翰毅可以单手抓握吸管，另一只手三指抓握吸管向下插入洞洞中。翰毅还尝试双手同时插入洞洞中，表明了他手眼协调能力良好。

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development ( pick up objects using pincer grasp, hold crayon to scribble, fasten/unfasten zippers/buttons, screw, unscrew bottle caps, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：用大拇指、食指及中指（三指）抓物品、拉拉链、扣纽扣、拧瓶盖等。

title: 二月，探索大自然。PTC
description:
老师自制一个触觉与视觉的探索物，让他可以用手去摸纽扣，看一看小鱼塘里的鱼、海藻。。。
刚开始他只是趴在很远的地方看着老师，老师鼓励他爬过来探索小鱼塘，后来他爬过来；探索小鱼塘里的鱼、海藻。。。还会很仔细看它。
最后他会爬过去探索干花，时不时会用眼神与老师交流。
他不只达到勇于探索新的材料，还达到社会行为发展的目标，真棒!

learning_goals.title: Foster enjoyment in playing with toys and materials 通过提供适宜的玩具和材料，培养婴幼儿对玩具和材料的喜爱。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: 二月第四周，我喜欢到处探索。（Update）
description: 他会到处探索，按玩具的钮如它发出声音，也会去朋友的照片板认识朋友；更会去翻一翻书看一看。

learning_goals.title: Foster understanding of cause and effect through engagement with toys, materials and books 通过玩有回馈动作的玩具（如：按压一个会嘎嘎叫的玩具）、探索材料（如：吹泡泡）和阅读书籍等活动，初步发展婴幼儿对于因果关系的感知。

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: Rainbow Sort and Choice
description: After learning about the colours of the rainbow, the children were invited to choose two colours they liked and sort objects in those colours into the corresponding rainbow sections. Alternatively, they could work with a partner to create their rainbow bridge using materials from the class, such as markers and Legos.
interpretation:
Zacchaeus quickly chose his two favourite colours, red and orange. He picked a yellow cup and a green train toy and proudly showed the teacher, saying, “Yellow and Green!” Without any prompting, he sorted the objects into the correct rainbow sections. He was able to place most of the objects in the seven colors of the rainbow without assistance. As he worked, Zacchaeus repeated the colour names aloud and carefully checked to make sure each object matched the correct colour. When unsure, he would place an object in a color section and compare it to see if it matched. During pair work, Zacchaeus helped his friends identify the correct colours in different shades of pink with the teacher’s guidance.

This demonstrates Zacchaeus’s strong colour recognition skills and his ability to work both independently and cooperatively by communicating. He approached the task confidently and methodically, showing a clear understanding of the activity.

learning_goals.title: Sort objects by one attribute (i.e: colour, shape, or size)

title: Rainbow Sort and Choice
description: After learning about the colours of the rainbow, the children were invited to choose two colours they liked and sort objects in those colours into the corresponding rainbow sections. Alternatively, they could work with a partner to create their rainbow bridge using materials from the class, such as markers and Legos.
interpretation:
When asked about her favorite colour, Naomi Anne replied, “I like all the colours!” She began by selecting a blue bristle block and continued to find all the blue-coloured toys in the box, placing them in the corresponding colour section of the rainbow. She proceeded to do the same for all the colors of the rainbow without any prompts or assistance. As she worked, she occasionally showed her progress to the teacher, saying, “Pink” and “Look!” When her friend found a black toy but noticed there was no black section on the rainbow, Naomi Anne found a similar black toy and said, “It’s okay. I have black too!”


This demonstrates Naomi Anne’s strong colour recognition skills and her ability to work cooperatively, showing understanding and empathy toward her peer’s feelings. She used her own strengths to approach the task confidently and methodically, indicating a clear understanding of the activity.

learning_goals.title: Sort objects by one attribute (i.e: colour, shape, or size)

title: Spot Me!
description:
At the discovery space, Emma was encouraged to spot a series of items with the teacher. The teacher asked, "Emma, can you point to something green?" Emma looked at the tray of items and pointed to a green spoon. Next, the teacher asked if she could point to something blue. Again, Emma looked at the tray of items and pointed to a blue crayon. 

The teacher praised her for spotting the items and readied her for another tricky question. "Emma, can you find something red?" Emma promptly pointed at the red straw. "And can you find another thing that has the same colour as the red straw?" the teacher asked. Emma looked through the trays of items and pointed to the red train. She said, "Nah, they are the same colour, red." The teacher nodded to acknowledge and thanked her for helping to spot the items.
interpretation: Emma was able to distinguish between the colours of the items. She could classify the items by colours and see them in their likeness and differences through colours. While doing so, she understood and comprehended the teacher's spoken language and questions.

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: 唱早安歌
description: 在晨间活动中，老师鼓励幼儿们坐到出席板前一起唱早安歌，方凯听到老师唱儿歌：“小朋友们坐过来，坐过来。”时，方凯便走到出席板前坐了下来，老师说：“太阳公公在哪里？”方凯便跟随老师一起将双手向上举高做出太阳的形状，方凯跟随老师一起哼唱早安歌，并做出相应的动作，唱完儿歌时，方凯和同伴一起笑着拍手并发出“耶耶耶”的声音，当老师说：“早安，小朋友们。”方凯回应老师说：“早安，liuliu。”之后，老师出示幼儿的图片进行点名，当老师拿出方凯的图片问幼儿：“这是谁啊？林？”方凯笑着举手说：“林方凯，到。”老师将方凯的照片递给他后，方凯将自己的照片粘贴到了出席板上。在老师拿出其他幼儿的照片时，方凯也会跟随老师一起说出其他同伴的名字，并与朋友说早安。
interpretation: 方凯能够愿意加入晨间活动，在唱早安歌时，能够展现出高兴的情绪，在老师点名时，方凯能够给予老师回应，并能够愿意与其他同伴进行互动，说早安等。

learning_goals.title: Foster sense of self (responding to their names) 培养自我意识，如：回应自己的名字等。
Foster a sense of trust in caring adults 通过了解并满足幼儿的需求，培养其对照顾者的信任感。
Foster social skills at all times – routines, interactions and activities 在常规活动、互动和体验中，初步培养社会交往技能。
Foster sense of belonging in a group, being part of a group 知道自己是群体中的一员，初步发展幼儿的归属感。
Foster sense of well-being 通过建立与培育师和同伴间的良好关系，初步培养幼儿的幸福感。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: 小小设计师——彩纸服装设计
description:
教师提供了多种彩纸、剪刀、胶水及黑色画纸作为背景，引导幼儿以“设计服装”为主题进行创作。教师还通过展示范例激发幼儿的创作兴趣，并给予灵活的创作空间。
 
  姝慧先观察了桌子上的材料，低声说：“so many colour paper ，how can I use it？”她看着其他小朋友的作品，有些困惑，但很快就询问教师：“吴老师，我可以用这个纸做裙子吗？”老师鼓励她自己尝试，姝慧点了点头，开始专注于自己的创作。姝慧开始尝试剪裁彩纸。她用手比划着说：“我要做long dress！”随后，她挑选了粉色，红色和蓝色的彩纸，把它们剪成了不同的形状，然后贴在黑纸上。过程中她对旁边的朋友说：“好看吗？”当姝慧完成裙子的部分后，她开始设计上衣。上衣设计好后，她看了看桌子上的材料问老师：“吴老师，我可以做鞋子吗？”老师说：“当然了，你是一个小设计师。”姝慧便又开始设计她的鞋子。
interpretation: 姝慧在活动中表现出强烈的好奇心和创造力，她对材料的使用和搭配有自己的见解，并通过语言表达了设计理念。通过教师提供的多种彩纸，设计出了独具特色的衣服。她在“小小设计师”活动中表现出主动探究的精神，深入了解了与设计相关的知识，并将所学内容与自己的创意相结合。这不仅让她学习了新的技能，还在实践中体验到了设计的乐趣和成就感。

learning_goals.title: 主动探究使幼儿从中获得更多有关主题知识。（PRAISE）
认识人类行为对环境带来的后果：初步了解人们工作和生活的方式对环境的影响。
认识人类行为对环境带来的后果：初步了解人们怎样影响他们生活的环境。
认识人类行为对环境带来的后果：开始意识人与他们居住环境的关系。

title: 小小设计师——彩纸服装设计
description:
教师提供了多种彩纸、剪刀、胶水及黑色画纸作为背景，引导幼儿以“设计服装”为主题进行创作。教师还通过展示范例激发幼儿的创作兴趣，并给予灵活的创作空间。
  凯琳在活动开始时仔细观察了桌上的彩纸，兴奋地说：“哇，这些纸好漂亮！”她挑选了一张印有玫瑰花的彩纸问到：“吴老师，这张可以用来做裙子吗？”老师说：“当然了，你是小设计师。”凯琳小心翼翼地用剪刀剪出一件裙子的形状，然后把它摆在黑色画纸上比划，她一边操作一边自言自语：“裙子要不要再长一点呢？”接着她对旁边的朋友说：“你看她好像公主的衣服。”朋友点头赞同，她便继续剪裁其它的彩纸，做成了一件特别的衣服。凯琳完成作品后，开心地展示给老师看：“这是我设计的煮饭的时候穿的！”老师说：“你做的这件是围裙。”凯琳听后马上重复着说到：“嗯 是围裙。”
interpretation: 凯琳在活动中表现出强烈的好奇心和创造力，她对材料的使用和搭配有自己的见解，并通过语言表达了设计理念。通过教师提供的多种彩纸，设计出了独具特色的衣服。她在“小小设计师”活动中表现出主动探究的精神，深入了解了与设计相关的知识，并将所学内容与自己的创意相结合。这不仅让她学习了新的技能，还在实践中体验到了设计的乐趣和成就感。

title: 小小设计师——彩纸服装设计
description:
教师提供了多种彩纸、剪刀、胶水及黑色画纸作为背景，引导幼儿以“设计服装”为主题进行创作。教师还通过展示范例激发幼儿的创作兴趣，并给予灵活的创作空间。
  昱恒拿起彩纸，认真地翻看材料，对老师说：“吴老师，这些彩纸的颜色好特别，我想做一件彩条衣服！”他主动挑选了绿色和橙色的彩纸，并说到：“这样会很明显，很有意思。”
在制作过程中，昱恒小心地用剪刀裁剪彩纸成细条，并一条条地贴在黑色画纸上。他一边操作一边与老师对话：“吴老师，这样的彩条够宽吗？还是要再细一点？”老师回应他：“可以试试看不同的宽度，看看效果。”他尝试后满意地说：“这样好看，像一件很酷的毛衣，我回青岛的时候也会穿上这样厚的衣服，因为中国现在很冷的！”当他完成上衣部分后，开始制作裤子。他自言自语地说：“我想做一条有蓝色和粉色条纹的裤子，和上衣颜色不一样，这样更特别。”当裤子的设计完成时，他用手指着作品，兴奋地对老师说：“吴老师，你看，裤子和衣服搭起来是不是很好看？”老师对他竖起大拇指给予了赞同与肯定。
interpretation: 昱恒在活动中表现出强烈的好奇心和创造力，他对材料的使用和搭配有自己的见解，并通过语言表达了设计理念。通过教师提供的多种彩纸，设计出了独具特色的衣服。他在“小小设计师”活动中表现出主动探究的精神，深入了解了与设计相关的知识，并将所学内容与自己的创意相结合。这不仅让他学习了新的技能，还在实践中体验到了设计的乐趣和成就感。

title: 小小设计师——彩纸服装设计
description:
教师提供了多种彩纸、剪刀、胶水及黑色画纸作为背景，引导幼儿以“设计服装”为主题进行创作。教师还通过展示范例激发幼儿的创作兴趣，并给予灵活的创作空间。
  乐沁拿到材料后，她仔细挑选了一些紫色和粉色的彩纸，并对老师说：“我喜欢紫色，想用它来做裙子。”随后，她用剪刀剪出长条形的彩纸，并按顺序排列在黑色画纸上。在制作过程中，乐沁一边操作一边小声地自言自语：“这里要直一点，这样才好看。”她还问旁边的小朋友：“你看我的裙子也是你喜欢的紫色。”当朋友回应“对”的时候，她露出了自信的微笑。
 乐沁完成了裙子的创作，她又看看桌子上的材料继续创作着，当她贴上一颗玫瑰形的粉色彩纸时，她笑眯眯地说：“吴老师，这是帽子，这是一个纽扣，如果裙子很大的话，可以用这个纽扣。”
interpretation: 乐沁在活动中表现出强烈的好奇心和创造力，她对材料的使用和搭配有自己的见解，并通过语言表达了设计理念。通过教师提供的多种彩纸，设计出了独具特色的衣服。她在“小小设计师”活动中表现出主动探究的精神，深入了解了与设计相关的知识，并将所学内容与自己的创意相结合。这不仅让她学习了新的技能，还在实践中体验到了设计的乐趣和成就感。

title: 小小设计师——彩纸服装设计
description:
教师提供了多种彩纸、剪刀、胶水及黑色画纸作为背景，引导幼儿以“设计服装”为主题进行创作。教师还通过展示范例激发幼儿的创作兴趣，并给予灵活的创作空间。
  建凯挑选了黄色条纹、红色、绿色的彩纸，他一边挑选一边说：“我要做衣服和裤子。”说完他开始裁剪。他用剪刀剪出一件橙黄色的长袖上衣。他对身边的朋友说：“这是long sleeves的衣服，还有这个是红色的帽子。”接着他开始设计裤子。建凯举起来对老师说：“吴老师，我做的是短裤！”完成作品后，他主动展示给老师和朋友们看，并详细介绍说：“这是long sleeves的衣服，帽子是红色和蓝色的，裤子是绿色的，这样穿起来很漂亮。”
interpretation: 建凯在活动中表现出强烈的好奇心和创造力，他对材料的使用和搭配有自己的见解，并通过语言表达了设计理念。通过教师提供的多种彩纸，设计出了独具特色的衣服。他在“小小设计师”活动中表现出主动探究的精神，深入了解了与设计相关的知识，并将所学内容与自己的创意相结合。这不仅让他学习了新的技能，还在实践中体验到了设计的乐趣和成就感。

title: 小小设计师——彩纸服装设计
description:
教师提供了多种彩纸、剪刀、胶水及黑色画纸作为背景，引导幼儿以“设计服装”为主题进行创作。教师还通过展示范例激发幼儿的创作兴趣，并给予灵活的创作空间。
  祈恒挑选了绿色、蓝色、粉色、橙色和紫色的彩纸。他拿起绿色纸说：“我要做绿色的短裤，它很舒服。”祈恒先将彩纸剪成短裤的形状。他对身边的朋友说：“我的裤子要很多颜色！”接着，他一边将剪好的裤子排列在画纸上，一边调整位置。他自言自语道：“绿色放在这里，蓝色和粉色放这里。”祈恒完成后举起画纸向老师展示，并用手指着说：“这些都是我做的裤子，有短裤，有长裤。颜色不一样。”老师问他怎么都是裤子，没有衣服呢？他拿着纸走回座位上继续创作衣服。不一会的时间祈恒又拿来完成的作品对老师说：“吴老师，你看这些衣服也都是不一样的。”
interpretation: 祈恒在活动中表现出强烈的好奇心和创造力，他对材料的使用和搭配有自己的见解，并通过语言表达了设计理念。通过教师提供的多种彩纸，设计出了独具特色的衣服。他在“小小设计师”活动中表现出主动探究的精神，深入了解了与设计相关的知识，并将所学内容与自己的创意相结合。这不仅让他学习了新的技能，还在实践中体验到了设计的乐趣和成就感。

title: 小小设计师——彩纸服装设计
description:
教师提供了多种彩纸、剪刀、胶水及黑色画纸作为背景，引导幼儿以“设计服装”为主题进行创作。教师还通过展示范例激发幼儿的创作兴趣，并给予灵活的创作空间。
  艾莎在材料区挑选橙色和红色纸。她拿起橙色纸说：“我要这个，因为我喜欢orange。”艾莎将橙色纸剪成两块，她说道：“吴老师，这是衣服，这是long dress。”随后，她选择红色纸作为裙子的装饰。在设计另一个服装时，她尝试用对称的方法拼贴出同样的形状，并对旁边的朋友说：“This is dress too。”艾莎创作完成后向老师介绍说：“吴老师，这个是我的dress，这个是我的妹妹的dress。Beause 我tall than 我的妹妹。”
interpretation: 艾莎在活动中表现出强烈的好奇心和创造力，她对材料的使用和搭配有自己的见解，并通过语言表达了设计理念。通过教师提供的多种彩纸，设计出了独具特色的衣服。她在“小小设计师”活动中表现出主动探究的精神，深入了解了与设计相关的知识，并将所学内容与自己的创意相结合。这不仅让她学习了新的技能，还在实践中体验到了设计的乐趣和成就感。

title: 游戏-能干的小兔子
description:
教师向幼儿展示红萝卜教具，请幼儿说说这是谁最爱吃的食物。教师带领幼儿回顾兔子的外形特征以及兔子的动作。引领幼儿来到活动场地，将提前剪好的红萝卜散放在地上，教师带领幼儿玩游戏-能干的小兔子。
  于扬手挎篮子，认真寻找藏起来的胡萝卜。她专注地探索四周，仔细检查每个可能的藏匿点。当轮到她藏胡萝卜时，她特意选择隐秘的地方，并兴奋地告诉朋友们：“你们一定找不到！我藏得超级超级难！”当朋友们寻找时，她会在一旁偷偷观察，并适时给予提示，如：“再往前一点，你就会看到了！”当朋友找到她藏匿的胡罗卜时，她会为朋友拍手欢呼。
interpretation: 于扬在本次游戏中展现了强烈的好奇心和探索精神，她能够清晰表达自己的想法，并通过语言调动游戏氛围，使活动更具挑战性和趣味性。
