title: Work Sample #1: Fan-tastic New Year!
description:
To foster children’s creative expression and enhance their fine motor skills, the children were invited to create their version of a Chinese New Year fan. They used different materials such as crepe papers, pompoms, markers, pipe cleaners and straws to express their ideas. While creating a functional and decorative fan, this activity also aimed to foster cultural awareness.

Avery shared, "I draw a tree in a house."

learning_goals.title: Experiment with a variety of techniques (e.g: crayon etching, cotton-bud painting, and splatter painting).
Experiment with elements to create artworks (e.g: mix paints to get different colours or shades of colours, use shapes and lines to create patterns).
Describe and explain ideas in their artworks (e.g: lines to represent motion).

title: 动物形状配对
description: 在区角活动中，老师为幼儿介绍不同的动物以及动物形状配对的玩具，并鼓励幼儿尝试将不同形状的小动物头与身体进行配对。方凯看到后便走了过来，方凯拿起地毯上的椭圆形大象，老师问道：“你拿的是什么动物？应该跟哪一个动物配对？”方凯看了看墙上的小动物后，便将椭圆形大象头粘贴到了对应的大象身上，老师表扬说：“方凯很棒，这是大象。”方凯听了便跟随老师一起说出：“大象。”之后方凯又继续粘贴了猴子和斑马，方凯粘贴完斑马后，指着斑马对老师说：“zebra。”老师说：“嗯，是的，华文是斑马。”方凯跟随老师说出了：“斑马。”老师表扬说：“方凯很棒，能够正确的进行配对。”方凯全部完成配对后，再次跟随老师逐一说出动物的名称，完成活动。
interpretation: 方凯能够根据动物的颜色，以及不同的形状等完成正确的动物形状配对，并能够跟随老师说出不同的动物名称等。

learning_goals.title: Foster problem solving during independent and group activities (puzzles, sequencing activities etc.) 通过拼图游戏、排序等活动，初步培养解决问题的能力。
Foster sustained involvement and concentration in chosen activities 通过幼儿所选择的活动，培养持续参与和专注力。
Foster an understanding of the connection between pictures, objects and print 培养对于图片、物体与词语之间关系的理解。

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: 户外散步
description: 在户外散步活动中，老师边走边唱儿歌：“走走走走走，我们小手拉小手，走走走走走，一起去散步。”泽阳听了后便笑着将手伸向老师说：“拉手。”老师拉起泽阳的手说：“泽阳真棒，你看黎莎还没有朋友一起拉手散步，你要不要和黎莎拉手一起散步啊？”泽阳一边看向莎莎，一边便将小手伸向黎莎并对她说：“莎莎。” 黎莎也将小手伸向泽阳，两人拉手后，笑着看着老师，老师鼓掌说：“哇，泽阳愿意跟朋友一起拉手散步，真棒！”。老师继续边走边唱儿歌“走走走走走”。泽阳也拉着莎莎的手，跟着老师一起笑着唱：“走走走走走走。”泽阳在散步过程中会与不同的朋友一起拉手散步，直到活动结束。
interpretation: 泽阳能够与老师建立良好的依恋关系，能够在老师的鼓励下，愿意参与散步活动，并愿意与同伴拉手，能够展示出高兴的情绪等。

learning_goals.title: Foster sense of self (responding to their names) 培养自我意识，如：回应自己的名字等。
Foster sense of others (identifying others to their names) 培养对他人的认识，如：指认同伴等。
Foster interactions, attachment and relationships with adults 通过与成人的互动，建立依恋和良好的关系。
Foster social skills at all times – routines, interactions and activities 在常规活动、互动和体验中，初步培养社会交往技能。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: 舀取鸡蛋
description: 在区角活动中，老师带领幼儿一起寻找鸡蛋，并鼓励幼儿将鸡窝里的鸡蛋转移到鸡蛋盒里，老师为幼儿示范后，为幼儿提供了不同的汤匙，泽阳看了看所有的汤匙，拿取了较大的汤匙，然后蹲在了装满鸡蛋的鸡窝旁边，用右手握住汤匙的尾部，眼睛看向鸡窝里的鸡蛋，泽阳向外向上旋转右手手腕，将鸡蛋舀取到了汤匙里。之后，泽阳眼睛一直盯着汤匙里的鸡蛋，并向右转动身体，面朝鸡蛋盒的方向，他向内向下旋转右手手腕，使汤匙里的鸡蛋掉落到鸡蛋盒里的其中一个洞中，完成了鸡蛋的运输，之后泽阳持续的尝试用不同大小的汤匙运输鸡蛋，直到将大部分的鸡蛋都运输到了鸡蛋盒里。
interpretation: 泽阳能够手眼协调的使用汤匙转移鸡蛋，有较好的协调性和手眼协调能力。

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development ( pick up objects using pincer grasp, hold crayon to scribble, fasten/unfasten zippers/buttons, screw, unscrew bottle caps, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：用大拇指、食指及中指（三指）抓物品、拉拉链、扣纽扣、拧瓶盖等。
Develop eye-hand coordination (roll a ball, pick up soft blocks and stack, self-feed, put simple things together and take them apart) 发展手眼协调能力，如：滚球，叠放软积木，喂食，把简单玩具连在一起再拆开等。

title: 和朋友拉手唱歌
description: 在音乐律动活动中，老师带领幼儿一起跳舞，老师播放儿歌《划小船》，并鼓励道：“小朋友们找一个朋友一起划小船吧，黎莎听到后看了看周围的朋友，当她看到旁边的朋友们开始拉手划小船时，老师问她：“黎莎，你想要和哪个朋友一起划小船呢？”黎莎看了看老师没有回答。这时，坐在黎莎旁边的方凯向黎莎伸出了双手，并对黎莎说：“拉手。”老师协助询问黎莎：“你想要跟方凯一起拉手划小船么？”听完，黎莎眼睛看向方凯，笑着将身体转向方凯，跟方凯一起拉手，面对面的随音乐划小船。两人拉手一起前后摇晃身体，当老师说：“划呀划呀划呀划呀，划到哪里去？”的时候，黎莎和方凯松开了双手，看着彼此笑了起来，之后两个人再次拉手划小船，音乐结束时，老师拍手说：“哇，黎莎和方凯一起划小船，真棒！”。黎莎看着老师和方凯一起笑着鼓掌。
interpretation: 黎莎能够在老师的引导下和同伴一起拉手，随音乐互动，能够愿意加入活动，并展现出高兴的情绪。

learning_goals.title: Foster interactions, attachment and relationships with adults 通过与成人的互动，建立依恋和良好的关系。
Foster social skills at all times – routines, interactions and activities 在常规活动、互动和体验中，初步培养社会交往技能。
Foster sense of well-being 通过建立与培育师和同伴间的良好关系，初步培养幼儿的幸福感。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: 拆红包
description: 在新年活动中，老师出示不同样式的新年红包，让幼儿进行探索，黎莎看到后便走了过来，老师将红包递给黎莎，并向黎莎介绍红包以及示范怎样打开红包，怎么将物品放入和取出，黎莎看了看便从盒子里拿出一个红包，左手握住红包底部，右手拇指、食指捏住红包开口处的其中一侧，将红包口打开，之后左手拇指、食指、中指从地上拿取一片圆形木头（做金币），眼睛看向红包口，左手将圆形木头放到了红包里。完成后，老师鼓励黎莎将红包里的物品取出来，黎莎左手握住红包口，右手捏住红包的一侧纸，向外撕拉，将红包撕开。最后，她用左手握住红包上端，眼睛看向红包底部的物品，右手将红包里的物品逐一的全部取了出来。之后，黎莎重复进行装红包和拆红包的活动，直到活动结束。
interpretation: 黎莎能够手眼协调的往红包里放入物品，并能双手协调的将红包撕开，取出红包里的物品。

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development ( pick up objects using pincer grasp, hold crayon to scribble, fasten/unfasten zippers/buttons, screw, unscrew bottle caps, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：用大拇指、食指及中指（三指）抓物品、拉拉链、扣纽扣、拧瓶盖等。
Develop eye-hand coordination (roll a ball, pick up soft blocks and stack, self-feed, put simple things together and take them apart) 发展手眼协调能力，如：滚球，叠放软积木，喂食，把简单玩具连在一起再拆开等。

title: Obstacle
description:
The obstacle course was set up, and the children were invited to explore it. Ethan began by carefully stepping on each cone and stone, taking his time to maintain his balance. Once he reached the end of the stones, he jumped and continued walking towards the arch. He climbed onto the arch slowly, making sure not to lose his balance. When he reached the other side, Ethan confidently descended, proud of his accomplishment. Next, he carefully climbed down the arch, ensuring it remained steady.

Ethan displayed great confidence in his abilities and finished the obstacle course with impressive body control and balance.

learning_goals.title: Move with balance and control.

title: Numicon Colour Match and Sort
description:
A Numicon set was introduced to the children, and the concept of sorting was explained. An example was demonstrated to help them understand the activity. Ethan and his friends were invited to sort the Numicon toys by colour. Ethan selected the plate with green paper, indicating that he needed to look for the green Numicon toys. Once the Numicon toys were laid out in front of them, Ethan and his friends began sorting. Ethan carefully searched for the green Numicon pieces and placed them on his plate. As his friends were with him, Ethan waited for his turn to take the toys.

Ethan displayed an enthusiastic attitude while doing the activity and demonstrated a clear understanding of how to sort the toys by colour.

Ethan’s careful search for the green Numicon pieces suggests self-regulation, as he is able to focus and take his time to complete the task accurately, despite the presence of his peers.

learning_goals.title: Sort one category of objects from an assortment of objects.

title: Music Medley
description:
Ethan and his peers were exploring the scarf and ribbon, following the beat of the song introduced by the teacher. Ethan was holding a scarf and moving it up and down. He lifted the scarf to observe its slow movements in the air.

At the end of the activity, a ribbon was given to them. While holding the ribbon, Ethan waved it at me and said, "Rainbow!" He moved it side to side quickly when the beat of the music became faster.

The activity exposed Ethan to musical instruments and body movements that accompany music. Ethan was able to move around and use the musical materials provided to him.

Ethan actively participated in the activity, interacting with the music and the materials. His engagement showed a positive emotional attitude toward the activity.

learning_goals.title: Create movement using imagination in response to music.

title: Five Senses
description:
The 'Talking Tub' activity was introduced to the children, and each child was invited to select an object. Liv took a photo of ear and she happily shared, “I got ear.” Liv and Gemma showed the photo of ear and mouth. I asked Liv, “How many ears do we have?” Liv answered “I have two ears.”. I asked everyone, “What is the use of ears?” Liv said, “to hear”

After discussing body parts, the children were encouraged to explore the other objects in the tub. A tissue with a mint scent was handed to each child. Liv smelled the tissue and made a disgusted face. I asked her, "You don't like the smell?" Liv shook her head and said, "I don't like the smell."
At the end of the activity, I asked the children about the five senses. When I asked about the body parts we use to hear, Liv stood up and pointed to the photo of an ear.

Liv was actively engaged in discussions and exploration of the objects in the tub. She observed the scent of the tissue and expressed her preference through facial expressions and verbal communication. Liv demonstrated her ability to recognize and express her emotions in a social setting by showing her personal preference. She expressed her dislike for the mint-scented tissue by making a disgusted face and verbally saying, "I don't like the smell.”

learning_goals.title: Observe and talk about living things, non-living things, places and events.

title: Match and Celebrate Pairs
description:
A box with different objects was presented to the children, and the concept of pairing was explained by demonstrating an example. Each child was invited to choose the item they liked, and Liv chose a cup. I asked Liv, "What is a cup for? How do we use it?" Liv demonstrated how she uses a cup to drink.

I called Liv to stand in front and told her to see who among her friends was holding the item that could be paired with her cup. Without hesitation, Liv said it was Naomi. Liv and Naomi stood next to each other and demonstrated how a cup and a pitcher are used as a pair.

Liv displayed an understanding of the concept of pairing related objects. She demonstrated an enthusiastic attitude and interacted positively with her teachers and friends.

Liv interacted positively with Naomi and I. This positive engagement reflects her ability to communicate effectively and build relationships.

learning_goals.title: Pair related objects (e.g: a cup to a saucer, a fork to a spoon)

title: Self-Portrait
description:
The children were invited to create a self-portrait by drawing their faces and using playdough. Liv chose a green marker to draw her face. While adding details to her drawing, she shared her thoughts by saying, "My eye here," "This is my face," and "I have long hair." She then manipulated the playdough and attached it to the head of her portrait. I asked her, "Is that your hair?" and she said yes.

Once Liv had finished making her self-portrait, I asked her if she liked it. She smiled sweetly and posed for me to take her photo with her portrait.

Liv displayed confidence and self-awareness in creating her own portrait. She was able to identify her drawing, and using simple sentences, she shared her thoughts clearly.

learning_goals.title: Use expanded vocabulary and language for a variety of purposes.

title: Obstacle Course
description: The children were introduced to an obstacle course that included tasks like balancing, alternating feet, climbing slopes, stepping down stairs, and crawling under barriers. As they navigated the course, they developed their balance, coordination, and strength, while also practicing problem-solving and perseverance in a fun and engaging way.
interpretation:
Ethan demonstrated strong adaptability and confidence as he navigated through the obstacle course with minimal guidance. Despite a slight fall on the taller steps, he quickly adjusted by using his arms to balance himself. He continued determined, trying the stepping stones again after a bit of encouragement. Ethan showed great courage in facing new obstacles, particularly those involving heights. When stepping down stairs, he bent lower and placed his hand on the side of the steps to maintain balance and prevent falling.


As Ethan crawled under the lower bridge, he saw his peers moving slower. He pressed his palms and knees into the mat for balance and lifted his head to look around, careful not to bump into anyone. His ability to adjust his movements and problem-solve shows his growing confidence and physical awareness as he continued to make progress through the course at his own pace.

learning_goals.title: Be aware of what the body can do and develop their locomotor skills.

title: Obstacle Course
description: The children were introduced to an obstacle course that included tasks like balancing, alternating feet, jumping across hoops, stepping up stairs, and crawling through the tunnels. As they navigated the course, they developed their balance, coordination, and strength, while also practicing problem-solving and perseverance in a fun and engaging way.
interpretation:
Yi Xuan showed growing adaptability and confidence while navigating the obstacle course with minimal guidance. After slightly missing the first few alternating foot steps, Yi Xuan observed the left-right pattern and adjusted her movements, extending her legs further to reach each step. She demonstrated persistence and courage, particularly when tackling obstacles like jumping across hoops. She used her hands to help pull herself up and secure her footing, while also staying mindful of the hula hoops to avoid falling.


When crawling through the tunnel, Yi Xuan noticed that her peers were moving faster. She adapted by bending her body higher to make herself more comfortable and used her knees to push herself faster. Her ability to adjust her movements and problem-solve shows her growing confidence and physical awareness, as she continued to make progress through the course at her own pace.

learning_goals.title: Be aware of what the body can do and develop their locomotor skills.

title: Obstacle Course
description: The children were introduced to an obstacle course that included tasks like balancing, alternating feet, climbing slopes, stepping down stairs, and crawling under barriers. As they navigated the course, they developed their balance, coordination, and strength, while also practicing problem-solving and perseverance in a fun and engaging way.
interpretation:
Shuo-Yun showed great progress as he navigated the obstacle course with minimal guidance. While he needed some support to take his first steps, he confidently reached for the teacher’s hand when attempting higher steps. With encouragement, he was able to balance himself and take steps down using his legs, demonstrating his growing independence, in his own unique way compared to his peers, who used different methods to descend.


When crawling under the lower bridge, Shuo-Yun explored how his body parts could help him move. He chose to move backward while lying on his back, a position that seemed more comfortable for him and allowed him to better see the bridge, helping him avoid obstacles. His thoughtful adjustments showed his increasing confidence and awareness of his own abilities as he continued to progress at his own pace.

learning_goals.title: Be aware of what the body can do and develop their locomotor skills.

title: Reach for the Star
description:
The activity "Reach for the Star" was introduced to the children to help them demonstrate body movements and coordination. Liv began the activity by stepping and hopping over the obstacles. Once she reached the last obstacle, Liv jumped very high to reach the star. With both hands raised, she jumped and reached for the star again, making sure to touch it.

Liv demonstrated body movements and coordination as she participated in the activity. Self-confidence was observed, as Liv confidently jumped and reached for the star, indicating a strong belief in her abilities. She also showed positive emotional involvement and enjoyment.

learning_goals.title: Coordinate movements to perform simple tasks.

It was also observed that Kyan showed self-awareness when he smiled after reaching the star, indicating his sense of accomplishment and enjoyment of the activity. He also communicated his desire to try the activity one more time.

title: Music Medley
description:
Engracia and her peers were exploring rhythmic sticks, following the beat of the song introduced by the teacher. While manipulating the sticks, Engracia said, "It's the lion dance." She was referring to their previous experience of watching a lion dance and a band at school.

At the end of the activity, Engracia was holding a scarf and figuring out what movements she would make. After some time, she decided to lay it on the floor and move slowly to accompany the song.

The activity exposed Engracia to musical instruments and body movements that accompany music. Drawing from her previous experiences and imagination, Engracia was able to move around and use the musical materials provided to her. This experience also demonstrated social awareness, as she reflected on her previous experience of watching a lion dance and a band at school.

learning_goals.title: Create movement using imagination in response to music.

title: 作品展示
description: 幼儿们在参观美术馆后，用水彩画表达他们对艺术的创造力。这不仅培养了他们的观察力和创造力，还让他们通过色彩和形状自由表达自己的想法。

learning_goals.title: 运用观察和想象力创作平面和立体的艺术作品：在粘土上刻纹和印上纹理。
运用观察和想象力创作平面和立体的艺术作品：能够画出不同表面的纹理。
运用观察和想象力创作平面和立体的艺术作品：通过使用模板来创作花纹。
运用观察和想象力创作平面和立体的艺术作品：通过其它的媒介（如：蜡或墨汁）或不同素材来探索画的特性。
运用观察和想象力创作平面和立体的艺术作品：能够剪切不同的形状并组成一幅图。
运用观察和想象力创作平面和立体的艺术作品：能够使用各种类型的纸张来创作一个艺术的作品。
运用观察和想象力创作平面和立体的艺术作品：能利用再循环或日常用品组合，创作出一个不同造型的作品。
与其他孩子一起创作艺术品，如：壁画。
开始学习各种基本的艺术技巧：版画、粘土创作、中国画、拼贴画、铁丝造型、将所发现的材料组合等。

title: 幼儿作品分析——表情脸谱
description:
艾雯小朋友的作品是一个以纸盘为基础制作的生气表情脸谱，整体造型简单但极具表现力。
主要使用了一次性纸盘作为脸部基础。通过黑色纸剪裁出眉毛、眼睛和嘴巴，并粘贴在纸盘上，形成五官。绿色的小绒球被巧妙地用作鼻子，增添了趣味性。眉毛呈斜向下倾斜的粗黑条状，表现出生气时紧皱的眉头。
圆形黑色眼睛简单直接，增强了表情的清晰度。嘴巴采用下弯的弧形设计，展现出生气或不满的情绪，颜色搭配简洁明了，黑色与白色形成强烈对比，突出了面部表情的特点。绿色的鼻子点缀使作品更具童趣和创意，增加了视觉上的亮点。纸盘边缘有均匀的裁剪痕迹，可能是为了增强质感或便于固定。
总体来看，艾雯小朋友的作品成功地表现出了“生气”的情绪，具有强烈的情感表达能力，同时展现了孩子的创造力和动手能力。这种艺术活动不仅锻炼了孩子的手工技能，还帮助他们更好地理解和表达情绪。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解1个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：尝试用华语与人交谈。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：喜欢涂涂画画，能画出较直、横的线，基本能控制笔的方向。
感知和描述艺术的基本元素：线条、颜色、形状、质地。
运用不同的绘画工具（如：马克笔、蜡笔、颜料、粉笔、面团）进行艺术创作。
通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。

title: 幼儿作品分析——表情脸谱
description:
家悦小朋友的作品是一个表达“高兴”情绪的表情脸谱，采用简单但富有表现力的设计方式，成功传递了开心的情绪。
他主要使用了一次性纸盘作为脸部基础，白色背景使五官更清晰。
通过黑色纸剪裁出眉眼和嘴巴，并粘贴在纸盘上，形成完整的面部表情。
选用一个红色的小绒球作为鼻子，为作品增添了活泼的色彩点缀。眉眼采用上扬弧形设计，形成“笑眼”，给人一种愉悦和开心的感觉。嘴巴呈上弯的弧形，展现出开怀的笑容，使整个表情更加生动。红色鼻子不仅增加了色彩的对比度，也让脸谱显得更富童趣。他在颜色搭配简单但有效，黑白对比突出表情特征，红色点缀增强趣味性。作品整体造型简洁而富有感染力，成功传达了高兴的情绪。纸盘边缘有均匀的剪裁痕迹，可能是为了便于操作或增强手感。
家悦小朋友的脸谱作品充分展现了“高兴”的表情，设计简洁但具有较强的情感表现力。通过弧形的笑眼和微笑的嘴巴，成功营造出开心、愉快的氛围。这不仅锻炼了孩子的手工能力，也帮助他们通过艺术方式表达情绪，增强对表情与情感的理解。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解1个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：尝试用华语与人交谈。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：喜欢涂涂画画，能画出较直、横的线，基本能控制笔的方向。
感知和描述艺术的基本元素：线条、颜色、形状、质地。
运用不同的绘画工具（如：马克笔、蜡笔、颜料、粉笔、面团）进行艺术创作。
通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。

title: 幼儿作品分析——表情脸谱
description:
靖炜小朋友的作品是一个表现“高兴”情绪的表情脸谱，整体造型简洁大方，富有艺术感。
他以一次性纸盘作为脸谱的基础，白色背景突出了五官的颜色和形状。
黑色剪纸制作的眼睛呈细长形，带有弧度，增添了一种优雅的神韵。
选用了红色的小绒球作为鼻子，使整体形象更加生动有趣。嘴巴采用鲜艳的红色剪纸，呈现出上扬的微笑，突出了愉快的情绪。
他把眼睛设计成细长的弧形，呈现出一种温和、微笑的神态，让整体表情显得柔和而开心。嘴巴的弧度明显上扬，展现出喜悦和满足的表情，使作品充满欢乐感。红色鼻子的点缀增加了趣味性，同时使整体色彩搭配更加协调。他的作品颜色对比鲜明，黑色的眼睛、红色的嘴巴和鼻子，在白色底色上形成了清晰的视觉效果。造型简单但富有表现力，成功传递了“高兴”的情绪。作品整体风格优雅，眼睛的设计赋予脸谱一种温柔、快乐的特质。
靖炜小朋友的脸谱作品以简洁的设计成功表达了“高兴”的情绪，眼睛的形状使作品具有独特的个性，嘴巴的微笑则传递出温暖和欢乐的氛围。这样的艺术创作不仅培养了孩子的动手能力，也帮助他们通过视觉艺术来理解和表达情感。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解1个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：尝试用华语与人交谈。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：喜欢涂涂画画，能画出较直、横的线，基本能控制笔的方向。
感知和描述艺术的基本元素：线条、颜色、形状、质地。
运用不同的绘画工具（如：马克笔、蜡笔、颜料、粉笔、面团）进行艺术创作。
通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。

title: 幼儿作品分析——表情脸谱
description:
楷钧小朋友制作的生气表情脸谱作品非常有创意，充分展现了情绪的表达能力和动手能力。
他的作品采用了白色纸盘作为脸的基础，利用简单的剪裁和粘贴技法来塑造表情。五官的设计使用了黑色纸片和一颗黄色小球，构造简洁但表达明确。他把眉毛贴成两条黑色纸条呈向下倾斜的“八”字形状，表现出愤怒的情绪。两个黑色圆形，简洁明了的做眼睛，凸显了情绪的集中表达。他用黄色的小球做鼻子增添立体感，同时让作品更具趣味性。他把嘴巴贴成弯曲向下的黑色弧线，清楚地表现出生气或不满的表情。他的作品色彩简单但对比强烈，黑色五官与白色底板形成鲜明的视觉效果，使表情更加突出。纸盘边缘的剪裁增加了一些装饰感，使整体造型更有层次。通过动手制作，培养了他的手工能力、创造力和对情绪的认知表达。
整体而言，楷钧小朋友的生气表情脸谱作品非常生动，通过简单的材料和构图精准地传达了“生气”的情绪，是一件富有创意和表现力的儿童手工艺术作品。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解1个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：尝试用华语与人交谈。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：喜欢涂涂画画，能画出较直、横的线，基本能控制笔的方向。
感知和描述艺术的基本元素：线条、颜色、形状、质地。
运用不同的绘画工具（如：马克笔、蜡笔、颜料、粉笔、面团）进行艺术创作。
通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。

title: 幼儿作品分析——表情脸谱
description:
灵昀小朋友的开心表情脸谱作品生动有趣，充分展现了快乐的情绪表达。
她的作品使用白色纸盘作为脸的基础，简单但富有表现力。五官由黑色纸片和一个粉色小球组成，运用了剪裁和粘贴技法，使表情更加立体生动。
她把 眉毛贴成两条黑色弯曲的眉毛，呈现出自然的弧度，增加了表情的亲和力。一只眼睛为弯弯的弧形，另一只眼睛呈“眯眼”状态，类似眨眼的效果，使得脸谱充满活力和调皮感。她使用粉色小球作为鼻子，增加了一抹温暖的色彩，同时提升了作品的立体感。大大的弧形微笑，向上弯曲，展现出明显的开心情绪，传递出快乐的氛围。
她的作品色彩对比鲜明，黑色的五官与白色纸盘形成强烈对比，粉色鼻子作为点缀，增添趣味。通过简单的线条和形状，准确表现出开心和调皮的表情。整体观感轻松愉悦，感受到快乐情绪。她的作品不仅锻炼了灵昀的动手能力，还帮助她通过艺术表达自己的情绪。这样的手工活动能增强她对情绪的认知，引导她理解和表现不同的情感状态。
灵昀小朋友的开心表情脸谱充满欢乐气息，表达生动，是一件优秀的儿童手工艺术作品。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解1个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：尝试用华语与人交谈。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：喜欢涂涂画画，能画出较直、横的线，基本能控制笔的方向。
感知和描述艺术的基本元素：线条、颜色、形状、质地。
运用不同的绘画工具（如：马克笔、蜡笔、颜料、粉笔、面团）进行艺术创作。
通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。

title: 幼儿作品分析——表情脸谱
description:
书雅小朋友作品使用了白色纸盘作为基础，并通过剪纸与粘贴的方式呈现了一张笑脸。五官的设计夸张且生动，充分展现了儿童对表情的理解与表达。
她在组织五官时，眉毛采用黑色剪纸制作，呈现上扬的弧度，表现出开心和愉悦的情绪。眼睛以半弧形的剪纸表现闭合的微笑眼神，传递出愉快和满足的感觉。鼻子使用了粉色的小棉球，增添了作品的立体感，同时增加了可爱的元素。嘴巴选用黑色剪纸制作了一个张开的笑嘴，使整体表情更具感染力，给人一种热情友好的感觉。她的作品的颜色较为简洁，以黑色、白色和粉色为主，黑色用于五官，粉色则点缀在鼻子上，既增强了视觉对比，又赋予了作品可爱和童趣感。整体作品表达了欢乐、友好和幸福的情绪，反映了她在创作过程中愉悦的心理状态。她通过简单的形状和夸张的表情传递了积极的情感，展现了孩子对世界的美好想象和对快乐的理解。从粘贴的精细程度来看，她具备一定的动手能力，能较好地控制材料，并有意识地安排五官的位置，表现出较强的空间感知能力和创造力。
书雅小朋友的作品构思清晰，表现力强，通过简单的材料创造出了富有感染力的表情脸谱，展现了她对情绪的理解以及初步的艺术表达能力。该作品不仅反映了孩子积极阳光的内心世界，也锻炼了她的手部精细动作和美术创造能力，值得肯定和鼓励。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解1个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：尝试用华语与人交谈。
语言学习成果（说）- 说华语：喜欢说华语。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：喜欢涂涂画画，能画出较直、横的线，基本能控制笔的方向。
感知和描述艺术的基本元素：线条、颜色、形状、质地。
运用不同的绘画工具（如：马克笔、蜡笔、颜料、粉笔、面团）进行艺术创作。
通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。

title: Rainbow Sorting Garden
description:
The children had the opportunity to participate in an activity in which they were provided with matching “flower pots” labelled by two attributes, such as 'red circles', ' pink circles', 'blue triangles', 'yellow triangles', etc.

Kelsey began by selecting two coloured papers of varying attributes and said, "I take pink circle and yellow triangle because I like pink and yellow." Next, she drew various flower designs on it. 

After drawing, the children placed their flower drawings in a small container. When it was Kelsey's turn to “plant" two flowers in the corresponding pots, she picked a yellow triangle paper and placed it in the middle pot. Next, she grabbed a yellow triangle from the container before placing it into the first pot. She then said, "I am done!"
interpretation: Through this activity, Kelsey can confidently sort objects according to two attributes; the colour and shape of the paper cutouts. In addition, Kelsey can also take responsibility for her own actions, such as learning to make choices independently.

learning_goals.title: Sort objects according to two attributes (e.g: colour and shape, colour and size).

title: 火山爆发实验
description:
在《菲菲生气了》绘本中，菲菲的愤怒情绪像火山一样爆发。教师让幼儿一起探索了火山，作为故事延伸的活动。教师准备了纸杯、纸盘和胶带，让幼儿用胶带将纸杯固定在纸盘上。然后，教师提供食用小苏打、醋和红色食用色素，让幼儿亲手操作并观察火山喷发的过程。活动的目标是激发幼儿对火山爆发现象的兴趣，并通过实验操作，加深他们对火山爆发原理的理解。

当老师发放材料时，Varvara十分专注地用胶带固定纸杯。她尝试了几次，终于成功地将纸杯牢牢固定在纸盘上。在实验开始前，她好奇地问老师红色的液体是什么。老师让她闻一闻，她闻后露出有点抗拒的表情。老师告诉她那是“醋”，她便跟着老师重复了一遍。随后，她小心翼翼地将红色的醋倒入火山模型中，手部动作稳定而谨慎。当火山“喷发”时，她兴奋地笑了起来，发出“哇”的惊叹声，并开心地说出“火山”这个词。
interpretation: 通过观察可以发现，Varvara对实验过程充满好奇，尤其是在亲手操作时表现得十分专注。她不仅认真地完成每个步骤，还积极参与互动。此外，她愿意尝试用华语与老师交流，她能用简单的华语描述自己的观察，如“火山”“红色”，展现了她对实验的理解以及表达。

learning_goals.title: 表现对事物奥秘的好奇心和兴趣：提问并探究问题的答案。

title: 问卷调查-生气了该怎么办
description:
幼儿阅读了绘本《菲菲生气了》后，教师引导他们思考问题，并通过不同方式获取信息来寻找答案。随后，幼儿进行了一次调查访问，走到校园里向老师和阿姨们提问，询问他们生气时的应对方法，并将得到的答案记录在问卷上，整理每个人的消气方法。

雯禧在活动中始终表现得很积极，她会主动举手，表示想向阿姨或老师们提问。当轮到她发问时，她需要老师在旁引导，例如，老师会提醒她：“可以问阿姨会因为什么事情而生气？”她会先复述问题，然后向阿姨提问。聆听回答时，她专注地思考，并用绘画的方式将听到的内容记录在纸上。当老师问她画了什么时，她用英文回答：“angry cannot hit people。”
interpretation: 雯禧愿意主动表达，并积极参与问卷调查，能够用绘画的方式将听到的答案记录在问卷上。虽然在提问时仍需老师协助，但她能通过聆听、绘画和语言表达来记录信息，对活动已有一定的理解。未来可以鼓励她多尝试用华语沟通，以提升语言运用能力。

learning_goals.title: 通过绘画或书写作简单的观测记录：海报展示。如：照顾宠物。

title: 生气的脸
description:
阅读绘本《菲菲生气了》后，教师提供了不同颜色的纸、剪刀、胶水和马克笔。活动开始前，幼儿先观察“生气”时的五官变化，并尝试用表情展现“生气”的样子。本次活动引导幼儿通过手工制作“生气的脸”，他们需要思考如何运用剪纸和拼贴来表现生气的情绪，如皱起的眉毛、张开的嘴巴等，同时练习剪贴技巧，提高手眼协调能力。

恩萱先用马克笔在纸上画出眼睛和嘴巴，再沿着线条剪下，然后用长条纸折出鼻子。剪裁时，她双手稳稳握住剪刀，动作熟练。在制作眉毛时，她尝试用黑色长条纸放在眼睛上方，反复调整后，最终选择了两个向内倾斜的眉毛角度，并贴上。完成拼贴后，她小心翼翼地撕下双面胶，将褐色纸贴在背景色纸上。最后，她剪裁出不同颜色的纸条，为作品设计了头发。作品完成后，她主动拿起作品向老师展示，说：“黄老师，你看！”当老师问她做了什么时，她回答：“生气。”老师再问她关于嘴巴为何要剪裁成那样？她便哈哈大笑起来，但并没有回应老师的问题。
interpretation: 从活动表现来看，恩萱在制作过程中展现了专注力和创造力，剪贴技巧比去年更熟练。在语言表达方面，她能够用完整的句子描述自己的作品，并尝试用华语表达想法。

learning_goals.title: 通过艺术作品表达自己的经历和感受，如：个人活动、实地考察、旅游。

title: 新年手工 – 摇摆蛇
description:
本次活动是为了庆祝蛇年，幼儿们制作了一条彩色的摇摆蛇。教师提供了彩色纸、剪刀、胶水、纸盘和马克笔等材料。活动的目的是让幼儿练习使用剪刀剪出不同形状的纸片，并运用粘贴技巧将其组合成完整的蛇形作品，同时在过程中表达他们的创意。

Kiaan小心地使用剪刀剪裁彩色纸，确保每一片纸条的大小合适。在粘贴时，他首先把胶水涂抹在纸盘上，再根据自己的喜好将彩色纸条贴在上面。遇到没有粘好地方时，他会看着老师指着贴不好的地方说：“这个不可以”，然后自己重新涂抹胶水，确保纸条固定在纸盘上。过程中，老师注意到Kiaan在剪裁蛇头和眼睛时，虽然尝试按照线条剪裁，但最终没有完全做到。不过，Kiaan依然保持积极态度，对自己的作品感到非常满意。最后，他兴奋地展示自己的作品，并说：“我做好了！很多颜色的Snake。”
interpretation: 在制作过程中，Kiaan在制作过程中展现了专注力。他能用简单的句子表达了自己的观察，并解释了他制作的作品。当遇到不熟悉的词汇时，他会尝试用肢体动作表达，或者用英文来取代。

learning_goals.title: 运用不同的素材实践创造艺术作品，如：混合颜料得到不同的颜色或色调、使用形状和线条创作图案。

title: 如果妈妈不在家
description:
在阅读《朱家故事》后，教师引导幼儿展开想象：如果妈妈不在家，自己的房间会变成什么样子？教师提供图画纸、马克笔和彩色笔等绘画工具，让幼儿将自己的想法记录下来，并在大家面前分享。

亮杰站在白板前，手里拿着麦克风，向朋友们介绍自己的作品。他的关注点不在“妈妈不在家”，而是“爸爸不在家”。他等到大家安静后，才开始说：“我的妈妈在家，是爸爸不在家。”然后，他笑着补充：“我的房间很 neat（整齐的意思）。”接着，他指着自己的作品说：“这个是床，玩具在下面。”分享时，他的声音响亮，脸上带着笑容。
interpretation: 通过观察可以发现，亮杰对自己的作品充满信心，他能够用华语表达想法，遇到不会的词时，会自然地用英文代替。他的分享清楚完整，尽管他的理解与原本的主题有所不同，但他能够解释自己的想法，并积极分享，这说明他理解了活动目标，并愿意表达自己的观点。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 表达：能用完整的较连贯的语言说话。

title: 粘土手工-奥莉薇
description:
教师提供了多种彩色的轻粘土，引导幼儿以轻粘土捏制奥莉薇（小猪塑像和）和为小猪设计服装为主题进行创作。活动中她表现出极大的热情和对艺术创作的好奇心，并给予灵活的创作空间。
  
  灵熙一边拿起肤色粘土，一边说：“奥莉薇的身体要先捏一个大大的圆，像球一样！” 她摸着粘土说着：“这粘土好软啊，我要小心捏，不然会弄坏的。” 当她制作耳朵时，发现形状有点不对：“这个耳朵怎么不一样大，吴老师，我可以在做一个耳朵吗？”  老师回复她：“当然可以，你将粘土合在一起，再捏一次就好了。”灵熙认真地制作着她的小猪，当她要设计衣服的时候，她停下来想了一会，挑选了粉色的粘土，小心翼翼地捏着奥莉薇的衣服。灵熙完成作品后，兴奋地展示作品说：“吴老师，你看！这是我的奥莉薇！她穿着粉色的裙子，还戴着一个小皇冠！”
interpretation: 灵熙在活动中展现出对创意和艺术的热爱。无论是轻粘土捏制还是对于服装设计，她都充满了想象力，并通过丰富的语言表达出自己的想法。这些活动不仅帮助她发展了精细动作和审美能力，还培养了她的主动探究的精神，深入了解了与设计相关的知识，并将所学内容与自己的创意相结合。这不仅让她学习了新的技能，还在实践中体验到了设计的乐趣和成就感。

learning_goals.title: 主动探究使幼儿从中获得更多有关主题知识。（PRAISE）
认识人类行为对环境带来的后果：初步了解人们工作和生活的方式对环境的影响。
认识人类行为对环境带来的后果：初步了解人们怎样影响他们生活的环境。
认识人类行为对环境带来的后果：开始意识人与他们居住环境的关系。

title: 粘土手工-奥莉薇
description:
教师提供了多种彩色的轻粘土，引导幼儿以轻粘土捏制奥莉薇（小猪塑像和）和为小猪设计服装为主题进行创作。活动中她表现出极大的热情和对艺术创作的好奇心，并给予灵活的创作空间。  
  育涵在老师分发轻粘土后，仔细挑选出自己喜欢的颜色。她拿起一团淡粉色的粘土，用小手轻轻揉搓，形成一个大致的圆形，她说：“要先做一个大大的身体，鼻子长长的，才像奥莉薇！”她专注地用手掌不断调整球体的形状，确保它的表面光滑。育涵开始将淡粉色粘土捏成一个长鼻子的形状，并将其粘贴在“头部”中央。随后，她从桌子上的彩色粘土中挑选红色和黄色，准备为奥莉薇设计一个“漂亮的裙子”。她对老师说：“吴老师，我要用这么多颜色，因为裙子要有好多颜色，像彩虹一样，她跳舞会很好看！”完成后，育涵小心翼翼地将作品托在手上，满脸兴奋地向老师展示自己的成果：“你看，我还加了一个皇冠！她是个公主！”
interpretation: 育涵在活动中展现出对创意和艺术的热爱。无论是轻粘土捏制还是对于服装设计，她都充满了想象力，并通过丰富的语言表达出自己的想法。这些活动不仅帮助她发展了精细动作和审美能力，还培养了她的主动探究的精神，深入了解了与设计相关的知识，并将所学内容与自己的创意相结合。这不仅让她学习了新的技能，还在实践中体验到了设计的乐趣和成就感。

title: 粘土手工-奥莉薇
description:
教师提供了多种彩色的轻粘土，引导幼儿以轻粘土捏制奥莉薇（小猪塑像和）和为小猪设计服装为主题进行创作。活动中她表现出极大的热情和对艺术创作的好奇心，并给予灵活的创作空间。
  康泽拿到材料后，迫不及待地开始将淡粉色粘土揉搓成一个大球。他一边揉一边说：“我要给奥莉薇做一个大大的肚子，还有长长的鼻子，像大象一样长！”接着他将一条长条状的粘土连接到球体上，塑造出了小猪的鼻子。大概模型做好后，康泽观察了桌上的彩色粘土，他选择了鲜红色和黄色粘土作为装饰。他一边用手指捏小块粘土，一边说：“红色是外套，奥莉薇要喜欢红色！”康泽认真地做好了外套对旁边的朋友说：“你看，奥莉薇的衣服很大，哈哈哈。”康泽完成后，满脸自豪地举起作品向大家展示。他笑着对老师说：“吴老师你看，奥莉薇好看吗？”老师给予肯定，他拿着莉薇开心的笑着拍照。
interpretation: 康泽在活动中展现出对创意和艺术的热爱。无论是轻粘土捏制还是对于服装设计，他都充满了想象力，并通过丰富的语言表达出自己的想法。这些活动不仅帮助他发展了精细动作和审美能力，还培养了他的主动探究的精神，深入了解了与设计相关的知识，并将所学内容与自己的创意相结合。这不仅让他学习了新的技能，还在实践中体验到了设计的乐趣和成就感。

title: 粘土手工-奥莉薇
description:
教师提供了多种彩色的轻粘土，引导幼儿以轻粘土捏制奥莉薇（小猪塑像和）和为小猪设计服装为主题进行创作。活动中她表现出极大的热情和对艺术创作的好奇心，并给予灵活的创作空间。
  廷瑞拿到轻粘土后，先揉搓了一大块淡粉色的粘土，准备做奥莉薇的头部和身体。他对老师说：“奥莉薇的身体是圆圆的，她很喜欢漂亮的衣服！”接着，他用绿色的粘土为塑像制作了一个裙子造型，边揉边问老师：“吴老师，绿色好看吗？我觉得她也是喜欢绿色。”老师回复他：“你做的绿色衣服真的很好看。”在裙子完成后，廷瑞注意到其他小朋友给奥莉薇加了皇冠。他选择了黄色的粘土，做了一个小皇冠，放在奥莉薇的头顶上。他一边调整皇冠的形状，一边笑着说：“这个奥莉薇真漂亮！”在作品完成后，廷瑞高兴地举起自己的塑像向老师展示。他摆出俏皮的表情，学着奥莉薇的样子对老师说：“这是我的奥莉薇，她喜欢跳舞，还喜欢绿色裙子！”
interpretation: 廷瑞在活动中展现出对创意和艺术的热爱。无论是轻粘土捏制还是对于服装设计，他都充满了想象力，并通过丰富的语言表达出自己的想法。这些活动不仅帮助他发展了精细动作和审美能力，还培养了他的主动探究的精神，深入了解了与设计相关的知识，并将所学内容与自己的创意相结合。这不仅让他学习了新的技能，还在实践中体验到了设计的乐趣和成就感。

title: 作品介绍——纸杯兔子
description:
幼儿制作的纸杯兔子手工作品，通常结合简单的材料和有趣的创意，让孩子们在动手过程中感受乐趣，同时锻炼他们的手眼协调能力和创造力。以下是对纸杯兔子作品的介绍：
幼儿使用一次性纸杯（兔子的身体），作为兔子的身体，可根据喜好装饰颜色或图案。用卡纸剪出两只长长的兔耳朵，可以用粉色或其他颜色点缀耳朵内侧。
1.	粘贴五官：
o	眼睛可以用卡纸剪出圆形贴上，或直接画上去。
o	鼻子可以使用小绒球，增加立体感。
o	嘴巴可以用笔画上或剪纸贴出微笑的形状。
2.	添加兔子尾巴：在纸杯背面粘上一个小棉球作为兔子的尾巴，使整体造型更加可爱。
3.	个性装饰（可选）：可以给兔子加上胡须、蝴蝶结，甚至画上衣服或小配件，使其更具个性。
作品特点：
•	造型可爱：圆圆的纸杯身体搭配长耳朵和绒球鼻子，整体形象俏皮生动。
•	色彩丰富：孩子们可以自由搭配颜色，展现自己的创意。
•	简单易做：手工步骤简单，适合四岁幼儿操作，并能培养他们的精细动作能力。
•	表达个性：不同的表情、颜色和装饰让每只纸杯兔子都独一无二。
•	动手能力：通过剪、贴、画等步骤，锻炼幼儿的手部肌肉发展。
•	创造力：鼓励孩子发挥想象，自由设计兔子的表情和装饰。
•	情感表达：手工制作带来的成就感能增强孩子的自信心，同时也能培养他们对小动物的喜爱。
这类纸杯兔子手工活动，以实现“来创造“领域的“通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。”学习成果。   
不仅是孩子们的一次趣味创作体验，也能让他们在游戏中学习，提高他们的艺术感知和实践能力！

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解1个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：尝试用华语与人交谈。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：喜欢涂涂画画，能画出较直、横的线，基本能控制笔的方向。
语言学习成果（写）- 笔画：基本能控制笔的方向，并写出一些基本的笔画。
使用多种材料以获得感知经验和探索体会。
感知和描述艺术的基本元素：线条、颜色、形状、质地。
运用不同的绘画工具（如：马克笔、蜡笔、颜料、粉笔、面团）进行艺术创作。
通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。

title: 粘土手工-奥莉薇
description:
教师提供了多种彩色的轻粘土，引导幼儿以轻粘土捏制奥莉薇（小猪塑像和）和为小猪设计服装为主题进行创作。活动中她表现出极大的热情和对艺术创作的好奇心，并给予灵活的创作空间。
  睿熙拿起淡粉色轻粘土，仔细揉搓成奥莉薇的头部和身体。他抬起头问老师：“吴老师，奥莉薇的鼻子是怎么做的？”老师一步一步做给他看，他一边调整鼻子的大小，一边用两种颜色制作鼻孔，最后选择粉色的粘土捏出两个鼻尖，并笑着说：“哈哈，奥莉薇有粉色的鼻子。”睿熙制作好后，看到旁边的朋友做了皇冠，他也为塑像加上黄色的皇冠，并用绿色粘土点缀。他一边搓粘土一边说：“这个奥莉薇很好看。”在制作蓝色服装时，他揉搓粘土形成一片片的小块，他说：“她的衣服是蓝色的。我喜欢蓝色也是”当塑像完成后，睿熙拿着他的作品走到老师和同伴面前，开心地说：“你看，这是奥莉薇！我做好了。”
interpretation: 睿熙在活动中展现出对创意和艺术的热爱。无论是轻粘土捏制还是对于服装设计，他都充满了想象力，并通过丰富的语言表达出自己的想法。这些活动不仅帮助他发展了精细动作和审美能力，还培养了他的主动探究的精神，深入了解了与设计相关的知识，并将所学内容与自己的创意相结合。这不仅让他学习了新的技能，还在实践中体验到了设计的乐趣和成就感。

运用不同的绘画工具（如：马克笔、蜡笔、颜料、粉笔、面团）进行艺术创作。
通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。

title: 粘土手工-奥莉薇
description:
教师提供了多种彩色的轻粘土，引导幼儿以轻粘土捏制奥莉薇（小猪塑像和）和为小猪设计服装为主题进行创作。活动中她表现出极大的热情和对艺术创作的好奇心，并给予灵活的创作空间。
 炜衡做好奥莉薇的身体后，拿起红色轻粘土，并仔细搓揉成奥莉薇的裙子形状。他问老师：“吴老师，你喜欢红色吗？”老师回复他：“我喜欢红色，要过新年了，我们都会穿红色的衣服呀。”他又说到：“是，我也是有红色的衣服。”炜衡继续专注的做着，他用不同颜色来装饰衣服。他给奥莉薇的裙子增加了多个黄色的小点缀，并说到：“这个黄色很好看，我做了很多的小小的这个放在上面。”老师说：“真的很漂亮，黄色很亮，奥莉薇可以穿这个跳舞。”炜衡笑嘻嘻地说：“ 是，奥莉薇穿这个跳舞很好看。”
interpretation: 炜衡在活动中展现出对创意和艺术的热爱。无论是轻粘土捏制还是对于服装设计，他都充满了想象力，并通过丰富的语言表达出自己的想法。这些活动不仅帮助他发展了精细动作和审美能力，还培养了他的主动探究的精神，深入了解了与设计相关的知识，并将所学内容与自己的创意相结合。这不仅让他学习了新的技能，还在实践中体验到了设计的乐趣和成就感。

learning_goals.title: 主动探究使幼儿从中获得更多有关主题知识。（PRAISE）
认识人类行为对环境带来的后果：初步了解人们工作和生活的方式对环境的影响。
认识人类行为对环境带来的后果：初步了解人们怎样影响他们生活的环境。
认识人类行为对环境带来的后果：开始意识人与他们居住环境的关系。

title: 作品介绍——纸杯兔子
description:
幼儿制作的纸杯兔子手工作品，通常结合简单的材料和有趣的创意，让孩子们在动手过程中感受乐趣，同时锻炼他们的手眼协调能力和创造力。以下是对纸杯兔子作品的介绍：
幼儿使用一次性纸杯（兔子的身体），作为兔子的身体，可根据喜好装饰颜色或图案。用卡纸剪出两只长长的兔耳朵，可以用粉色或其他颜色点缀耳朵内侧。
1.	粘贴五官：
o	眼睛可以用卡纸剪出圆形贴上，或直接画上去。
o	鼻子可以使用小绒球，增加立体感。
o	嘴巴可以用笔画上或剪纸贴出微笑的形状。
2.	添加兔子尾巴：在纸杯背面粘上一个小棉球作为兔子的尾巴，使整体造型更加可爱。
3.	个性装饰（可选）：可以给兔子加上胡须、蝴蝶结，甚至画上衣服或小配件，使其更具个性。
作品特点：
•	造型可爱：圆圆的纸杯身体搭配长耳朵和绒球鼻子，整体形象俏皮生动。
•	色彩丰富：孩子们可以自由搭配颜色，展现自己的创意。
•	简单易做：手工步骤简单，适合四岁幼儿操作，并能培养他们的精细动作能力。
•	表达个性：不同的表情、颜色和装饰让每只纸杯兔子都独一无二。
•	动手能力：通过剪、贴、画等步骤，锻炼幼儿的手部肌肉发展。
•	创造力：鼓励孩子发挥想象，自由设计兔子的表情和装饰。
•	情感表达：手工制作带来的成就感能增强孩子的自信心，同时也能培养他们对小动物的喜爱。
这类纸杯兔子手工活动，以实现“来创造“领域的“通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。”学习成果。   
不仅是孩子们的一次趣味创作体验，也能让他们在游戏中学习，提高他们的艺术感知和实践能力！

语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：尝试用华语与人交谈。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：喜欢涂涂画画，能画出较直、横的线，基本能控制笔的方向。
运用不同的绘画工具（如：马克笔、蜡笔、颜料、粉笔、面团）进行艺术创作。

title: 粘土手工-奥莉薇
description:
教师提供了多种彩色的轻粘土，引导幼儿以轻粘土捏制奥莉薇（小猪塑像和）和为小猪设计服装为主题进行创作。活动中她表现出极大的热情和对艺术创作的好奇心，并给予灵活的创作空间。
  Amrin选择了红色和蓝色轻粘土作为奥莉薇的主要服饰颜色。在老师的帮助下他先捏出长长的形状后，接着用红色轻粘土制作上衣部分。他一边做一边说：“Tr Izza help，吴老师help。”老师看到他做的衣服后竖起大拇指给与肯定。他笑嘻嘻地说：“吴老师，so  happy。”在制作面部时，Amrin模仿老师用黑色粘土做眼睛和鼻孔，当他贴上眼睛时哈哈大笑说：“so funny。”
interpretation: Amrin在活动中展现出对粘土的喜爱，他能够在老师的帮助下完成捏奥莉薇的活动。这些活动不仅帮助他发展了精细动作和审美能力，还培养了他的主动探究的精神。

认识人类行为对环境带来的后果：开始意识人与他们居住环境的关系。

title: 粘土手工-奥莉薇
description:
教师提供了多种彩色的轻粘土，引导幼儿以轻粘土捏制奥莉薇（小猪塑像和）和为小猪设计服装为主题进行创作。活动中她表现出极大的热情和对艺术创作的好奇心，并给予灵活的创作空间。
  鈞澤用淡粉色的轻粘土捏出奥莉薇的主体，并且很认真地用手慢慢塑形。他边捏边说：“吴老师，这个很软，这边都破洞了。”老师说：“是的，粘土很软，所以不要太用力，”鈞澤继续使用黑色轻粘土做出两只大大的眼睛，并且调整了几次位置。老师说：“这个奥莉薇的眼睛真大啊。”他笑着说：“我的眼睛不是很大，一笑起来就看不到了。” 鈞澤看到朋友们做了皇冠，他也用红色轻粘土做出一顶皇冠，并在顶部加了黄色的小点点，骄傲地展示给老师看：“吴老师，你看我的奥莉薇，我也是给她做了皇冠。”
interpretation: 鈞澤在活动中展现出对创意和艺术的热爱。无论是轻粘土捏制还是对于服装设计，他都充满了想象力，并通过丰富的语言表达出自己的想法。这些活动不仅帮助他发展了精细动作和审美能力，还培养了他的主动探究的精神，深入了解了与设计相关的知识，并将所学内容与自己的创意相结合。这不仅让他学习了新的技能，还在实践中体验到了设计的乐趣和成就感。

title: 作品介绍——纸杯兔子
description:
幼儿制作的纸杯兔子手工作品，通常结合简单的材料和有趣的创意，让孩子们在动手过程中感受乐趣，同时锻炼他们的手眼协调能力和创造力。以下是对纸杯兔子作品的介绍：
幼儿使用一次性纸杯（兔子的身体），作为兔子的身体，可根据喜好装饰颜色或图案。用卡纸剪出两只长长的兔耳朵，可以用粉色或其他颜色点缀耳朵内侧。
1.	粘贴五官：
o	眼睛可以用卡纸剪出圆形贴上，或直接画上去。
o	鼻子可以使用小绒球，增加立体感。
o	嘴巴可以用笔画上或剪纸贴出微笑的形状。
2.	添加兔子尾巴：在纸杯背面粘上一个小棉球作为兔子的尾巴，使整体造型更加可爱。
3.	个性装饰（可选）：可以给兔子加上胡须、蝴蝶结，甚至画上衣服或小配件，使其更具个性。
作品特点：
•	造型可爱：圆圆的纸杯身体搭配长耳朵和绒球鼻子，整体形象俏皮生动。
•	色彩丰富：孩子们可以自由搭配颜色，展现自己的创意。
•	简单易做：手工步骤简单，适合四岁幼儿操作，并能培养他们的精细动作能力。
•	表达个性：不同的表情、颜色和装饰让每只纸杯兔子都独一无二。
•	动手能力：通过剪、贴、画等步骤，锻炼幼儿的手部肌肉发展。
•	创造力：鼓励孩子发挥想象，自由设计兔子的表情和装饰。
•	情感表达：手工制作带来的成就感能增强孩子的自信心，同时也能培养他们对小动物的喜爱。
这类纸杯兔子手工活动，以实现“来创造“领域的“通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。”学习成果。   
不仅是孩子们的一次趣味创作体验，也能让他们在游戏中学习，提高他们的艺术感知和实践能力！

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解1个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：尝试用华语与人交谈。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：喜欢涂涂画画，能画出较直、横的线，基本能控制笔的方向。
运用不同的绘画工具（如：马克笔、蜡笔、颜料、粉笔、面团）进行艺术创作。
通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。

title: 粘土手工-奥莉薇
description:
教师提供了多种彩色的轻粘土，引导幼儿以轻粘土捏制奥莉薇（小猪塑像和）和为小猪设计服装为主题进行创作。活动中她表现出极大的热情和对艺术创作的好奇心，并给予灵活的创作空间。
  诗雅认真地聆听教师的讲解，她先捏出奥莉薇的主体，在捏耳朵的时候，她很注重耳朵大小和位置。老师问她：“诗雅捏的耳朵很好，可以帮助朋友一下吗？”她回答：“好。”诗雅接过朋友的粘土开始制作起来。诗雅继续地创作，在选择衣服颜色时诗雅在紫色和蓝色之间想了一会儿，最后她选了蓝色作为衣服的颜色。在捏奥莉薇鼻孔的时候，她选了紫色作为奥莉薇的鼻孔。她看着即将完成的小猪雕塑，看向朋友们的，她又拿起了黄色制作成皇冠，橙色制作成蝴蝶结。
interpretation: 诗雅在活动中展现出对创意和艺术的热爱。无论是轻粘土捏制还是对于服装设计，她都充满了想象力，并通过丰富的语言表达出自己的想法。这些活动不仅帮助她发展了精细动作和审美能力，还培养了她的主动探究的精神，深入了解了与设计相关的知识，并将所学内容与自己的创意相结合。这不仅让她学习了新的技能，还在实践中体验到了设计的乐趣和成就感。

learning_goals.title: 主动探究使幼儿从中获得更多有关主题知识。（PRAISE）
认识人类行为对环境带来的后果：初步了解人们工作和生活的方式对环境的影响。
认识人类行为对环境带来的后果：初步了解人们怎样影响他们生活的环境。
认识人类行为对环境带来的后果：开始意识人与他们居住环境的关系。

•	简单易做：手工步骤简单，适合四岁幼儿操作，并能培养他们的精细动作能力。
•	表达个性：不同的表情、颜色和装饰让每只纸杯兔子都独一无二。
•	动手能力：通过剪、贴、画等步骤，锻炼幼儿的手部肌肉发展。
•	创造力：鼓励孩子发挥想象，自由设计兔子的表情和装饰。
•	情感表达：手工制作带来的成就感能增强孩子的自信心，同时也能培养他们对小动物的喜爱。
这类纸杯兔子手工活动，以实现“来创造“领域的“通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。”学习成果。   
不仅是孩子们的一次趣味创作体验，也能让他们在游戏中学习，提高他们的艺术感知和实践能力！

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解1个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：尝试用华语与人交谈。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：喜欢涂涂画画，能画出较直、横的线，基本能控制笔的方向。
运用不同的绘画工具（如：马克笔、蜡笔、颜料、粉笔、面团）进行艺术创作。
通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。

title: 绘本阅读：《五颜六色的毛毛虫》
description: 上午的阅读时间，瑞泽在书架选择了《五颜六色的毛毛虫》这本书，老师在旁边辅助瑞泽坐下阅读，瑞泽先是观察绘本封面，用手指点点书面的毛毛虫，然后翻开书页到绘有“红红的苹果”这一页，老师在旁边小声解说，让瑞泽知道自己看的是什么，瑞泽停留一下后接着翻到“橙色的胡萝卜”这一页，老师告诉瑞泽午餐会有胡萝卜可以吃，瑞泽看着老师然后把手指放进嘴巴，好像忍不住要吃了，最后瑞泽翻到吃了五颜六色的食物后的大毛毛虫这一页，瑞泽先是短暂的观察，之后开心的拍手大笑。阅读过程中从瑞泽的表情和动作可以看出，瑞泽能初步的理解绘本彩绘的内容，例如“胡萝卜”，“午餐”，瑞泽会伸手进嘴巴，看到大大的五颜六色漂亮的毛毛虫会开心大笑，初步理解艺术是美好开心的表达。

children.fullname: Lam Sui Tsak Reagan (Lan Rui Ze)

learning_goals.title: Communication and Language Development - Art 沟通与语言发展 - 审美与创意表达-美术
Foster an interest in art (familiarise with colours, shapes, etc.) 通过美术活动，如：涂鸦、水彩画等，认识熟悉的颜色、形状等，培养婴幼儿对艺术的兴趣。

title: 作品分析——《生气的脸》
description:
《生气的脸》活动围绕绘本《菲菲生气了——非常、非常的生气》展开，帮助幼儿认识和表达“生气”这一情绪，并通过语言与艺术创作加深理解。活动开始时，教师展示生气表情的照片，引导幼儿观察并描述表情特征，如皱眉和撅嘴。随后，幼儿通过照镜子模仿生气表情，并用华语表达自己的观察。接着，幼儿使用马克笔在纸盘上绘制“生气的脸”，再通过双面胶、吸管、扭扭棒等材料进行装饰，进一步展现情绪感受。最后，幼儿展示作品并参与整理材料，培养责任感。活动提升了幼儿的语言表达能力和创造力，帮助他们更好地理解和管理情绪。

  陈熙恩在创作过程中，先使用纸盘作为脸部的基础背景，运用橙色马克笔勾勒出两道直直的眉毛、圆形的嘴巴以及虚线状的眼泪，初步表现出生气的表情。接下来，她选择了彩色扭扭棒和吸管进行装饰，使作品更加丰富。她用红色扭扭棒制作嘴巴，使其更加突出；眉毛部分使用蓝色、红色、黄色和绿色的吸管进行装饰，以强化情绪表达；同时，她还使用了紫色的扭扭棒作为眼泪，进一步突出生气和委屈的情绪。整个过程中，陈熙恩认真观察自己的生气表情，并尝试通过不同材料呈现，能够专注创作，并在完成后向同伴展示自己的作品。
interpretation: 陈熙恩的作品以纸盘为基础，充分利用马克笔、扭扭棒和吸管等多种材料，表现出“生气的脸”主题。她用橙色马克笔绘制脸部五官，其中直直的眉毛向下倾斜，突出了愤怒的情绪；嘴巴则用红色扭扭棒勾勒出圆形，呈现出张开、愤怒的状态，使表情更具表现力。此外，她用紫色扭扭棒代表眼泪，增强了作品的情绪表达，展现了生气中带有委屈的感受。在额头部位，她使用蓝色、红色、黄色和绿色吸管进行装饰，使作品更加立体和生动，同时增添了层次感和视觉冲击力。整体而言，该作品在表情特征、色彩搭配和材料运用上具有较强的表现力，能清晰传达生气的情绪。幼儿在创作过程中能够结合观察与想象，充分表达自己的情绪认知，并展现了良好的动手能力和创造力。

learning_goals.title: 描述和说明他们在艺术作品中的想法和构思，开始有意识地把各种艺术元素组织在一起，创造出艺术视觉表现，如：用颜色表达情感；用线条营造动感；用模板创作各种图案。
谈论他们朋友的作品。

title: 作品分析——《生气的脸》
description:
《生气的脸》活动以绘本《菲菲生气了——非常、非常的生气》为引导，帮助幼儿认识和表达“生气”这一情绪，并通过语言和艺术创作加深理解。活动开始时，教师展示生气表情的照片，引导幼儿观察并描述表情特征，如皱眉、撅嘴等。随后，幼儿通过照镜子模仿生气的表情，并用华语表达自己的观察。接着，幼儿使用马克笔在纸盘上绘制“生气的脸”，并利用双面胶、吸管、扭扭棒等材料进行装饰，使作品更加立体生动。最后，幼儿展示作品并参与整理材料，培养责任感。本次活动不仅提升了幼儿的情绪认知能力，也增强了他们的语言表达能力和创造力，使他们能更好地理解和管理自己的情绪。

  陈卓毅在创作过程中，先使用纸盘作为基础背景，并运用蓝色马克笔简单绘制了一张表情温和的笑脸。随后，他尝试使用不同材料进行装饰，在另一张作品中，他用橙色扭扭棒制作了两个圆形的眼睛，突出表情的特征，并选择黄色和绿色的吸管作为嘴巴，摆放成横向结构，使表情呈现出略微生气的情绪。整个过程中，他表现得十分专注，认真挑选合适的材料，并尝试调整其位置以达到最佳效果。他能够按照自己的理解进行创作，并在完成后向同伴展示自己的作品。
interpretation: 陈卓毅的作品展现了对情绪表达的理解和材料运用的探索。他先尝试用蓝色马克笔绘制了一张笑脸，表现出不同的情绪变化。随后，在“生气的脸”作品中，他使用橙色扭扭棒制作眼睛，颜色明亮，增强了面部特征的表现力。嘴巴部分由黄色和绿色的吸管组合而成，横向排列，营造出生气的表情效果。整体作品在色彩运用上较为简洁，注重面部的主要元素，虽然表情并未表现出明显的愤怒感，但能通过眼睛的颜色和嘴巴的排列方式展现情绪特征。整体而言，他在创作过程中能够自主选择材料，并大胆尝试不同的表达方式，展现了一定的创造力和情绪认知能力。

learning_goals.title: 描述和说明他们在艺术作品中的想法和构思，开始有意识地把各种艺术元素组织在一起，创造出艺术视觉表现，如：用颜色表达情感；用线条营造动感；用模板创作各种图案。
谈论他们朋友的作品。

title: 不一样的体验
description: 祥宏背部直挺的坐在软底上，手里还在玩着小玩具，转换不同的玩法，左手换右手，敲敲打打，手部不停的动作同时身体也在尽量维持平衡。祥宏在达到月领6个月，老师会参照婴幼儿发展里程碑，来让祥宏尝试独立坐着和脊柱的支撑能力，祥宏从开始 不可以坐直到现在可以坐3到5分钟，进步很快，并且身体发展达到6个月幼儿的发展需求，同时可以和老师互动，加油祥宏！

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development (grasping, holding to small objects, pushing small objects, pinching small objects, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：能用五指抓物品。
Foster gross motor development (rolling over, sitting, crawling, standing, etc.) 发展粗大动作，如：翻身、坐、爬、站立等。

title: 作品分析——《生气的脸》
description:
《生气的脸》活动围绕绘本《菲菲生气了——非常、非常的生气》展开，帮助幼儿认识和表达“生气”这一情绪，并通过语言与艺术创作加深理解。活动开始时，教师展示生气表情的照片，引导幼儿观察并描述表情特征，如皱眉和撅嘴。随后，幼儿通过照镜子模仿生气表情，并用华语表达自己的观察。接着，幼儿使用马克笔在纸盘上绘制“生气的脸”，再通过双面胶、吸管、扭扭棒等材料进行装饰，进一步展现情绪感受。最后，幼儿展示作品并参与整理材料，培养责任感。活动提升了幼儿的语言表达能力和创造力，帮助他们更好地理解和管理情绪。


  明凯的作品以纸盘为基础，通过马克笔、吸管和扭扭棒进行创作，表现“生气的脸”。初稿中使用蓝色马克笔描绘五官，其中嘴巴以弯曲的锯齿状线条表现“龇牙”特征，圆形的眼睛位置对称，突出了眼部的强调。装饰阶段，明凯使用黄色吸管和蓝色扭扭棒增强了眉毛的立体感。眉毛通过横向排列表现出明显的愤怒特征。整体作品在表情特征和材料搭配上清晰直观，明凯在创作时模仿了龇牙动作，面部紧绷，进一步凸显了作品情绪的真实性。
interpretation:
蔡明凯的作品以纸盘为基础，运用马克笔、吸管和扭扭棒等材料，成功表现了“生气的脸”主题。他使用蓝色马克笔勾勒五官，其中嘴巴采用弯曲的锯齿状线条，表现出“龇牙”的愤怒表情，使整体情绪更加鲜明。眼睛部分呈圆形，对称分布，突出了眼部的特征，使面部结构更加完整。

在装饰环节，他选择了黄色吸管和蓝色扭扭棒，使作品更加立体。其中，黄色吸管和蓝色扭扭棒被用于眉毛区域，增强了怒气的表现力。眉毛的横向排列方式，使表情更具张力，进一步强化了“生气”这一主题。

整体来看，该作品在色彩搭配、材料运用和情绪表达上较为突出，清晰地展现了生气的情绪特征。蔡明凯在创作过程中模仿了龇牙的表情，并通过面部紧绷的动作来增强作品的情绪真实性。他能够利用不同的材料突出五官特征，并结合个人观察进行表达，展现了较强的创造力和情绪理解能力。

learning_goals.title: 描述和说明他们在艺术作品中的想法和构思，开始有意识地把各种艺术元素组织在一起，创造出艺术视觉表现，如：用颜色表达情感；用线条营造动感；用模板创作各种图案。
谈论他们朋友的作品。

title: 作品分析——《生气的脸》
description:
《生气的脸》活动围绕绘本《菲菲生气了——非常、非常的生气》展开，帮助幼儿认识和表达“生气”这一情绪，并通过语言与艺术创作加深理解。活动开始时，教师展示生气表情的照片，引导幼儿观察并描述表情特征，如皱眉和撅嘴。随后，幼儿通过照镜子模仿生气表情，并用华语表达自己的观察。接着，幼儿使用马克笔在纸盘上绘制“生气的脸”，再通过双面胶、吸管、扭扭棒等材料进行装饰，进一步展现情绪感受。最后，幼儿展示作品并参与整理材料，培养责任感。活动提升了幼儿的语言表达能力和创造力，帮助他们更好地理解和管理情绪。

  蔡昀杉在创作过程中，使用纸盘作为基础背景，并用蓝色马克笔勾勒出具有强烈情绪的面部特征。她画出了圆圆的眼睛，并在嘴巴部分使用圆圆的线条勾勒出嘴巴的轮廓，用锯齿状线条，表现出龇牙的愤怒表情，使整体情绪更加鲜明。随后，她选择了不同的材料进行装饰，用蓝色扭扭棒在脸颊两侧增加线条，使表情更加生动，同时在额头部分粘贴了黄色和绿色的吸管，增强作品的层次感和立体感。整个创作过程中，她展现出高度的专注力，并尝试调整材料的位置，使作品更加完整。

《生气的脸》活动围绕绘本《菲菲生气了——非常、非常的生气》展开，旨在帮助幼儿认识和表达“生气”这一情绪，并通过语言与艺术创作加深理解。教师通过展示生气表情的照片，引导幼儿观察和描述表情特征，如皱眉、撅嘴或龇牙等。接着，幼儿通过照镜子模仿生气表情，并尝试用华语表达自己的观察。随后，幼儿使用马克笔在纸盘上绘制“生气的脸”，并利用双面胶、吸管、扭扭棒等材料进行装饰，使作品更具立体感和表现力。最后，幼儿展示作品，并在教师的引导下参与整理材料，培养责任感。本次活动不仅帮助幼儿提高语言表达能力，还提升了他们对情绪的认知能力和创造力，使他们更好地理解和管理自己的情绪。

title: 作品分析——《生气的脸》
description:
《生气的脸》活动围绕绘本《菲菲生气了——非常、非常的生气》展开，帮助幼儿认识和表达“生气”这一情绪，并通过语言与艺术创作加深理解。活动开始时，教师展示生气表情的照片，引导幼儿观察并描述表情特征，如皱眉、撅嘴等。随后，幼儿通过照镜子模仿生气表情，并用华语表达自己的观察。接着，幼儿使用马克笔在纸盘上绘制“生气的脸”，再通过双面胶、吸管、扭扭棒等材料进行装饰，进一步展现情绪感受。最后，幼儿展示作品并参与整理材料，培养责任感。活动提升了幼儿的语言表达能力和创造力，帮助他们更好地理解和管理情绪。


  符诗恩在创作过程中，先使用蓝色马克笔在纸盘上勾勒出五官特征。她画出上扬的三角形眉毛，突出生气时的情绪特征，并以简单的线条绘制了紧闭的嘴巴，使整个表情显得愤怒而严肃。随后，在装饰阶段，她使用了粉色扭扭棒制作眉毛，增强了五官的立体感，并在鼻子部分添加了一个粉色的扭扭棒，使整体作品更加生动。嘴巴部分，她选择了两根蓝色吸管拼接成“V”字形，突出了撅嘴的情绪特征。整个过程中，她表现得非常投入，专注于调整材料的摆放，使作品更具表现力，并在完成后向同伴展示自己的创作。
interpretation: 符诗恩的作品通过纸盘、马克笔、扭扭棒和吸管等材料，成功塑造了“生气的脸”主题。她使用蓝色马克笔勾勒出五官，其中眉毛采用上扬的三角形线条，增强了生气表情的力度，使作品富有情绪张力。嘴巴部分呈现“V”字形，搭配蓝色吸管，使愤怒的情绪更加直观。装饰部分，她用粉色扭扭棒制作眉毛，使表情更加夸张和突出；鼻子部分使用粉色扭扭棒，使整个作品更具立体感。从整体来看，该作品在色彩搭配和材料运用上较为丰富，生气的特征表现得非常直观。符诗恩在创作过程中展现了对情绪的观察力和表现力，能够利用不同的材料突出五官特征，并结合自己的想象力进行创作，作品具有较强的个性化特点。

learning_goals.title: 描述和说明他们在艺术作品中的想法和构思，开始有意识地把各种艺术元素组织在一起，创造出艺术视觉表现，如：用颜色表达情感；用线条营造动感；用模板创作各种图案。
谈论他们朋友的作品。

title: Scoop and transfer
description: In developing the children’s fine motor skills, they were invited to scoop and transfer the pompom balls from the plate into the holes of the egg carton. Jaylen sat on the floor and picked up the plastic spoon with his right hand. He carefully moved the spoon to pick up a pompom ball from the plate, balancing it on the spoon as he moved his hand toward the egg carton. Jaylen repeated the process by scooping and transferring the pompom balls into the egg carton with a steady hand. Each time, he adjusted his grip on the spoon and carefully placed the pompom ball neatly inside the egg carton. Once Jaylen had transferred all the pompom balls, he smiled at the teacher.
interpretation: In this activity, Jaylen displayed his developing fine motor skills, particularly in the areas of hand-eye coordination and hand dexterity. The task of using a spoon to scoop and place the pompom balls required him to coordinate his hand and eye movements carefully, which helped strengthen his control and dexterity over small muscle movements. Moreover, the act of transferring the pompom balls into the egg carton helped to develop his spatial awareness as he ensured that the balls were placed in the holes of the egg carton. This activity supports the development of essential skills that would benefit Jaylen in other tasks requiring fine motor precision and coordination. Jaylen also showcased great perseverance as he was able to persist and complete the task of scooping and transferring the pompom balls.

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development ( pick up objects using pincer grasp, hold crayon to scribble, fasten/unfasten zippers/buttons, screw, unscrew bottle caps, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：用大拇指、食指及中指（三指）抓物品、拉拉链、扣纽扣、拧瓶盖等。

title: Scoop and transfer
description: In developing the children’s fine motor skills, they were invited to scoop and transfer the pompom balls from the plate into the holes of the egg carton. Jumaius sat on the floor and picked up the plastic spoon with his right hand. He carefully moved the spoon to pick up a pompom ball from the plate, balancing it on the spoon as he moved his hand toward the egg carton. With focus, he placed the pompom ball neatly into one of the holes in the carton, continuing to repeat the action of scooping and transferring until all the holes were filled. Once Jumaius had transferred all the pompom balls, he looked at the teacher and nodded.
interpretation: In this activity, Jumaius displayed his developing fine motor skills, particularly in the areas of hand-eye coordination and hand dexterity. He demonstrated increasing control of his hands and his visual tracking abilities as he balanced the pompom ball on the spoon with precision and steady hand movements. Moreover, the act of transferring the pompom balls into the egg carton helped strengthen his spatial awareness as he ensured that the balls were placed into specific holes in the egg carton. This activity supports the development of essential skills that would benefit Jumaius in other tasks requiring fine motor precision and coordination. Jumaius also showcased great perseverance as he was able to persist and complete the task of scooping and transferring the pompom balls.

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development ( pick up objects using pincer grasp, hold crayon to scribble, fasten/unfasten zippers/buttons, screw, unscrew bottle caps, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：用大拇指、食指及中指（三指）抓物品、拉拉链、扣纽扣、拧瓶盖等。

title: Scoop and transfer
description: In developing the children’s fine motor skills, they were invited to scoop and transfer the pompom balls from the plate into the holes of the egg carton. Levelle sat on the floor and picked up a small plastic spoon with her right hand. She carefully moved the spoon to scoop up the pompom ball and relied on her left hand to guide and place the ball firmly onto the spoon, preventing it from falling off. Afterwards, Levelle moved her hand to transfer the pompom ball into the egg carton. She continued to repeat the action of scooping and transferring, consistently using her left hand to assist in placing the pompom balls onto the spoon. Once Levelle had transferred all the pompom balls, she smiled at the teacher.
interpretation: This activity demonstrated Levelle’s developing hand-eye coordination and fine motor skills. Her use of both hands for different tasks (e.g., her right hand for scooping and her left hand for assisting in the transfer) showed an early form of coordination, indicating her progress in hand dominance and improving the dexterity of each hand accordingly. Moreover, Levelle’s ability to transfer the pompom balls into the egg carton suggested growing concentration and an understanding of the task at hand. This activity supports the development of essential skills that would benefit Levelle in other tasks requiring fine motor precision and coordination. Levelle also displayed great perseverance as she was able to persist and complete the task of scooping and transferring the pompom balls.

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development ( pick up objects using pincer grasp, hold crayon to scribble, fasten/unfasten zippers/buttons, screw, unscrew bottle caps, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：用大拇指、食指及中指（三指）抓物品、拉拉链、扣纽扣、拧瓶盖等。

title: Work Sample #1: Fan-tastic New Year!
description:
To foster children’s creative expression and enhance their fine motor skills, the children were invited to create their version of a Chinese New Year fan. They used different materials such as crepe papers, pompoms, markers, pipe cleaners and straws to express their ideas. While creating a functional and decorative fan, this activity also aimed to foster cultural awareness.

Abigail shared, "This is a flower. I used different colours."

learning_goals.title: Experiment with a variety of techniques (e.g: crayon etching, cotton-bud painting, and splatter painting).
Experiment with elements to create artworks (e.g: mix paints to get different colours or shades of colours, use shapes and lines to create patterns).
Describe and explain ideas in their artworks (e.g: lines to represent motion).

title: 吸管插洞洞
description:
老师邀请小朋友参与吸管插洞洞活动。老师提供好打好孔的纸箱和吸管若干，请小朋友们一只手抓住，插入洞洞中。
老师对小朋友们说：“谁要参加吸管插洞洞游戏啊？”彩绚看着老师。老师笑着对彩绚说：“你要玩吗？”彩绚看着老师点点头。老师鼓励彩绚说：“我要玩。”彩绚模仿老师的动作拍了拍自己，表示我。老师拿出吸管和洞洞箱，请彩绚小朋友动手操作。彩绚开始一只手呈五指抓握吸管，尝试插入洞洞箱，在发展很难插入，她会低头看向洞洞中，在尝试向下插入吸管。在反复的穿插吸管过程中，彩绚从最初五指抓握吸管，逐渐可以三指抓握吸管插入洞洞中。当吸管插光了后，彩绚会看向老师，双手张开发出：“噢”的声音。老师看向彩绚，询问彩绚：“怎么了？是要吸管吗？”彩绚微笑的点头。老师鼓励彩绚说：“还要、我还要吸管。”彩绚用小手拍了拍自己的胸口回应老师，又低头继续参与插洞洞的游戏中。
interpretation: 彩绚小朋友可以积极参与吸管插洞洞的活动，可以尝试使用动作点头、拍拍自己的胸口表示自己的想法。并可以一只手抓住吸管，另一只手从五指抓握，逐渐变成三指抓握吸管向下按压插入洞洞中，手要协调能力良好。

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development ( pick up objects using pincer grasp, hold crayon to scribble, fasten/unfasten zippers/buttons, screw, unscrew bottle caps, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：用大拇指、食指及中指（三指）抓物品、拉拉链、扣纽扣、拧瓶盖等。

老师对小朋友们说：“谁要参加吸管插洞洞游戏啊？”函豫看着老师拍拍自己的胸口。老师笑着对函豫说：“我要玩。”函豫慢慢的说：“我、要、玩。”老师竖起大拇指表扬函豫：“说的很好。”函豫微笑的拿起装吸管的杯子，并尝试三指抓握吸管插入洞洞箱中。当吸管插入遇到阻碍时，函豫会三指捏住吸管向上抬，另一只手按住纸箱。当吸管全都拉出来后，函豫低头看向洞洞箱中。当没有发现有什么不同后，函豫三指捏住吸管，双手同时抓握吸管,用力向下插入吸管。当吸管全部插入洞洞中，函豫微笑的拍手庆祝。老师也微笑的回应，并表扬函豫：“好棒呀！”函豫又继续低头游戏，这次她尝试把吸管插入不同的位置。
interpretation: 函豫小朋友可以积极参与吸管插洞洞活动。可以尝试使用动作和词汇表达自己的想法。并可以尝试双手三指抓握住吸管，插入洞洞中。在插入洞洞的过程中遇到阻碍时，函豫会拔出吸管观察洞洞箱。并没有害怕失败，而是继续尝试。

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development ( pick up objects using pincer grasp, hold crayon to scribble, fasten/unfasten zippers/buttons, screw, unscrew bottle caps, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：用大拇指、食指及中指（三指）抓物品、拉拉链、扣纽扣、拧瓶盖等。

title: 三月，创造音乐。PTC
description:
老师与他在大自然区域互动。
刚开始他听老师唱歌，接着就拍拍手配搭；然来，他用双手拍打盖在轮胎的板来制造节凑配搭老师的唱歌。
接着他爬去拿一个手摇铃，跪着敲盖在轮胎的板再次来制造节凑配搭老师的唱歌。
越敲越起劲，他就站起来敲节凑更加强壮；更加开心。
他达到创造音乐节凑初步发展目标，真棒！

learning_goals.title: Foster an interest and enjoyment in music and movement (through exploring musical toys, musical instruments, etc.) 通过声音探索周围的环境，如：敲击表面、摇晃物体、敲击手鼓、刮鼓、按压音乐玩具上的按钮，培养婴幼儿对音乐律动的兴趣，享受音乐与律动。

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: 叠高搭建积木
description: 在区角活动中，老师邀请幼儿一起来做搭建积木的游戏，方凯看到后走了过来，方凯看了看老师搭建的三块小积木，便用右手从旁边五指抓握了一块红色的方块积木，眼睛看向老师搭建的三块积木，右手稳稳的将手里的红色积木放到了上面。然后方凯用左手抓起一块积木递到右手，并举高右手再次以同样的方式将紫色的方块积木搭建上去。最后，方凯又拿起一块蓝色的方块积木，但他坐着无法进行叠加，老师说：“啊，方凯搭建的这么高。”方凯笑了笑，站了起来，站稳后，方凯用右手将蓝色的方块积木叠加上去，老师为方凯拍手，方凯笑着将搭建好的所有积木推倒，然后再次重新搭建，方凯重复搭建、推倒、再搭建，直到区角活动结束。
interpretation: 方凯能够手眼协调的进行搭建活动，能够将三个以上的积木垒起来。

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development ( pick up objects using pincer grasp, hold crayon to scribble, fasten/unfasten zippers/buttons, screw, unscrew bottle caps, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：用大拇指、食指及中指（三指）抓物品、拉拉链、扣纽扣、拧瓶盖等。
Develop eye-hand coordination (roll a ball, pick up soft blocks and stack, self-feed, put simple things together and take them apart) 发展手眼协调能力，如：滚球，叠放软积木，喂食，把简单玩具连在一起再拆开等。

title: 动物拼图板
description: 在区角活动中，泽阳走到图书角落，将动物拼图板拿了出来，老师问泽阳：“你要玩动物拼图嘛？”泽阳点头回答老师说：“要。”泽阳坐下来后将所有的动物从拼图板里拿了出来，然后拿起公鸡的拼图板块，看了看拼图板，老师说：“泽阳，这是公鸡，你找找公鸡在哪里？”泽阳跟随老师说出了：“鸡。”老师鼓励泽阳说出：“公”和“鸡”。泽阳逐一跟随老师说出：“公”、“鸡”。并在拼图板上找到了对应的公鸡图片，将公鸡板块放了回去，完成了配对。之后，泽阳分别将动物图板牛、羊、猪以及马逐一进行正确的配对，并能够跟随老师复述说出所有的动物名称，老师给予泽阳鼓掌，泽阳笑着回应老师后，又选择了其他的拼图板进行拼图活动。
interpretation: 泽阳能够进行图配图的拼图活动，并能够跟随老师逐字说出动物名称。

learning_goals.title: That children become confident, curious, involved learners 婴幼儿是自信、好奇和投入的学习者。
Foster problem solving during independent and group activities (puzzles, sequencing activities etc.) 通过拼图游戏、排序等活动，初步培养解决问题的能力。
Foster sustained involvement and concentration in chosen activities 通过幼儿所选择的活动，培养持续参与和专注力。

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: Rainbow Sorting Garden
description:
The children had the opportunity to participate in an activity in which they were provided with matching "flower pots" labelled by two attributes, such as "red circles," "pink circles," "blue triangles," "yellow triangles," etc.

Kelsey began by selecting two coloured papers of varying attributes and said, "I take pink circle and yellow triangle because I like pink and yellow." Next, she drew flower designs on it.

After drawing, the children placed their flower drawings in a small container. When it was Kelsey's turn to "plant" two flowers in the corresponding pots, she picked a yellow triangle paper and placed it in the middle pot. Next, she grabbed a yellow triangle from the container before putting it into the first pot. She then said, "I am done!"
interpretation: Through this activity, Kelsey can confidently sort objects according to two attributes; the colour and shape of the paper cutouts. She can also take responsibility for her own actions, such as learning to make choices independently.

learning_goals.title: Sort objects according to two attributes (e.g: colour and shape, colour and size).

title: 幼儿作品分析——表情脸谱
description:
雨蒽小朋友用纸盘制作了一张“难过”的表情脸谱，整体造型简单明了，能够清晰地传达出悲伤的情绪。通过对五官的设计与摆放，她成功表现出了一个哭泣、难过的面部表情。
她选择黑色纸剪出“X”形的眼睛，象征着紧闭或挤压的状态，增强了脸谱的情绪表达。这种眼神设计生动地展现了痛苦或委屈的感受。嘴巴使用黑色纸剪成向下弯曲的弧形，呈现出典型的悲伤嘴型，直观地表达了“难过”的情绪。两个黄色小绒球贴在脸颊一侧，象征着滑落的泪水，增强了作品的情感表现力。通过简单的形状与颜色搭配，雨蒽小朋友巧妙地表达了情绪，展现了自己的观察能力与创造力。黑色的眼睛和嘴巴与白色纸盘形成鲜明对比，使表情更具冲击力。黄色小球的使用不仅丰富了作品的层次感，还增加了趣味性和独特性。在制作过程中，她能更好地理解“难过”这种情绪，并通过手工艺术进行表达。拼贴的过程锻炼了她的手部精细动作，提升了手眼协调能力。
雨蒽小朋友的作品富有创意，充分展现了“难过”的表情特点，细节处理得当，能有效传达情绪。这个脸谱不仅是一次成功的手工尝试，也是一种对情绪的艺术表达，让孩子在动手过程中学习和成长。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解1个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：尝试用华语与人交谈。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：喜欢涂涂画画，能画出较直、横的线，基本能控制笔的方向。
运用不同的绘画工具（如：马克笔、蜡笔、颜料、粉笔、面团）进行艺术创作。
通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。

title: 模拟参观美术馆
description:
教师在学校内装饰美术馆区域，带领幼儿模拟参观美术馆。鼓励幼儿观察与表达自己对画作的喜好。
  于扬手持一张记录表和一支绿色记号笔，在“美术馆”的墙上认真观察挂着的几幅画作。她先停在一幅《向日葵》的画前，一边看一边诉说着：“这些花是太阳花，颜色是黄色的。我在花店也是看到过。”于扬随后走到一幅静物水果画前，指着画描述到：“我喜欢这幅画，因为这个看起来很好吃，有橙子，柠檬。”老师问：“你为什么喜欢这幅画呢？”她回答：“因为我喜欢吃橙子，橙子酸酸甜甜的，有时候呢，我也是会去机器那边买鲜榨的橙汁喝。”于扬最后在记录表上圈出水果画，并用绿色记号笔画了一颗小爱心，开心地举起来给老师看，说：“我还是喜欢这个水果画。”
interpretation: 通过此次活动，于扬展现了良好的观察力、表达能力和对艺术的热情。她能够细致地观察画作的细节，并准确描述画作的内容和色彩。她能够使用连贯的语言，态度自然得表达了对画作的喜好，能够清楚地说明原因，展现了较强的逻辑思维和语言组织能力。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 倾听：能认真有礼貌地倾听别人讲话，能辨别声调、语调的不同，有良好的倾听习惯。
语言学习成果（听）- 倾听：能听出一段话的要点。
语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解3个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（听）- 欣赏文学作品：喜欢倾听故事，在语言的引导下能对故事展开想象，体会故事描述的情景和表达的感情。
语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：能够积极主动地用华语表达，态度自然。
语言学习成果（说）- 表达：能清楚连贯地表达事情经过。
语言学习成果（说）- 表达：能针对某一个话题展开讨论。
语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（说）- 说华语：能熟练自如地讲华语。

title: 模拟参观美术馆
description:
教师在学校内装饰美术馆区域，带领幼儿模拟参观美术馆。鼓励幼儿观察与表达自己对画作的喜好。
  乐沁拿着一张记录纸和一支笔，走到《向日葵》的画前，指着画中的花朵对老师说：“吴老师，这些花很漂亮，它是太阳花！它们是黄色的，有大的，还有小的。”老师问：“你看到这些向日葵，是什么心情呢？”乐沁回答：“我看了，我会很开心。”说完乐沁开始数向日葵的数量，说：“这里有11朵向日葵，很多很多。”乐沁又看了一会儿《静物水果》的画，指着橙子说：“这个也很好看。”她停顿了一下，认真对比后说：“我还是喜欢向日葵这个画。”乐沁最后在记录纸上画了一朵小向日葵，并对老师说：“这是我最喜欢的画，我也想画了一个向日葵。”
interpretation: 通过此次活动，乐沁展现了良好的观察力、表达能力和对艺术的热情。她能够细致地观察画作的细节，并准确描述画作的内容和色彩。她能够使用连贯的语言，态度自然得表达了对画作的喜好，能够清楚地说明原因，展现了较强的逻辑思维和语言组织能力。

语言学习成果（说）- 表达：能清楚连贯地表达事情经过。
语言学习成果（说）- 表达：能针对某一个话题展开讨论。

title: 幼儿作品分析——表情脸谱
description:
敏绮小朋友使用纸盘制作了一张“高兴”的表情脸谱，整体设计简洁明了，能够生动地表达愉悦的情绪。通过五官的搭配，使整个作品充满童趣与感染力，让人一眼就能感受到开心和快乐的氛围。
她选择黑色纸剪出弯弯的眉眼形状，象征着微笑时上扬的眼睛，使表情更加自然，选用红色纸剪成上扬的弧形嘴巴，传递出笑容的愉悦感。嘴型较大且呈现明显的弧度，使整体表情更富有感染力。整体构图通过黑色和红色的基本形状拼贴出表情，符合她的认知特点。纸盘的圆形为脸部提供了稳定的基础，增强了整体的协调感。敏绮小朋友通过弯弯的眼睛和大大的微笑，成功塑造了一个开心的脸谱，展示了她对情绪的理解。黑色和红色的组合对比鲜明，使脸谱更具视觉冲击力，同时增加了表现力。
敏绮小朋友的作品整体构图清晰，情绪表达准确，形象生动可爱。通过简单的设计，她成功地传达了一种愉快和幸福的氛围，展示了自己的创造力和对情感的敏感认知。这不仅是一次成功的手工体验，也是一种美好的情绪表达方式。

运用不同的绘画工具（如：马克笔、蜡笔、颜料、粉笔、面团）进行艺术创作。

title: 模拟参观美术馆
description:
教师在学校内装饰美术馆区域，带领幼儿模拟参观美术馆。鼓励幼儿观察与表达自己对画作的喜好。
  诗雅站在一幅抽象画前，用手指指向画说：“我喜欢这幅画。”老师问：“你觉得这些颜色放在一起好看吗？”诗雅点点头回答：“很好看。”老师又问了几个问题，诗雅仔细地观察画说到：“嗯，这里有很多线条；我喜欢这个颜色；我不可以画一摸一样的。”老师向她讲解：“这是抽象画，画家用自己的想象力画出来的，画的不是具体的东西，而是表达一种感觉。”诗雅听后点了点头，说：“嗯 是的。”诗雅最后在自己的记录纸上画了一条弯弯的线条。
interpretation: 通过此次活动，诗雅展现了良好的观察力、表达能力和对艺术的热情。她能够细致地观察画作的细节，并准确描述画作的内容和色彩。她能够使用连贯的语言，态度自然得表达了对画作的喜好，能够清楚地说明原因，展现了较强的逻辑思维和语言组织能力。

title: 模拟参观美术馆
description:
教师在学校内装饰美术馆区域，带领幼儿模拟参观美术馆。鼓励幼儿观察与表达自己对画作的喜好。
  凯琳站在一幅抽象画前，用手指着画中蓝色和橙色的部分，对老师说：“吴老师，这个画它有很多的线，很乱。”老师问：“你觉得这幅画像什么？”凯琳认真看了看说：“我看不出，这里好像眼睛，这里好像房子。”凯琳好奇地问老师：“这个画家为什么不画出清楚的东西呢？”老师回答说：“有些画家喜欢用颜色和形状来表达感觉，而不是具体的东西，这叫抽象艺术。”凯琳点点头说：“哦，我知道了，这样可以让人想象更多东西！”凯琳兴奋地说：“我很喜欢这个画，它让我觉得很开心，好像在看风吹过天空。”
interpretation: 通过此次活动，凯琳展现了良好的观察力、表达能力和对艺术的热情。她能够细致地观察画作的细节，并准确描述画作的内容和色彩。她能够使用连贯的语言，态度自然得表达了对画作的喜好，能够清楚地说明原因，展现了较强的逻辑思维和语言组织能力。

title: 幼儿作品分析——表情脸谱
description:
姝雅小朋友使用纸盘制作了一张“难过”的表情脸谱，整体设计突出了悲伤、愤怒或委屈的情绪，表情十分生动。通过五官的夸张处理，使观者能够一眼识别出脸谱所表达的情感。
她选择黑色三角形纸剪出向下倾斜的粗眉，增强了表情的愤怒感和压迫感。眉毛的角度较大，进一步突出了一种强烈的不满或委屈的情绪。眼睛呈现半闭状态，黑色的弧形眼线表现出愤怒或不开心时的眯眼神态。选用红色纸剪出向下弯曲的嘴巴，并加上几条竖线，表现出紧绷或咬牙切齿的状态。这样的嘴型不仅表达了难过，还带有一丝愤怒或委屈的感觉。纸盘的圆形提供了稳定的结构，使五官布局清晰易懂。颜色对比鲜明，黑色和红色的搭配突出情绪张力，强化了悲伤的表达。她通过眉毛的斜度、眼睛的眯起以及嘴巴的下弯，姝雅小朋友成功塑造了一个愤怒又悲伤的表情，表现力极强。使用简单的几何形状（如三角形眉毛、弧形眼睛和嘴巴）来构建表情，充分体现了孩子的创造力。姝雅小朋友通过手工制作，更加直观地认识和表达“难过”这一情绪。
姝雅小朋友的作品构图明确，表情设计富有戏剧性，成功展现了“难过”这一情绪。她通过简洁而夸张的线条和色彩搭配，使作品充满表现力和创意。这不仅是一次艺术体验，更是一次对情绪认知的深刻探索。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解1个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：尝试用华语与人交谈。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：喜欢涂涂画画，能画出较直、横的线，基本能控制笔的方向。
感知和描述艺术的基本元素：线条、颜色、形状、质地。
通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。

title: 模拟参观美术馆
description:
教师在学校内装饰美术馆区域，带领幼儿模拟参观美术馆。鼓励幼儿观察与表达自己对画作的喜好。
  灵熙站在《向日葵》画作前说：“我喜欢这副画。”她用手指向其中一朵大的向日葵，对老师和同伴说：“我非常喜欢这朵，它的花看起来像太阳。”老师问：“你为什么喜欢这幅画呢？”灵熙认真地回答：“因为我喜欢花朵，我的妈妈也很喜欢花朵。”灵熙继续补充道：“这里还有一个花瓶呢，和我家里的花瓶不一样，我家里的更大。这里面的向日葵有些大，有些小，画的很漂亮。”接着灵熙拿起笔在最喜欢的画作下面做了标记。
interpretation: 通过此次活动，灵熙展现了良好的观察力、表达能力和对艺术的热情。她能够细致地观察画作的细节，并准确描述画作的内容和色彩。她能够使用连贯的语言，态度自然得表达了对画作的喜好，能够清楚地说明原因，展现了较强的逻辑思维和语言组织能力。

title: 幼儿作品分析——表情脸谱
description:
思彤小朋友的这幅难过表情脸谱作品采用了简单的材料和剪贴手法，成功表达出悲伤的情绪。
她的作品以一次性纸盘为基础，适合儿童手工制作，轻便易操作。她选用黑色和红色卡纸剪贴出表情元素，眉毛向上倾斜并弯曲，呈现出忧愁的状态，符合人类悲伤时的眉部变化。眼睛由黑色弯曲的纸条组成，微微下垂，传递出伤心的感觉。嘴巴大大的张开、向下弯曲的红色形状，象征哭泣或哀伤的表达，使整体情绪更加强烈。颜色选择简单但有效，黑色和红色的组合能突出情绪表达。 通过手工制作脸谱，思彤可以学习如何用不同的形状和颜色表达情感。
整体而言，思彤小朋友的作品表达准确，具有创意，也展现了一定的动手能力和对情绪的理解，值得鼓励！

title: 模拟参观美术馆
description:
教师在学校内装饰美术馆区域，带领幼儿模拟参观美术馆。鼓励幼儿观察与表达自己对画作的喜好。
  姝慧站在静物画《水果与玻璃瓶》前，认真观察画中的每一个细节，她用手指着画对老师说：“我喜欢这幅画。”老师问：“那请说说你为什么喜欢这副都是水果的画呢？”姝慧回答：“这里有很多的水果，这是新年吃的orange，我家里有很多。”姝慧接着描述道：“嗯 chinese year的时候，我拿了很多红包！”说完她嘻嘻地笑了起来。老师问：“姝慧很喜欢画画，你也画一幅都是水果的画可以吗？”她回答：“可以，我会画。”
interpretation: 通过此次活动，姝慧展现了良好的观察力、表达能力和对艺术的热情。她能够细致地观察画作的细节，并准确描述画作的内容和色彩。她能够使用连贯的语言，态度自然得表达了对画作的喜好，能够清楚地说明原因，展现了较强的逻辑思维和语言组织能力。

title: 模拟参观美术馆
description:
教师在学校内装饰美术馆区域，带领幼儿模拟参观美术馆。鼓励幼儿观察与表达自己对画作的喜好。
  育涵站在一幅画前，用手指着画中的水果部分说：“我喜欢这幅画。有很多的橙子，我的家里也有很多的橙子，有的甜，很好吃，有的酸，不好吃。”老师问：“你觉得这幅画里的东西有什么特别的？”她回答：“嗯，这些水果颜色很多，我想要吃它们，它们好像是真的水果，吴老师我可以说它们是一模一样吗？”老师说：“对啊，你可以用一模一样这个成语，因为画出来的和真的好像一模一样的。”她点点头说：“嗯，我喜欢吃水果，我的妈妈说吃苹果不会生病，哈哈哈。”
interpretation: 通过此次活动，育涵展现了良好的观察力、表达能力和对艺术的热情。她能够细致地观察画作的细节，并准确描述画作的内容和色彩。她能够使用连贯的语言，态度自然得表达了对画作的喜好，能够清楚地说明原因，展现了较强的逻辑思维和语言组织能力。

title: 我的博物馆
description: 在学习绘本故事《奥莉薇》 的过程中， 孩子们对有奥莉薇去的博物馆很感兴趣。 俊懿对于博物馆很好奇， 我们一起收集了一些关于博物馆的信息。 当我问他：“ 如果你有一个博物馆， 会是什么博物馆呢？” 他认真的想了想， 告诉我说：" 我喜欢大大的恐龙骨头。” 于是我接着问， “那这个博物馆里都有什么呢？你能画出来给我看吗？” 俊懿听了很开心， 他迅速地拿出一张纸， 开始画了起来。 画完之后他主动在其他小朋友们面前做了分享与说话， 通过老师和朋友的协助， 他自信地分享到：“ 这是恐龙博物馆。 里面有恐龙， 我喜欢恐龙。这个博物馆要在2025年2月26日开， 在学校。”
interpretation: 通过俊懿制作的海报， 可以看出他能够将自己的想象通过绘画的方式表现出来， 是创作能力的体现。 同时， 他能够使用简单的华语以小段话的方式表达出来， 说明他具有良好的沟通与表达能力， 能够自信地使用华语。

learning_goals.title: 运用观察和想象力创作平面和立体的艺术作品：能够使用各种类型的纸张来创作一个艺术的作品。
描述和讨论他们对各种艺术品的所见、所闻和所感。

title: 幼儿作品分析——表情脸谱
description:
彦丰小朋友的悲伤表情脸谱作品通过简单的剪贴手法，成功表现了悲伤的情绪。
他使用黑色纸片剪裁出眉毛、眼泪和嘴巴，并粘贴在纸盘上，使表情清晰可见。眉毛向上倾斜的眉毛呈现出忧愁的状态，增强了表情的悲伤感， 眼睛下方的多个小黑色纸片象征眼泪流淌，细节丰富，使表情更具感染力。 嘴巴向下弯曲的嘴巴，传递出明显的伤心情绪，符合人类自然的悲伤表情。
他的作品整体设计简洁但有效，利用黑白对比，使表情清晰易懂。眼泪的细节增强了悲伤情绪的表达，使人物形象更加生动。
通过手工制作，彦丰可以学习如何用形状和颜色表达情绪。帮助他识别和理解悲伤的情绪。
彦丰小朋友的作品精准地传达了悲伤情绪，设计简单却富有表现力，特别是眼泪的细节处理，让表情更具情感冲击力。这是一个成功的情绪表达作品，值得鼓励和赞赏！

语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：尝试用华语与人交谈。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：喜欢涂涂画画，能画出较直、横的线，基本能控制笔的方向。
感知和描述艺术的基本元素：线条、颜色、形状、质地。
通过艺术品表现环境中的事物。

title: 幼儿作品分析——表情脸谱
description:
翊枫小朋友的惊讶表情脸谱作品通过简洁的设计和精心的细节处理，成功地展现了“惊讶”这一情绪。
翊枫的作品使用一次性纸盘作为底座，方便制作，增强立体感。他采用黑色剪纸拼贴出眉毛、眼睛和嘴巴，并增加一个蓝色的圆形鼻子，使整体更具个性。纸盘边缘做了均匀剪切，可能是为了增强视觉效果，使脸谱更具立体感或表现某种动态感。眉毛呈上扬倾斜状，表现出惊讶时眉毛上挑的特征，增加了表情的戏剧性。眼睛圆形大眼睛中加入白色高光，使眼神更加生动，突出了惊讶的情绪。嘴巴呈现“O”型张开，符合人们在惊讶时自然的嘴部反应，增强了情感表达。鼻子采用蓝色毛球作为鼻子，与其他黑白元素形成对比，使脸谱更有趣，增加了童趣感。
他的作品设计简洁，能够清晰地传达惊讶的情绪。颜色搭配合理，黑白主色调加上蓝色鼻子，使整体形象更具辨识度和趣味性。此作品能够帮助他通过简单的形状和颜色学习如何表达和识别不同的情绪。鼓励翊枫发挥创造力，在有限的材料中进行个性化设计。
翊枫小朋友的惊讶脸谱作品精准地展现了惊讶的神态，特别是大眼睛、高挑的眉毛和张开的嘴巴，强化了情绪的表现力。同时，蓝色鼻子的点缀为作品增添了趣味性和个性化特点，整体创意十足，值得肯定和鼓励！

title: Work Sample 2: Journaling
description: The children were invited to express their thoughts about what they enjoy about being three years old by drawing in their journals.
interpretation:
Elliot used orange coloured pencils to draw long and short rectangles. He drew lines and connected them to form the shapes. When asked about the shapes, he said, "A bolster is a rectangle and it's long." For the long rectangles, he made the lines tall and filled the paper, while the short ones were smaller.


Through gestures and long phrases like "This is long" and “I am drawing a Bolster that I hug when I go to sleep”, Elliott showed how he communicates to interact with others. When asked about his drawing, he said, "I like that I can use and know which is long and short bolster." without prompts. This shows his strong confidence to express himself in a few complete sentences and ability to recognise his own likes.

learning_goals.title: Represent ideas and stories through pictures, dictation and play.

title: Work Sample 2: Journaling
description: The children were invited to express their thoughts about what they enjoy about being three years old by drawing in their journals.
interpretation:
Kai En used blue and red crayons to draw lines moving up and down. For his jungle drawing, he crossed the lines to make it look "messy and crowded." He made the lines tall and filled every part of the paper, saying, “The jungle is taller than me!”

When asked about his picture, Kai En said, "I like that I can go into the jungle."


He also shared that now that he’s bigger, he feels braver to try new things, like going to the jungle. He was able to speak his ideas in short phrases progressing to sentences such as, “I like blue and red. Like fire.” This shows his ability to identify his own likes and preference of communication with others to express himself.

learning_goals.title: Represent ideas and stories through pictures, dictation and play.

title: Work Sample 2: Journaling
description: The children were invited to express their thoughts about what they enjoy about being three years old by drawing in their journals.
interpretation:
Olivia used different coloured pencils and pencils to draw shapes like circles and filled them with colour to express her ideas. She pointed to the largest circle, explaining, “That’s me and I am reading a black storybook.”

Through gestures and short phrases like "book" or by pointing to herself, Olivia demonstrated how she communicates to interact with others. When asked about her drawing, she said, "I like that I can read more books now!" This shows her ability to identify her own likes, as she enjoys being in class to read books, and express her personal feelings in the process.

learning_goals.title: Represent ideas and stories through pictures, dictation and play.

title: Work Sample 2: Journaling
description: The children were invited to express their thoughts about what they enjoy about being three years old by drawing in their journals.
interpretation:
Matthias used pencils, coloured pencils, and markers in red, yellow, purple, blue, black, and brown to draw animals and plants in the jungle. He drew shapes like squares, rectangles, and circles and filled them with color. For his jungle drawing, he crossed lines to make it "messy and crowded."


Through gestures and short phrases like "Jungle" and “Lines”, Matthias showed how he communicates to interact with others. When asked about his drawing, he said, "I like that I can go into the jungle." He was also able to reason why he chose jungle, saying “I’m bigger now.” The above demonstrates his ability to identify his likes, as he enjoys going to the jungle and expressing his feelings.

children.fullname: Heng Tian Rui Matthias (Xing Tian Rui)

learning_goals.title: Represent ideas and stories through pictures, dictation and play.

title: Work Sample 2: Journaling
description: The children were invited to express their thoughts about what they enjoy about being three years old by drawing in their journals.
interpretation:
Ethan used blue coloured pencils and regular pencils to draw shapes and lines. For his drawing, he added a big circle for his body and face, smaller circles for eyes, and long lines for the hands and legs. He made the lines scribbly and messy to represent his "curly and short" hair.


Through gestures and short phrases like "Eyes" or by pointing to himself, Ethan showed how he communicates to interact with others by using the name of body parts he learnt from previous lessons. When asked about his picture, Ethan said, "I like that I am growing taller and bigger." He also reasoned further that now that he's bigger, he feels braver to try new things. This shows his growing ability to identify his own likes and to express his feelings in more complete sentences.

learning_goals.title: Represent ideas and stories through pictures, dictation and play.

title: Work Sample 2: Journaling
description: The children were invited to express their thoughts about what they enjoy about being three years old by drawing in their journals.
interpretation:
Zacchaeus pencils, coloured pencils, and crayons in a variety of colours, including red, yellow, green, and blue. He can draw shapes such as squares, rectangles, and circles, filling them with color to express his ideas. For example, when drawing noodles, he used scribbled lines, layering them to represent the noodles. When asked about his drawing, Zacchaeus responded, "I like that I can eat noodles."

Through gestures and a few sentences like, "Noodles” and “Beef”, this showed how Zacchaeus communicated with others. When asked about his drawing, he said, “This is beef noodles. The beef is red in colour." The above demonstrates his ability to identify his likes, as he enjoys eating noodles and expressing his feelings.

learning_goals.title: Represent ideas and stories through pictures, dictation and play.

title: Work Sample 2: Journaling
description: The children were invited to express their thoughts about what they enjoy about being three years old by drawing in their journals.
interpretation:
Naomi Anne uses pencils, colour pencils and markers in colours of black, blue and purple. She is able to draw some shapes like circles and hearts within filled colouring to present her ideas better. When asked to explain her drawing, she first pointed to the small blue circle and pointed back to herself. She also drew bigger circles and pointed to the teachers.


When asked about the choice for different sizes, she replied, “ Because I am smaller”. Through her gestures and short phrases such as, “Teacher Chari.” or pointing towards the teacher and herself, this showed how Naomi Anne communicated with others.

Her answer to the question is, “I like that I can be in the same class as Teacher Chari and Teacher Crystal.” This demonstrates her growing ability to identify her likes and express her feelings.

learning_goals.title: Represent ideas and stories through pictures, dictation and play.

title: Work Sample 2: Journaling
description: The children were invited to express their thoughts about what they enjoy about being three years old by drawing in their journals.
interpretation:
Jaea used a purple-coloured pencil to draw shapes like circles to express her ideas. She pointed to the largest circle when asked, and drew bigger circles for the teachers, explaining that, “I draw myself and my friend small (smaller). I am little." She added smaller circles and lines for eyes and mouths to show more detail.


Through gestures and short phrases like "Teacher Crystal" or by pointing to the teacher and herself, Jaea demonstrated how she communicates to interact with others. When asked about her drawing, she said, "I like that I can be in the same class as Teacher Crystal and Eldrin." This shows her ability to identify her own likes, as she enjoys being in class with her teachers and friends, and expresses her personal feelings in the process.

learning_goals.title: Represent ideas and stories through pictures, dictation and play.

title: Work Sample 2: Journaling
description: The children were invited to express their thoughts about what they enjoy about being three years old by drawing in their journals.
interpretation:
Raylan used a green coloured pencil to draw shapes and lines that represent a helicopter. For his drawing, he used a long rectangle for the tail and a large square-like shape for the head. When asked about his choice of colour, he commented, “I like green, so helicopters are green too.”


This shows his growing confidence in expressing his interests and knowledge, as well as his ability to identify his own preferences.

Raylan also shared that “I’m a big boy now and I can tell mummy more about helicopters and the things I (have) learned.” Through his increasing usage of sentences, he demonstrated his strong ability to reason and how he communicates with others.

learning_goals.title: Represent ideas and stories through pictures, dictation and play.

title: Work sample 2: Self-portrait
description: The children were invited to create a self-portrait by drawing their face and using playdough.
interpretation:
Shuo-yun used a brown marker to draw his face and blue playdough to shape his hair. As he worked, he pointed to different parts of his drawing and said simple words like "face," "eyes," and "nose." After finishing his self-portrait, Shuo-yun smiled happily and repeatedly said, "Like like," showing his excitement and pride in completing his artwork.

Shuo-yun displayed joy and self-awareness in creating his self-portrait. Even with simple one-word phrases, he clearly expressed his satisfaction with his work.

learning_goals.title: Experiment with a variety of media (e.g. marker, crayon, paint, chalk, play dough)

title: Work Sample #2: Math Sensory Art (Texture Collage)
description:
To foster children’s aesthetic and creative expression, a variety of materials such as felt, glitter papers, colour papers, reflective papers, and corrugated boards were provided for tactile experience and exploration. Besides varying in textures, these materials also varied in colours and shapes, which enabled children to choose their favourite materials to create a texture collage. This learning experience encouraged children to express autonomy, and sort the objects by observable features such as colour, shape, and texture.

Avery shared, "I make a house. I got smooth heart shapes."

learning_goals.title: Sort objects by simple features (e.g: texture or material)

Use strength and control to accomplish tasks (e.g: use a paper punch without help, make complex forms and designs stretching rubber bands across geoboards, tear a piece of masking tape off the roll without letting the tape get stuck to itself, etc.).

title: 幼儿作品分析——表情脸谱
description:
Diyansh小朋友的惊讶表情脸谱作品通过简洁的设计和精心的细节处理，成功地展现了“惊讶”这一情绪。
他的作品展示了一张惊讶的脸，主要通过圆形大嘴巴和圆睁的双眼来表现。眼睛由白色和黑色圆形剪纸组成，使其看起来十分生动。小红色的毛球作为鼻子，为作品增添了立体感和趣味性。作品主要材料是纸盘，边缘有均匀的剪裁，可能用于装饰或增强立体感。使用了彩色卡纸（黑色、白色、红色）进行五官的拼贴。鼻子采用了柔软的小毛球，增加了触感的丰富性。颜色搭配合理，红色嘴巴和鼻子形成亮点，黑白对比的眼睛增强了表情的突出性。
总的来说，这是一幅富有创意的手工作品，充分体现了他对表情的理解和表达。Diyansh 很好地运用了简单的材料和对比色彩，使作品生动有趣！

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解1个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：尝试用华语与人交谈。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：喜欢涂涂画画，能画出较直、横的线，基本能控制笔的方向。
感知和描述艺术的基本元素：线条、颜色、形状、质地。

title: 幼儿作品分析——表情脸谱
description:
Kaitlyn小朋友制作的生气表情脸谱作品非常有创意，充分展现了情绪的表达能力和动手能力。
她的作品表达了愤怒的情绪，主要通过眼睛、眉毛和嘴巴的形状表现出来。眉毛两条倾斜向下的黑色粗眉，形成强烈的愤怒感。眼睛呈尖角状，类似于“怒目”，增强了愤怒的神态。嘴巴向下弯曲的嘴角，传达出明显的不满或生气的情绪。五官使用 黑色卡纸 剪贴，形成鲜明的对比，突出面部表情。眉毛的倾斜角度、眼睛的形状和嘴巴的弧度 都精准地传达了生气的感觉。她的作品呈现出清晰、直接的情绪表达，符合儿童直观的观察方式。
Kaitlyn 的作品通过简单的黑白剪纸，精准地表达了生气的表情，充分展现了孩子对情绪的理解和创造力。这是一幅成功的幼儿艺术作品，值得鼓励！

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解1个口头指示并完成任务。
感知和描述艺术的基本元素：线条、颜色、形状、质地。

title: Hula Hoop Bean Bag Toss
description: During outdoor play, Cavill noticed the teacher setting up hula hoops, cones, and bean bags on the ground. He ran towards the bean bags, and picked them up one by one. Holding a bean bag in his hand, he positioned himself a short distance from the hula hoop and threw it inside. He watched as it landed, then quickly moved around the space to collect more bean bags. Each time he threw, he adjusted his position and distance from the hoop. When his bean bag landed inside, he smiled and immediately looked around for more bean bags to continue the activity. He turned to the teacher and said, “I want more bean bags.”
interpretation: This observation shows Cavill’s ability to coordinate his hand movements and control his throwing force to aim at a target. He demonstrated spatial awareness by adjusting his distance from the hula hoop and moving around the play area to locate more bean bags.

learning_goals.title: Develop spatial awareness (move around an object without knocking onto it, navigate between spaces) 发展空间知觉，如：能将大球丢远。

title: Hula Hoop Bean Bag Toss
description: During outdoor play, Talia observed the teacher placing hula hoops, cones, and bean bags on the ground. She walked toward a bean bag, crouched down, and picked it up. Holding it with both hands, she looked at the hula hoop, took a step forward, and tossed the bean bag inside. She then scanned the area, moved around the space, and picked up another bean bag. Each time she threw, she adjusted her arm movements and position from the hoop. When she saw her bean bag land inside the hoop, she ran to Teacher Michelle and said, “Teacher Michelle, see. I throw inside.”
interpretation: This observation shows Talia’s ability to control her hand-eye coordination while aiming at a target. She demonstrated spatial awareness by moving around the play area to collect more bean bags and adjusting her body position to toss them into the hoop successfully.

learning_goals.title: Develop eye-hand coordination  (roll a ball, pick up soft blocks and stack, self-feed, put simple things together and take them apart) 发展手眼协调能力，如：滚球，叠放软积木，喂食，把简单玩具连在一起再拆开等）。
Develop spatial awareness (move around an object without knocking onto it, navigate between spaces) 发展空间知觉，如：能将大球丢远。

title: Rainbow Sort and Choice
description: After learning about the colours of the rainbow, the children were invited to choose two colours they liked and sort objects in those colours into the corresponding rainbow sections. Alternatively, they could work with a partner to create their rainbow bridge using materials from the class, such as markers and Legos.
interpretation:
Raphael quickly chose his two favourite colours, red and yellow. He picked a red connector and a yellow lego black cup and proudly showed the teacher, saying, “Red and yellow!” Without any prompting, he sorted the objects into the correct rainbow sections. He was able to place at least one object in each of the seven colours of the rainbow with no assistance. As he worked, Raphael repeated the colour names out loud and carefully checked to ensure the objects matched the right colour. When unsure, he would place an object in a colour section and compare it to see if it matched.


This shows Raphael’s strong colour recognition skills and ability to work independently. He approached the task confidently and methodically, demonstrating a solid understanding of the activity.

learning_goals.title: Sort objects by one attribute (i.e: colour, shape, or size)

title: My Body
description: The children were invited to participate in a body tracing activity. They lay down on a large piece of mahjong paper while the teacher traced their outlines. Afterwards, they were encouraged to color their tracings using crayons and hand stamps. Each child then pasted their picture onto the traced outline.

title: Rainbow Sort and Choice
description: After learning about the colours of the rainbow, the children were invited to choose two colours they liked and sort objects in those colours into the corresponding rainbow sections. Alternatively, they could work with a partner to create their rainbow bridge using materials from the class, such as markers and Legos.
interpretation:
Olivia quickly chose her two favorite colours, red and yellow. She picked red and yellow bristle blocks and proudly showed the teacher, saying, “I got red! Oh, and a yellow block!” Without any prompting, she sorted the objects into the correct rainbow sections. She was able to place at least one object in each of the seven colours of the rainbow with no assistance. As Olivia worked, she occasionally repeated the colour names aloud, carefully checking that each object matched the correct hue. She also noticed when her friend needed assistance and, with the teacher's guidance, asked, "Liv, do you need help?"


This shows Olivia’s strong colour recognition skills and her ability to work cooperatively. She approached the task with confidence and a methodical process, demonstrating a solid understanding of the activity.

learning_goals.title: Sort objects by one attribute (i.e: colour, shape, or size)

title: Rainbow Sort and Choice
description: After learning about the colours of the rainbow, the children were invited to choose two colours they liked and sort objects in those colours into the corresponding rainbow sections. Alternatively, they could work with a partner to create their rainbow bridge using materials from the class, such as markers and Legos.
interpretation:
Raylan was able to choose his favourite colour, blue. He picked a blue marker and a blue cup and proudly showed the teacher, saying, “I found two blue things!” Without any prompting, he sorted the objects into the correct rainbow sections. He was able to place at least one object in each of the seven colours of the rainbow with no assistance. As he worked, Raylan repeated the colour names out loud and carefully checked to ensure the objects matched the right colour. With minimal prompting from the teacher, he was able to place objects in the correct colour section for comparison and assist his peers when needed. For instance, he quickly noticed that Zacchaeus could help sort the objects, while he passed them from the box to Zacchaeus.


This shows Raylan's strong colour recognition skills and ability to work independently as well as cooperatively. He approached the task confidently and methodically, demonstrating a solid understanding of the activity.

title: Work Sample 2: Journaling
description: The children were invited to express their thoughts about what they enjoy about being three years old by drawing in their journals.
interpretation:
Yi Xuan used a regular pencil and yellow colored pencils to draw shapes like circles to express her ideas. When asked about her drawing, she pointed to a circle at the bottom right and explained, “That’s me, and the black shapes around me are the lego blocks.” She drew more shapes that resembled rectangles, similar in size to lego blocks, all around the page because, as she said, “In class, we have a lot of legos to share.”


Through gestures and short phrases like "Blue lego" or by pointing to herself, Yi Xuan showed how she communicates to interact with others. When asked about her drawing, she said, "I like that I can play with bigger lego blocks." This demonstrates her ability to identify her own likes, as she enjoys playing with legos, and expresses her personal feelings.

learning_goals.title: Represent ideas and stories through pictures, dictation and play.

title: Work Sample 2: Journaling
description: The children were invited to express their thoughts about what they enjoy about being three years old by drawing in their journals.
interpretation:
Shuyin used coloured pencils, including purple, green, and pink, to draw shapes like circles to express her ideas. When asked, she pointed to the largest circle, explaining that she drew different foods she has eaten, like rambutan and fruits, saying, "I am bigger now so I can eat more." She added a simple drawing of an apple, saying, “I want to continue eating healthy.”


Through gestures and short phrases like "Bread" or by pointing to herself, Shuyin showed how she communicates to interact with others. When asked about her drawing, she said, "I like that I can eat different foods." The above demonstrates her ability to identify her likes, as she enjoys trying new foods and expressing her feelings.

learning_goals.title: Represent ideas and stories through pictures, dictation and play.

title: Work Sample 1: Letter Tt
description: After learning the letter "T" through Letterland, the children practiced writing both uppercase and lowercase "Tt" with a pencil, following air tracing exercises to build confidence and muscle memory.
interpretation:
Elliott initially asked for help with writing the letter "T" as he was unsure how to form it. After I demonstrated by air-tracing the letter "T" on the book, he carefully followed my movements, using his finger to trace the lines. He was then able to write both the uppercase and lowercase "T" with a pencil using a palmar grasp. 


As he attempted to draw straight lines, they were slightly curved, resulting in letter-like shapes that resembled "T"s and a copied symbol of a curved "t." This suggests that Elliott is still refining his fine motor skills and hand control. With more practice, he will likely improve his ability to draw straighter lines and form more accurate letters. After completing the task, he proudly showed me his work, saying, "Look! Teacher Crystal! Letter T big and small!"

learning_goals.title: Use letter-like shapes, symbols and letters to convey meaning.

title: Work Sample 1: Happy Valentine’s
description: The Valentine artwork is a simple yet meaningful gesture from the children to show love and appreciation to the seniors. After reading a story about love, the children were inspired to create something special for the elderly.
interpretation: Jaea created a Valentine’s Day artwork using pink paper, her favourite color, which she colored red with crayon to form a heart. She added two pom-poms for eyes and one for the nose. To represent the mouth, she used twine for a smile, inspired by her friends. After struggling with gluing the thin string, her teacher guided her to press it down using her palms. The final piece featured a heart with a pom-pom face and twine smile. She explained that it represented a self portrait of a grandma. This reflects Jaea’s developing understanding of expressing appreciation and linking it to her personal experiences.

learning_goals.title: Represent things in the environment through artwork.

title: Work Sample 1: Happy Valentine’s

He wrote the word “Love” to express his feelings for the elderly grandparents. Zacchaeus added different shades of pink, like red and light pink, to create smaller hearts inside the big heart. On the back, he wrote his name, saying, “I hope the grandpa and grandma will remember my name.” His choices reflected his intention to make the artwork colorful and clearly communicate his thoughts in a simple way.
