title: Work Sample 1: Happy Valentine’s!
description: The Valentine artwork is a simple yet meaningful gesture from the children to show love and appreciation to the seniors. After reading a story about love, the children were inspired to create something special for the elderly.
interpretation: Matthias created a heart with a face using coloring pencils to outline the features. He initially used glitter glue to add shine but switched to regular glue when it didn’t stick well. While working with twine, Matthias learned that a small amount of glue helped it stand out. Using his left hand and pincer grip, he carefully attached pom-poms for eyes, brown twine for a beard, and circle paper rolls as spectacles. These choices reflected his intention to make the artwork colorful, and he explained that he wanted it to “look like a grandpa.” This demonstrates Matthias' growing understanding of expressing appreciation and connecting it to his personal experiences.

She used various coloring materials, such as crayons and pencils, to make the heart colorful like a rainbow, reflecting her love for rainbows. She added a pom-pom for the nose and crumpled tissues, using her palmer grasp, to represent the white hair of the grandma. After initially struggling with gluing the tissue, her teacher guided her to press it down using her palms. The final piece featured a heart with colorful houses representing "my house," "grandma’s house," and "mummy’s house," with the idea that they could all go to the green field to play together. This reflects Yi Xuan’s developing understanding of expressing appreciation and linking the activity to her personal experiences.

title: Loud and Soft
description: The children were introduced to loud and soft sounds using two musical instruments. They were invited to explore which instrument played loud or soft music.
interpretation:
Jaea was introduced to two instruments, bells and a guitar, to explore loud and soft sounds. Unsure which instrument made which sound, she identified the bells as "very loud" and the guitar as "soft" after hearing them played a few times and prompts. This showed her growing ability to distinguish between different sound volumes. 


After the teacher named the instruments, Jaea tries incorporating them into her language, saying things like, "I want to play the bells".Through different hand gestures while playing the guitar, Jaea begins to understand how the speed and size of her movements influence the sound's volume—faster, larger movements create louder sounds, while slower, smaller movements produce softer ones. For example, when she uses the palm of her hand to strum across all the strings, the sound is much louder and fuller. In contrast, when she uses just her fingers for a more delicate strum, the sound is softer and more controlled. This deepened her understanding of how physical actions can control sound.

learning_goals.title: Begin to identify and reproduce two extreme form of dynamic (e.g. very loud and very soft)

title: Loud and Soft
description: The children were introduced to loud and soft sounds using two musical instruments. They were invited to explore which instrument played loud or soft music.
interpretation: Zacchaeus was introduced to two instruments, a bell and a guitar, to explore loud and soft sounds. Initially, he was unsure which instrument made which sound, he identified the bells as "very loud" and the guitar as "soft" after hearing them played a few times. This showed his ability to distinguish between different sound volumes. After the teacher named the instruments, Zacchaeus incorporated them into his language, saying things like, "I want to play the bells" and "Jaea, you can play with the guitar. I can play the strings fast to make it louder." He also learned that the speed of movement affects the volume of sound—fast movements make the sound louder, while slower movements produce softer sounds. The experience deepened his understanding of how physical actions can control sound.

learning_goals.title: Begin to identify and reproduce two extreme form of dynamic (e.g. very loud and very soft)

title: I am Special
description: The children were introduced to the song "I Am Special" by Kidboomers and encouraged to explore various actions that corresponded with the lyrics, such as "I," "You," and "We."
interpretation:
Naomi Anne demonstrated a growing engagement with music and imaginative expression. Initially, she observed and mimicked her friends' actions, but over time, she began to integrate her own ideas, such as choosing to place her hand around her friend instead of hugging for the "we" action. She actively participated in the movements for "I" and "You," showing an understanding of the song's rhythm and meaning. 


Her ability to follow the beat, with slight guidance from the teacher, reflects her developing coordination. Naomi Anne was able to connect with the song's lyrics, particularly in short phrases like "I am special," indicating an emerging ability to express herself through music and imagination.

learning_goals.title: Create movement using imagination in response to music.

title: Loud and Soft
description: The children were introduced to loud and soft sounds using four musical instruments. They were invited to explore which instrument played loud or soft music.
interpretation:
Olivia was introduced to four instruments—bells, a castanet, a drum, and a guitar—to explore loud and soft sounds. Though initially unsure which instrument produced which sound, she quickly identified the drum as "very loud" and the guitar as "soft" after hearing them played. This demonstrated her ability to distinguish sound volumes. 


After the teacher named the instruments, Olivia incorporated them into her language, saying things like, "I want to play the guitar" and "Kai En is playing the drum. He should use the drumsticks to make it louder." She also discovered that the speed of movement affects volume—fast movements create louder sounds, while slower ones produce softer sounds. This deepened her understanding of how physical actions can control sound.

learning_goals.title: Begin to identify and reproduce two extreme form of dynamic (e.g. very loud and very soft)

title: Loud and Soft
description: The children were introduced to loud and soft sounds using four musical instruments. They were invited to explore which instrument played loud or soft music.
interpretation:
Shuyin was introduced to four instruments—bells, a castanet, a drum, and a guitar—to explore loud and soft sounds. Though initially unsure which instrument produced which sound, she quickly identified the drums as "very loud" and the guitar or bells as "soft" after hearing them played. This demonstrated her ability to distinguish sound volumes. 


After the teacher named the instruments, Shuyin incorporated them into her language, saying things like, "I want to play the bells and the castanet" and "Naomi Anne is playing the drum. She is using drumsticks. it's very loud." She also discovered that the speed of movement affects volume—fast shaking bells and hitting the castanets on the table create louder sounds, while slower ones produce softer sounds. This deepened her understanding of how physical actions can control sound.

description: The children were introduced to loud and soft sounds using four musical instruments. They were invited to explore which instrument played loud or soft music.
interpretation:
Kai En was introduced to four instruments—bells, a castanet, a drum, and a guitar—to explore loud and soft sounds. Though initially unsure which instrument produced which sound, he quickly identified the drum as "very loud" and the guitar as "soft" after hearing them played. This demonstrated his ability to distinguish sound volumes. 


After the teacher named the instruments, Kai En incorporated them into his language, saying things like, "I want to play the drum" and "Oli is playing the guitar." He also discovered that the speed of movement affects volume—fast and big movements of hitting the drum create louder sounds, while slower ones produce softer sounds. This deepened his understanding of how physical actions can control sound.

learning_goals.title: Begin to identify and reproduce two extreme form of dynamic (e.g. very loud and very soft)

title: Kicking a ball
description: During Ready Steady Go Kids, the children were invited to place a ball on the cone and kick it forward into the goal post. When it was Harold’s turn, he stood on the red circle mat, gripping the teacher’s hand with a sense of security. He looked at her, his eyes filled with curiosity and a hint of hesitation. With the teacher’s encouragement, Harold took a small step forward, gaining confidence while approaching the cone. He let go of the teacher's hand and carefully kicked the ball forward with his right leg. The ball wobbled and rolled towards the goal post, landing inside. A look of joy spread across Harold's face and he bounced with excitement. The teacher lifted her hand and Harold gave her a high-five.
interpretation: Through this activity, Harold demonstrated emerging gross motor skills as he was able to kick a ball forward with minimal guidance. This activity highlighted his growing ability to coordinate his large muscles as he learns to balance, aim, and propel the ball forward. Moreover, his increasing confidence when attempting to kick the ball suggested a developing sense of body awareness and control, which are important components of gross motor development. Overall, Harold’s ability to kick the ball reflects his progress in motor development, coordination, and self-confidence, laying the foundation for continued growth in physical skills and cognitive development. Moreover, Harold also portrayed great engagement as he was able to stay focused and participate actively in the activity throughout.

learning_goals.title: Foster gross motor development (walk, run, jump, bend, kick, throw, etc.) 发展粗大动作，如：走、跑、双脚跳、弯腰、踢、丢球等。

title: Kicking a ball
description: During Ready Steady Go Kids, the children were invited to place a ball on the cone and kick it forward into the goal post. When it was Jumaius' turn, he stood on the red circle mat and approached the ball with focus. With the teacher’s instructions, Jumaius took a small step forward, positioned himself, and used his right foot to kick the ball with intention. The ball rolled towards the goal post, landing inside. A look of joy spread across Jumaius' face and he bounced with excitement. The teacher lifted her hand and gave Jumaius a high-five.
interpretation: Through this activity, Jumaius demonstrated his ability to kick the ball independently, thus showcasing his development in both gross motor skills and self-confidence. His coordination between using his hands for positioning and his foot for kicking highlighted his increasing ability to control his movements with intention. This action also displayed his growing physical strength and balance, as well as his understanding of the task at hand. Jumaius' focus and determination in executing the skill of kicking suggested that he is becoming more engaged in physical activities and developing important gross motor skills that will benefit his future learning experiences. Moreover, Jumaius also portrayed great engagement as he was able to stay focused and participate actively in the activity throughout.

title: Kicking a ball
description: During Ready Steady Go Kids, the children were invited to place a ball on the cone and kick it forward into the goal post. When it was Jaylen's turn, he stood on the red circle mat and approached the ball with focus and determination. With the teacher’s instructions, Jaylen took a small step forward and moved his hands to positioned himself. He raised his right foot and proceeded to kick the ball in the direction of the goal post independently. The ball shot forward with impressive speed, quickly rolling inside. A look of joy spread across Jaylen's face and he bounced with excitement. The teacher lifted her hand and gave Jaylen a high-five.
interpretation: Through this activity, Jaylen demonstrated significant progress in both his gross motor skills and self-confidence. His coordination between using his hands for positioning and his foot for kicking highlighted his increasing ability to control his movements with intention. This action also displayed his growing physical strength and balance, as well as his understanding of the task at hand. Jaylen's focus and determination in executing the skill of kicking suggested that he is becoming more engaged in physical activities and developing important gross motor skills that will benefit his future learning experiences. Moreover, Jaylen also portrayed great engagement as he was able to stay focused and participate actively in the activity throughout.

learning_goals.title: Foster gross motor development (walk, run, jump, bend, kick, throw, etc.) 发展粗大动作，如：走、跑、双脚跳、弯腰、踢、丢球等。

title: 黏贴花束
description: 在制作花束的黏贴花朵过程中，老师给耀曦已经涂彩好的蛋盒花朵，蓬蓬球、彩纸叶子，鼓励耀曦进行黏贴花束活动。在老师的引导下，耀曦右手一把握住笔刷蘸取胶水，左手拿住蛋盒花朵，在花心涂刷胶水，然后放下笔刷，拇指食指捏起蓬蓬球，放到花心上，再用食指压一压，所有的花芯黏好后，耀曦右手握住笔刷，左手压住彩纸，在彩纸上涂刷胶水，接着用左手将花朵一个一个黏在刷过胶水的位置上，最后用右手拇指和食指捏起彩纸叶子，黏在彩纸上，就这样耀曦的花束完成了。老师问：“这是谁的花？好漂亮！”耀曦指着自己的作品回答：“耀曦的。
interpretation: 从黏贴花朵的过程中，耀曦能够右手握笔刷涂花心胶水并用拇指食指捏取蓬蓬黏到花心处；将彩纸叶子黏到彩纸上；能够左手扶住纸张，右手抓握笔刷进行涂刷胶水，左手拿取花朵黏贴到纸上，独立完成一系列的动作，最后完成作品。展现出耀曦精细动作有进一步发展；手眼协调能力也在进一步的发展中，逐渐能够完成一些较复杂的精细动作。

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development ( pick up objects using pincer grasp, hold crayon to scribble, fasten/unfasten zippers/buttons, screw.unscrew bottle caps, stack big soft blocks, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：能用大拇指与食指（两指）抓物品、拉拉链、扣纽扣、拧瓶盖等。

title: 黏贴花束
description: 在制作花束的黏贴花朵过程中，老师给凯翔已经涂彩好的蛋盒花朵，蓬蓬球、彩纸叶子，鼓励凯翔进行黏贴花束活动。在老师的引导下，凯翔右手一把握住笔刷蘸取胶水，左手拿住蛋盒花朵，在花心涂刷胶水，然后放下笔刷，拇指食指捏起蓬蓬球，放到花心上，再用食指压一压，所有的花心黏好后，凯翔右手握住笔刷，左手压住彩纸，在彩纸上涂刷胶水，接着用右手将花朵一个一个黏在刷过胶水的位置上，最后用笔刷涂了胶水，用右手拇指和食指捏起彩纸叶子，黏在彩纸上，就这样凯翔的花束完成了。老师问：“这是谁的花？美不美呀？”凯翔看看自己的作品回答：“凯翔的花，美美的。”
interpretation: 从黏贴花朵的过程中，凯翔能够右手握笔刷涂花心胶水并用拇指食指捏取蓬蓬黏到花心处；能够左手扶住纸张，右手抓握笔刷进行涂刷胶水，拿取花朵黏贴到纸上，捏取彩纸叶子并黏到彩纸上，独立完成一系列的动作，最后完成作品，展现出凯翔精细动作有进一步发展；手眼协调能力也在进一步的发展中，逐渐能够完成一些较复杂的精细动作。

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development ( pick up objects using pincer grasp, hold crayon to scribble, fasten/unfasten zippers/buttons, screw.unscrew bottle caps, stack big soft blocks, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：能用大拇指与食指（两指）抓物品、拉拉链、扣纽扣、拧瓶盖等。

title: 黏贴花束
description: 在制作花束的黏贴花朵过程中，老师给轩宇已经涂彩好的蛋盒花朵，蓬蓬球、彩纸叶子，鼓励轩宇进行黏贴花束活动。在老师的引导下，轩宇右手三指握住笔刷蘸取胶水，左手拿住蛋盒花朵，在花心涂刷胶水，然后放下笔刷，拇指食指捏起蓬蓬球，放到花心上，再用食指压一压，所有的花心黏好后，轩宇右手握住笔刷，左手压住彩纸，在彩纸上涂刷胶水后，右手拇指和食指捏起彩纸叶子，左手拇指和食指一起捏住叶子的另一端，轻轻地放到胶水涂过的地方，接着左手拿起花朵放到彩纸上，右手又去按压一下花朵，让花朵粘牢。就这样轩宇完成了自己的花束。老师问：“这是谁的花束？”轩宇回答：“轩宇的花。”
interpretation: 从黏贴花朵的过程中，轩宇能够右手三指握笔刷涂胶水并将蓬蓬球黏到花心处；能够左手扶住纸张，右手三指抓握笔刷进行涂刷胶水；能够用拇指食指捏取细小纸张，左右手配合进行黏贴；左手拿取蛋盒花朵放到彩纸上，右手按压花朵，独立完成一系列的动作，最后完成作品，展现出轩宇精细动作的感知有进一步发展；手眼协调能力也在进一步的发展中，逐渐能够完成一些较复杂的精细动作

learning_goals.title: Foster fine motor development ( pick up objects using pincer grasp, hold crayon to scribble, fasten/unfasten zippers/buttons, screw.unscrew bottle caps, stack big soft blocks, etc.) 发展精细动作，如：能用大拇指与食指（两指）抓物品、拉拉链、扣纽扣、拧瓶盖等。

title: 黏贴花束
description: 在制作花束的黏贴花朵过程中，老师给录恩已经涂彩好的蛋盒花朵，蓬蓬球、彩纸叶子，鼓励录恩进行黏贴花束活动。在老师的引导下，录恩右手一把握住笔刷蘸取胶水，左手拿住蛋盒花朵，在花心涂刷胶水，然后放下笔刷，拇指食指捏起蓬蓬球，放到花心上，再用食指压一压，所有的花心黏好后，录恩右手握住笔刷，左手压住彩纸一角，在彩纸上涂刷胶水，接着他用右手拿起花朵放到彩纸上，并用手指压一压花朵，然后右手拇指和食指捏起彩纸叶子放到彩纸上，并用手指轻轻按压，录恩的花束完成了。老师问：“这是谁的花束？”录恩回答：“白白的花。”
interpretation: 从黏贴花朵的过程中，录恩能够右手握笔刷涂花心胶水并用拇指食指捏取蓬蓬黏到花心处；能够左手扶住纸张，右手抓握笔刷进行涂刷胶水，拿取花朵黏贴到纸上，捏取彩纸叶子并黏到彩纸上，独立完成一系列的动作，最后完成作品，展现出录恩精细动作有进一步发展；手眼协调能力也在进一步的发展中，逐渐能够完成一些较复杂的精细动作。

title: 穿线活动
description: 老师提供暄蒽照片制作的穿线板和线绳 ，鼓励暄蒽进行穿线活动。暄蒽拿起穿线板开始进行活动，她左手抓住线板，右手抓住线绳，拇指和食指捏住线头，眼睛注视线板上的小孔，将线头穿进小孔里，她左手拿着线板边沿，拇指和食指去捏住线头，换成右手拿住线板，接着将线绳从小孔里拉了出来，她拿给老师看，老师说：“暄蒽真棒！能将线穿进小孔里，接着穿下一个孔吧。”暄蒽笑眯眯地看看老师，继续进行穿孔活动。
interpretation: 在穿线活动中，暄蒽左手抓住线板，右手抓住线绳，拇指和食指捏住线头，将线头穿进孔里，左手握住线板，拇指和食指去捏住线头，将线绳从小孔里拉了出来。暄蒽能够独立完成穿孔。暄蒽眼睛能够精准地观察孔洞的位置与大小，同时手部将线绳准确地穿过孔洞，展现出暄蒽手指灵活度和手眼协调能力有进一步发展中，精细动作能力进一步增强。

title: Read and Sequence
description:
During the Lit Attack activity, the children engaged in reading a passage with decodable words and worked collaboratively to interpret its meaning. Abhigyan actively participated in the group reading process. After a friend read the first sentence, he continued with the next, saying, "The… pet hen… got wet... Okay, it's your turn now." He followed along and took turns reading with his peers.

While sequencing the pictures, Abhigyan identified the number 10 picture card and said, "I think this is the last one," before placing it in the final box. As the group continued reading, he picked up another picture and handed it to a peer, saying, "This one. Here you go, Leanne!"

When the group had one last image left, Abhigyan observed, "This one is number 5. It is the last one. Because they went home and went to bed. We need to move this one." The group adjusted their sequence accordingly, moving the earlier image that had been placed in box number 5 and replacing it with the image of the bed. The children were also observed rereading the passage and checking it against the sequence of pictures below.
interpretation:
Abhigyan was actively engaged in decoding and reading during the Lit Attack activity. He demonstrated strong teamwork by participating in group discussions and supporting his peers. He showed kindness and cooperation by handing them picture cards and helping to arrange them in the correct sequence.


Abhigyan’s thoughtful observation about the last image showed his developing comprehension skills. He was observed reasoning to understand the flow of the passage. When rereading the passage, Abhigyan continued to self-correct when he notices that the picture does not seem to match the sentence. These reflects his developing understanding of how stories are structured and his confidence in making meaning from text.

learning_goals.title: Phonological Awareness: Decode unfamiliar words.
Comprehension: Use strategies to construct meaning from print.
Comprehension: Anticipate events in stories and make predictions.

title: 走轮子
description: 在游乐场，老师准备游戏活动的大轮子平放在地面，鼓励懿妍站到轮子的侧沿上,并尝试围着走一圈。懿妍双手扶住轮子边沿，左脚踩在上面，右脚用力，身体往上，右脚向上抬，站上了轮沿，然后慢慢直起身体站了起来，她双手微微打开，接着左脚开始滑步向前，右脚也跟着移动脚步，就这样懿妍一步一步地缓缓移动脚步和身体，走完了一圈，然后跨下轮子，平稳站到地面上。老师称赞：“懿妍真棒！能够自己站上轮子并走完一圈。”懿妍看看老师笑了。
interpretation: 从走轮子活动中，懿妍能够自己独立站到大轮子的侧沿上，并能够慢慢挪动脚步，移动身体，走完一圈，跨下轮子，平稳站到地面上，展现出懿妍四肢力量和身体平衡协调能力进一步增强。

title: Music play
description: The children were engaged in a music and movement activity where they were given various musical instruments to explore while listening to music. Davi chose different instruments, including a clapper, a squeaky egg, and a wooden instrument. As the music played, Davi was encouraged to explore with the instruments. He even tried using two instruments at once while enjoying the music in the background.
interpretation: This observation shows that Davi demonstrates an interest in musical instruments as he actively explores with them while the music plays.

learning_goals.title: Foster an interest and enjoyment in music and movement (through musical instruments, moving with the music, etc.) 通过使用小的打击乐器，如：沙球、摇铃，培养幼儿对音乐与律动的兴趣和喜好。

description: 在游乐场，老师准备游戏活动的大轮子平放在地面，鼓励恺励站到轮子的侧沿上,并尝试围着走一圈。恺励来到大轮子前面，看了看老师，老师说：“加油！恺励，你可以的。”在老师的鼓励下，她双手扶住轮沿右脚踩在轮沿上，身体向上左脚也站到轮沿上，接着慢慢直起身体站起来，然后看看老师，老师说：“恺励真棒！试试在轮沿上走一走。”在老师的鼓励下，恺励缓缓移动了脚步，缓缓走了一圈后走下了轮子。老师竖起大拇指称赞：“恺励真棒！”
interpretation: 从走轮子活动中，恺励在老师的鼓励下能够自己独立站到大轮子的侧沿上，并能够慢慢移动脚步走完一圈，之后自己跨到地面，展现出恺励四肢力量和身体平衡协调能力进一步增强。

learning_goals.title: Foster gross motor development (walk, run, jump, climb on playground equipment, bend, kick，throw, etc.) 发展粗大动作：走、跑、攀爬、弯腰、踢、投掷等。

title: 走轮子
description: 在游乐场，老师准备游戏活动的大轮子平放在地面，鼓励暄蒽站到轮子的侧沿上,并尝试围着走一圈。在老师的鼓励下，右手扶住轮沿,左脚踩到轮沿上，身体用力右脚向上一缩，暄蒽蹲到轮沿上，然后慢慢站了起来，双手打开稳稳站在轮子上，老师说：“暄蒽真棒！试试在轮沿上走一走。”在老师的鼓励下，暄蒽缓缓移动脚步，在轮沿上走了一圈，然后走下轮子。老师说：“暄蒽真的很棒！”暄蒽笑眯眯地看看老师。
interpretation: 从走轮子活动中，暄蒽在老师的鼓励下，能够自己独立站到大轮子的侧沿上，并能够慢慢移动脚步走完一圈，之后自己下到地面，展现出暄蒽四肢力量和身体平衡协调能力进一步增强。

learning_goals.title: Foster gross motor development (walk, run, jump, climb on playground equipment, bend, kick，throw, etc.) 发展粗大动作：走、跑、攀爬、弯腰、踢、投掷等。

title: 走轮子
description: 在游乐场，老师准备游戏活动的大轮子平放在地面，鼓励欣恩站到轮子的侧沿上,并尝试围着走一圈。欣恩来到大轮子前面，看了看老师，她双手扶住轮沿,右脚踩到轮沿上，身体用力左脚向上一缩，欣恩蹲到轮沿上，然后慢慢站了起来，老师说：“欣恩真棒！试试在轮沿走一走。”欣恩移动脚步，缓缓走了一圈后走下了轮子。老师竖起大拇指称赞：“欣恩真棒！能够走完一圈。”
interpretation: 从走轮子活动中，欣恩能够自己独立站到大轮子的侧沿上，并能够慢慢挪动脚步，移动身体，走完一圈，跨下轮子，展现出欣恩四肢力量和身体平衡协调能力进一步增强。

learning_goals.title: Foster gross motor development (walk, run, jump, climb on playground equipment, bend, kick，throw, etc.) 发展粗大动作：走、跑、攀爬、弯腰、踢、投掷等。

title: 走拱凳
description: 在游乐场，老师准备走拱凳活动，将拱凳排成一排，鼓励录恩自己站到高凳的一端，再慢慢走到另一端，然后走下高凳。录恩双手扶住拱凳，右脚踩在上面，左脚用力，身体往前倾斜，左脚向上收，录恩蹲在了拱凳上，接着他慢慢站起来，身体站直后，录恩笑眯眯地看看老师，老师说：“录恩自己站上了拱凳，好棒！慢慢往前走。”录恩开始尝试着走起来，他双手微微打开，缓缓向前挪动脚步，就这样他自己走过了拱凳桥，接着跨下拱凳，平稳站到地面上。老师再一次称赞：“录恩真的很棒！能够自己走过拱凳桥。”录恩笑眯眯地看看老师。
interpretation: 从走拱凳桥活动中，录恩能够自己独立站到拱凳桥上，并能够缓缓移动双脚，走过拱凳桥，平稳跨到地面，展现出录恩四肢力量和身体平衡协调能力有进一步的增强与提高。

learning_goals.title: Foster gross motor development (walk, run, jump, climb on playground equipment, bend, kick，throw, etc.) 发展粗大动作：走、跑、攀爬、弯腰、踢、投掷等。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation: 嘉乐绘制的是“奥莉薇起床了，它要去找妈妈。”画中奥莉薇面带微笑，身体似乎在往前迈步，而妈妈则在房间外等待，表现出她在等待或者回应奥莉薇。这幅画充满了童趣，展现了嘉乐对绘本内容的理解和再创作能力。从奥莉薇的形象，色彩和人物动态来看，嘉乐通过绘画表达了对奥莉薇起床后去找妈妈的温馨场景，同时也反映了他对妈妈的期待和依恋。这不仅是对绘本内容的再现，也是嘉乐表达情感的一种方式。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 笔画与笔顺：主动地仿写短句。

title: 走拱凳
description: 在游乐场，老师准备走拱凳活动，将拱凳排成一排，鼓励恩雪自己站到高凳的一端，再慢慢走到另一端，然后走下高凳。恩雪双手扶住拱凳，右脚踩在上面，左脚用力，身体向前，左脚向上收，蹲在了拱凳上，接着她慢慢站起来身体站直后，老师说：“恩雪好棒自己站上拱凳！你尝试走到拱桥另一端。”恩雪开始慢慢移动脚步，接着她微微打开双臂，双脚左右交替走到拱桥的另一端，然后蹲下身体，右脚踩到地面左手扶住拱凳，左脚跟着走下拱凳平稳站到地面上。
interpretation: 从走拱凳桥活动中，恩雪能够自己独立站到拱凳桥上，并能够缓缓交替移动双脚，走过拱凳桥，蹲下身体后，两脚先后平稳下到地面，展现出恩雪四肢力量有较大增强；身体平衡协调能力有较大提高。

learning_goals.title: Foster gross motor development (walk, run, jump, climb on playground equipment, bend, kick，throw, etc.) 发展粗大动作：走、跑、攀爬、弯腰、踢、投掷等。

title: 走拱凳
description: 在游乐场，老师准备走拱凳活动，将拱凳排成一排，鼓励静恩自己站到高凳的一端，再慢慢走到另一端，然后走下高凳。静恩双手扶住拱凳，右脚踩在上面，左脚用力，身体向前，左脚向上收，跪在了拱凳上，接着她慢慢站起来，身体站直后，老师说：“静恩好棒能够自己站上拱凳！你尝试走到拱桥另一端。”静恩双臂微微打开，脚步慢慢移动，一会后，静恩双脚开始交替缓缓走起来，她走到拱凳桥的另一端后，静恩身体微微弯下，左脚先右脚跟着走下拱凳，平稳地站到地面。她抬头笑眯眯地看看老师，老师竖起拇指说：“静恩真棒！”

title: 走拱凳
description: 在游乐场，老师准备走拱凳活动，将拱凳排成一排，鼓励睿萱自己站到高凳的一端，再慢慢走到另一端，然后走下高凳。睿萱双手扶住拱凳，左脚脚踩在拱凳上面，右脚踩在地面，身体跨在拱凳上，接着右脚向上收，身体蹲在拱凳上，然后慢慢站起来，身体站直后，老师说：“睿萱真棒能够自己站上拱凳！你尝试走到拱桥另一端。”睿萱看看老师，双手微微打开，缓缓挪动脚步，老师为她加油鼓励，睿萱慢慢地来到拱凳的另一端。她兴奋地举起双臂大叫：“耶！”老师称赞：“睿萱太棒了！你能够走过拱凳咯！”接着她蹲下左脚先，右脚后平稳跨到地面上。
interpretation: 从走拱凳桥活动中，睿萱能够自己独立站到拱凳桥上，并能慢慢走过拱凳桥，蹲下身体，左右脚先后走下拱凳，平稳站地站到地面上，展现出睿萱四肢力量和身体平衡协调能力有进一步的增强与提高。

learning_goals.title: Foster gross motor development (walk, run, jump, climb on playground equipment, bend, kick，throw, etc.) 发展粗大动作：走、跑、攀爬、弯腰、踢、投掷等。

title: 走拱凳
description: 在游乐场，老师准备走拱凳活动，将拱凳排成一排，鼓励睿彤自己站到高凳的一端，再慢慢走到另一端，然后走下高凳。睿彤双手扶住拱凳，左脚踩在上面，右脚用力，身体向前，右脚向上收，蹲在了拱凳上，接着她慢慢站直身体，老师说：“彤彤真棒能自己站上拱凳！你尝试走到拱桥另一端。”睿彤双臂打开开始慢慢挪动脚步，在老师的鼓励下，她一步一步缓缓移动，来到拱凳的另一端，然后蹲下身体，左脚踩到地面，右脚跟着走下拱凳，平稳站在地面上。老师竖起大拇指给她一个赞：“彤彤真棒！”她抬头看看老师。

title: 走拱凳
description: 在游乐场，老师准备走拱凳活动，将拱凳排成一排，鼓励耀曦自己站到高凳的一端，再慢慢走到另一端，然后走下拱凳。耀曦右脚踩在拱凳上，双手微微打开，身体半蹲，左脚向上提起，他蹲在了拱凳上，，接着他慢慢站直身体，老师说：“耀曦真棒自己站上拱凳！你尝试走到拱桥另一端。”耀曦开始慢慢移动脚步，接着双脚左右交替缓缓走到拱桥的另一端，然后蹲下身体，左脚踩到地面，右手扶住拱凳，右脚跟着走下拱凳平稳站在地面上。他看看老师，老师竖起大拇指给她一个赞：“耀曦真棒！”
interpretation: 从走拱凳桥活动中，耀曦能够自己独立站到拱凳桥上，并能够缓缓交替移动双脚，走过拱凳桥，蹲下身体后，两脚先后平稳下到地面，展现出耀曦四肢力量有较大增强；身平衡协调能力也有较大提高。

learning_goals.title: Foster gross motor development (walk, run, jump, climb on playground equipment, bend, kick，throw, etc.) 发展粗大动作：走、跑、攀爬、弯腰、踢、投掷等。

title: 翻爬球池
description: 在游乐场上，轩宇在球池里玩耍，这时他来到球池边，准备爬出球池，老师问：“轩宇要出来吗？”轩宇点点头，老师说：“让老师看看轩宇怎样爬出球池。”他双手抓住球池边沿，身体趴在球池沿上，接着右脚搭在球池沿上，身体用力骑在球池沿，随后左脚跟着跨出球池，双手扶住池沿，双脚落到地面，轩宇稳稳地站在地面上。然后笑眯眯地看看老师，老师称赞：“轩宇真棒！能够这么快速爬出球池。”
interpretation: 通过轩宇翻爬球池壁时整个连贯的身体动作过程，且迅速翻爬出球池。展现出轩宇四肢力量有较大增强；身体衡协调能力也有较大提高。

learning_goals.title: Foster gross motor development (walk, run, jump, climb on playground equipment, bend, kick，throw, etc.) 发展粗大动作：走、跑、攀爬、弯腰、踢、投掷等。

title: 翻爬球池
description: 在游乐场上，Kemy在球池里玩耍，这时他来到球池边，准备爬出球池，他双手抓住球池边沿，身体趴在球池沿上，接着右脚搭在球池沿上，身体用力骑在球池沿，随后左脚跟着跨出球池，双手扶住池沿，双脚落到地面，Kemy稳稳地站在地面上。
interpretation: 通过Kemy翻爬球池壁时整个身体动作过程，kemy 完整连续翻爬出球池。展现出Kemy四肢力量有较大增强；身体协调能力也有较大提高。

learning_goals.title: Foster gross motor development (walk, run, jump, climb on playground equipment, bend, kick，throw, etc.) 发展粗大动作：走、跑、攀爬、弯腰、踢、投掷等。

title: 小小设计师
description: 教师邀请幼儿回忆奥莉薇的不同穿着，然后出示图片，邀请幼儿观察和讨论奥莉薇的不同装扮，哪一件是自己最喜欢的。教师和幼儿一起讨论大家平时的衣服和装扮，鼓励幼儿用语言描述出来，并请他们说说自己觉得哪种款式的服装最漂亮。教师为幼儿提供图画纸、铅笔、剪刀、胶水以及不同质地的材料。教师鼓励幼儿发挥想象力，自由选择他们喜欢的材料和工具进行创作。教师请幼儿在图画纸上画出自己的脸，然后剪贴布料为自己设计衣服，以展示自己最漂亮的模样。
interpretation:
Abhigyan的作品主体是一个正面的自画像，由简单的线条进行勾勒。头部比例较大，眼睛涂黑，用于表现浓眉大眼的形象，耳朵也有清晰的轮廓，说明他注意到了五官的完整性。他的作品融合了绘画和拼贴，体现了他在视觉艺术方面的探索能力。他的衣领上有三个白色的纽扣，说明他观察到了服装的细节，并通过拼贴增强立体感。

从拼贴的材质选择到绘画的细节处理，都可以看出他对服装设计的兴趣和观察力。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（写）- 笔画与笔顺：主动地仿写短句。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation:
浩恩的作品画面使用了丰富的颜色，如红色、紫色、蓝色和黄色等，展现了他对世界的鲜明感知和自由表达能力。画面由几个不同的部分组成，分别代表了奥莉薇起床后的几个活动。他绘制了奥莉薇起床后打开门，去游乐场玩耍的场景。

作品展示了浩恩对绘本内容的理解和再创造能力，他不仅复述了奥莉薇的故事，还根据自己的想象力进行了故事续编。颜色和形状的搭配富有童趣，表达方式具有独特的个人风格。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：对书写汉字有兴趣。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation:
家乐绘制了奥莉薇起床后，来到游乐场玩耍的情景。他的作品分为左右两侧，分别代表了奥莉薇在家里和奥莉薇在游乐场玩耍的不同场景。室外的紫色云朵，增添了画面的空间感。

他绘制的奥莉薇形象具有典型的动物特征，面部夸张的笑容表现了它的活力。画面整体结构清晰，反应了他对空间布局的认知能力。作品生动、有趣，充满童趣和创造力。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 笔画与笔顺：主动地仿写短句。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation:
思婷的作品颜色较为丰富，运用了蓝色、红色、棕色和橙色等。橙色和蓝色的对比搭配的运用，使得画面更有层次感。她的作品主要分为两个部分，分别代表奥莉薇的家和游乐场两个不同的空间。这幅画体现了思婷对绘本的理解和再创造，运用了多种颜色和简单的几何图形来表达场景。

画中奥莉薇的形象较小，但清晰可见，说明她关注奥莉薇的角色形象，对角色有一定的认知和理解。

作品展现了思婷对生活的观察和对故事的归纳能力，能够抓住故事中的主要情节并进行在创作。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 笔画与笔顺：主动地仿写短句。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation: 子萱绘制的奥莉薇的床，使用了粉色、绿色和蓝色。体现了她的空间意识的增强，她能够区分床的结构，并通过色彩和形状来表现被子、枕头等物品。她的作品色彩搭配鲜明，对比强烈。奥莉薇粉色的裙子以及脸上的微笑给人温暖、活泼的感觉，体现了奥莉薇的个性特点。虽然画面没有精致的房间描绘，但是通过文字和简单几何图形表达了核心信息。她绘制了奥莉薇起床后去找小恩玩，也可能是她最自我的投射。她起床后可能会去找家人玩，因此她赋予了奥莉薇相同的行为。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 笔画与笔顺：主动地仿写短句。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation:
慈恩的作品画面结构清晰，色彩对比鲜明。那副乱七八糟的画非常有趣，这是她对抽象艺术的童真理解。画面中的奥莉薇是粉色的，站在衣服画作前，侧身观看，呈现出一种专注的姿态。它的裙子、耳朵、表情等都清晰可见，说明她具备了角色的辨识与形象塑造能力，也表现出了角色的个性。

慈恩照搬了绘本中“去美术馆”的去情节，还结合了自己的理解，加入了“乱七八糟”的画这一生动的描述，展现了她对故事理解以及将自己的行为投射到创作中。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：对书写汉字有兴趣。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation: 家乐使用了简洁的线条和鲜艳的颜色来表现角色和场景。他的作品结构清晰，展现了他对现实世界的观察能力。家乐的作品画面里出现了三个主要部分，分别是奥莉薇的床铺，奥莉薇和门，然后去游乐场玩滑梯。每个部分的场景相对独立，但又按时间顺序排列，反映了他在空间组织上的逻辑思维和一定的空间规划能力，也表示他已经具备能用图像连贯地表达事件的能力。他能够对故事的理解和再创作，具备了良好的故事复述和创新能力。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 笔画与笔顺：主动地仿写短句。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation:
伯闻的画面内容丰富，色彩鲜艳。他的画面有多个场景，包括床、做梦唱歌、在墙上画画以及进门后惊讶的妈妈。体现了较强的叙事能力。

作品中，奥莉薇身穿红色衣服，符合原绘本的形象，体现了伯闻对角色的记忆和再现能力。人物形态简单但富有表现力。说明伯闻对绘本故事的理解和个性化的表达方式，他在故事中加入了自己的想法。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 笔画与笔顺：主动地仿写短句。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation:
欣颖的作品画面布局较为丰富，包含角色、环境、物品等多个元素，展现了一定的叙事能力和想象能力。她的色彩使用大胆，天空、太阳、植物等元素的涂色增强了画面的生动感。不同的动物角色分别分布在不同的区域，表现了她在构图上的思考。

她在基于对绘本的理解上，也添加了自己的生活经验和想象，奥莉薇和小恩去了游乐场又去了农场。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 笔画与笔顺：主动地仿写短句。

title: 奥莉薇故事续编
description: 教师带领幼儿复习绘本《奥莉薇》，并将《奥莉薇》最后一页的情节作为起点，想象奥莉薇醒来后的一系列活动。通过自己的理解和想象来创编奥莉薇醒来后的行为。教师通过提问或给出一些示范来引导幼儿思考，例如：奥莉薇喜欢什么，她醒来后会做自己喜欢的事情吗？教师为幼儿提供材料，邀请幼儿通过绘画和仿写的方式将自己的故事分享出来。
interpretation: 维恩的画面表现了一种积极向上的情绪。故事延续了《奥莉薇》的核心特点，奥莉薇是一个充满活力、独立又充满想象力的小猪，它总是有各种各样的活动和想法。维恩的画面上有几个彩色的云朵，有爱心的形状。整个画面和文字都表现了一种轻松、欢快的氛围，说明维恩想象中的奥莉薇是一个喜欢玩耍、热爱生活的角色。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 笔画与笔顺：主动地仿写短句。

title: 印象最深刻的画面
description:
新学期的第一周，孩子们学习了绘本《奥莉薇》。故事的主人公是一只小猪，它擅长很多事情，但是最擅长的事情就是把人累昏，甚至常常把自己也累昏。它会涂妈妈的口红、穿上妈妈的高跟鞋照镜子，还会吓唬弟弟。要是出门，它还会把所有的衣服都拿出来穿一遍。晴天时，它会去海边，它会把自己晒成一条大热狗；而下雨天，她则会去参观美术馆。她喜欢直接走到德加的《芭蕾排练》面前，幻想自己将来有一天也能够在大大的舞台表演。不过，也有一幅画它怎么也看不懂。回家，它就在墙上画了起来。孩子们从这只可爱的小猪身上找到了许多的共鸣，他们分享自己也会做和奥莉薇一样的事情。教师邀请他们回顾奥莉薇给他们
留下了哪些印象，并鼓励他们用一句话来形容奥莉薇，例如：奥莉薇很可爱；奥莉薇喜欢画画；奥莉薇最爱玩堆沙堡……然后将自己印象最深刻的一件事情用绘画和仿写的形式记录到白纸上。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：能主动地将阅读和书写结合起来。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：能主动地将阅读和书写结合起来。

title: 我的身体部位
description:
描述：
       教师和幼儿坐在地板上，教师播放儿歌“身体歌”，通过儿歌帮助幼儿复习身体各部位的名称。复习身体各部位的名称后，请幼儿来到镜子面前，观察自己。 
       歆淯坐在镜子前对着镜子在做鬼脸。然后教师向歆淯提问：“歆淯，请问你的鼻子在哪里呀？”歆淯边看着镜子里的自己边指了指自己的鼻子说道：“鼻子”，教师接着提问：“歆淯，请问你的嘴巴在哪里呀？”歆淯看着镜子张开了嘴巴看出啊呜的声音，然后用手指指了下自己的嘴巴说：“嘴巴”。教师对歆淯竖起了大拇指。教师继续问道：“歆淯，请问你的屁股在哪里呀？”歆淯看着镜子摸了一下自己的肚子，教师告诉歆淯说：“歆淯这里是肚子哦，屁股在这里。”歆淯对教师点了点头，又看向镜子拍了拍自己的屁股。
interpretation:
诠释：

      歆淯在活动过程中能够持续的参与活动，并在活动中表现出快乐；通过和教师的谈话，歆淯能够指出自己的身体部位名称并说出来。

learning_goals.title: Foster sustained involvement and persistence in chosen activities 通过幼儿所选择的活动，培养持续参与和坚持性。
Foster language and expression through conversations, songs, stories and rhymes 通过谈话、歌曲、故事和儿歌，促进幼儿的理解和用短句表达能力的发展。

description:
新学期的第一周，孩子们学习了绘本《奥莉薇》。故事的主人公是一只小猪，它擅长很多事情，但是最擅长的事情就是把人累昏，甚至常常把自己也累昏。它会涂妈妈的口红、穿上妈妈的高跟鞋照镜子，还会吓唬弟弟。要是出门，它还会把所有的衣服都拿出来穿一遍。晴天时，它会去海边，它会把自己晒成一条大热狗；而下雨天，她则会去参观美术馆。她喜欢直接走到德加的《芭蕾排练》面前，幻想自己将来有一天也能够在大大的舞台表演。不过，也有一幅画它怎么也看不懂。回家，它就在墙上画了起来。孩子们从这只可爱的小猪身上找到了许多的共鸣，他们分享自己也会做和奥莉薇一样的事情。教师邀请他们回顾奥莉薇给他们
留下了哪些印象，并鼓励他们用一句话来形容奥莉薇，例如：奥莉薇很可爱；奥莉薇喜欢画画；奥莉薇最爱玩堆沙堡……然后将自己印象最深刻的一件事情用绘画和仿写的形式记录到白纸上。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：能主动地将阅读和书写结合起来。

title: 小小设计师
description: 教师邀请幼儿回忆奥莉薇的不同穿着，然后出示图片，邀请幼儿观察和讨论奥莉薇的不同装扮，哪一件是自己最喜欢的。教师和幼儿一起讨论大家平时的衣服和装扮，鼓励幼儿用语言描述出来，并请他们说说自己觉得哪种款式的服装最漂亮。教师为幼儿提供图画纸、铅笔、剪刀、胶水以及不同质地的材料。教师鼓励幼儿发挥想象力，自由选择他们喜欢的材料和工具进行创作。教师请幼儿在图画纸上画出自己的脸，然后剪贴布料为自己设计衣服，以展示自己最漂亮的模样。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：对书写汉字有兴趣。

title: 手工奥莉薇
description:
教师将奥莉薇手工展示给幼儿，鼓励他们观察立体的奥莉薇模型。然后出示手工所需要的材料，粘土、塑料鸡蛋、弹珠等材料。教师带领幼儿一步一步地制作奥莉薇手工。首先将肉色粘土揉成球，然后像摊印度煎饼一样在桌上展开。待他们摊开后，将粘土包裹在鸡蛋上。包裹好后，使用粘土和报纸卷制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，将粘土揉成四个“迷你小香肠”制作奥莉薇地手和脚。教师将参考图发给幼儿，邀请他们选择自己喜欢的图案制作奥莉薇的衣服和装饰。媖绮拿到粘土后，她问教师：“这个是什么颜色？”教师告诉她是‘肤色’或者‘肉色’。她听后
复述到：“肉色。”她又问：“老师，这个怎么放到鸡蛋上？”教师邀请她先把粘土揉成一个球，她一边揉，一边问：“这样对吗？”教师点点头，然后为她演示，将圆形的粘土在桌子上摊开，并告诉她就像和做印度煎饼一样。她笑着说：“我在做印度煎饼。”然后她用双手把粘土压扁，然后将粘土的边缘往外推。待她将推好的粘土贴到塑料鸡蛋上后，教师递给她一个报纸卷。她问道：“这个是什么。”教师将实先做好的奥莉薇模型举起来给她看，请她猜测用途。她观察了一下模型，说：“我知道了，是鼻子，对吗？”教师点点头示意她对了。
interpretation: 媖绮能够跟着教师的讲解，一步一步地使用粘土制作手工奥莉薇。在教师的引导下，能够在制作过程中，耐心思考如何将粘土揉搓成不同的形状大小、进行颜色搭配等，发挥自己的想象力制作属于自己的奥莉薇。

title: 手工奥莉薇
description:
教师将奥莉薇手工展示给幼儿，鼓励他们观察立体的奥莉薇模型。然后出示手工所需要的材料，粘土、塑料鸡蛋、弹珠等材料。教师带领幼儿一步一步地制作奥莉薇手工。首先将肉色粘土揉成球，然后像摊印度煎饼一样在桌上展开。待他们摊开后，将粘土包裹在鸡蛋上。包裹好后，使用粘土和报纸卷制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，将粘土揉成四个“迷你小香肠”制作奥莉薇地手和脚。教师将参考图发给幼儿，邀请他们选择自己喜欢的图案制作奥莉薇的衣服和装饰。
恺骏将粘土揉成一团，然后在桌上展开。他先用双手手掌将粘土压扁，然后向外推开。他一边推一边笑着说：“看，我在做RotiPrata。”他将压好的粘土贴到透明鸡蛋上。然后用手指按压和推挤不平整的地方。教师将一个报纸卷递给他，请他猜测用来做什么。他想了想说：“嗯，是Nose。”教师问他Nose华文是什么，他说道：“是鼻子。”教师点头示意他猜对了。教师邀请他像刚刚一样制作一个小的印度卷饼将报纸卷包起来。他制作好后，将包好的报纸卷粘贴到塑料鸡蛋偏上的地方。他将鼻子装好后，用在教师的引导下将手做好贴在奥莉薇身上。他告诉教师：“我要黑色的眼睛。”说完，他拿取来一些黑色粘土，然后揉成两个小球粘贴到奥莉薇脸上。
interpretation: 恺骏能够跟着教师的讲解，一步一步地使用粘土发挥自己的想象力制作手工奥莉薇。在教师的引导下，能够在制作过程中，耐心思考如何将粘土揉搓成不同的形状大小、进行颜色搭配等。

title: 手工奥莉薇
description:
教师将奥莉薇手工展示给幼儿，鼓励他们观察立体的奥莉薇模型。然后出示手工所需要的材料，粘土、塑料鸡蛋、弹珠等材料。教师带领幼儿一步一步地制作奥莉薇手工。首先将肉色粘土揉成球，然后像摊印度煎饼一样在桌上展开。待他们摊开后，将粘土包裹在鸡蛋上。包裹好后，使用粘土和报纸卷制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，将粘土揉成四个“迷你小香肠”制作奥莉薇地手和脚。教师将参考图发给幼儿，邀请他们选择自己喜欢的图案制作奥莉薇的衣服和装饰。
Abhigyan跟着教师的指示，将粘土放在桌上用手揉搓成一个香肠。他一边揉搓，一边说：“看老师，我的香肠。”教师笑着点头并告诉他做的很好。他将揉成条的粘土分成两段，分别贴到了奥莉薇身体的两侧。他说道：“老师，看奥莉薇的手。”教师问他想为奥莉薇做什么样的衣服，他看了看桌子上的粘土，说：“我想要Orange。”教师告诉他是橙色，他大声复述道：“橙色。”他拿取一些橙色粘土，在桌上揉搓，推平后贴到奥莉薇身上。他说：“老师，你看。我做了衣服。”教师问他还想添加什么。他说：“我还要皇冠。”说完，他拿起一些黄色粘土，搓成
长条，贴到奥莉薇头上，然后又揉了一些黄色短条。他将黄色小条添加到长条上。他说：“我做好了！”
interpretation: Abhigyan能够跟着教师的讲解，一步一步地使用粘土发挥自己的想象力制作手工奥莉薇。在教师的引导下，能够在制作过程中，耐心思考如何将粘土揉搓成不同的形状大小、进行颜色搭配等。

title: 手工奥莉薇
description:
教师将奥莉薇手工展示给幼儿，鼓励他们观察立体的奥莉薇模型。然后出示手工所需要的材料，粘土、塑料鸡蛋、弹珠等材料。教师带领幼儿一步一步地制作奥莉薇手工。首先将肉色粘土揉成球，然后像摊印度煎饼一样在桌上展开。待他们摊开后，将粘土包裹在鸡蛋上。包裹好后，使用粘土和报纸卷制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，将粘土揉成四个“迷你小香肠”制作奥莉薇地手和脚。教师将参考图发给幼儿，邀请他们选择自己喜欢的图案制作奥莉薇的衣服和装饰。
彦申说：“我要做奥莉薇。”教师点点头，将肉色的粘土递给彦申，并邀请她在桌上将粘土揉成一个煎饼。她看了看教师的示范动作，然后将粘土揉搓成一个大球，然后放在桌上用双手压平，再往旁边推开。然后，她将摊开的粘土包裹到塑料鸡蛋上。她又用同样的方法制作了奥莉薇的鼻子，她在教师的引导下将鼻子粘贴到奥莉薇身体偏上的部分。教师问她想给奥莉薇做什么样的衣服。她说：“我想要红色和绿色的衣服。”教师将红色和绿色粘土递给她。她将红色粘土撕下一些，拉长然后贴在奥莉薇身上。待她将奥莉薇衣服做好后，她说：“我想做一个皇冠。”教师引导她将黄色的粘土捏成长方形，然后在上面压出两个凹槽，将凹槽两边拉长
变成一个皇冠的尖角。彦申再在皇冠上添加了一些红色的点缀。
interpretation: 彦申能够跟着教师的讲解，一步一步地使用粘土发挥自己的想象力制作手工奥莉薇。在教师的引导下，能够在制作过程中，耐心思考如何将粘土揉搓成不同的形状大小、进行颜色搭配等。

title: 手工奥莉薇
description:
教师将奥莉薇手工展示给幼儿，鼓励他们观察立体的奥莉薇模型。然后出示手工所需要的材料，粘土、塑料鸡蛋、弹珠等材料。教师带领幼儿一步一步地制作奥莉薇手工。首先将肉色粘土揉成球，然后像摊印度煎饼一样在桌上展开。待他们摊开后，将粘土包裹在鸡蛋上。包裹好后，使用粘土和报纸卷制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，将粘土揉成四个“迷你小香肠”制作奥莉薇地手和脚。教师将参考图发给幼儿，邀请他们选择自己喜欢的图案制作奥莉薇的衣服和装饰。
馨琪接过教师递给她的粘土，她问道：“这个是什么颜色呢？”教师告诉她是肤色，皮肤的
颜色或者是肉色。她笑着复述道：“肉色。”她接着问：“我们怎么做呢？”教师邀请她将粘土揉成一个球，然后桌上压扁，用手将粘土往周围推开。馨琪听后，开始揉搓自己的粘土。她将揉搓好的粘土球放到桌上，然后开始按压。她用手掌拍打粘土团，用手指将边上的粘土团向外推。她将推好的粘土团放到透明鸡蛋上。她问道：“这些没有的地方怎么办呢？”教师邀请她将厚重的粘土压平，然后推到没有的地方。馨琪用手指按压粘土，然后将多余的地方推平，补充到空白的地方。她说：“这个很有趣。”教师问她想为奥莉薇做什么，她说：“我要给它一个帽子，还有书包。”
interpretation: 馨琪能够跟着教师的讲解，一步一步地使用粘土发挥自己的想象力制作手工奥莉薇。在教师的引导下，能够在制作过程中，耐心思考如何将粘土揉搓成不同的形状大小、进行颜色搭配等。

title: 手工奥莉薇
description:
教师将奥莉薇手工展示给幼儿，鼓励他们观察立体的奥莉薇模型。然后出示手工所需要的材料，粘土、塑料鸡蛋、弹珠等材料。教师带领幼儿一步一步地制作奥莉薇手工。首先将肉色粘土揉成球，然后像摊印度煎饼一样在桌上展开。待他们摊开后，将粘土包裹在鸡蛋上。包裹好后，使用粘土和报纸卷制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，将粘土揉成四个“迷你小香肠”制作奥莉薇地手和脚。教师将参考图发给幼儿，邀请他们选择自己喜欢的图案制作奥莉薇的衣服和装饰。
子彬跟着教师的步骤，将粘土在桌上推成一个大的‘煎饼'，然后将‘煎饼’覆盖到透明蛋壳上制作奥莉薇的身体。他指着蛋壳上空白的部分问教师：“这个，这个怎么办？”教师为他演示将厚重的粘土慢慢推到空白处，他看了看，说：“我知道了。”然后他开始一边推一边填满空白的地方。之后，他双手握起奥莉薇的身体，用手心按压，尝试将凹凸不平的粘土整理平整。他告诉教师：“我想要Black的eye。”教师问他Black和eye的华文是什么，他想了想，说：“是黑色和眼睛。”教师将黑色粘土递给他，他捏下两小块，然后用手指捏成两个小球，粘到奥莉薇脸上。之后，他将一些红色粘土搓成条再压扁贴到奥莉薇身上。他说道：“我做衣服，红色的。因为奥莉薇穿红色的衣服。”
interpretation: 子彬能够跟着教师的讲解，一步一步地使用粘土发挥自己的想象力制作手工奥莉薇。在教师的引导下，能够在制作过程中，耐心思考如何将粘土揉搓成不同的形状大小、进行颜色搭配等。

title: 手工奥莉薇
description:
教师将奥莉薇手工展示给幼儿，鼓励他们观察立体的奥莉薇模型。然后出示手工所需要的材料，粘土、塑料鸡蛋、弹珠等材料。教师带领幼儿一步一步地制作奥莉薇手工。首先将肉色粘土揉成球，然后像摊印度煎饼一样在桌上展开。待他们摊开后，将粘土包裹在鸡蛋上。包裹好后，使用粘土和报纸卷制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，将粘土揉成四个“迷你小香肠”制作奥莉薇地手和脚。教师将参考图发给幼儿，邀请他们选择自己喜欢的图案制作奥莉薇的衣服和装饰。
宇衡接过教师递给他的粘土，他说道：“这个就是肉色。”教师告诉他也叫肤色。他听后点点头，开始用手揉搓粘土。他将揉搓好的粘土高高举起，然后‘啪’一声丢到桌上，他用手将粘土球压扁，再沿着粘土地边缘按压。他将粘土按压成一张‘大饼’后，将粘土覆盖到塑料鸡蛋上制作奥莉薇的身体。他推挤粘土的厚实部分，直到将鸡蛋完全覆盖。教师递给他一个报纸卷，他问道：“这个用来做什么呢？”教师请他猜测用途，他问道：“是鼻子吗？”教师点点头示意他对了。然后他在教师的引导下，用粘土包裹报纸卷制作了奥莉薇的鼻子，然后将两块粘土揉成‘迷你香肠’，分别贴到奥莉薇的身体两边制作奥莉薇的手。他告诉教师：“我想要紫色的衣
服。”他拿起一些紫色粘土，问道：“我要怎么做呢？”教师告诉他可以将紫色粘土做成长方形，然后贴到奥莉薇的身体上。他听后点点头，开始制作起奥莉薇的衣服。
interpretation: 宇衡能够跟着教师的讲解，一步一步地使用粘土发挥自己的想象力制作手工奥莉薇。在教师的引导下，能够在制作过程中，耐心思考如何将粘土揉搓成不同的形状大小、进行颜色搭配等。

title: 手工奥莉薇
description:
教师将奥莉薇手工展示给幼儿，鼓励他们观察立体的奥莉薇模型。然后出示手工所需要的材料，粘土、塑料鸡蛋、弹珠等材料。教师带领幼儿一步一步地制作奥莉薇手工。首先将肉色粘土揉成球，然后像摊印度煎饼一样在桌上展开。待他们摊开后，将粘土包裹在鸡蛋上。包裹好后，使用粘土和报纸卷制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，将粘土揉成四个“迷你小香肠”制作奥莉薇地手和脚。教师将参考图发给幼儿，邀请他们选择自己喜欢的图案制作奥莉薇的衣服和装饰。
玫柔接过教师递给她的粘土，问道：“这是什么颜色？”教师告诉她是肉色，也叫肤色，皮
肤的颜色。她复述道：“皮肤的颜色。”她一会儿揉搓粘土，一会儿观察桌上的透明鸡蛋。她问道：“是要把这个放到鸡蛋上吗？”教师点点头，为她演示和讲解如何将粘土做成一张‘大饼’。玫柔用双手揉搓，然后将揉成球的粘土放到桌上用手掌按压，将球压扁。接着，她用手掌把粘土的边缘往四周推，她将粘土推成一个‘大饼’后将粘土拿起来，覆盖到透明鸡蛋上制作奥莉薇的身体。她继续推挤粘土，直到将鸡蛋完全覆盖。她又用同样的方式制作了奥莉薇的鼻子，她将鼻子贴到奥利维的身体上。待她做好了奥莉薇的眼睛和耳朵后，教师问她想要给奥莉薇做什么样的衣服。她看了看示意图，说：“我想要粉红色的。”说完，她拿起粉红色粘土揉
搓、拉扯、按压，再贴到奥莉薇的身体周围。
interpretation: 玫柔能够跟着教师的讲解，一步一步地使用粘土发挥自己的想象力制作手工奥莉薇。在教师的引导下，能够在制作过程中，耐心思考如何将粘土揉搓成不同的形状大小、进行颜色搭配等。

description:
教师将奥莉薇手工展示给幼儿，鼓励他们观察立体的奥莉薇模型。然后出示手工所需要的材料，粘土、塑料鸡蛋、弹珠等材料。教师带领幼儿一步一步地制作奥莉薇手工。首先将肉色粘土揉成球，然后像摊印度煎饼一样在桌上展开。待他们摊开后，将粘土包裹在鸡蛋上。包裹好后，使用粘土和报纸卷制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，将粘土揉成四个“迷你小香肠”制作奥莉薇地手和脚。教师将参考图发给幼儿，邀请他们选择自己喜欢的图案制作奥莉薇的衣服和装饰。
浩恩接过教师递给他的粘土，他用手将粘土揉成球，然后放到桌上按压。他继续用手推挤粘土，然后将推好的粘土放置到透明鸡蛋上制作奥莉薇的身体。他指着鸡蛋上空白的地方问教师：“这个怎么做？”教师引导他用手推挤粘土厚重的地方。他推挤好后将完全覆盖的鸡蛋举起来给教师看，他说道：“你看，我好了。”教师夸奖他很棒，然后递给他一块粘土邀请他制作奥莉薇的手和脚。他跟着教师的引导，将粘土分成四份，然后分别贴到奥莉薇身上。教师问他想给奥莉薇做什么样的衣服。他看了看，说：“我要Orange。”教师告诉他是橙色，他复述道：“橙色。”他问教师：“怎么做？”教师引导他先将粘土揉成条，然后压扁，再贴到奥莉薇身上。
interpretation: 浩恩能够跟着教师的讲解，一步一步地使用粘土发挥自己的想象力制作手工奥莉薇。在教师的引导下，能够在制作过程中，耐心思考如何将粘土揉搓成不同的形状大小、进行颜色搭配等。

title: 手工奥莉薇
description:
教师将奥莉薇手工展示给幼儿，鼓励他们观察立体的奥莉薇模型。然后出示手工所需要的材料，粘土、塑料鸡蛋、弹珠等材料。教师带领幼儿一步一步地制作奥莉薇手工。首先将肉色粘土揉成球，然后像摊印度煎饼一样在桌上展开。待他们摊开后，将粘土包裹在鸡蛋上。包裹好后，使用粘土和报纸卷制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，将粘土揉成四个“迷你小香肠”制作奥莉薇地手和脚。教师将参考图发给幼儿，邀请他们选择自己喜欢的图案制作奥莉薇的衣服和装饰。
家乐接过教师手里的粘土，教师告诉他粘土是肉色，也是肤色。他复述道：“肤色。”然后他开始揉搓粘土，他将粘土揉成球后放置到桌上用手按压。之后，他问道：“How to do，你可以帮我吗？”教师为他示范如何将压扁的粘土向四周展开。他看后，用手慢慢的推挤粘土，他一边推，一边问：“是这样吗？”教师点点头并鼓励他很棒。他将粘土摊成一个‘大饼’后，将粘土放置到塑料鸡蛋上制作奥莉薇的身体。他指着鸡蛋上空白的地方问教师：“这个怎么做？”教师请他按压粘土，并将多余的粘土推挤到空白处。他一边看教师的示范，一边跟着做。待他将奥莉薇的身体制作完成后，教师递给他一个报纸卷。他问教师：“这个是做什么？”教师拿起
制作好的奥莉薇模型请他猜测，他看了看，说：“我知道了，是nose。”教师问他nose的华文是什么。他说：“是鼻子。”在教师的引导下，他用同样的方式包裹好了报纸卷，制作了奥莉薇的鼻子。
interpretation: 家乐能够跟着教师的讲解，一步一步地使用粘土发挥自己的想象力制作手工奥莉薇。在教师的引导下，能够在制作过程中，耐心思考如何将粘土揉搓成不同的形状大小、进行颜色搭配等。

title: 手工奥莉薇
description:
教师将奥莉薇手工展示给幼儿，鼓励他们观察立体的奥莉薇模型。然后出示手工所需要的材料，粘土、塑料鸡蛋、弹珠等材料。教师带领幼儿一步一步地制作奥莉薇手工。首先将肉色粘土揉成球，然后像摊印度煎饼一样在桌上展开。待他们摊开后，将粘土包裹在鸡蛋上。包裹好后，使用粘土和报纸卷制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，将粘土揉成四个“迷你小香肠”制作奥莉薇地手和脚。教师将参考图发给幼儿，邀请他们选择自己喜欢的图案制作奥莉薇的衣服和装饰。
思婷告诉教师：“我想要做奥莉薇。”教师将肉的粘土递给她，她说：“我知道这个，是肉色。”教师点点头示意她对了，然后告诉她将粘土摊成一个‘大饼’的方法。她听后，将粘土放到桌上揉搓成球，然后按压粘土，并沿着粘土的边缘将中间的粘土往四周推挤。之后，她将粘土饼覆盖到透明鸡蛋上制作奥莉薇的身体。她指着鸡蛋上的空白处，问道：“这里怎么做？”教师邀请她推挤鸡蛋上粘土厚重的地方，直到将空白填满。她听后点点头，开始制作起来。她用同样的方式制作了奥莉薇的鼻子，再制作了奥莉薇的四肢。她告诉教师我想要粉色的鼻子，教师告诉她是鼻孔。她复述道：“我想要粉色的鼻孔。"教师邀请她将一小块粉色粘土分成两半，揉成小球贴到奥莉薇的鼻子上。接着，她有用粉色粘土制作了艾莉薇的衣服。她说
道：“我想放花在头上。”她拿起一些红色粘土问教师：“怎么做花呢？”教师引导她将粘土揉成一个小的圆形，然后折叠圆形的边缘，再在中心放一个小的黄色做为花的花蕊。她拿来一点绿色，说：“这个是叶子。”说完，她将绿色粘到花的根部。
interpretation: Interpretation 思婷能够跟着教师的讲解，一步一步地使用粘土发挥自己的想象力制作手工奥莉薇。在教师的引导下，能够在制作过程中，耐心思考如何将粘土揉搓成不同的形 状大小、进行颜色搭配等。

title: 情绪娃娃
description: 老师邀请幼儿们围坐在自己身边，播放儿歌《情绪歌》，请他们听听歌曲里唱到了哪些情绪，然后提供开心、哭泣、生气、害怕四种表情的人偶娃娃，鼓励凯翔尝试说出情绪娃娃的心情怎样，再说说自己心情怎么样。老师请凯翔选择人偶娃娃，凯翔先摸了摸哭泣表情的人偶娃娃看了看说：“cry.”老师说：“他哭了。”凯翔点点头说：“他哭了。老师问：“你喜欢哭的表情吗？”凯翔说：“I don’t like cry ,I like Happy face.”他拿起笑脸表情娃娃抱在怀里，笑眯眯地看看，然后看看老师和朋友。老师说：“凯翔喜欢开心表情，不喜欢伤心的表情。”凯翔点点头。老师说：“凯翔好棒！谢谢他的分享。”
interpretation: 从《情绪娃娃》活动中，凯翔愿意与老师的对话，并能和老师、朋友分享自己的表情和心情，展现出凯翔能与同伴、老师互动建立良好关系；对老师有信任感

learning_goals.title: Foster interactions, attachment and relationships with adults and children 通过与成人和同伴的互动，建立良好的关系。
Foster a sense of trust in adults 通过回应与互动，培养幼儿对成人的信任感。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: 情绪娃娃
description: 老师请幼儿们围坐在自己身边，播放儿歌《情绪歌》，请他们听听歌曲里唱到了哪些情绪，然后提供开心、哭泣、生气、害怕四种表情的人偶娃娃，鼓励轩宇尝试说出表情娃娃的心情怎样，再说说自己心情怎么样。轩宇指着表情娃娃，一个一个说出表情：“scare, angry, happy, sad。”他拿起生气娃娃展示给老师和朋友看：“angry face。”然后两手叉腰，做出生气的样子，老师说：“轩宇说的对，这是生气脸谱。”接着轩宇拿起惊讶表情娃娃，嘴巴张大对着老师和朋友又做了个害怕的表情，并告诉大家：“Scare”老师说：“轩宇做的是害怕的表情。”轩宇说：“害怕！”老师说：“轩宇好棒！谢谢他的分享。”
interpretation: 从《情绪娃娃》活动中，轩宇愿意与老师的对话说出表情娃娃的各种表情，愿意和老师、朋友分享自己的心情表情，展现出能与同伴、老师互动建立良好关系；对老师有信任感。

description: 老师请幼儿们围坐在自己身边，播放儿歌《情绪歌》，请他们听听歌曲里唱到了哪些情绪，然后提供开心、哭泣、生气、害怕四种表情的人偶娃娃，鼓励懿妍尝试说出表情娃娃的心情怎样，再说说自己心情怎么样。懿妍先拿到生气表情的人偶娃娃，看了看，皱了一下眉头，老师问：“懿妍你拿到什么表情的娃娃？”她拿起来给老师看说：“生气。”然后她双手叉腰做了个生气的样子，老师又请她和朋友交换人偶娃娃，老师问：“懿妍拿的表情娃娃，是什么表情？”懿妍回答：“害怕”她又模仿人偶娃娃的表情，嘴巴张的大大作出害怕的表情。老师说：“懿妍好棒！谢谢她的分享。”

title: Fingerprint Exploration
description: Children explored the process by using their fingers to press onto ink pads and then transfer the imprint onto paper, discovering the effects of this hands-on activity.
interpretation:
With encouragement from her teacher, Shuyin first decided to try the black ink pad. After pressing her fingers onto it, she observed her hands turning black and noted, "They're all black and dirty." Her teacher reassured her that it would wash off. Shuyin pressed her finger onto the paper, then tilted it upwards to examine the imprint. After noticing the small lines, she used a magnifying glass for a closer look.


She experimented with different fingers using her sense of touch to feel the ink on her fingers and saw how it transferred to the paper, observing that her thumb made a larger print while her pinky left a smaller one. She used both red and black ink pads and noticed the different patterns she could create. This sparked her curiosity, and she became eager to experiment with all her different fingers to create fingerprints patterns.


Through this activity, Shuyin demonstrated her ability to use her senses and simple tools, like the magnifying glass, to explore both living and non-living things. Her growing interest in investigating objects and her ability to communicate her findings show her developing cognitive, sensory, and fine motor skills.

learning_goals.title: Use senses and simple tools (e.g: magnifying viewer/glass, mirror, pulley, magnet, torchlight) to examine living and non-living things.

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: Fingerprint Exploration
description: Children explored the process by using their fingers to press onto ink pads and then transfer the imprint onto paper, discovering the effects of this hands-on activity.
interpretation:
Elliott was excited to try the ink pad of his choice, black, with just a bit of encouragement from his teacher. As he pressed his fingers onto the ink, he noticed his hands turning black and exclaimed, "Look, it's black, it's dirty!" His teacher reassured him that it was okay and would come off after washing his hands. With guidance, Elliott pressed his finger onto the paper and tilted his head sideways to closely observe the result. He noticed the imprints had lines and, using a magnifying glass, he excitedly pointed out the small lines to the teacher. This sparked his curiosity, and he became eager to experiment with all his different fingers to create fingerprints, fascinated by the patterns he could make.


Through this activity, Elliott demonstrated his ability to use his senses and simple tools, like the magnifying glass, to explore both living and non-living things. He used his sense of touch to feel the ink on his fingers and saw how it transferred to the paper, while also keenly observing the fine details of the fingerprints. His growing interest in investigating objects and his ability to communicate his findings show his developing cognitive, sensory, and fine motor skills.

learning_goals.title: Use senses and simple tools (e.g: magnifying viewer/glass, mirror, pulley, magnet, torchlight) to examine living and non-living things.

description: 老师邀请幼儿们围坐在自己身边，播放儿歌《情绪歌》，请他们听听歌曲里唱到了哪些情绪，然后提供开心、哭泣、生气、害怕四种表情的人偶娃娃，鼓励需要尝试说出表情娃娃的心情怎样，再说说自己心情怎么样。老师请许拿起一个表情娃娃后，老师问：“许与你的人偶娃娃是什么表情？”许与拿起人偶娃娃看了看，脸上露出伤心表情说：“Sad face.”并给朋友看，接着许与拿起开心表情娃娃看了看，拿起表情娃娃放到自己的脸旁边，笑眯眯地看看老师和朋友说“Happy face ”老师说：“是开心的脸。”许与点点头说：“开心的脸。”随后她又拿起害怕表情娃娃看看，跟着做了一个害怕的表情，老师说：“许与好棒！谢谢她的分享。

His teacher reassured him that it was okay and would come off after washing his hands. Through this activity, Kai En demonstrated his ability to use his senses and simple tools, like the magnifying glass, to explore both living and non-living things. He used his sense of touch to feel the ink on his fingers and saw how it transferred to the paper, while also keenly observing the fine details of the fingerprints. His growing interest in investigating objects and his ability to communicate his findings show his developing cognitive, sensory, and fine motor skills.

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: Fingerprint Exploration
description: Children explored the process by using their fingers to press onto ink pads and then transfer the imprint onto paper, discovering the effects of this hands-on activity.
interpretation:
Zacchaeus was excited to try the ink pad of his choice, black. As he pressed his fingers onto the ink, he noticed his hands turning black and exclaimed, "Look, it's black, it's dirty!" His teacher reassured him that it was okay and would come off after washing his hands. With guidance, Zacchaeus pressed his finger onto the paper and tilted his head sideways to closely observe the result. He noticed the imprints had lines and, using a magnifying glass, he excitedly pointed out the small lines to the teacher. This sparked his curiosity, and he became eager to experiment with all his different fingers or different colours to create fingerprints, fascinated by the patterns he could make.


Through this activity, Zacchaeus demonstrated his ability to use his senses and simple tools, like the magnifying glass, to explore both living and non-living things. He used his sense of touch to feel the ink on his fingers and saw how it transferred to the paper, while also keenly observing the fine details of the fingerprints. His growing interest in investigating objects and his ability to communicate his findings show his developing cognitive, sensory, and fine motor skills.

learning_goals.title: Use senses and simple tools (e.g: magnifying viewer/glass, mirror, pulley, magnet, torchlight) to examine living and non-living things.

title: 情绪娃娃
description: 老师邀请幼儿们围坐在自己身边，播放儿歌《情绪歌》，请他们听听歌曲里唱到了哪些情绪，然后提供开心、哭泣、生气、害怕四种表情的人偶娃娃，鼓励喧蒽尝试说出表情娃娃的心情怎样，再说说自己心情怎么样。老师请喧蒽和朋友各人拿起一个表情娃娃后，喧蒽摸了一下害怕表情人偶娃娃没有拿起，她选择了笑脸娃娃，老师问：“喧蒽，你的人偶娃娃是什么表情？”喧蒽拿起人偶给大家看并抱到自己面前笑眯眯地说：“happy face，I like happy face.”老师鼓励喧蒽和朋友们交换表情娃娃，喧蒽拿到一个害怕表情的人偶娃娃，老师问：“喧蒽的人偶娃娃是什么表情？”她拿起给大家看看，然后张开嘴巴模仿害怕的表情。老师说：“是害怕的表情吗？”暄蒽点点头说：“是，害怕。”老师说：“谢谢暄蒽的分享。”
interpretation: 从《情绪娃娃》活动中，暄蒽能与老师的对话，并能和老师、朋友分享自己的表情和自己心情，展现出暄蒽能与同伴、老师互动，逐渐建立良好关系，并对老师有信任感。

learning_goals.title: Foster interactions, attachment and relationships with adults and children 通过与成人和同伴的互动，建立良好的关系。
Foster a sense of trust in adults 通过回应与互动，培养幼儿对成人的信任感。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: 情绪娃娃
description: 老师邀请幼儿们围坐在自己身边，播放儿歌《情绪歌》，请他们听听歌曲里唱到了哪些情绪，然后提供开心、哭泣、生气、害怕四种表情的人偶娃娃，鼓励Husna尝试说出表情娃娃的心情怎样，再说说自己心情怎么样。姝雅指着表情娃娃，一个一个说出表情：“happy face、sad cry face、scare face、angry face。”她拿起开心娃娃，笑眯眯地看着，接着展示给老师和朋友看：“I like happy face。”老师说：“Husna很棒！她选择了开心娃娃，并告诉我们她喜欢开心的表情。”Husna笑眯眯地看看老师和朋友。
interpretation: 从《情绪娃娃》活动中，Husna能与老师的对话，说出表情娃娃的各种表情，愿意和老师、朋友分享自己喜欢的表情和心情，展现出能与Husna同伴、老师互动，逐渐建立良好关系，并对老师有信任感。

title: Fingerprint Exploration
description: Children explored the process by using their fingers to press onto ink pads and then transfer the imprint onto paper, discovering the effects of this hands-on activity.
interpretation:
Ethan was excited to try the ink pad of his choice, black. As he pressed his fingers onto the ink, he noticed his hands turning black and exclaimed, "Look, it's black!" With guidance, Ethan pressed his finger onto the paper and tilted his head sideways to closely observe the result. He noticed the imprints had lines and, using a magnifying glass, he excitedly pointed out the small lines to his friends. This sparked his curiosity, and he became eager to experiment with all his different fingers or different colours to create fingerprints, fascinated by the patterns he could make. He shared his fingerprint findings with his friend Matthias, and together they began counting how many prints they could make.


Through this activity, Ethan demonstrated his ability to use his senses and simple tools, like the magnifying glass, to explore both living and non-living things. He used his sense of touch to feel the ink on his fingers and saw how it transferred to the paper, while also keenly observing the fine details of the fingerprints. His growing interest in investigating objects and his ability to communicate his findings show his developing cognitive, sensory, and fine motor skills.

Through this activity, Matthias demonstrated his ability to use his senses and simple tools, like the magnifying glass, to explore both living and non-living things. His growing interest in investigating objects and his ability to communicate his findings show his developing cognitive, sensory, and fine motor skills.

title: 彩虹伞
description: 老师提供一个彩虹伞和皮球，邀请并鼓励欣恩和朋友们一起进行彩虹伞游戏。老师请欣恩拉着彩虹伞的一个角和朋友们走圆圈，一会进一会儿出，老师又将皮球放到彩虹伞上，欣恩和老师、朋友一起拉着彩虹伞让皮球在里面滚动，接着欣恩和老师、朋友们一起将彩虹伞抛起来，大家钻进彩虹伞下面，哈哈哈地笑着。就这样在老师的带领下欣恩和朋友们变换着方式玩着游戏。游戏结束后，老师问：“欣恩和朋友一起玩游戏开心吗？”欣恩笑着看看老师。
interpretation: 从《彩虹伞》活动中，欣恩能够按照老师的引导指令，开心地和朋友一起握住彩虹伞的边缘进行转圈、抛接、在彩虹伞下互相嬉戏等，与同伴共同完成各种任务，通过这些互动，欣恩进一步学习分享、合作、轮流等社交技能，能够和老师、朋友之间逐渐建立良好的关系，和老师也逐渐建立起了相互的信任。

learning_goals.title: Foster interactions, attachment and relationships with adults and children 通过与成人和同伴的互动，建立良好的关系。
Foster a sense of trust in adults 通过回应与互动，培养幼儿对成人的信任感。

interpretation:
Raylan was excited to try the ink pad of his choice, red then black. As he pressed his fingers onto the ink, he noticed his hands turning black and exclaimed, "Look, my hand is red!" With guidance, Raylan pressed his finger onto the paper and tilted his head sideways to closely observe the result. He noticed the imprints had lines and, using a magnifying glass, he excitedly pointed out the small lines to the teacher. He also could recognise and compare his peers' fingerprints based on their size and shape, “Engracia’s finger is the smallest and Zac has the biggest!”


Through this activity, Raylan demonstrated his ability to use his senses and simple tools, like the magnifying glass, to explore both living and non-living things. He used his sense of touch to feel the ink on his fingers and saw how it transferred to the paper, while also keenly observing the fine details of the fingerprints. His growing interest in investigating objects and his ability to communicate his findings show his developing cognitive, sensory, and fine motor skills.

title: Fingerprint Exploration
description: Children explored the process by using their fingers to press onto ink pads and then transfer the imprint onto paper, discovering the effects of this hands-on activity.
interpretation:
With encouragement from her teacher, Naomi Anne first decided to try the red ink pad. After pressing her fingers onto it, she observed her hands turning black and noted, "Look! My hand is red." Her teacher reassured her that it would wash off. Naomi Anne pressed her finger onto the paper, then tilted it upwards to examine the imprint. After noticing the small lines, she used a magnifying glass for a closer look.

She experimented with different fingers using her sense of touch to feel the ink on her fingers and saw how it transferred to the paper, observing that her thumb made a larger print while her pinky left a smaller one. She used both red and black ink pads and noticed the different patterns she could create. This sparked her curiosity, and she became eager to experiment with all her different fingers to create fingerprints, fascinated by the patterns she could make.


Through this activity, Naomi Anne demonstrated her ability to use her senses and simple tools, like the magnifying glass, to explore both living and non-living things. Her growing interest in investigating objects and her ability to communicate her findings show her developing cognitive, sensory, and fine motor skills.

learning_goals.title: Use senses and simple tools (e.g: magnifying viewer/glass, mirror, pulley, magnet, torchlight) to examine living and non-living things.

title: Guided Reading
description: The children were introduced to book awareness and learned how to use a book during the guided reading activity. They began to recognise sight words like "I," "am," and "like," and applied reading techniques such as using pictures for word prediction and pointing to each word while listening to the audio.
interpretation:
Shuyin showed keen engagement in reading while listening to the audio. During the activity, she initially observed the teacher closely. Understanding that it was a reading activity, she was introduced to placing the book on the table instead of holding it up. She was gently guided to point to the words one by one, rather than following her finger across the page. With a bit of encouragement, she was able to read the words more clearly and with more volume while listening to the audio.


Shuyin can read 3 word sentences and recognised words like “playing” after hearing the audio a few times. When asked how she knew, she replied, “because the girl (in the picture) is holding a toy,” showing her comprehension of the book's theme about school activities. While she initially got confused between painting and writing due to the image of paper, with guidance on different materials, she could recognise the differences more clearly. This reflects her developing listening, word recognition, and comprehension skills, as she connects visuals with text and demonstrates an understanding of the read-aloud content

learning_goals.title: Comprehension: Comprehend and respond to stories and other texts read aloud.

title: Guided Reading
description: The children were introduced to book awareness and learned how to use a book during the guided reading activity. They began to recognise sight words like "I," "am," and "like," and applied reading techniques such as using pictures for word prediction and pointing to each word while listening to the audio.
interpretation:
Olivia showed keen engagement in reading while listening to the audio. During the activity, she initially observed the teacher and her peers closely. Understanding that it was a reading activity, she was introduced to placing the book on the table instead of holding it up. She was gently guided to point to the words one by one, rather than following her finger across the page. With a bit of encouragement, she was able to read the words more clearly and with more volume while listening to the audio.


Olivia can read 3 word sentences and recognised words after hearing the audio a few times. When asked how she knew, she replied, “because the girl (in the picture) is drawing with a marker,” showing her comprehension of the book's theme about school activities. While she initially got confused between painting and writing due to the image of paper, with guidance on different materials, she could recognise the differences more clearly. This reflects her developing listening, word recognition, and comprehension skills, as she connects visuals with text and demonstrates an understanding of the read-aloud content.

learning_goals.title: Comprehension: Comprehend and respond to stories and other texts read aloud.

title: Guided Reading
description: The children were introduced to book awareness and learned how to use a book during the guided reading activity. They began to recognise sight words like "I," "am," and "like," and applied reading techniques such as using pictures for word prediction and pointing to each word while listening to the audio.
interpretation:
Shuo-Yun demonstrated growing engagement with the book and a little bit of the audio. With guidance and encouragement, he observed the teacher to learn how to read. He was able to put on the headphones with some assistance.


Initially, Shuo-Yun looked through the book, pointing to pictures of objects like a girl, car, and marker, but he didn’t want to use the audio. He was able to recognise the images and named them accordingly, “Car” and “Marker!” After a second attempt with the volume lowered, and with some gentle guidance, he began to follow along with the audio. He was able to turn the pages in sync with the pacing of the book and, with a few verbal cues from the teacher, such as "flip the page," he successfully read along while flipping the pages.


By the third reading, Shuo-Yun was able to read most of the sentences in the book aloud after the audio. He was occasionally able to read while pointing to one or two words. This shows his developing listening, word recognition, and comprehension skills as he connects visuals with text and demonstrates an understanding of the content.

learning_goals.title: Comprehension: Comprehend and respond to stories and other texts read aloud.

title: 情绪娃娃
description: 老师请幼儿们围坐在自己身边，播放儿歌《情绪歌》，请他们听听歌曲里唱到了哪些情绪，然后提供开心、哭泣、生气、害怕四种表情的人偶娃娃，鼓励睿萱尝试说出表情娃娃的心情怎样，再说说自己心情怎样？睿萱先拿到开心表情的人偶娃娃，看了看，，老师问：“睿萱你拿到什么表情的娃娃？”她拿起来给老师看说：“开心。”但睿萱的表情没有显得开心，老师又请她再拿一个，老师问：“睿萱拿的表情娃娃，是什么表情？”睿萱没有回答，但睿萱皱了皱眉头，放下表情娃娃，接着又拿起一个伤心哭泣的表情娃娃。接着就想要哭了，老师问：“睿萱看到哭泣的娃娃想要哭，是吗？”睿萱说：“I want dad mummy.”老师安慰她，睿萱慢慢平静下来。
interpretation: 从《情绪娃娃》活动中，睿萱能与老师的对话，并能与老师、朋友分享自己的表情和心情，并且在老师的安慰下平静下来，展现出睿萱能与同伴、老师互动建立良好关系；对老师有信任感。

learning_goals.title: Foster interactions, attachment and relationships with adults and children 通过与成人和同伴的互动，建立良好的关系。
Foster a sense of trust in adults 通过回应与互动，培养幼儿对成人的信任感。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: 一起开车
description: 在游乐场，小朋友们在各自进行不同的活动，一位朋友开着一辆蓝色的小车过来，老师和开车的小朋友商量，请他让Kemy一起开车，在老师的引导下，Kemy坐上了朋友开的小汽车，Kemy一边笑着一边和朋友，在游乐场来回驾驶，他们两个一起驾驶了很长一段时间，过后Kemy又去跟着其他朋友一起玩耍了。
interpretation: Kemy 在老师的引导下，和朋友一起驾驶小汽车一段时间，过后又跟着其他朋友玩耍，Kemy在他人的引导下，开始尝试和朋友互动，逐渐与成人和同伴互动，建立关系。

learning_goals.title: Foster interactions, attachment and relationships with adults and children 通过与成人和同伴的互动，建立良好的关系。
Foster a sense of trust in adults 通过回应与互动，培养幼儿对成人的信任感。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: Guided Reading
description: The children were introduced to book awareness and learned how to use a book during the guided reading activity. They began to recognise sight words like "I," "am," and "like," and applied reading techniques such as using pictures for word prediction and pointing to each word while listening to the audio.
interpretation:
Kai En demonstrated engagement with the book and audio. With prompting, he observed the teacher and his peers to learn how to read. He was able to put on the headphones by himself with little to no assistance. Kai En followed the instructions with slight repetition, such as opening the book, repeating words, and pointing to the words as he read. For example, he needed a little more explanation to understand and follow the teacher's instructions and demonstration, when asked to open the book and repeat the words.


When listening to the audio, Kai En often repeated the last word or two of a phrase, such as "like" after hearing "I like reading." Gradually, he started to say the whole sentence. For example, after hearing the audio for "My teacher likes me," he would repeat the entire sentence. When asked to read a page without the audio, he could read parts of the sentence using the pictures to help him guess the words, like recognising the picture of a child writing on paper and saying "writing" when reading "I like writing.” This reflects his developing listening, word recognition, and comprehension skills, as he connects visuals with text and demonstrates an understanding of the read-aloud content.

learning_goals.title: Comprehension: Comprehend and respond to stories and other texts read aloud.

title: February Show and Tell
description: Children are invited this February to share and talk about their favourite activity to do on weekends. This activity encourages self-expression as each child describes what they love to do, why it’s special to them, and what makes their weekend fun.
interpretation:
Zacchaeus brought his blue soccer ball and explained that he enjoys playing and kicking the ball with his daddy at the park on weekends. Using 4 to 5-word sentences, he clearly communicated the location ("I go to park"), the time ("I play on weekends"), and the activity ("I kick ball with daddy"). Through his actions, he demonstrated how he kicks and throws the ball, mimicking the movements of playing with the ball. 


When asked why he chose a ball, Zacchaeus was able to understand and respond, “I like balls and my daddy plays balls with me,” showing his ability to reason about his preferences and explain the bond he shares with his father during their weekend activity.

Zacchaeus displayed strong communication skills, using both verbal explanations and physical demonstrations to convey his favourite weekend activity, showing his ability to express thoughts clearly and effectively.

learning_goals.title: Speak clearly enough to be understood without contextual clues.

title: Guided Reading
description: The children were introduced to book awareness and learned how to use a book during the guided reading activity. They began to recognise sight words like "I," "am," and "like," and applied reading techniques such as using pictures for word prediction and pointing to each word while listening to the audio.
interpretation:
Matthias demonstrated engagement with the book and audio. With prompting, he observed the teacher and his peers to learn how to read. He was able to put on the headphones by himself with minimal assistance. Matthias followed 3 step instructions well, such as opening the book, repeating words, and pointing to the words as he read. For example, when asked to open the book and repeat the words, he followed through with little guidance.


When listening to the audio, Matthias would quickly repeat 3 to 4 word sentences, moving on to the next before it finished. When reading independently, he used pictures to help him infer words, like recognising a child is writing and saying "writing" when reading the sentence - "I like writing." This shows his strong listening, word recognition, and comprehension skills.


To further support his reading, we also introduced pauses, encouraging him to take his time and focus on each word, which will help him maintain a steady pace and build confidence in his reading.

title: January Show and Tell
description: Children are invited this January to share and talk about their favourite item. This activity encourages self-expression as each child describes what the item is, why it is special to them, and the memories or feelings associated with it.
interpretation: Raphael brought his red Spider-Man jacket to show and tell, explaining that it is his favorite item. He shared that he loves wearing it because it makes him feel like Spider-Man and gives him the power to be strong and brave. Using 4 to 5-word sentences, he clearly described the item ("It's a red coat") and explained when and where he wears it ("I wear it when it rains"). Raphael demonstrated excitement as he pointed to the jacket, showing how he puts it on and imagines being a superhero. When asked why it’s his favorite, he was able to respond, "Spider-Man is my hero," and further explained that he likes Spider-Man from the Spider-Man movie. Raphael's communication skills were evident as he combined verbal descriptions with gestures to express his thoughts, effectively sharing his fondness for the jacket and the meaning behind it.

learning_goals.title: Speak clearly enough to be understood without contextual clues.

title: 逃家小兔故事续编
description: 教师邀请幼儿想一想，如果自己是故事里的小兔子，当他们想要逃离妈妈的时候会想要变成什么。然后妈妈如果想追到小兔一个话题展开讨论”的学习子并把它抓回家，又会变成什么。教师邀请幼儿使用句式“如果你变成……，我就变成……”来分享自己的故事。之后，老师为他们提供了彩色铅笔、马克笔、剪刀和纸，鼓励他们将刚刚分享的内容绘制到白纸上，然后用剪刀剪下一些图案或者图画粘贴到作品上制作一副长轴画。
interpretation: 宇衡的作品线条简单，但是有一定的叙事逻辑。单独的线条代表了风，风围绕着小兔子变成的小船，代表着妈妈的爱包围着小兔子。红色的部分代表着风的力量或者是某种情绪。虽然他的故事依然延续了《逃家小兔》的主题，他的作品加入了自己的理解和情感，表达了依恋、探索和守护的主题，展现了他的创造力和情感表达能力的提高。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 仿编故事：在理解故事的基础上，根据故事书提供的线索展开想象，并能独自仿编故事。
语言学习成果（写）- 写前准备：对书写汉字有兴趣。

title: 我的名字
description: 报到时间，小朋友们围坐在老师身边，准备点名报到，老师出示暄蒽的点名卡，让暄蒽说说自己的名字，再让其他幼儿说说她的名字，老师说：“这是谁？”暄蒽说：“暄蒽。”老师说：“请像我一样告诉朋友们：我叫陈暄蒽。“暄蒽告诉大家：”我叫陈暄蒽。”老师把名卡递给暄蒽，暄蒽拿着自己的名卡，来到报到板前贴到板上，然后回到自己原来的位置。老师说：“暄蒽真棒！能够大声用华语说出自己的名字。”当老师说到其他朋友时，暄蒽也会一一说出朋友的名字。
interpretation: 从《我的名字》活动中，暄蒽能够说出：我叫陈暄蒽，也能从整个活动中认识并说出朋友的名字，展现出暄蒽的自我意识和对他人认识进一步发展中。

learning_goals.title: Foster sense of self (telling others their names) 培养自我意识，如：说出自己的名字等。
Foster sense of others (saying out the names of their peers) 培养对他人的认识，如：说出同伴的名字等。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: My ‘Not a Box’ Project
description:
After reading the story Not a Box, the children were invited to create their own "not a box" structures using different pieces of cardboard. Prior to the activity, the children were challenged to transform 2D cardboard pieces into 3D structures. We watched a video and learned 10 different ways to connect cardboard pieces. While creating their structures, the children used various techniques depending on their design goals.

Abhigyan created a design inspired by the environment. After planning his design, he began collecting materials, starting with cardboard pieces and cardboard rolls. He observed his peers for inspiration before focusing on his own work. Abhigyan was seen cutting small tabs around the bottom of a cardboard roll. As he worked, he carefully ensured the tabs were evenly spaced, applying what he had seen in the demonstration video. He folded the tabs outward and secured them with tape. Proud of his creation, Abhigyan exclaimed, “Look! I made a tree!”

The teacher encouraged him to think about what else he could add to make it look more like a tree. Abhigyan replied, “I think I can add the leaves on top.” He took a rectangular piece of cardboard and cut a slot midway on both the rectangle and the cardboard roll. “I know! I can use the slot and put this on top,” he said as he slotted the cardboard piece onto the top of the roll, creating a canopy for his tree.

Next, Abhigyan continued building his bridge. He selected a long piece of cardboard and used a ruler to guide him. Applying the "bend" method, he made even creases along the cardboard, allowing it to curve into the shape of a bridge.
interpretation:
Abhigyan’s participation in this activity highlights his growing creativity and problem-solving abilities. He demonstrated resourcefulness and applied prior knowledge when exploring various ways to connect and construct 3D forms. His ability to recall techniques and adapt them to suit his design goals reflects a deepening understanding of structure and stability.


When encouraged to expand on his ideas, Abhigyan showed critical thinking and flexibility, considering new ways to enhance his design. His confidence and willingness to experiment illustrate his sense of agency and enthusiasm for learning through hands-on exploration. He also exhibited strong planning and precision skills, using tools thoughtfully to achieve his desired outcome. This experience provided a rich opportunity for Abhigyan to develop essential skills across multiple domains while fostering self-expression and confidence in his abilities as a designer and builder.

learning_goals.title: Experiment with open-ended materials.
Exercise creativity, innovation, imagination and seeing things differently while problem solving or performing a task.

title: 我的名字
description: 报到时间，小朋友们围坐在老师身边，准备点名报到，老师出示录恩的点名卡，让录恩说说自己的名字，再让其他幼儿说说他的名字，老师说：“这是谁？”录恩看看名卡和老师说：“白录恩。”老师说：“录恩能用华语说出自己的名字，真棒！”老师接着说：“请说出我叫...”录恩立即回应：“我叫白录恩。”老师说：“录恩说的很好！”老师把名卡递给录恩，录恩笑眯眯地拿着自己的名卡，来到报到板前，贴到板上，然后回到自己原来的位置。当老师说到朋友时，录恩也会一一说出朋友的名字。
interpretation: 从《我的名字》活动中，录恩能够说出：我叫白录恩，也能从整个活动中认识并说出朋友的名字，展现出录恩的自我意识和对他人认识进一步发展中。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: Partner Toss Challenge
description:
As part of our Kidzercise game, the children participated in a Partner Toss Challenge, where they practiced throwing and catching a ball with a partner. This activity focused on developing hand-eye coordination, control, and teamwork. The children started with short, gentle throws and gradually increased the distance as they gained more confidence. The challenge encouraged them to throw accurately and catch consistently while staying engaged with their partner.

Abhigyan was first given the task of throwing the ball. Excited to begin, he immediately tossed the ball toward his partner. After the first throw, his partner mentioned that she was not ready. Abhigyan responded by asking, “Ok, I will wait for you. Are you ready now?” Upon receiving confirmation, Abhigyan threw the ball again. Throughout the activity, Abhigyan experimented with different throwing strengths. When he tried throwing the ball with more force, it went past his partner. When he threw it more gently, the ball fell short. Although he did not reach the target, Abhigyan practiced adjusting the strength of his throws after each turn.

When it was his turn to catch the ball, Abhigyan showed improved body posture by leaning forward and stretching out his arms to reach the ball. At certain moments, he squinted his eyes as he felt the ball approaching, staying focused on tracking it as it came closer.
interpretation:
Through this activity, Abhigyan showed increased focus and experimentation with both throwing and catching the ball. As he practiced different throwing strengths, he demonstrated an understanding of how adjusting his throw could impact the distance and accuracy. Although he didn’t always reach the target, Abhigyan was engaged in the process of trial and error, which allowed him to refine his skills and experiment with different techniques.


When it was his turn to catch, Abhigyan displayed improved posture and awareness of his body’s position, demonstrating an understanding of how to properly prepare for a catch. His focus on tracking the ball, indicated by his squinting, shows that he is actively working on his hand-eye coordination and beginning to recognize the importance of focus when catching.


Abhigyan’s involvement in both throwing and catching indicates that he is on the path to becoming more confident and skilled in both activities. With continued practice, he will further develop his control, accuracy, and consistency in both throwing and catching.

title: 我的名字
description: 报到时间，小朋友们围坐在老师身边，准备点名报到，老师出示懿妍的点名卡，让懿妍说说自己的名字，再让其他幼儿说说她的名字，老师说：“这是谁？”懿妍看看名卡和老师说：“傅懿妍。”老师说：“懿妍能用华语说出自己的名字，真棒！”老师接着说：“你叫什么名字”懿妍立即回应：“我叫傅懿妍。”老师说：“懿妍说的很好！会告诉大家我叫傅懿妍。”老师把名卡递给懿妍，懿妍笑眯眯地拿着自己的名卡，来到报到板前，贴到板上，然后回到自己原来的位置。当老师说到朋友时，懿妍也能一一说出朋友的名字。
interpretation: 从《我的名字叫》活动中，懿妍能够说出：我叫傅懿妍，也能从整个活动中认识并说出朋友的名字，展现出懿妍的自我意识和对他人认识进一步发展中。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: Read and Sequence
description:
During the Lit Attack activity, the children engaged in reading a passage with decodable words and worked together to interpret its meaning. Arielle waited patiently while her partner read the first sentence. She then read the second sentence slowly, “He… is… a… /c/ /o/ /p/. Cuuh-o-p. Cop.” In the fourth sentence, Arielle read, “The dog… hid… in a bo… /x/… box.” She continued to the last sentence, saying, “The dog /h/ /o/ /p/ /s/… h…o…p… hop…s… hops on Tom.”

After finishing the passage, the pair looked at the pictures to match them to the sentences. As her friend picked up a picture to match the first sentence, Arielle said, “Yes… yes… it is correct because it shows the cop.” She then picked up a picture of the cop holding a dog for the sentence, “Tom went to find a dog.” Later, Arielle noticed there was no image to match the sentence, “Tom found the dog.” She discussed this with her partner, saying, “But if we put this one here, we cannot match it to the sentence ‘The dog hops on Tom.’”

After reasoning and discussing together, Arielle and her partner decided to rearrange the pictures. They replaced the first picture with an image of Tom the cop standing in front of a police station, explaining that it showed more clearly that Tom is a police officer.
interpretation: Arielle is developing her early reading and comprehension skills. During the Lit Attack activity, she used her decoding strategies to read new words and took her time to blend and pronounce them correctly. Arielle showed great problem-solving skills and reasoning as she carefully matched the pictures to the sentences. She also demonstrated strong communication skills by discussing her ideas with her partner and explaining her thinking. When she noticed that one picture didn’t match, Arielle worked with her partner to solve the problem, showing flexibility and teamwork. Her ability to reflect, adjust her choices, and collaborate with others highlights her growing confidence as a learner and her emerging leadership skills.

learning_goals.title: Phonological Awareness: Decode unfamiliar words.
Comprehension: Use strategies to construct meaning from print.
Comprehension: Anticipate events in stories and make predictions.

title: Partner Toss Challenge
description:
As part of our Kidzercise game, the children participated in a Partner Toss Challenge, where they practiced throwing and catching a ball with a partner. This activity focused on developing hand-eye coordination, control, and teamwork. The children started with short, gentle throws and gradually increased the distance as they gained more confidence. The challenge encouraged them to throw accurately and catch consistently while staying engaged with their partner.

Arielle was first tasked with catching the ball. She positioned herself by stretching her arms out and leaning her body forward, showing readiness and focus. On her first attempt, she narrowly missed the ball, but she quickly adjusted her approach. During the next throw, Arielle demonstrated increased concentration, keeping her eyes on the rubber ball as it moved through the air. As the ball came closer, she continued to stretch her arms out and adjust her body position, allowing her to successfully make the catch. Her ability to track the ball and make small adjustments highlights her growing hand-eye coordination and spatial awareness.

When it was her turn to throw, Arielle carefully positioned herself, swinging her arms backward before making her throw. Her first attempt showed good form, and she immediately reflected on her throw, realising she needed a bit more force. Over the next few throws, she adjusted her strength, making each throw slightly stronger until she successfully reached her target.
interpretation:
Through this activity, Arielle showed strong confidence and skill in both throwing and catching. She demonstrated an understanding of how body positioning, focus, and controlled movements contribute to success. By making small adjustments, she improved her accuracy and control, showing perseverance and a willingness to refine her technique.


Arielle displayed natural ability in this task and was able to throw and catch the ball with minimal prompts or supervision. She quickly grasped key techniques and adjusted her movements as needed, demonstrating that she can execute these skills with ease. With continued practice, she will further refine her coordination and maintain her strong level of confidence in physical activities.

title: 手工奥莉薇
description:
教师将奥莉薇手工展示给幼儿，鼓励他们观察立体的奥莉薇模型。然后出示手工所需要的材料，粘土、塑料鸡蛋、弹珠等材料。教师带领幼儿一步一步地制作奥莉薇手工。首先将肉色粘土揉成球，然后像摊印度煎饼一样在桌上展开。待他们摊开后，将粘土包裹在鸡蛋上。包裹好后，使用粘土和报纸卷制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，将粘土揉成四个“迷你小香肠”制作奥莉薇地手和脚。教师将参考图发给幼儿，邀请他们选择自己喜欢的图案制作奥莉薇的衣服和装饰。
子萱接过教师递给她的黏土，她说：“肉色。”教师点点头，告诉她也叫肤色，皮肤的肤。她笑着复述道：“肤色。”然后她将黏土放到桌上开始揉搓。然后，她用手掌按压黏土。她将黏土压扁后，用手指将黏土的边缘往四周推，尝试制作黏土‘煎饼’。待她制作好后，她将黏土煎饼覆盖到透明鸡蛋上。她指着鸡蛋上空白处问：“谢老师，这里怎么做？”教师邀请她先按压黏土厚重的地方，然后将多余的黏土推挤到空白处。听后，她开始按压和推挤黏土。教师递给她一个报纸卷，她问：“这个是什么？”教师邀请她猜测，她想了想，说：“我知道了，是鼻子。”教师点点头，邀请她用同样的方式制作一个小的黏土煎饼。待她做好后，她用黏土煎饼将报纸卷包裹起来，粘贴到奥莉薇的身体上。然后将奥莉薇鼻子和身体处的通过黏土推挤、按压衔接到一起。
interpretation: 子萱能够跟着教师的讲解，一步一步地使用粘土发挥自己的想象力制作手工奥莉薇。在教师的引导下，能够在制作过程中，耐心思考如何将粘土揉搓成不同的形状大小、进行颜色搭配等。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解3个口头指示并完成任务。
积极参与与生活相关的有趣的活动。（PRAISE）

title: 手工奥莉薇
description:
教师将奥莉薇手工展示给幼儿，鼓励他们观察立体的奥莉薇模型。然后出示手工所需要的材料，粘土、塑料鸡蛋、弹珠等材料。教师带领幼儿一步一步地制作奥莉薇手工。首先将肉色粘土揉成球，然后像摊印度煎饼一样在桌上展开。待他们摊开后，将粘土包裹在鸡蛋上。包裹好后，使用粘土和报纸卷制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，将粘土揉成四个“迷你小香肠”制作奥莉薇地手和脚。教师将参考图发给幼儿，邀请他们选择自己喜欢的图案制作奥莉薇的衣服和装饰。
家乐将黏土放到桌上用手揉搓。他将黏土搓成一个球后，用手掌按压黏土，然后用手指将黏土的四周往外推，将黏土推成一个‘大饼’。他将黏土大饼覆盖到透明鸡蛋上，按压和推挤黏土厚重的地方，将鸡蛋上的空白处都覆盖好。他用同样的方式制作了一个小的黏土饼，他将黏土饼覆盖到报纸卷上，然后将贴到奥莉薇身上制作奥莉薇的鼻子。教师又递给他一些黏土，他跟着教师的指引将黏土揉搓成条‘香肠’，然后分成两条‘香肠’和两条‘迷你香肠’。他将长条贴到奥莉薇的身体两边，制作它的手。他又将两条迷你‘香肠’贴在奥莉薇的身体下方，制作坐着的奥莉薇的脚。
interpretation: 家乐能够跟着教师的讲解，一步一步地使用粘土发挥自己的想象力制作手工奥莉薇。在教师的引导下，能够在制作过程中，耐心思考如何将粘土揉搓成不同的形状大小、进行颜色搭配等。

title: 手工奥莉薇
description:
教师将奥莉薇手工展示给幼儿，鼓励他们观察立体的奥莉薇模型。然后出示手工所需要的材料，粘土、塑料鸡蛋、弹珠等材料。教师带领幼儿一步一步地制作奥莉薇手工。首先将肉色粘土揉成球，然后像摊印度煎饼一样在桌上展开。待他们摊开后，将粘土包裹在鸡蛋上。包裹好后，使用粘土和报纸卷制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，将粘土揉成四个“迷你小香肠”制作奥莉薇地手和脚。教师将参考图发给幼儿，邀请他们选择自己喜欢的图案制作奥莉薇的衣服和装饰。
伯闻在教师的指引下制作好奥莉薇的身体后。教师递给他一个报纸卷，他问到：“这个是做什么的？”教师邀请他看看奥莉薇模型，猜猜报纸卷的用途。他看了看，说：“是它的鼻子。”他将一块小的黏土放到桌上揉搓，然后压成一个‘小饼’，他用黏土饼将报纸卷包裹起来，粘贴到奥莉薇身上制作了奥莉薇的鼻子。他将奥莉薇的手脚粘贴好后，说：“我要给奥莉薇做一件衣服，我要红色的衣服。”说完，他拿取了一些红色黏土，揉成长条后压扁，粘贴到奥莉薇身上。“我还要一些橙色和蓝色。”说完，他又将一些红色、蓝色黏土叠加到奥莉薇的身上制作奥莉薇的衣服。
interpretation: 伯闻能够跟着教师的讲解，一步一步地使用粘土发挥自己的想象力制作手工奥莉薇。在教师的引导下，能够在制作过程中，耐心思考如何将粘土揉搓成不同的形状大小、进行颜色搭配等。

title: 手工奥莉薇
description:
教师将奥莉薇手工展示给幼儿，鼓励他们观察立体的奥莉薇模型。然后出示手工所需要的材料，粘土、塑料鸡蛋、弹珠等材料。教师带领幼儿一步一步地制作奥莉薇手工。首先将肉色粘土揉成球，然后像摊印度煎饼一样在桌上展开。待他们摊开后，将粘土包裹在鸡蛋上。包裹好后，使用粘土和报纸卷制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，将粘土揉成四个“迷你小香肠”制作奥莉薇地手和脚。教师将参考图发给幼儿，邀请他们选择自己喜欢的图案制作奥莉薇的衣服和装饰。
欣颖用黏制作好奥莉薇的身体后，她又将黏土揉成球，又用手掌按压成饼。她将报纸卷用黏土卷起来后，粘贴到透明鸡蛋上制作奥莉薇的鼻子。之后，她发现奥莉薇的身体还有空白处。她用手指推挤黏土的厚重处，将多余的黏土推挤到空白处。待她制作好奥莉薇的手和脚后。她说：“我想要做裙子，要粉色的裙子。”说完，她拿取了一些粉色黏土，揉搓成条再按压成片。她将粉色的黏土片粘贴到奥莉薇身上。她问道：“怎么做花朵？”教师引导她将黏土揉成球，然后用手指按压几个凹口制作花瓣。她取来一些蓝色贴到花朵的中心制作花蕊。她说：“要做一个crown。”教师告诉她是皇冠，她说：“我要做一个彩色的皇冠给奥莉薇。”她笑着说：“我要放在它的鼻子。”她先用黄色黏土做了一个条，在条上贴了一些揉搓成球的彩色圆球。她将做好的皇冠放到奥莉薇的鼻子上，她说：“这个很有趣，我喜欢我的奥莉薇。”
interpretation: 欣颖能够跟着教师的讲解，一步一步地使用粘土发挥自己的想象力制作手工奥莉薇。在教师的引导下，能够在制作过程中，耐心思考如何将粘土揉搓成不同的形状大小、进行颜色搭配等。

title: Work Sample: Tin foil painting
description:
To foster the children's interest in art, they were invited to unleash their creativity and use different coloured paints (e.g., red, yellow, green) to paint on the tin foil. During the art process, Jumaius was able to experience painting on a different texture as well as explore colour mixing while painting. Afterwards, he was provided with cellophane papers to add another layer of sensory engagement. This activity allows the children to use various art media to create their unique tin foil artwork. 

Jumaius shared, "Red, green" with the teacher's prompts.

title: Work sample: My Christmas tree
description:
To foster the children's interest in art, they were invited to create a Christmas tree using toilet rolls and green paint. Levelle was encouraged to dip the toilet roll into the paint and stamp it onto her paper, creating the Christmas tree. Afterwards, she was provided with various art materials such as pompom balls, round stickers, and a golden star sticker to decorate the Christmas tree. This activity allows the children to use various art media to create their Christmas tree.

Levelle shared, "Blue" with the teacher's prompts.

title: 颜色排序
description:
教师带领幼儿观察一些不同风格的绘画作品，鼓励他们细心观察。通过讨论，引导他们注意颜色的不同层次。例如，画面中有些部分使用了明亮的色调，而其他部分则使用了较深的颜色。从而引出颜色深浅的概念。教师出示色块，请幼儿观察这些颜色，带领他们从深到浅或从浅到深排列这些色块。之后，教师请幼儿创作色彩排序画，鼓励幼儿使用水彩颜料，按照从深到浅或者从浅到深的顺序选择颜料盘里的颜色，绘制出自己喜欢的图形进行排序。最后，教师邀请幼儿选择一种排序方式，将6张深浅不一的色卡按照选择的方式进行排序。
嘉乐问道：“Is it from dark to light?"教师告诉他dark是深，light是浅。他复述道：“Dark深，light浅，从深到浅。”教师邀请他从水彩颜料盘里选择5个颜色，进行深浅排序。他指着色彩盘里的蓝色看向教师，教师告诉他可以，但是下一个颜色要比这个颜色更浅。他蘸取一些蓝色，他一边画一边说：“Rabbit。”教师问他华文是什么。他说：“兔子。”教师夸他真棒。他笑着有蘸取了一些红色画到蓝色的前面。教师问他红色深还是蓝色深，他抿着嘴笑着不回答。教师告诉他是蓝色深，所以红色应该在蓝色的后面。他点点头，继续选颜色。等他完成绘制后，教师出示两个白板，介绍上面写的排序要求。嘉乐指着从浅到深说：“这个。”教师告诉他是从浅到深，他复述道：“从浅到深。”他拿起卡片看了看，教师告诉他白色是浅色。他将白色放在最前面，接着是黄色、绿色、粉红色。教师提醒他仔细观察绿色和粉红色哪个更浅，他看了看，将绿色和粉红色的位置调换了一下。
interpretation: 嘉乐通过观察绘画作品学习颜色的变化，学会了区分颜色的深浅。在教师的引导下，通过动手实践，选取色彩盘里的颜色和色卡按照要求排序，加深了对颜色深浅的理解，逐渐培养了对艺术作品色彩运用的感知力。

title: 颜色排序
description:
教师带领幼儿观察一些不同风格的绘画作品，鼓励他们细心观察。通过讨论，引导他们注意颜色的不同层次。例如，画面中有些部分使用了明亮的色调，而其他部分则使用了较深的颜色。从而引出颜色深浅的概念。教师出示色块，请幼儿观察这些颜色，带领他们从深到浅或从浅到深排列这些色块。之后，教师请幼儿创作色彩排序画，鼓励幼儿使用水彩颜料，按照从深到浅或者从浅到深的顺序选择颜料盘里的颜色，绘制出自己喜欢的图形进行排序。最后，教师邀请幼儿选择一种排序方式，将6张深浅不一的色卡按照选择的方式进行排序。
教师问欣颖想要绘制怎样的颜色排序。欣颖说：“我想要从浅到深。”然后她看了看水彩颜料盘，说：“纸already白色了，白色看不到。”教师告诉她最浅的颜色可以用其他颜色代替白色。她又看了看水彩颜料，说：“我可
以用黄色。”教师点点头。她先蘸取了一些黄色，绘制到白纸上，她一边画，一边说：“我要画月亮。”说完，她继续绘制了起来。待她完成后，教师邀请她选择一个白板上的颜色排序，她指着一个白板说：“我要这个，从深到浅。”说完，她从卡片堆里找出黑色卡片，放置到文字的下方。接着，她分别摆放了蓝色、绿色、粉色、黄色和白色。完成排序后，她说：“我好啦。”
interpretation: 欣颖通过观察绘画作品学习颜色的变化，学会了区分颜色的深浅。还通过动手实践，选取色彩盘里的颜色和色卡按照要求排序，加深了对颜色深浅的理解，逐渐培养了对艺术作品色彩运用的感知力。
