title: I can tell a story
description:
Devan and Tresor was exploring the character puppets from the book 'Painting a Picture' during Guided Reading session. He and Tresor opened the puppet bag and took out all the puppets. Whilst doing so, Devan looked at Tresor and said " See, she draw the mountain." as he was pulling out the puppets. Tresor replied him and said "yes, then later she will pant more things" In which, Devan responded and said "ya, have cow, then river also."

Once they are done with taking out all the puppets, Devan and Tresor described the various puppets to one another as they took turns to become the painter in the book and shared what they had painted. 

As they kept away the puppets after the exploration, Tresor asked Devan " you like to paint?" Devan answered that he liked painting and that he liked the colour red.
interpretation:
From the brief interaction that Devan had with his peer, he had displayed the ability to gain meaning by listening as Tresor shared about her knowledge on the guided reading book. 


He was also able to express himself clearly as his peers understood what he was sharing and responded accurately. However, he would need to work on his vovubulary bank as he tended to speak to speak in short sentences.

learning_goals.title: Gain meaning by listening.
Use expanded vocabulary and language for a variety of purposes.
Speak clearly and convey ideas effectively.

title: 颜色排序
description:
教师带领幼儿观察一些不同风格的绘画作品，鼓励他们细心观察。通过讨论，引导他们注意颜色的不同层次。例如，画面中有些部分使用了明亮的色调，而其他部分则使用了较深的颜色。从而引出颜色深浅的概念。教师出示色块，请幼儿观察这些颜色，带领他们从深到浅或从浅到深排列这些色块。之后，教师请幼儿创作色彩排序画，鼓励幼儿使用水彩颜料，按照从深到浅或者从浅到深的顺序选择颜料盘里的颜色，绘制出自己喜欢的图形进行排序。最后，教师邀请幼儿选择一种排序方式，将6张深浅不一的色卡按照选择的方式进行排序。
教师邀请伯闻参与活动。伯闻说：“我要从浅到深。”说完，他用笔蘸取一些黄色颜料，说：“我要用黄色，因为白色看不见。”他一边画，一边说：“我画一个黄色的正方形，绿色的三角形。”他看了看颜料盘，说：“下一个我要Orange。”教师请他使用华文。他说：“我要橙色的长方形。”说完，他蘸取了一些橙色颜料绘制了一个长方形。待他绘制好后，教师为伯闻展示两个白板。教师问他想要用哪种排序排列颜色的深浅。他看了看白板，指着其中一个白板说：“我要这个，从深到浅。”教师将卡片递给他，他看了看卡片，选出黑色卡片放到白板上的空白处。接着，他放置了蓝色，粉色。教师鼓励他仔细观察粉色和绿色卡片的深浅。他看了看，说：“绿色深。”他将绿色和粉色卡片调换了位置，继续将剩下的卡片排好。
interpretation: 伯闻通过观察绘画作品学习颜色的变化，学会了区分颜色的深浅。还通过动手实践，选取色彩盘里的颜色和色卡按照要求排序，加深了对颜色深浅的理解，逐渐培养了对艺术作品色彩运用的感知力。

title: 颜色排序
description:
教师带领幼儿观察一些不同风格的绘画作品，鼓励他们细心观察。通过讨论，引导他们注意颜色的不同层次。例如，画面中有些部分使用了明亮的色调，而其他部分则使用了较深的颜色。从而引出颜色深浅的概念。教师出示色块，请幼儿观察这些颜色，带领他们从深到浅或从浅到深排列这些色块。之后，教师请幼儿创作色彩排序画，鼓励幼儿使用水彩颜料，按照从深到浅或者从浅到深的顺序选择颜料盘里的颜色，绘制出自己喜欢的图形进行排序。最后，教师邀请幼儿选择一种排序方式，将6张深浅不一的色卡按照选择的方式进行排序。
教师将白纸递给家乐，他拿起笔刷，蘸取了一些黑色颜料。教师问他要画哪种顺序，他说：“我要从深到浅。”他在纸上画了一个图案，他说：“是兔子。”说完，他又蘸取了棕色、蓝色。教师告诉他棕色不够深可以多少一点水，多一些颜料就会比蓝色深了。他听后点点头，继续画了一个黄色和一个白色的兔子。画好后，他在纸上仿写出了从深到浅四个字。教师出示两个分别写有从深到浅和从浅到深的白板邀请他选择一个排序方式。他指着一个白板说：“我要这个。”教师问他白板上的内容。他说：“从深到浅。”说完后，他开始将颜色卡按照从深到浅的顺序排列起来。
interpretation: 家乐通过观察绘画作品学习颜色的变化，学会了区分颜色的深浅。还通过动手实践，选取色彩盘里的颜色和色卡按照要求排序，加深了对颜色深浅的理解，逐渐培养了对艺术作品色彩运用的感知力。

慈恩告诉教师：“我要画星星。”说完，她蘸取了一些粉红色颜料在白纸上画出一颗粉色的星星。她说：“我要从浅到深，这个是很浅的粉红色。”说完，她看了看颜料，说：“我要橙色。”她又在纸上画出一颗橙色的星星。待她画完后，她说：“谢老师，你看。我画好了，从浅到深。”教师出示两块分别写有从深到浅和从浅到深的白板，问她想要进行哪个排列顺序。她看了看，指着其中一块白板说道：“我要这个，从深到浅。”说完，她观察了一下卡片。然后拿出黑色卡片放在最前面，她一边放，一边说：“黑色，蓝色，绿色，粉色，黄色，白色。我好了。”
interpretation: 慈恩通过观察绘画作品学习颜色的变化，学会了区分颜色的深浅。还通过动手实践，选取色彩盘里的颜色和色卡按照要求排序，加深了对颜色深浅的理解，逐渐培养了对艺术作品色彩运用的感知力。

title: 颜色排序
description:
教师带领幼儿观察一些不同风格的绘画作品，鼓励他们细心观察。通过讨论，引导他们注意颜色的不同层次。例如，画面中有些部分使用了明亮的色调，而其他部分则使用了较深的颜色。从而引出颜色深浅的概念。教师出示色块，请幼儿观察这些颜色，带领他们从深到浅或从浅到深排列这些色块。之后，教师请幼儿创作色彩排序画，鼓励幼儿使用水彩颜料，按照从深到浅或者从浅到深的顺序选择颜料盘里的颜色，绘制出自己喜欢的图形进行排序。最后，教师邀请幼儿选择一种排序方式，将6张深浅不一的色卡按照选择的方式进行排序。
子萱看了看水彩颜料盘，蘸取了一些黑色画在白纸上。接着，她又蘸取了棕色。教师问她使用的哪种排列方式。她说：“Dark to light。”教师告诉她是从深到浅。她复述道：“是从深到浅。”她画到最后一个时，又蘸取了一次粉色。教师问她为什么还要用粉色。她说：“我放多水，它就边light了。”说完，她将粉色绘制到白纸上。待她完成后，教师为她展示两块分别写有从浅到深和从深到浅的白板。教师问她要选哪一种排列方式。她说：“我要从浅到深。”教师问她是那一块白板，她看了看说：“不知道。”教师指着白板上的字，邀请她一起读：“从浅到深。”读完，她开始翻找卡片。她将白色放置到最前面，接着依次放置了黄色、粉色、绿色、蓝色和黑色。放好后，她说：“我好了。”
interpretation: 子萱通过观察绘画作品学习颜色的变化，学会了区分颜色的深浅。还通过动手实践，选取色彩盘里的颜色和色卡按照要求排序，加深了对颜色深浅的理解，逐渐培养了对艺术作品色彩运用的感知力。

title: 颜色排序
description:
教师带领幼儿观察一些不同风格的绘画作品，鼓励他们细心观察。通过讨论，引导他们注意颜色的不同层次。例如，画面中有些部分使用了明亮的色调，而其他部分则使用了较深的颜色。从而引出颜色深浅的概念。教师出示色块，请幼儿观察这些颜色，带领他们从深到浅或从浅到深排列这些色块。之后，教师请幼儿创作色彩排序画，鼓励幼儿使用水彩颜料，按照从深到浅或者从浅到深的顺序选择颜料盘里的颜色，绘制出自己喜欢的图形进行排序。最后，教师邀请幼儿选择一种排序方式，将6张深浅不一的色卡按照选择的方式进行排序。
思婷接过教师递给她白纸后，蘸取了一些黑色，然后在白纸上画了一个兔子头，她说：“我在画兔子，因为我喜欢兔子。”教师问她想要画哪一种排序。她说：“我想要画深色先。”她继续选择颜色画着，她蘸取了白色画了最后一个兔子头。她看了看，说：“白色看不到。”然后她有蘸取了黑色颜料，将白色那一边涂成了黑色。教师问她为什么这样画，她答道：“因为是黑色，白色就看得到了。”教师夸奖她很棒。教师将两块分别写有‘从深到浅’和‘从浅到深’得白板放置到她面前，问她想要选择哪种方式将色卡排序。她说：“我要从深到浅。”教师问她是哪一个白板。她指着其中一块白板说：“是这个。”说完，她将6张色卡按照从深到浅得顺序排列起来。
interpretation: 思婷通过观察绘画作品学习颜色的变化，学会了区分颜色的深浅。还通过动手实践，选取色彩盘里的颜色和色卡按照要求排序，加深了对颜色深浅的理解，逐渐培养了对艺术作品色彩运用的感知力。

title: 颜色排序
description:
教师带领幼儿观察一些不同风格的绘画作品，鼓励他们细心观察。通过讨论，引导他们注意颜色的不同层次。例如，画面中有些部分使用了明亮的色调，而其他部分则使用了较深的颜色。从而引出颜色深浅的概念。教师出示色块，请幼儿观察这些颜色，带领他们从深到浅或从浅到深排列这些色块。之后，教师请幼儿创作色彩排序画，鼓励幼儿使用水彩颜料，按照从深到浅或者从浅到深的顺序选择颜料盘里的颜色，绘制出自己喜欢的图形进行排序。
教师将白纸递给家乐，他用笔刷蘸取了一些黑色颜料在纸上画出一个黑色圆圈，他一边画，一边说：“我要画pokemon的，这是一个pokemon ball。”教师告诉他ball的华文是球。他说道：“我画的球，我要画一个eevee。”说完，他蘸取了一些紫色在白纸上画了一个轮廓。教师告他紫色太浅了，之后很难找到更浅的颜色。他问道：“How？”教师请他看看调色盘里的紫色，请他看看自己的笔刷。他看后说：“太多水了。”教师点点头，请他再蘸取一些紫色填充到图案中。他填好后，又使用了橙色、黄色。他指着白色说：“这个看不见。”教师告诉他白色已经沾染到其他颜色并请他试试看。他蘸取了白色，在纸上画下一个图案。他说：“可以。”教师问他选择的哪种排列顺序，他说：“From light to dark."教师告诉他是从浅到深，他复述了：“从浅到深。”教师指正他从浅到深第一个颜色应该是白色。他指着作品说：“From 这边。”
interpretation: 家乐通过观察绘画作品学习颜色的变化，学会了区分颜色的深浅。还通过动手实践，选取色彩盘里的颜色和色卡按照要求排序，加深了对颜色深浅的理解，逐渐培养了对艺术作品色彩运用的感知力。

title: Exploring with coloured blocks
description:
During outdoor time, Jumaius was engaged in an exploration activity using see-through coloured blocks (e.g. red, blue, green, and yellow) to look at the world around them. He took a yellow coloured block and held it up to the light, observing how they changed the appearance of the environment around him. 

The teacher went over to him and asked, "What colour did you see around you, Jumaius?" He responded by pointing in front of him. The teacher prompted him, "Did you see the colour yellow? Say yellow." Jumaius nodded and said softly, "Yellow." The teacher acknowledged him and expanded on his words, "Yes, you see yellow! Let's try looking at the trees over there! What did you see?" Jumaius smiled and said, "Tree!" The teacher nodded and passed Jumaius a red coloured block, "What happens if we look through the red one?" 

He took the red coloured block from the teacher, prompting him to continue his exploration.
interpretation:
Throughout the activity, Jumaius demonstrated curiosity, problem-solving, and sensory exploration. The teacher's warm presence and guided questioning supported his sense of security and attachment, allowing him to engage in the activity in a safe and secure environment.


By being present and interacting with him, the teacher was able to make Jumaius feel valued and supported as he moved around the outdoor area and explored with ease. Additionally, the interaction with the teacher also helped to foster attachment and trust as the teacher reinforced Jumaius' confidence in exploring and expressing his thoughts. The shared enjoyment of exploration supports a positive teacher-child relationship, hence reinforcing the teacher's role as both a guide and a secure attachment figure. Moreover, Jumaius also demonstrated respect as he was able to listen attentively to the teacher's questions and responded appropriately.

learning_goals.title: Foster interactions, attachment and relationships with adults 通过与成人的互动，建立依恋和良好的关系。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: 颜色排序
description:
教师带领幼儿观察一些不同风格的绘画作品，鼓励他们细心观察。通过讨论，引导他们注意颜色的不同层次。例如，画面中有些部分使用了明亮的色调，而其他部分则使用了较深的颜色。从而引出颜色深浅的概念。教师出示色块，请幼儿观察这些颜色，带领他们从深到浅或从浅到深排列这些色块。之后，教师请幼儿创作色彩排序画，鼓励幼儿使用水彩颜料，按照从深到浅或者从浅到深的顺序选择颜料盘里的颜色，绘制出自己喜欢的图形进行排序。
教师将白纸递给礼宣，他拿起笔刷蘸取了一些黄色，然后在白纸上画出一个黄色的长方形。然后他又黄色的后面画了一个绿色。教师问他先要绘制哪种排列顺序。他说：“从深到浅。”教师告诉他黄色以及很浅了，绿色笔黄色深。他问道：“怎么办？”教师告诉他可以在黄色里添加一些蓝色，让它变得更深。他蘸取了一些覆盖到黄色上。待他画完后，教师问他为什么选择从深到浅但是画的是从浅到深，他说：“是从这边的。”教师带点点头，邀请他选择一个排列顺序进行色卡排序活动。他说：“我要从深到浅。”教师问他哪一块白板写着从深到浅。他指着其中一块白板问道：“是这个吗？”教师点点头，邀请他一起读：“从深到浅。”读完后，教师邀请他开始排序。他先将黑色卡片放置到第一个，接着，依次放置了蓝色、绿色、黄色、粉色。教师提醒他仔细看看黄色和粉色那个更深。他看了看，将黄色的和粉色调换了位置，最后放置了白色卡片。
interpretation: 礼宣通过观察绘画作品学习颜色的变化，学会了区分颜色的深浅。还通过动手实践，选取色彩盘里的颜色和色卡按照要求排序，加深了对颜色深浅的理解，逐渐培养了对艺术作品色彩运用的感知力。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 表达：能针对某一个话题展开讨论。
参照下面要求把三个或更多东西排序：颜色的深浅（如：从浅到深）

title: 颜色排序
description:
教师带领幼儿观察一些不同风格的绘画作品，鼓励他们细心观察。通过讨论，引导他们注意颜色的不同层次。例如，画面中有些部分使用了明亮的色调，而其他部分则使用了较深的颜色。从而引出颜色深浅的概念。教师出示色块，请幼儿观察这些颜色，带领他们从深到浅或从浅到深排列这些色块。之后，教师请幼儿创作色彩排序画，鼓励幼儿使用水彩颜料，按照从深到浅或者从浅到深的顺序选择颜料盘里的颜色，绘制出自己喜欢的图形进行排序。
馨琪接过白纸，她说道：“我要画从浅到深。”然后，她蘸取了一些黄色，在白纸上画出一个黄色的圆形，她说：“你看，我画的黄色的圆形。”接着，她又蘸取了一些粉色，她一边画，一边说：“我要画粉色和紫色。”待她画好后，她在白纸上仿写出了从浅到深，她一边写，一边说：“从浅到深，我好啦。”教师将两块分别写有从浅到深和从深到浅的白板放置到她面前，问她想要选择哪种排列方式进行色卡排序活动。她说：“我要从深到浅。”教师问她那一块白板写了这个排列顺序。她指着其中一块白板说：“是这个。”教师点点头，将色卡递给她。她接过色卡，排列起来。她先将黑色卡放置到最前面，接着是蓝色、绿色、粉色、黄色、最后是白色。
interpretation: 馨琪通过观察绘画作品学习颜色的变化，学会了区分颜色的深浅。还通过动手实践，选取色彩盘里的颜色和色卡按照要求排序，加深了对颜色深浅的理解，逐渐培养了对艺术作品色彩运用的感知力。

title: 这是谁的水壶
description: 老师邀请幼儿将他们的水壶放在一起，带领幼儿玩游戏《这是谁的水壶》。老师一个一个指着水壶，请幼儿说出这是谁的水壶？老师指到耀曦的水壶问：“这是谁的水壶？”耀曦马上回答：“耀曦的。”接着老师让耀曦自己拿起一个朋友的水壶，老师问：“这是谁的水壶？”耀熙回答：“Husna的水壶。”老师说：“对，是Husna的水壶，请你把水壶给她好吗？”耀曦把水壶递给了Husna。老师说：“谢谢耀曦！”
interpretation: 从《这是谁的水壶》活动中，当老师指到耀曦的水壶问是谁的水壶时，耀曦马上回答自己的名字；老师请他拿起朋友的水壶并说说是谁的水壶时，耀曦也能够认出水壶是谁的，说出朋友的名字；把水壶给朋友，耀曦能够指认自己和朋友的物品，展现出耀曦的自我意识和对他人的认识进一步增强。

learning_goals.title: Foster sense of self (telling others their names) 培养自我意识，如：说出自己的名字等。
Foster sense of others (saying out the names of their peers) 培养对他人的认识，如：说出同伴的名字等。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: I can Sort!
description:
Children was split into smaller groups and were invited to sort one attribute of their choice during lesson. 

Devan choose to sort by colour and picked orange. He then proceeded to take all the orange patterning blocks from the tray. As he was picking all the orange blocks, he told the teacher that he was going to make an orange flower.

Teacher then asked him what are the other attributes that he can sort other then colour. He replied that other than colours, he can sort by big and small, long and short too. Teacher then tried guiding him and said "how about you sort all the blocks that are orange and big." Devan responded by looking at the shape blocks in the tray  and shaking his head. He then continued to build his orange flower. 

Once he was done, he turned to the teacher and said "done!, I used all the orange blocks make flower!"
interpretation:
Through the activity, Devan displayed his ability in being able to sort in accorande to simple attribute such as colour. He was able to do so independently and was able to articulate the attribute of his choice as well. 


However, he is still in the process of being able to sort items according to two attributues as he would got confused when asked to do so.

learning_goals.title: Sort objects according to two attributes (e.g: colour and shape, colour and size).
Sort objects by simple features (e.g: texture or material)

title: 颜色排序
description:
教师带领幼儿观察一些不同风格的绘画作品，鼓励他们细心观察。通过讨论，引导他们注意颜色的不同层次。例如，画面中有些部分使用了明亮的色调，而其他部分则使用了较深的颜色。从而引出颜色深浅的概念。教师出示色块，请幼儿观察这些颜色，带领他们从深到浅或从浅到深排列这些色块。之后，教师请幼儿创作色彩排序画，鼓励幼儿使用水彩颜料，按照从深到浅或者从浅到深的顺序选择颜料盘里的颜色，绘制出自己喜欢的图形进行排序。
玫柔接过白纸后开始画了起来，她一边画，一边说：“你看，我画了兔子。是黑的兔子。”接着她又画了黑色。教师问她用的是哪种排列顺序。她答道：“是从深到浅。”说完后，她继续画着。当她画到第四个黄色时，她说：“我画的是爱心，但是没有位置了。”教师告诉她可以画到下面，她说：“好的。”然后她画了一个白色的爱心，画完她又使用倒序画了四个彩色爱心。教师告诉她添加了这四个爱心就不是从深到浅了。她笑着说：“哦，我知道了。”教师将两块分别写有从深到浅和从浅到深的白板放到她身前，问她想要选择哪种排列方式来排列色卡。她指着其中一个白板说：“是这个。”说完，她开始排列了起来。
interpretation: 玫柔通过观察绘画作品学习颜色的变化，学会了区分颜色的深浅。还通过动手实践，选取色彩盘里的颜色和色卡按照要求排序，加深了对颜色深浅的理解，逐渐培养了对艺术作品色彩运用的感知力。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: 量词配对
description:
教师出示奥莉薇的着装图，带领他们一起讨论奥莉薇的衣服和饰品。然后邀请幼儿分享他们最喜欢的服装，鼓励他们分享自己的穿戴，引导他们关注这类物品。接着，告诉幼儿，“今天我们要学一种有趣的东西，叫做‘量词’。量词是用来数东西的，比如帽子，我们用‘一顶’来数。展示每一件服饰物品，并解释与其配套的量词。将量词卡片（如“顶”、“双”等）与相应的服饰物品放在桌子上，邀请幼儿根据物品选择正确的量词卡片并配对。
教师邀请媖绮参与活动，媖绮看了看卡片上的图片说：“我知道这个，奥莉薇红色的裙子。”教师邀请她找出字卡-裙子，并粘贴到活动板上。她看了看，拿起一张卡片说：“裙子。”待她贴好后，教师问她裙子应该用哪个量词，她答道：“一个裙子。”教师告诉她应该是一条裙子，并邀请她将字卡-条贴到活动板上。教师又出示一张图卡，问媖绮奥莉薇手上有什么。她说：“手套。”她看了看，从卡片堆里选出拿出字卡-手套贴到活动板上，教师问她手套要用什么量词，她想了想，说：“是一双。”她看了看字卡，手在量词卡中间徘徊。教师提醒双字是两个一样的字组合在一起。她拿起字卡-双，贴到了制定地点。然后读道：“一双手套。”
interpretation: 媖绮能够说出一些常见的服饰和量词的名称，能够理解不同物品对应了不同的量词，并将服饰和量词进行搭配。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：能够积极主动地用华语表达，态度自然。
由幼儿自行选择属性配对物品。

title: 量词配对
description:
教师出示奥莉薇的着装图，带领他们一起讨论奥莉薇的衣服和饰品。然后邀请幼儿分享他们最喜欢的服装，鼓励他们分享自己的穿戴，引导他们关注这类物品。接着，告诉幼儿，“今天我们要学一种有趣的东西，叫做‘量词’。量词是用来数东西的，比如帽子，我们用‘一顶’来数。展示每一件服饰物品，并解释与其配套的量词。将量词卡片（如“顶”、“双”等）与相应的服饰物品放在桌子上，邀请幼儿根据物品选择正确的量词卡片并配对。
恺骏做好后，他问道：“这个是什么？”教师告诉他是量词配对游戏。教师指着活动板上奥莉薇的卡片问他奥莉薇背着什么。他答道：“帽子。”教师邀请他找出帽子的字卡。他看了一会儿，说：“我不知道。”教师告诉他帽子有个子字，他拿起裙子和帽子的字卡问道：“是哪一个？”教师指着帽子的字卡邀请他一起读。他读道：“帽子。”然后将卡片贴到活动板上。教师问他帽子对应的量词是什么，他说：”一个帽子。”教师告诉他是一顶帽子。他将顶字贴好后，读道：“一顶帽子。”教师又将一张图片贴到活动板上，问他是什么。他说：“是书包。”教师邀请他找出书包的字卡，贴到指定的地方。他看了看字卡堆，想了想，指着书包的字卡问道：“是这个吗？”教师点点头。教师问他书包对应的量词是什么。他说：“一个。”然后他拿起字卡-个，贴到活动板上。
interpretation: 恺骏能够说出一些常见的服饰和量词的名称，能够理解不同物品对应了不同的量词，并将服饰和量词进行搭配。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：能够积极主动地用华语表达，态度自然。
由幼儿自行选择属性配对物品。

title: 这是谁的水壶
description: 老师邀请幼儿将他们的水壶放在一起，带领幼儿玩游戏《这是谁的水壶》。老师一个一个指着水壶，请幼儿说出这是谁的水壶？老师指到轩宇的水壶问：“这是谁的水壶？”轩宇马上回答：“ Zephyr 的。”老师说：“是刘轩宇的水壶吗？”轩宇回答：“是，刘轩宇的。”，接着，老师让他自己拿起一个朋友的水壶，老师问：“这是谁的水壶？”轩宇看看拿起的水壶回答：“Maya的。”老师说：“说对了，是Maya的水壶，请你把水壶给Maya 好吗？” 轩宇把水壶递给了Maya。老师说：“谢谢轩宇！”
interpretation: 从《这是谁的水壶》活动中，当老师指到轩宇的水壶，问是谁的水壶时，轩宇马上回答自己的名字；老师请他拿起朋友的水壶并说说是谁的水壶时，轩宇也能够认出水壶是谁的，并说出朋友的名字；把水壶递给朋友，轩宇能够指认自己和朋友的物品，展现出轩宇的自我意识和对他人的认识进一步增强。

title: 量词配对
description:
教师出示奥莉薇的着装图，带领他们一起讨论奥莉薇的衣服和饰品。然后邀请幼儿分享他们最喜欢的服装，鼓励他们分享自己的穿戴，引导他们关注这类物品。接着，告诉幼儿，“今天我们要学一种有趣的东西，叫做‘量词’。量词是用来数东西的，比如帽子，我们用‘一顶’来数。展示每一件服饰物品，并解释与其配套的量词。将量词卡片（如“顶”、“双”等）与相应的服饰物品放在桌子上，邀请幼儿根据物品选择正确的量词卡片并配对。
教师邀请维恩参与活动。维恩坐下来后，笑着说：“是奥莉薇，我喜欢奥莉薇。”教师指着图片上的奥莉薇问她奥莉薇背上背的是什么。维恩看了看，说：“是书包。”教师邀请她找出字卡-书包，贴到活动板上。她看了一眼，从字卡中拿出字卡-书包贴到制定地方。教师问她书包对应的量词是什么，她说：“是一个书包。”然后她拿起字卡-个贴到制定地方。教师更换一张图片，问她这次奥莉薇穿的什么。她说：“是裙子。”然后她拿起字卡-裙子贴到活动板上。教师问她裙子对应的量词是什么，她说：“是一条。”她拿起字卡-条说：“是这个。”贴好后，她读道：“一条裙子。”教师夸奖她很棒。
interpretation: 维恩能够说出一些常见的服饰和量词的名称，能够理解不同物品对应了不同的量词，并将服饰和量词进行搭配。

title: Artwork sample: Butterfly Craft with Cake Filters
description:
Children created their own beautiful butterflies using cake filters! The process starts with children scribbling various shapes and patterns onto the cake filter with colourful markers. Once the design is complete, they drop some water onto the filter paper, watching in awe as the ink spreads and creates a stunning, blended effect across the paper. 

The filter paper was then folded in a pleated manner to form the wings of a butterfly.

This craft introduces children to the concept of how colours can blend and spread when water is added. It is also a way to develop their fine motor skills and understanding of cause and effect to foster an interest in art.

"What colours do you see in your butterfly?" the teacher asked.
"Black and pink," replied Matteo.

children.fullname: Matteo Wong Zi Lun(Huang Zi Lun)

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: Animal Finger Puppet Play- Old MacDonald
description:
Cole is engaged in a finger puppet play through a song “Old MacDonald Had a Farm”. Educarer provided him with animal finger puppets for him to manipulate and explore with.

Cole was sitting on the floor in front of his educarer. Educarer invited him while prompting him the animal puppets arranged on the wooden puppet holder, “Cole, look what I have? I have many animals. Cole smiled in response and excitedly took the duck. “Oh, you like the duck.” Educarer said. Cole giggled gaily and babbled “du duck” while showing it to his educarer. “Yes! That’s right. It’s a duck.” Educarer answered him back. He then manipulated the duck and inserted it into his finger. Educarer started singing, “Old MacDonald had a farm, e, i, e, i,o. And on his farm he had some ducks, e, i, e, i o.” Cole was smiling and swayed his body left to right while listening to his educarer. With a duck puppet on his finger, he also moved it up and down. “Oh! Good dancing Cole.” Educarer praised him. After playing with the duck, he took the dog and said “du duck”. Educarer told him, “Cole, it’s a dog.” and continued singing the song “with a woof woof here and a woof woof there”. Cole tried babbling the sound “oof oof”. “Yes, you are right. The dog says, “woof, woof”, educarer explained. He then continued dancing while manipulating the puppet as educarer sang the song. 

Cole took the pig and also picked up the horse puppet on his other hand. He extended his left arm and showed the pig puppet to his educarer while saying “du duck”. “Oh! Oh! That’s a pig. And the pig says, “Oink! Oink!” educarer explained. As educarer continued singing, Cole stood up and bounced his body up and down. He was smiling and giggling while stomping his feet and swaying his hands with the puppets. “Wow! Good dancing Cole.” Educarer applauded him.
interpretation:
• Cole displayed strong interests in animals. He expressed his enjoyment in playing and manipulating the animal finger puppets during puppet play. He displayed high level of happiness, trust, confidence, curiosity and positive interactions during the activity.
  • He also shown strong interests in music and movements. He loves and enjoys dancing as he listened to songs and music.
  • Cole demonstrated good social interactions towards his educarer and sustained involvement during the activity. He was able to respond with enjoyment to his educarer through smiling, giggling, babbling and hand gestures.

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: 量词配对
description:
教师出示奥莉薇的着装图，带领他们一起讨论奥莉薇的衣服和饰品。然后邀请幼儿分享他们最喜欢的服装，鼓励他们分享自己的穿戴，引导他们关注这类物品。接着，告诉幼儿，“今天我们要学一种有趣的东西，叫做‘量词’。量词是用来数东西的，比如帽子，我们用‘一顶’来数。展示每一件服饰物品，并解释与其配套的量词。将量词卡片（如“顶”、“双”等）与相应的服饰物品放在桌子上，邀请幼儿根据物品选择正确的量词卡片并配对。
教师邀请彦申参与活动，她坐好后，教师指着图片问她奥莉薇穿的什么。她说：“衣服。”教师告诉她是上衣，她复述道：“上衣。”教师邀请她将上衣的字卡找出来并贴到活动板的指定位置。她看了看字卡，拿起一张字卡说：“这个是上衣。”然后贴好。教师问她上衣对应的量词是什么。她说：“是一件。”说完，她在量词字卡里寻找件字。她拿起一张字卡问教师：“是这个吗？”教师指着件字，邀请她一起读她读道：“件。”待她贴好后，她读道：“一件上衣。”教师又出示一张图片问她奥莉薇戴了什么，她说：“手套。”她将手套的字卡贴好后，教师问她手套对应的量词是什么，她说：“是一双。”然后她拿起字卡-双，贴到指定位置后。她读道：“一双手套。”
interpretation: 彦申能够说出一些常见的服饰和量词的名称，能够理解不同物品对应了不同的量词，并将服饰和量词进行搭配。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：能够积极主动地用华语表达，态度自然。
由幼儿自行选择属性配对物品。

title: Read and Sequence
description:
During the Lit Attack activity, the children engaged in reading a passage with decodable words and worked together to interpret its meaning. After reading, they were tasked with matching pictures to the sentences. Bowen began by reading the first sentence from the passage slowly, “Tim is a… kid.” After reading, Bowen turned to the images to find the matching picture. A friend noticed a picture of a boy and passed it to him. Bowen responded, “Yes, thank you.”

Bowen listened and observed attentively as his peers continued reading the passage. On his next turn, he read the sentence, “Tim… got his bag… with… a… zip.” He immediately picked up a picture of a bag and placed it in box number four.

Bowen worked collaboratively with his peers, checking each picture they picked up to ensure it matched the correct sentence. The group observed reasoning and discussed the order of their pictures. They re-reading the sentences carefully and reviewed the pictures to confirm their choices.
interpretation:
Bowen is developing his early reading and comprehension skills, demonstrating confidence in decoding simple sentences. During the Lit Attack activity, he read each sentence carefully, taking calculated pauses to blend the sounds in his head before reading the words aloud, without needing to individually decode each letter. Bowen also showed strong problem-solving skills by identifying and matching pictures to the sentences independently. His response, “Yes, thank you,” highlights his growing social skills and ability to work cooperatively with others.


Bowen’s attentive listening and observation skills were evident as he followed along while his peers read and contributed to the group’s success. He actively participated in discussions about the order of the pictures, demonstrating reasoning and critical thinking. His willingness to collaborate and check the group’s work shows his developing ability to engage in shared learning experiences with confidence and focus.

learning_goals.title: Phonological Awareness: Decode unfamiliar words.
Comprehension: Use strategies to construct meaning from print.
Comprehension: Anticipate events in stories and make predictions.

title: 这是谁的水壶
description: 老师邀请幼儿将他们的水壶放在一起，带领幼儿玩游戏《这是谁的水壶》。老师一个一个指着水壶，请幼儿说出这是谁的水壶？老师指到静恩的水壶问：“这是谁的水壶？”静恩马上回答：“Noelle 的  。”老师说：“是罗静恩的水壶吗？”静恩看看老师，点了点头，接着老师让她自己拿起一个朋友的水壶，老师问：“这是谁的水壶？”静恩看看拿起的水壶，回答：“Husna的。”老师说：“说对了，是Husna的，请你把水壶给Husna 好吗？” 静恩把水壶递给了Husna。老师说：“谢谢静恩！”
interpretation: 从《这是谁的水壶》活动中，当老师指到静恩的水壶问是谁的水壶时，静恩马上回答自己的名字；老师请她拿起朋友的水壶并说说是谁的水壶时，静恩也能够认出水壶是谁的，并说出朋友的名字；把水壶递给朋友，静恩能够指认自己和朋友的物品，展现出静恩的自我意识和对他人的认识进一步增强。

Foster sense of others (saying out the names of their peers) 培养对他人的认识，如：说出同伴的名字等。

title: 量词配对
description:
教师出示奥莉薇的着装图，带领他们一起讨论奥莉薇的衣服和饰品。然后邀请幼儿分享他们最喜欢的服装，鼓励他们分享自己的穿戴，引导他们关注这类物品。接着，告诉幼儿，“今天我们要学一种有趣的东西，叫做‘量词’。量词是用来数东西的，比如帽子，我们用‘一顶’来数。展示每一件服饰物品，并解释与其配套的量词。将量词卡片（如“顶”、“双”等）与相应的服饰物品放在桌子上，邀请幼儿根据物品选择正确的量词卡片并配对。
子彬坐好后，教师指着活动板上的图片问他奥莉薇头上戴的是什么。他说：“Hat。”教师问他华文知道吗，他说：“是帽子。”邀请他找出帽子的字卡。他在字卡堆里找了找，教师提醒他帽子的子字和他名字一样。他拿起一张字卡，问道：“这个是帽子？”教师点点头，他将字卡贴到活动板上。教师问他帽子对应的量词是什么，他说道：“一个帽子。”教师指着顶字告诉他是一顶帽子。他将字卡贴好后，读道：“一顶帽子。”教师为他展示另一张图片，问他奥莉薇穿了什么。他说：“衣服。”教师告诉他是上衣。他点点头，然后拿起一张字卡问道：“是这个吗？”教师点点头，他将字卡-上衣贴好后，教师问他上衣对应的量词是什么，他问道：“是一个吗？”教师告诉他是一件，他看着字卡问道：“是哪一个？”教师将件的字卡递给他，待他贴好后，邀请他一起读道：“一件上衣。”
interpretation: 子彬能够说出一些常见的服饰和量词的名称，能够理解不同物品对应了不同的量词，并将服饰和量词进行搭配。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（说）- 交谈：能够积极主动地用华语表达，态度自然。
由幼儿自行选择属性配对物品。

title: Threading Straws
description:
Cole was provided with jumbo dinking straws cut into pieces and a puppet wooden holder for him to engage in threading.

Educarer invited Cole to sit on the floor while showing him the materials. “Cole, look! I have some colourful straws for you. Let’s do threading ” educarer told him. Cole excitedly extended his right arm into the bin with straws and happily took some of them. “Do you know what we are going to do with these straws? Educarer asked him. Cole looked at her and babbled “ta ta” while showing him the straws. “Look, I pick up the straw with my pincer grasp and thread it here.” Educarer described the actions while showing him the process. Cole smiled and quickly dropped the straws back into the bin. Using his pincer grasp, he took one of the straws. “Yes, we take the straw one at a time” educarer explained. While holding the straw, he slowly aimed it into the stick (which size was same as the straw’s hole- which is challenging).  After adjusting and repositioning, he managed to insert the straw and pushed it down slowly. “Yay! You did it! Good threading Cole.” Educarer praised him. Cole smiled at her and clapped his hands in response. 

Cole continued doing the activity. With good pincer grasp and hand-eye coordination, he held the straw gently and threaded it into the stick. As the straw went in halfway, using his palm, he then pushed it down all the way to the bottom. “Wow! You did it well Cole.” educarer applauded him. He smiled and babbled “ta ta” in response. He continued threading the remaining straws. He picked them up one by one using his pincer and palmar grasp alternately. While threading, he looked so focused and determined by slowly eyeing the stick and poking the straw into it. He managed to thread all the straws into the puppet wooden holder.
interpretation:
• Cole’s fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination are developing very well. He displayed good pincer and palmar grasp while manipulating the materials. He demonstrated good hand-eye coordination while aiming the straws to the wooden stick holder to thread them. While threading, he displayed good control and coordination while readjusting and repositioning his hand/material.
  • As observed, he also displayed increasing sustained concentration and persistence during the entire activity.

title: Learning about Chinese New Year Culture
description:
Devan and his peers was exploring the various items that are used during Chinese New Year. 

Teacher explained to the children about the use of orange during Chinese New Year and shared some of the greetings that people will wish one another during home visiting. After which, children were invited to smell and touch the pair of oranges that was passed around. 

Devan received the oranges from his peers. He used his free hand to explore the oranges and said that it "was smooth" When asked how it smelt like, he replied that it "smell nice." After which, he passed the oranges to his peer sitting beside him.

Once the oranges had made its round, Teacher directed the attention of the children to the decoration in class. When asked what festive celebration was coming up. Devan raised his hands and said " Chinses New Year!" When asked how he came to that answer, he replied that "cos Chinese New Year always got oranges and red packet."
interpretation: Through the above observation, Devan displayed his ability in being able to compre and classify things and events in accoradance to its characteristics. He was also able to observe the changes in the environment as well.

learning_goals.title: Compare and classify things, places and events according to their characteristics.

title: Artwork sample: Butterfly Craft with Cake Filters
description:
Children created their own beautiful butterflies using cake filters! The process starts with children scribbling various shapes and patterns onto the cake filter with colourful markers. Once the design is complete, they drop some water onto the filter paper, watching in awe as the ink spreads and creates a stunning, blended effect across the paper. 

The filter paper was then folded in a pleated manner to form the wings of a butterfly.

This craft introduces children to the concept of how colours can blend and spread when water is added. It is also a way to develop their fine motor skills and understanding of cause and effect to foster an interest in art.

"Wow, look at all the colours you used on your butterfly!," said the teacher.
"Pink and black," James added.

title: 这是谁的水壶
description: 老师邀请幼儿将他们的水壶放在一起，带领幼儿玩游戏《这是谁的水壶》。老师一个一个指着水壶，请幼儿说出这是谁的水壶？老师指到睿彤的水壶问：“这是谁的水壶？”恺励恺励看看水壶又看看老师回答：“恺励的。”老师说“说对了，是恺励的。”接着老师让她自己拿起一个朋友的水壶，老师问：“这是谁的水壶？”恺励看看拿起的水壶，回答：“ Bella的。”老师说：“是睿萱的吗？“恺励看看老师是：“是。”老师说：“请你把水壶给睿萱好吗？” 恺励把水壶递给了睿萱。老师说：“谢谢恺励！”
interpretation: 从《这是谁的水壶》活动中，当老师指到恺励的水壶问是谁的水壶时，恺励马上回答自己的名字；老师请她拿起朋友的水壶并说说是谁的水壶时，恺励也能够认出水壶是谁的，说出朋友的名字；把水壶给朋友，恺励能够指认自己和朋友的物品，展现出恺励的自我意识和对他人的认识进一步增强。

learning_goals.title: Foster sense of self (telling others their names) 培养自我意识，如：说出自己的名字等。
Foster sense of others (saying out the names of their peers) 培养对他人的认识，如：说出同伴的名字等。

domains.title: Psycho-social Self 心理-社会行为

title: Artwork sample: Butterfly Craft with Cake Filters
description:
Children created their own beautiful butterflies using cake filters! The process starts with children scribbling various shapes and patterns onto the cake filter with colourful markers. Once the design is complete, they drop some water onto the filter paper, watching in awe as the ink spreads and creates a stunning, blended effect across the paper. 

The filter paper was then folded in a pleated manner to form the wings of a butterfly.

This craft introduces children to the concept of how colours can blend and spread when water is added. It is also a way to develop their fine motor skills and understanding of cause and effect to foster an interest in art.

"What colours do you see in your butterfly?" the teacher asked.
"Red, red," replied Owen enthusiastically.

learning_goals.title: Foster an interest in art (drawing, painting, modelling, collage work etc.) 通过美术活动，如：粗蜡笔涂鸦、水彩画、撕贴画、拼贴等，培养幼儿对艺术的兴趣。

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: Partner Toss Challenge
description:
As part of our Kidzercise game, the children participated in a Partner Toss Challenge, where they practiced throwing and catching a ball with a partner. This activity focused on developing hand-eye coordination, control, and teamwork. The children started with short, gentle throws and gradually increased the distance as they gained more confidence. The challenge encouraged them to throw accurately and catch consistently while staying engaged with their partner.

Bowen was first given the task of catching the ball. As his friend threw the ball, she noticed that Bowen was holding the catching pad but was not reaching out to catch it. She encouraged him to track the ball and extend his arm to catch it. Bowen listened and applied these strategies. While he missed the ball by only a small margin, his adjustments showed growth in awareness and technique.

When it was his turn to throw, Bowen confidently called out, “I’m ready!” before making his throw. He swung his hands back and moved them from his right side to his left, which caused the ball to go sideways. With gentle guidance from the teacher, Bowen practiced extending his arm forward for a more controlled and accurate throw. After a few tries, he successfully adjusted his movement and threw the ball in the correct direction.
interpretation:
Bowen’s participation in the Partner Toss Challenge demonstrated his willingness to listen, learn, and apply new strategies. When tasked with catching, Bowen initially showed hesitation when he did not fully extend his arm. However, he was receptive to feedback and quickly attempted to focus more on the ball and actively reach out to catch it. Although he did not catch the ball on his first few tries, his effort and perseverance were evident as he continued to adjust his technique, gradually getting closer to success.


When it was his turn to throw, Bowen’s enthusiasm was clear as he called out to his friend to get their attention. This demonstrated his confidence and readiness to participate. His initial throw was off-target, but with guidance, he learned to adjust his body movements, leading to a more accurate throw. This process reflects Bowen’s ability to adapt and grow his eye-hand coordination. Bowen is gradually developing both his physical skills and his ability to respond positively to guidance. With continued practice, Bowen will likely gain even more confidence in his coordination and teamwork.

learning_goals.title: Be aware of what the body can do and develop their locomotor skills.
Coordinate movements to perform tasks.

title: 丢字卡游戏
description:
教师带领幼儿复习学过的字卡，爬山、捕鱼、园丁、大石头、追、抓、躲。然后将这些字卡贴到玻璃窗上。教师出示沙包，为幼儿演示投掷沙包击打玻璃上的字卡。之后，教师将幼儿分组，幼儿成功击打到字卡后需要读出字卡上的内容才能将字卡撕下。
礼宣和同伴一起来到指定地点，他捡起一个沙包准备好。待他听到教师的“开始”指令后，将沙包投掷出去。沙包击打到玻璃上。教师问他打到了哪个字，他说：“我没有。”教师问他沙包靠近哪个字，他走上前来指着‘追’字说：“这个。”教师问他是什么字。他想了想，说：“抓。”教师告诉他是‘追’。他点点头，复述道：“追。”然后他回到起点，又拿起一个沙包等待。教师发出指令后，他将沙包投掷出去。教师问他打到哪一个字词，他踮起脚指着‘园丁’说：“这个。”教师告诉他是‘园丁’。他复述了一次：“园丁。”
interpretation: 礼宣对认读字卡有兴趣，能够听懂3个指令并按照游戏规则进行投掷游戏，在教师的协助下能够读出一些击中的卡片上的词语。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解3个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（读）- 文字：对认读汉字有兴趣。

title: Jump and Land
description:
In this Kidzercise activity, Charis and her peers participated in a jumping challenge that involves jumping over obstacles for distance, and jumping for height. After a short warm-up session, the children were guided through proper jumping technique which focuses on using both feet to jump and land while bending their knees to soften the impact. The children were also encouraged to swing their arms to propel their bodies forward.

When it was Charis’ turn, she coordinated her arm movements with how she bent her knees to build momentum. She was observed bending her knees before propelling herself forward. However, when she landed, she kept her knees locked, which caused her to lose balance. Charis tried again and focused on bending her knees. She was observed bending her knees slightly upon landing to cushion the impact. Upon landing, Charis was able to regain her balance more quickly than before.

During the next jumping for height challenge, Charis applied the same strategy. She was also observed taking her time, as advised by the teachers, ensuring she didn’t rush through the movements.
interpretation:
Charis showed increasing control and focus in her jumping skills. She coordinated her arm movements and bent her knees to build momentum before jumping. At first, she had trouble balancing when she landed because her knees stayed straight. However, she quickly adjusted by bending them slightly, which helped her land more smoothly and regain her balance faster.


During the jumping for height challenge, Charis used the same technique and took her time, as advised by her teachers. Her careful and thoughtful approach showed her growing confidence and ability to refine her technique. This experience highlights her progress in body coordination, balance, and learning from feedback.

learning_goals.title: Be aware of what the body can do and develop their locomotor skills.
Move with balance and control.

title: Work Sample - Sorting Treasures
description:
During the Treasure Matching activity, the children demonstrated their ability to match objects based on their own chosen attributes. They began by drawing and carefully cutting out treasure items such as jewels, coins, and other artifacts. As they worked, they thoughtfully considered different characteristics, such as the colour, if the treasure was shiny, round, patterned or textured. Then the children organised their treasures into their chosen attributes.

Daxton sorted his treasures by color. He carefully grouped gold, brown, purple, orange, and silver items. He showed focus and patience while cutting and adjusted his grip of the scissors when needed. When sharing his sorting choices, he confidently explained why certain items belonged together based on their colours.

Through this hands-on activity, the children practiced visual recognition, categorisation, and fine motor skills as they carefully sorted and grouped their treasures while also demonstrating perseverance as they navigated tricky cuts and refined their sorting choices with determination.

learning_goals.title: Match objects with child-determined attributes.

title: My ‘Not a Box’ Project
description:
After reading the story Not a Box, the children were invited to create their own "not a box" structures using different pieces of cardboard. Prior to the activity, the children were challenged to transform 2D cardboard pieces into 3D structures. We watched a video and learned 10 different ways to connect cardboard pieces. While creating their structures, the children used various techniques depending on their design goals.

Using his design as a reference, Daxton began gathering a few cardboard pieces and experimented with different ways to connect them. He was observed cutting halfway through the width of his rectangular pieces and then slotting them together in the middle. Proudly, Daxton remarked, “Teacher Sammie, I used the slot method,” referring to one of the techniques from the video. He added, “These can be the rooms inside the house.”

Daxton continued assembling his structure, adding more rectangular pieces around the perimeter of the slotted pieces to form the shape of a house. He carefully cut out a small opening and used a hole puncher to create a hole at the top. Using a pipe cleaner, he attached a door that opened upwards, giving his house a functional entrance.

Daxton had also added two rectangular pieces to serve as the roof of his house. Once he was done, with some time to spare, he decided to create a person. Inspired by the strategies we learned to connect pieces and make them move, Daxton used a round head fastener to attach the arms and legs to his figure. After completing his work, Daxton proudly demonstrated how the arms and legs could move, saying, "Look! This is the person who lives in the house. He can move his arms and legs!"
interpretation:
Through this experience, Daxton demonstrated strong problem-solving abilities. Having watched the video earlier, he was equipped with the tools and strategies needed to confidently approach the challenge. Daxton applied the "slot" method independently, carefully manipulating the materials to transform 2D cardboard pieces into a 3D structure. His ability to recall and use this technique reflects his growing understanding of constructing with cardboard.


His creative use of a round head fastener to build a moveable figure reflects his understanding of basic building techniques and movable parts. Daxton adapted his design and refined his ideas as he built, thinking critically about how to achieve his goals. This hands-on experience allowed Daxton to experiment, make changes, and observe the results. His excitement in sharing his work highlights his ability to connect ideas to real life, strengthening his creativity and problem-solving skills.

learning_goals.title: Experiment with open-ended materials.
Exercise creativity, innovation, imagination and seeing things differently while problem solving or performing a task.

title: My ‘Not a Box’ Project
description:
After reading the story Not a Box, the children were invited to create their own "not a box" structures using different pieces of cardboard. Prior to the activity, the children were challenged to transform 2D cardboard pieces into 3D structures. We watched a video and learned 10 different ways to connect cardboard pieces. While creating their structures, the children used various techniques depending on their design goals.

Elijah, who had just returned from a holiday in Japan, decided to make a Shinkansen train with the cardboard pieces. He shared, "I think I want to make a Shinkansen train. I want to make a yellow one." Elijah began collecting the materials he needed, starting with a large piece of cardboard, which he cut into long rectangles. He asked, "But Teacher Sammie, how can I attach them together?"

The teacher brought Elijah to a poster that summarized the 10 methods for connecting cardboard. Elijah noticed how four pieces of cardboard were connected to form a rectangular prism using the "bracket" method. Inspired, he continued his work by connecting the tape from the inside of the rectangular prism.

Next, Elijah decided he needed to form the front part of the Shinkansen. He used a picture from the internet as a reference and, with a little help, shaped the front of the train to match the desired design.

"I need to make the cover for the body to cover the middle part," he said, pointing to the front of the train. Elijah cut out a rectangular piece the width of his train and attached it through the front part to complete the structure.
interpretation:
Elijah demonstrated curiosity and problem-solving skills as he engaged in constructing his Shinkansen train. His recent trip to Japan served as an inspiration, showing his ability to recall and apply prior knowledge in a meaningful way. Through this activity, Elijah explored the concept of 2D and 3D structures, learning how flat materials can be transformed into three-dimensional forms.


By referring to the poster with different connection methods, Elijah practiced observational and critical thinking skills. This process deepened his understanding of how materials can be connected to create stable structures. He also used technology as a tool for research, referencing an image from the internet to accurately shape the front of his train. Elijah’s thoughtful planning and willingness to seek help when needed reflect his growing independence and problem-solving abilities. His ability to adapt his design and explain his process highlights his developing spatial awareness and construction skills.

learning_goals.title: Experiment with open-ended materials.
Exercise creativity, innovation, imagination and seeing things differently while problem solving or performing a task.

title: Read and Sequence
description:
During the Lit Attack activity, the children engaged in reading a passage with decodable words and worked collaboratively to interpret its meaning. Elizabeth picked up a reading pointer and placed it on each word as she read “This is Zen." She continued, “She is a hen”.

After finishing her reading, Elizabeth looked at the corresponding pictures. She picked up a picture of a hen. As her peers continued reading the subsequent sentences, Elizabeth realised that the picture she had placed in the first box matched the third sentence: "The hen likes to be fed." Elizabeth reasoned, "I think this is for this one because this picture has the hen and the seeds. I will move it here." She continued, "Then the first one is this picture because it only shows the hen."

Elizabeth continued working collaboratively, checking each picture that her friends picked up to ensure it matched with the corresponding sentences.
interpretation: Elizabeth is developing her early reading skills and growing in confidence as a reader. During the Lit Attack activity, she used her decoding skills to read simple sentences and showed great thinking when matching the pictures to the correct sentences. Elizabeth was able to reflect on her choices, explaining her reasoning and adjusting her answers when needed. She also showed a positive attitude toward working with her friends, helping them check their pictures to make sure they matched the sentences. This shows that Elizabeth is building her problem-solving skills, improving her reading comprehension, and enjoying learning with others.

learning_goals.title: Phonological Awareness: Decode unfamiliar words.
Comprehension: Use strategies to construct meaning from print.
Comprehension: Anticipate events in stories and make predictions.

title: My ‘Not a Box’ Project
description:
After reading the story Not a Box, the children were invited to create their own "not a box" structures using different pieces of cardboard. Prior to the activity, the children were challenged to transform 2D cardboard pieces into 3D structures. We watched a video and learned 10 different ways to connect cardboard pieces. While creating their structures, the children used various techniques depending on their design goals.

Ethan created a design inspired by the scenery around him, drawing a picture of trees and a bridge to depict a garden or park. After planning his design, he began collecting materials, starting with cardboard pieces and cardboard rolls. Ethan remained focused throughout the task, working independently without engaging in conversation. His attention was fully on cutting and constructing.

Ethan was observed cutting small tabs around the bottom of a cardboard roll. As he worked, he carefully ensured the tabs were evenly spaced, similar to what he had seen in the demonstration video. He folded the tabs outward and tested the structure’s stability. "Look! I made a tree. It can stand," he exclaimed with pride. He then looked for an adhesive to attach his tree. After noticing that a friend’s cardboard structure held firmly with white glue, Ethan tested its stability by touching it. Satisfied with its strength, he decided to attach his tree structure using white glue.

Next, Ethan continued building his bridge. He selected a long piece of cardboard and used a ruler to guide him. Applying the "bend" method, he made even creases across the cardboard, allowing it to curve into the shape of a bridge.
interpretation:
Ethan’s work demonstrates his natural curiosity and growing ability to explore ideas through hands-on experiences. His design process reflects a strong sense of inquiry and problem-solving. Ethan thoughtfully applied techniques he had observed earlier, such as making “tabs” and using the "bend" method to shape his bridge, showing his ability to transfer knowledge into practice.


His persistence and attention to detail highlight his determination to test and refine his ideas. Ethan’s decision to observe how his peer’s structure was secured with glue and replicate the method reflects his ability to learn through observation and experimentation. These actions not only indicate his curiosity but also his growing confidence in making independent decisions and solving challenges creatively.


By constructing his design, Ethan explored key concepts related to stability, balance, and structure while expressing his creativity. His engagement in this activity supports his development as a curious and resourceful learner who takes initiative, seeks solutions, and brings his ideas to life.

As part of our Kidzercise game, the children participated in a Partner Toss Challenge, where they practiced throwing and catching a ball with a partner. This activity focused on developing hand-eye coordination, control, and teamwork. The children started with short, gentle throws and gradually increased the distance as they gained more confidence. The challenge encouraged them to throw accurately and catch consistently while staying engaged with their partner.

Ethan was first tasked with catching the ball. He positioned himself by stretching his arms out and leaning his body forward, showing readiness and focus. On his first attempt, he narrowly missed the ball but quickly adjusted his approach. During the next throw, Ethan demonstrated increased concentration, keeping his eyes on the rubber ball as it moved through the air. As the ball came closer, he tracked it carefully and managed to tap it with his catching pad. While he was unable to catch it, he showed good control in directing the ball. On his last turn, Ethan attempted to adjust his movements, aiming to soften his touch so the ball wouldn’t bounce away. He came very close to a successful catch.

When it was his turn to throw, Ethan gently swung his arm to toss the ball towards his friend. As his throw was a bit controlled, it fell short of the target. Recognising the need for a stronger throw, Ethan adjusted his swing, adding more force. His improved throw reached his partner and was almost caught. His ability to self-correct and refine his movements highlights his growing confidence and control in throwing and catching.
interpretation:
Through this activity, Ethan demonstrated growing confidence and control in both throwing and catching. He showed an understanding of how focus, tracking the ball, and adjusting movements contribute to success. His ability to make small changes, such as softening his touch while catching and adding more force when throwing, highlights his emerging coordination and problem-solving skills.


Ethan’s efforts to refine his technique, along with his willingness to self-correct and experiment with different strategies, show that he is developing a strong foundation in hand-eye coordination. With continued opportunities to practice, Ethan will further strengthen his ability to throw and catch with greater accuracy and consistency. His engagement and perseverance reflect his positive attitude toward learning new physical skills.

learning_goals.title: Be aware of what the body can do and develop their locomotor skills.
Coordinate movements to perform tasks.

title: Work Sample - Sorting Treasures
description:
During the Treasure Matching activity, the children demonstrated their ability to match objects based on their own chosen attributes. They began by drawing and carefully cutting out treasure items such as jewels, coins, and other artifacts. As they worked, they thoughtfully considered different characteristics, such as the colour, shape, if the treasure was shiny, round, patterned or textured. Then the children organised their treasures into their chosen attributes.

Kadie sorted her treasures by their colours. She carefully grouped her treasures into colours like purple, pink, green, yellow and beige. She showed focus and patience while cutting the intricate shapes and adjusted her grip of the scissors when needed. When sharing her sorting choices, she confidently explained why certain items belonged together based on their colours.

Through this hands-on activity, the children practiced visual recognition, categorisation, and fine motor skills as they carefully sorted and grouped their treasures. The children also demonstrated perseverance as they navigated tricky cuts and refined their sorting choices with determination.

learning_goals.title: Match objects with child-determined attributes.

title: Artwork sample: Butterfly Craft with Cake Filters
description:
Children created their own beautiful butterflies using cake filters! The process starts with children scribbling various shapes and patterns onto the cake filter with colourful markers. Once the design is complete, they drop some water onto the filter paper, watching in awe as the ink spreads and creates a stunning, blended effect across the paper. 

The filter paper was then folded in a pleated manner to form the wings of a butterfly.

This craft introduces children to the concept of how colours can blend and spread when water is added. It is also a way to develop their fine motor skills and understanding of cause and effect to foster an interest in art.

 "Which colour do you like the most on your butterfly?" asked the teacher.
"Blue," Muzhuo replied as he smiled.

title: Read and Sequence
description:
During the Lit Attack activity, the children engaged in reading a passage with decodable words and worked together to interpret its meaning. After reading, they were tasked with matching pictures to the sentences. Kleyzen waited patiently as his group member read the first sentence and picked up a picture of a boy, placing it in the first box. 

Kleyzen remarked, “Yes, correct.” He continued with the second sentence, reading slowly, “He… is… /s/ /i/ /x/… si…x… six.” He then picked up an image of the number six and placed it in the second box to match the sentence.

Kleyzen worked collaboratively with his peers, checking each picture his friends picked up to ensure it matched the correct sentence. The group observed reasoning and discussed the order of their pictures, reading the sentences again and carefully reviewing the pictures to confirm their choices.
interpretation:
Kleyzen is developing his early reading skills and showing confidence in decoding simple sentences. During the Lit Attack activity, he demonstrated patience and active listening as he waited for his peer to read the first sentence. He followed along attentively and provided positive affirmation, indicating his growing understanding of how words connect to meaning. Kleyzen carefully applied his phonics knowledge when reading the second sentence, blending sounds to decode the word "six."


He also showed strong problem-solving and collaborative skills as he worked with his peers to match pictures to the sentences. By reasoning and discussing the picture order with his group, Kleyzen displayed critical thinking and a willingness to engage in cooperative learning. His ability to contribute ideas and check the group’s work highlights his growing confidence and participation in group activities.

learning_goals.title: Phonological Awareness: Decode unfamiliar words.
Comprehension: Use strategies to construct meaning from print.
Comprehension: Anticipate events in stories and make predictions.

title: 丢字卡游戏
description:
教师带领幼儿复习学过的字卡，爬山、捕鱼、园丁、大石头、追、抓、躲。然后将这些字卡贴到玻璃窗上。教师出示沙包，为幼儿演示投掷沙包击打玻璃上的字卡。之后，教师将幼儿分组，幼儿成功击打到字卡后需要读出字卡上的内容才能将字卡撕下。
教师邀请Abhigyan来到起始线准备好，他站好后，从地上捡起一个沙包。他听到教师发出的‘开始’指令后，将沙包往前投掷。沙包击中玻璃窗上的一个字卡，他大喊道：“谢老师，我打到了。”教师问他打到了哪个字卡，他走到玻璃窗前指着字卡说：“这个。”教师问他字卡的内容是什么。他看了看，说：“躲。”教师告诉他是抓。他复述道：“抓。”他回到起始线，丢出一个沙包。教师问他打到字卡了吗，他说：“我没有。”教师邀请他再投掷一次，他又将沙包丢出去。这次他打到一张字卡。教师问他是什么内容，他看了看，说：“是爬山。”然后他将撕下来，他对着后面的同伴说：“我有一个。”
interpretation: Abhigyan对认读字卡有兴趣，能够听懂3个指令并按照游戏规则进行投掷游戏，能够读出一些击中的卡片上的词语。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解3个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（读）- 文字：对认读汉字有兴趣。

The filter paper was then folded in a pleated manner to form the wings of a butterfly.

This craft introduces children to the concept of how colours can blend and spread when water is added. It is also a way to develop their fine motor skills and understanding of cause and effect to foster an interest in art.

"Can you point to the biggest colour on your butterfly?" asked the teacher.
"Big blue!" replied Alyssa as she pointed to the blue mark on her art.

title: My ‘Not a Box’ Project
description:
After reading the story Not a Box, the children were invited to create their own "not a box" structures using different pieces of cardboard. Prior to the activity, the children were challenged to transform 2D cardboard pieces into 3D structures. We watched a video and learned 10 different ways to connect cardboard pieces. While creating their structures, the children used various techniques depending on their design goals.

Kleyzen became inspired right after watching the video and began gathering materials for his creation. He collected pieces of cardboard and focused intently on cutting and constructing. Occasionally, Kleyzen suggested ideas to his peers. “Actually, you can cut the top and put it through so it can stand,” he explained.

He started by cutting tabs on a cardboard roll to create trees. He applied glue to the tabs and held the roll in place on his cardboard base until it stood securely. Next, Kleyzen cut a slot on the top of the roll and another on a rectangular piece of cardboard, slotting them together to form the tree’s canopy.

After completing the trees, Kleyzen continued building by adding walls on the sides to make his structure look like a house. He used the “bracket” method and tape to attach the cardboard pieces. Once his house structure was complete, he decided to make a person to add to his scene. Using brass fasteners, Kleyzen carefully attached separate arms and legs to his figure. “Look! The hands and legs can move,” he said proudly, demonstrating the figure’s movable parts.
interpretation:
Kleyzen’s participation in this activity reflects his ability to creatively apply learned concepts while demonstrating strong problem-solving and collaboration skills. Inspired by the video demonstration, Kleyzen quickly engaged in the creative process, confidently gathering materials and experimenting with different construction techniques. His proactive approach and willingness to share suggestions with peers illustrate his emerging leadership and collaborative abilities.


Through his creation, Kleyzen demonstrated spatial awareness and an understanding of how to transform 2D materials into 3D forms. His use of the “bracket” method to attach walls and the careful construction of trees shows his growing knowledge of structural stability and design. 


His ability to adapt techniques and slot pieces together reflects both critical thinking and attention to detail.

Kleyzen’s decision to create a movable figure with brass fasteners highlights his innovative thinking. 


Through this experience, Kleyzen developed essential skills in creativity, problem-solving, and working with others. He explored simple engineering ideas and design concepts in a hands-on way, boosting his confidence as a young thinker and creator.

learning_goals.title: Experiment with open-ended materials.
Exercise creativity, innovation, imagination and seeing things differently while problem solving or performing a task.

"Green, purple, and red!" replied Vera as she smiled.

description:
教师带领幼儿复习学过的字卡，爬山、捕鱼、园丁、大石头、追、抓、躲。然后将这些字卡贴到玻璃窗上。教师出示沙包，为幼儿演示投掷沙包击打玻璃上的字卡。之后，教师将幼儿分组，幼儿成功击打到字卡后需要读出字卡上的内容才能将字卡撕下。

title: Read and Sequence
description:
During the Lit Attack activity, the children engaged in reading a passage with decodable words and worked collaboratively to interpret its meaning. Leanne began reading the passage, "/J/ /e/ /n/ Jen... has a /p/ pet... hen." She focused as her friends continued to read a sentence each. On her next turn, Leanne read, "The vet... /f/ ed... fed... the hen ten tr... /e/ ts." When the teacher corrected her, she repeated, "treats."

After the group finished reading the passage, they looked at the pictures to match them to the sentences. Leanne spotted a picture of a girl with a hen and immediately picked it up, saying, "This is the first one. This is Jen, and this is the hen." She continued working collaboratively, checking each picture that her friends picked up to ensure it matched.

When they were left with one picture, the group realised they might have placed an earlier picture incorrectly. Leanne reread the last two sentences of the passage and said, "I think we need to switch this one. This picture (number 10) should be here because the hen ate 10 treats.
interpretation:
Leanne demonstrated developing skills in decoding and comprehension during this activity. She confidently applied her phonics knowledge to sound out words, self-correcting with support when encountering unfamiliar words like “treats.” Her persistence and willingness to repeat the correct pronunciation reflect her growing accuracy and confidence in reading.


Leanne’s observation and logical reasoning during the sequencing task highlight her ability to connect the text with visual representations. When the group encountered a sequencing error, Leanne independently reread the passage and accurately identified the mismatch, showing her understanding of the text. This reflects her ability to self-correct and comprehend the text. Leanne is also demonstrating increasing independence when reading decodable passages, taking initiative to solve problems and verify her understanding.

learning_goals.title: Phonological Awareness: Decode unfamiliar words.
Comprehension: Use strategies to construct meaning from print.
Comprehension: Anticipate events in stories and make predictions.

title: Partner Toss Challenge
description:
As part of our Kidzercise game, the children participated in a Partner Toss Challenge, where they practiced throwing and catching a ball with a partner. This activity focused on developing hand-eye coordination, control, and teamwork. The children started with short, gentle throws and gradually increased the distance as they gained more confidence. The challenge encouraged them to throw accurately and catch consistently while staying engaged with their partner.

Leroy was first tasked with throwing the rubber ball to his partner. During his initial two throws, he experimented with different levels of force. His first two throws were too strong, sending the ball past his partner. After receiving guidance from the teacher to aim for the catching pad and use a gentler motion, Leroy adjusted his approach. 

His third throw showed improvement, landing closer to the target, and his final two throws were successful as his partner was able to catch his throw. 

When it was his turn to catch, Leroy initially missed, as he was not fully tracking the ball. After being reminded to keep his eyes on the ball, he adjusted his focus and successfully caught it once.
interpretation:
Through this activity, Leroy was able to build confidence in throwing and catching while developing better control and coordination. He explored different ways to throw the ball, adjusting his strength and aim to help his partner catch it.


At first, his throws were too strong, but with guidance, he learned to use gentler throws and aim more carefully.

When it was his turn to catch, Leroy discovered that keeping his eyes on the ball made a big difference. With practice, he was able to successfully catch the ball, showing his growing focus and perseverance.


This activity helped Leroy and his peers understand that small adjustments and practice can help them improve and succeed. It also encouraged them to work together, build confidence, and develop important movement skills that will support their physical growth.

Coordinate movements to perform tasks.

title: Jump and Land
description:
In this Kidzercise activity, Maia and her peers participated in a jumping challenge that involves jumping over obstacles for distance, and jumping for height. After a short warm-up session, the children were guided through proper jumping technique which focuses on using both feet to jump and land while bending their knees to soften the impact. The children were also encouraged to swing their arms to propel their bodies forward.

Maia was eager to try the jumping challenge and stepped forward alongside a peer. At first, she carefully observed her partner, as if trying to understand the technique before starting on her own. Eventually, she took the lead, and her peer began following her movements.

Maia swung her arms for momentum, but the timing didn’t quite match how she bent her knees. Although she was bending them, her movements weren’t fully coordinated. Before pushing herself forward, she hesitated, taking a long pause. She then swung her arms again, preparing herself. When she finally felt ready, Maia propelled herself forward with her arms and landed on both feet, but her knees remained locked, causing her body to lean forward slightly.

She then swung her arms again, preparing herself. When she finally felt ready, Maia propelled herself forward with her arms and landed perfectly with her knees bent, maintaining good balance and control.
interpretation:
Maia demonstrated growing confidence and control when jumping off with both feet during the Kidzercise activity. It took some time for Maia to find the right rhythm, but with repeated attempts, she gradually gained better momentum. As she continued practicing, her movements became more fluid, showing her growing confidence and understanding of the jumping technique. 


With guidance, she adjusted her technique by bending her knees before takeoff and upon landing, which helped her absorb impact more effectively. She also incorporated arm swings to generate momentum and improve her jump distance.

learning_goals.title: Be aware of what the body can do and develop their locomotor skills.
Move with balance and control.

title: Jump and Land
description:
In this Kidzercise activity, Reagan and his peers participated in a jumping challenge that involves jumping over obstacles for distance, and jumping for height. After a short warm-up session, the children were guided through proper jumping technique which focuses on using both feet to jump and land while bending their knees to soften the impact. The children were also encouraged to swing their arms to propel their bodies forward.

Reagan confidently stepped forward during his turn. He swung his arms back and forth to build momentum. After a few controlled swings, he pushed himself forward with a strong jump. As he took off, he was observed squatting and bending his knees. Upon landing, Reagan adjusted his posture to steady himself.
interpretation:
Reagan showed good progress during the jumping challenge. He effectively coordinated his arm movements with his jump and incorporated a slight knee bend when landing, demonstrating his understanding of proper jumping technique.


By swinging his arms to build momentum and bending his knees to soften the impact upon landing, Reagan was able to jump more smoothly and maintain his balance. This indicates that he is developing the coordination and control necessary for effective movement.

learning_goals.title: Be aware of what the body can do and develop their locomotor skills.
Move with balance and control.

title: Jump and Land
description:
In this Kidzercise activity, Wei En and her peers participated in a jumping challenge that involves jumping over obstacles for distance, and jumping for height. After a short warm-up session, the children were guided through proper jumping technique which focuses on using both feet to jump and land while bending their knees to soften the impact. The children were also encouraged to swing their arms to propel their bodies forward.

Wei En stepped up to the starting line, and prepared for her turn. While swinging her arms back and forth, Wei En was observed keeping her knees straight. She propelled herself forward with a jump and landed with straight knees. Wei En wobbled slightly and almost lost her balance. The teacher encouraged her to try again and reminded her to bend her knees while jumping and landing to soften the impact on her knees. 

On her next attempt, Wei En bent her knees slightly before pushing off the ground. She swung her arms to help propel herself forward and focused on landing with bent knees. This adjustment helped her maintain better balance.
interpretation:
Wei En demonstrated growing confidence and control when jumping off with both feet during the Kidzercise activity. Initially, Wei En kept her knees straight while jumping and landing, which made it harder for her to balance. With guidance, she adjusted her technique by bending her knees before takeoff and upon landing, which helped her absorb impact more effectively. She also incorporated arm swings to generate momentum and improve her jump distance.


Through repeated practice, Wei En refined her movements, showing better coordination and stability with each attempt. By the end of the activity, she appeared more comfortable and confident in her jumps, highlighting her progress in body control, balance, and effective jumping technique.

learning_goals.title: Be aware of what the body can do and develop their locomotor skills.
Move with balance and control.

title: Read and Sequence
description:
During the Lit Attack activity, the children engaged in reading a passage with decodable words and worked collaboratively to interpret its meaning. Wei En continued reading the third sentence after her group members had read the first two sentences: "Jen and her pet went to the vet." She read the sentence slowly but fluently, without any pauses, then continued listening attentively as her peers read the rest of the passage.

After the group finished reading, they looked at the pictures to match them to the sentences. Wei En waited patiently as her peer matched a picture to the first sentence. While doing so, she was observed scanning the second sentence. She then looked at the images and picked up a picture of a hen standing in the rain. As her groupmates read the sentence aloud, Wei En handed them the picture and placed it in the second box to match the sentence they were reading. She continued working collaboratively, checking each picture her peers picked up to ensure it matched the correct sentence.

When they were left with one picture, the group realized they might have placed an earlier picture incorrectly. Wei En suggested, "I think this number 10 is wrong. It should be in box number 4. The bed is here because they went home and went to bed, right?"
interpretation:
Wei En demonstrated strong decoding skills and growing confidence in reading during the Lit Attack activity. She read her sentences fluently, maintaining focus and accuracy without pauses. Wei En also exhibited active listening as her peers read, indicating her engagement and understanding of the task.


During the picture-matching activity, Wei En’s ability to scan the text and independently select the correct image showed her developing comprehension skills. Her careful observation and logical reasoning helped the group identify and correct an error in sequencing. Her explanation, “The bed is here because they went home and went to bed,” reflects her deepening understanding of how the text connects to visual representations and her growing ability to self-correct and problem-solve.


Wei En’s participation during this experience highlights her progress in decoding, interpreting meaning, and applying comprehension strategies during group tasks.

learning_goals.title: Phonological Awareness: Decode unfamiliar words.
Comprehension: Use strategies to construct meaning from print.
Comprehension: Anticipate events in stories and make predictions.

title: My ‘Not a Box’ Project
description:
After reading the story Not a Box, the children were invited to create their own "not a box" structures using different pieces of cardboard. Prior to the activity, the children were challenged to transform 2D cardboard pieces into 3D structures. We watched a video and learned 10 different ways to connect cardboard pieces. While creating their structures, the children used various techniques depending on their design goals.

Wei En was inspired to recreate an aquarium. She carefully selected her materials, gathering a few cardboard rolls and a large rectangular piece to use as her base. She worked independently for a while before pausing to observe how a friend connected his cardboard roll to his base.

Noticing her friend's approach, Wei En began cutting several tabs at the bottom of her cardboard roll. She paused again, watching closely, before folding the tabs outward and pressing the roll onto her base. To secure it, she used tape to fasten the tabs down. She repeated this process for the rest of her cardboard rolls.

The next day, Wei En returned to her work and began cutting small shapes, carefully pasting them onto the sides of the cardboard rolls. As she worked, she explained, "These are all the aquarium tanks. And these are the fishes."
interpretation:
Wei En’s engagement in this activity reflects her curiosity, adaptability, and problem-solving mindset. She demonstrates an interest in how materials can be manipulated to create meaningful structures. Her ability to incorporate new techniques suggests an openness to learning and a willingness to experiment with different methods. Her approach also highlights critical thinking and perseverance.


Additionally, Wei En’s work reveals her imaginative and representational thinking. She assigns meaning to her creation, transforming simple materials into a conceptual aquarium. This demonstrates an ability to translate abstract ideas into tangible forms.


By encouraging projects that allow for open-ended exploration, we can continue to nurture Wei En’s curiosity, confidence, and ability to think critically about how things are designed and constructed.

learning_goals.title: Experiment with open-ended materials.
Exercise creativity, innovation, imagination and seeing things differently while problem solving or performing a task.

title: 站起来
description: 下午的自由活动期间，在自然角落附近玩耍着的恩熙爬到塑胶盒前面对着塑胶盒坐了下来。她抬头看向塑胶盒的上方，接着她先后抬起左手臂和右手臂手掌掌心朝下使用五指一起抓握的手势掌握住了盒子的边缘，紧接着她还是先左后右的方式先后抬起左腿和右腿从坐姿转换成跪姿。在左手依旧抓握着盒子边缘的情况下她单独抬起右手臂将手肘搭到了盒子上方，然后双手臂和双腿一起有力至膝盖离开地面用双脚掌撑地挺直了身体，最后，她先迈动右腿和左腿向前走了一小步站在了盒子前。恩熙历时了约7-8秒钟从坐姿转换到跪姿，再转换到站姿。
interpretation: 首先，恩熙主动展开和享受了活动。这个过程中，恩熙展现了出色的身体协调性和平衡能力。从坐姿到跪姿再到站姿，她通过依次抬手、抬腿、支撑、挺直身体等一系列有序的动作，成功完成了站立的转换。这一系列动作不仅考验了她的核心力量和四肢协调性，还展现了她对自身动作的控制能力。

learning_goals.title: Foster gross motor development (rolling over, sitting, crawling, standing, etc.) 发展粗大动作，如：翻身、坐、爬、站立等。

title: 神奇的布卡
description: 上午的自由活动时间，老师协助刚刚喝完了奶的奕程坐稳在了婴儿椅上。接着，老师一边对他说：“奕程，这个布卡会唱歌。”一边轻轻抓捏着有声布卡，将它递到奕程的手前。在老师的抓捏声中，他低头看向了布卡，随后依次伸出右手和左手，两手一起抓握住了布卡。紧接着，他的手指微微张开又合拢，不断地抓捏着布卡。老师微笑着立即鼓励他：“奕程，你把布卡抓出了声音，真棒！抓一抓，它就会发出声音，对不对？”老师说完后，奕程抬起头，张开小嘴笑了起来，随后，他又反复地抓捏了布卡约10秒钟后，他突然挥动右手臂，把手里抓着的布卡甩了出去。在接下来的活动中，老师分别又给了他绒布和纤维网，他也都伸手拿了过去，使用了相同的方式一边看，一边抓捏了它们。
interpretation: 奕程在抓捏布卡的过程中，持续保持专注，并反复尝试大约10秒钟，说明他能够在短时间内集中注意力。在接下来的活动中，他对绒布和纤维网也展现出相同的探索方式，说明他在运用前一次经验来理解新的材料，这体现了他的持续参与能力。

learning_goals.title: Develop focus and concentration  through sustained involvement in routines, transitions and experiences 通过常规活动、互动和体验，初步培养婴幼儿的持续参与-注意力。

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: Artwork Sample: Making a ladybug!
description:
As children’s interest revolved around creepy crawlies, children were invited to participate in a ladybug making activity. 
Children engaged in the painting of their ladybug, where they were able to make independent choices for the colours of their ladybug. Children used paper plates to form the wings of the ladybug and used a paintbrush to paint the acrylic paint onto their paper plate. 
Next, as children understood there were dotted patterns on the ladybug’s wings, they used a sponge tool to stamp the ladybug’s dots on its back using black acrylic paint. 

This activity allows children to choose their own colours and explore different effects through painting and stamping. Making art a fun, hands-on, and meaningful experience. Additionally, fostering creativity and self-expression to bring their ladybug to life. 

“My ladybug!” Allysa said as she was done with the first round of painting the ladybug’s wings.

learning_goals.title: Foster an interest in art (drawing, painting, modelling, collage work etc.) 通过美术活动，如：粗蜡笔涂鸦、水彩画、撕贴画、拼贴等，培养幼儿对艺术的兴趣。

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: 新年红
description: 老师轻轻地扶着奕程，让他舒适地躺在游戏区的枕头上，然后拿起一根红色的缎带，在他的小手上方轻轻晃动，温柔地对他说：“奕程，看看这是什么？这是红色的带子，来，试着伸手抓住它吧！”在老师的话语声中，他的目光先停留在正上方的缎带上，凝视了约 2-3 秒钟后，小手缓缓举起，微微张开手指，尝试抓握。就在他成功握住带子的那一刻，老师笑着夸奖道：“奕程，真棒！你一把就抓住了红色的带子！红色象征着新年的喜庆，奕程一定会过一个红红火火的新年哦！”手中依旧掌握住带子的奕程小脸上漾起了一丝微笑。随后，老师拿起一个红色的网袋苹果，将它轻轻举到奕程面前。这一次，他依旧用相同的方式伸手抓握。当老师松开手后，他独自紧紧握住苹果，目不转睛地观察了 4-5 秒钟，直到苹果从小手中滑落。最后，他依然带着笑意，双手握着一个红包灯笼，玩耍了一会儿。
interpretation: 整个过程奕程的脸上带着微笑，他的情感状态是积极的，享受和物品互动的过程。通过游戏和互动，奕程在情感上体验到了愉悦和满足感。通过物品的探索，他逐步培养了对物品的喜爱。

learning_goals.title: Foster enjoyment in playing with toys and materials 通过提供适宜的玩具和材料，培养婴幼儿对玩具和材料的喜爱。

domains.title: The Thinking and Communicating Self 思考与沟通

title: 丢字卡游戏
description:
教师带领幼儿复习学过的字卡，爬山、捕鱼、园丁、大石头、追、抓、躲。然后将这些字卡贴到玻璃窗上。教师出示沙包，为幼儿演示投掷沙包击打玻璃上的字卡。之后，教师将幼儿分组，幼儿成功击打到字卡后需要读出字卡上的内容才能将字卡撕下。
家乐来到起始线站好，他捡起一个沙包，说道：“谢老师，我好了。”教师发出‘开始’指令后，家乐往前投掷沙包。他来到玻璃窗前，指着一个字卡，说：“我打到了这个。”教师问他字卡上的内容是什么。他看了看，说：“是捕鱼。”说完，他取下字卡。他将字卡交给组员并说：“我有一个了。”然后，他回到起始线，又进行了一次投掷。他来到玻璃窗前，告诉教师：“我打这个旁边。”教师问他是哪个字卡，他说：“是大石头。”说完，他取下了字卡。
interpretation: 家乐对认读字卡有兴趣，能够听懂3个指令并按照游戏规则进行投掷游戏，能够读出一些击中的卡片上的词语。

learning_goals.title: 语言学习成果（听）- 听指令：能完全理解3个口头指示并完成任务。
语言学习成果（读）- 文字：对认读汉字有兴趣。

title: 丢字卡游戏
description:
教师带领幼儿复习学过的字卡，爬山、捕鱼、园丁、大石头、追、抓、躲。然后将这些字卡贴到玻璃窗上。教师出示沙包，为幼儿演示投掷沙包击打玻璃上的字卡。之后，教师将幼儿分组，幼儿成功击打到字卡后需要读出字卡上的内容才能将字卡撕下。
欣颖来到起始线站好，她问道：“我可以开始了吗？”教师点点头，欣颖捡起地上的沙包往前丢去。教师问她是否击中了字卡，她说：“我没有。”教师问她沙包最靠近哪个字卡。她来到玻璃窗前，说道：“是在这个，园丁。”教师邀请她将字卡取下，她取下后将字卡递给同组的同伴，笑着说道：“我们又多一个了。”她又捡起沙包投掷出去。她来到玻璃窗前，说：“谢老师，我的靠近这个。”教师问她知道字卡内容吗，她说：“我知道，是爬山。”说完，她取下字卡。
interpretation: 欣颖对认读字卡有兴趣，能够听懂3个指令并按照游戏规则进行投掷游戏，能够读出一些击中的卡片上的词语。

语言学习成果（读）- 文字：对认读汉字有兴趣。

title: Playing soccer!
description:
To support children's gross motor development, they were invited to kick a soccer ball between two poles while imagining themselves as players in a soccer match. To help with balance, they were encouraged to stretch their arms out like airplane wings. The teacher provided verbal guidance, such as “Swing your leg back” and “Now, kick the ball with your foot”, to support their movements and coordination.

Avery stood behind the ball with her hands partially extended at her sides. She shifted her weight to the left and lifted her right leg backward. Though she wobbled slightly, she quickly swung her right leg forward and struck the ball with the front of her foot.

Given another opportunity, Avery chose to stand further behind the ball. This time, she ran a short distance while swinging her arms and kicked the ball with her right foot as she ran. When she successfully kicked the ball between the poles, the teacher cheered, “Goal! Good job, Avery!” Feeling a sense of accomplishment, Avery smiled and giggled excitedly.
interpretation: Avery was able to demonstrate a good sense of balance and coordination , which helped support her development in her ability to kick. Her ability to stand on one leg while preparing to kick demonstrates balance, a fundamental skill for controlled movements. Additionally, her coordination was evident as she synchronized her leg movement with her eye focus on the ball, ensuring accuracy. Hence, these combined skills contribute to her gross motor development in supporting her to engage in more complex physical activities such as kicking. Avery's level of engagement was evident through her high level of vitality during the activity.

children.fullname: Avery Ang Le Jing (Hong Le Jing)

learning_goals.title: Foster gross motor development (walk, run, jump, climb on playground equipment, bend, kick，throw, etc.) 发展粗大动作：走、跑、攀爬、弯腰、踢、投掷等。

title: Playing soccer!
description:
To support children's gross motor development, they were invited to kick a soccer ball between two poles while imagining themselves as players in a soccer match. To help with balance, they were encouraged to stretch their arms out like airplane wings. The teacher provided verbal guidance, such as “Swing your leg back” and “Now, kick the ball with your foot”, to support their movements and coordination.

Vera stood behind the ball, extending her arms for stability. At the teacher’s cue, “Ready, set, go!”, she took a small step to the left, shifting her weight before lifting her right leg slightly and kicking the ball with the front of her foot. As the ball moved, she quickly placed her foot down to regain balance.

Given another chance to practice, Vera bent her legs slightly, then stood back up, shifting her weight to the left before lifting her right leg to kick the ball. When she completed the activity, the teacher cheered, “Yay! Vera, you did it!”, and a bright smile appeared on her face.
interpretation: Vera was able to demonstrate her sense of balance and coordination through this activity. She displayed good balance when she was able to shift her body weight onto one leg and use her hands for stability. Vera demonstrated excellent eye-foot coordination by successfully synchronizing her leg movements while keeping her eyes focused on the ball. Vera displayed high levels of participation as she presented a positive attitude towards the activity.

title: 丢字卡游戏
description:
教师带领幼儿复习学过的字卡，爬山、捕鱼、园丁、大石头、追、抓、躲。然后将这些字卡贴到玻璃窗上。教师出示沙包，为幼儿演示投掷沙包击打玻璃上的字卡。之后，教师将幼儿分组，幼儿成功击打到字卡后需要读出字卡上的内容才能将字卡撕下。
嘉乐来到起始线站好，他捡起地上的沙包往前投掷出去。教师问他打到了哪个字卡。他来到玻璃窗前说：“This one。”教师问他字卡的内容是什么。他看了看，同伴提醒他是“躲”，他复述道：“躲。”说完，他撕下字卡递给同组的同伴后，又捡起一个沙包丢了起来。教师问他打到哪个字卡。他来到玻璃窗前，说：“I dont know。”教师告诉他字卡的内容是园丁。他一边复述道：“园丁。”一边将卡片撕了下来。
interpretation: 嘉乐对认读字卡有兴趣，能够听懂3个指令并按照游戏规则进行投掷游戏，在他人的协助下能够读出一些击中的卡片上的词语。

title: 坐立练习
description: 老师抱着奕程坐在柔软的枕头前，接着坐在他对面，帮助他双手撑在前方的软垫上，保持身体稳定。等奕程坐稳后，老师轻轻松开了手，微笑着对他说：“奕程，好棒哦！你看，你自己坐着了，而且坐得好稳！真是太棒了！”在老师的夸奖声中，奕程抬起头，张开小嘴露出了笑容看向老师。在老师的注视下，他面带微笑，抬起右手，轻轻地从软垫上松开，微微挺直身体，向右侧张开了手臂。接着，他又松开了左手，抬起后向左侧伸展。没有任何支撑的奕程独自坐了约4到5秒钟，随后开始向一侧倾斜，老师迅速伸手扶住了他。
interpretation: 总的来说，奕程的身体动作展现了他在身体控制、协调性的发展过程。他在老师的支持下逐步学会了如何保持坐姿、如何协调手臂动作，并且尝试独立完成短暂的平衡。这一过程体现了他在探索和学习身体运动技能时的逐步进步，同时也反映了他对自我身体控制的日益增强。

learning_goals.title: Foster gross motor development (rolling over, sitting, crawling, standing, etc.) 发展粗大动作，如：翻身、坐、爬、站立等。

title: Playing soccer!
description:
To support children's gross motor development, they were invited to kick a soccer ball between two poles while imagining themselves as players in a soccer match. To help with balance, they were encouraged to stretch their arms out like airplane wings. The teacher provided verbal guidance, such as “Swing your leg back” and “Now, kick the ball with your foot”, to support their movements and coordination.

Mabell was invited to stand behind the ball. On her first try, she extended her arms to the sides and gently kicked the ball with the front of her foot. As she did not express much excitement, the teacher applauded her effort, saying, “Yes! Good job, Mabell! Would you like to give it another go?” Mabell nodded in response.

For her next attempt, she stepped onto her left leg, shifting her weight while extending her arms for balance. She then tapped the ball gently with the top of her foot and watched it roll. On her final attempt, she appeared more relaxed and stable, smoothly alternating her arms for balance as she kicked the ball with her right leg. The teacher encouraged her progress, cheering, “Goal! You kicked the ball, well done, Mabell!”
interpretation: Mabell was able to display a good sense of balance and coordination, which contributed to her gross motor development in kicking. She was able to shift her body weight while maintaining stability, demonstrating awareness by extending her arms out for balance. In terms of her coordination, she was able to align her leg movements, as well as track the ball with her eyes, demonstrating good eye-foot coordination. Mabell displayed an increasing level of participation throughout the activity, which was accompanied with the teacher's motivation and support.
